title: The Wound & Repair Your Skin Blueprint
content:
https://myagingandwellness.lpages.co/the-wound-repair-course

Do you want younger, smoother and more radiant skin?

Have you then went down a rabbit hole looking for products online or in big brand stores?

Maybe you got referrals from friends or doctors recommendations and then, you find that you need like 7 products recommended for you?

You then find the shocking fact that each product is like 100 or $200.

If you're like me, you can only afford maybe one or two of these products, if that.

But, you find out that they usually work in synergy so you never see real results and then you’re back to square one using a few sparse products and with no actual change.

So the next logical step is that you think maybe you need to go to a plastic surgeon or dermatologist and get a consultation.

You go get a consultation and they give you a bunch of options and you’re confused.

Maybe you get on a good option that is 3 to 5 laser treatments and the cost is $750 each time or you get a package deal for $2500.

All I can say is, "Who the hell can afford that?"

Because three treatments are not going to solve your problem long-term aging situation.

Even if you get a facelift, that facelift is going to fall in like four or five years.

The late comedian Joan Rivers said, "You have to do something every four years because it doesn’t stick."

With that being said, no matter what you do, a facelift, Botox injections, pulling, tugging and, tightening doesn’t do anything for the outside of your skin.

They can pull your skin up, stick needles in your face, plump up your face, freeze your muscles to prevent future lines but if you don't maintain the texture everything else it useless.

That’s why I'm here

I want to show you what you can do to get rid of texture, age spots, large pores, uneven skin tone and how to firm up your skin!

And the great thing is, you can do it at home and without a plastic surgeon!

Even better, you don't have to spend $750 for one treatment.

I want to show you that for a very little cost of a few products, you can seriously change your skin.

I created the "Wound & Repair Your Skin Blueprint"

It's just a few simple steps that you will do to have younger and more youthful skin, seriously!

It works by slowly and controllably wounding the skin, letting it heal and then building upon it.

That's it! And, of course, protecting all that new baby skin too. I show you how to do that too.

No Botox, no fillers, no facelift can do what the "Wound & Repair Your Skin Blueprint" can do for your skin.

If you want to add Botox and other procedures to enhance the your outcome, then go right ahead.

However, you just might want to start with the Blueprint and then go from there 🤗

You’ll see significant changes at 30, 60, 90 days! You'll see and it just keeps getting better and better.

Consider this Blueprint a beginning to get your skin in the best shape and then secondly, consider it a maintenance plan for life because the more you stick to the plan the younger your skin will look.

title: Avalon Vitamin C Serum and skin care for less money..
content:
Here is the link for the products in this video:

https://amzn.to/2UWnoje


Hey everyone. Welcome back!

Today I want to talk to you about vitamin C Serum.

I was using the same vitamin C for about five years and then they stopped making it. I don't know what happened, but I loved it, they stopped making it.

Then when I went out to look for new vitamin C, I had the choice of some really expensive ones, like $166, to $250.

Now, I go through that stuff every four weeks or so, I can't afford that along with all my other products.

I just can't add another product that cost $200. It's just not feasible, it's not practical for me, and that's it. 


I usually don't use cleansers and toners, because I usually use Dove soap. I've been using it for 30 years.

I love it and it works for me. But I love vitamin C, I love how it brightens up my skin, it gets rid of my age spots, and it just makes my skin tone even.

So when I was set out to find my vitamin C, I found this brand. It's called the Avalon Organics, and I got this at Whole Foods.

You could get it at whole Foods, you could get it at my link, or you could just go on Amazon and get it. 


This is amazing. It's a facial serum that's concentrated and it has no GMOs, no parabens, no sulfates, no preservatives.

That's really important. Most of all, what I've learned about vitamin C is if you get air in it, it becomes oxidized and it doesn't last that long and its potency doesn't last.

So with these pumps, you pump the vitamin C in your hand, it doesn't get air back draft into it, if that's the right word for it, and it stays fresh. We don't want it to turn orange and get oxidized.


Let me show you what oxidation means. When I used to use other Vitamin Cs, I would get them in a dropper and every time I would take the dropper out it would fill up with air.

Then after a couple of weeks, my product was oxidized and the potency wasn't good.

See in my video that nasty orange look? Actually, it's turning almost a dark brown and the smell is not good. I don't want to use this. I don't want a product that's going to get air in it, because its potency's going to be lost.

That's super important, it's just as important as having enough of the active ingredient in your product. The two main factors when we're using anti-aging products is the active ingredient and the decline of air and oxidation.. 

Again, when I found this that has the pump, it doesn't get air in it, I loved it. It goes on really, really smooth, like water. It's not sticky at all.

I think it's like $24. It's amazingly priced. You can use this every day on your face, neck, and chest, and you can feel good about it.

But on top of that, I found that they also have an intense vitamin gel cleanser and then a vitamin C toner. So add these to the serum and, wow, your skin really does change. These are only, get this, like $13, $14. 


When you buy things like SkinCeuticals and Obagi, the cleansers are like $60, $70. Their serums are like $100 to $200. All three of these things cost, let's see, maybe $30, $40 dollars!

These are going to last me for about six weeks. That's a deal, because the vitamin C that I was using, I was paying like $45 to $50 just for the vitamin C by itself.

Again, I just wanted to show you the vitamin C that I found, and that is the Avalon Organics. The great thing is all this is organic.

No chemicals, no nothing, and it actually works really good. Then the intense vitamin C gel cleanser works amazing, and this toner works amazing.

When you use it after the third or fourth time, you can actually see your skin brighten right in front of your eyes. 


I Just wanted to share that with you so you wouldn't have to spend a bunch of money on vitamin C.

If you're looking for organic with no chemicals, this is also a very great option for you. Thanks for watching and I'll see you next time. 

Here is the link to the product in this video: https://amzn.to/2Cz9zQyhttps://amzn.to/2Cz9zQy

title: The Secret To A Good Skin Peel At Home
content:
The Secret To A Good Skin Peel At Home

https://youtu.be/j6wd6CtMb4c

Here is my affiliate link for the skin peel in the video that I love!

https://www.platinumskincare.com/#_l_11m

The Secret To A Good Skin Peel At Home

Hi, everyone. Today, I want to talk to you about chemical peels, skin peels that you do at home. I'm not going to talk to you about how to do them. I'll show you that in another video, but a lot of people ask me, "How do you keep your skin so smooth?" My number one secret is no secret at all, and that is to do chemical peels twice a month, and that's it. Of course, moisturize and sunscreen are essential as well. So with that being said, I have a little secret for you when you do your peels at home.

The Secret To A Good Skin Peel At Home

https://www.platinumskincare.com/#_l_11m

This is going to make all the difference. I didn't learn it until serendipitously I figured it out, but I don't want you to have to try and figure it out yourself because I went years doing this, and had I known what I know now, what I'm about to tell you, would have saved me a lot of time and money and would have given me more of an effective peel had I known this. So, I'm going to tell you what that is coming up right now. Okay, welcome back. I'm going to show you the secret to a good peel at home that you do yourself. I'm going to start with the peel that I used to use. That's this one right here. I'm not going to show you the label because I'm not really happy now with the brand. It was a good peel before I knew what I know now, and so I want to teach you a good habit instead of showing you what I did for 14 and a half years. I used to get the peel like this, and you can get a peel online. Just google it. I would get it, and I would open up the cap, I'd put it on the cotton ball, and I would do my swipes on my face. Over time, it just wasn't working as well. And so, I just chalked it up as just the peel, and I was getting used to it, and things like that. What really was happening was this was getting oxidized. I didn't know that until I tried a different peel. Okay? I tried a different peel, and I'll show you that peel and how I figured it out. Every time I open this jar, the chemical peel would get oxidized, and it would weaken the strength of the peel. And so, my peels would not work as effective over time. I was just like, "Well, I'm really getting used to these," so then I would buy another peel that was a lot stronger, and then I would use it on my face, and then I would burn my face, and then I couldn't figure out why, if I was not doing as well on the first peel, why I couldn't step it up one notch, and then start doing bad. And then that peel started getting weak, and then I'd go up and up and up. But the real problem was my peel was getting oxidized. Air was getting into it, and it was reducing its ability to work. And so that's with any products. For instance, if you use a vitamin C or any kind of serum in these dropper bottles, you'll have an oxidized product. See, this one's already turning orange because air is gotten into it. And so, the thing is is that when you do buy your products, your skin care products, other than the peel, and I'm going to show you the difference, you want to use a pump because a pump doesn't get air in it. It pulls up the products. It spits it out and then it stops. It doesn't vacuum back in the air. It doesn't get the air like when you open up these bottles. I don't know why all these companies are selling these products in bottles rather than an airtight way to do that. I mean, if I've figured it out, they should know this. Anyways. I'm kind of wasting my money. My peels are reducing their strength and my products are too, so I don't buy any more products that get oxidized by the air because I'm really defeating the purpose, and I'm actually wasting my money because they don't work as good as they should over time. Now, with that being said, I went ahead and tried this peel right here. I've already opened it. I've used it twice. I used it last week, two weeks ago. You never want to do a peel more than every two weeks. I was wondering why it came in these little vials. Okay? I was thinking, hm, okay. So I went ahead and took it out. I used it. And it worked amazingly. What this is, this one right here's a TCA 30 peel. It has a little metal thing. I'm not going to open it because these, to me, are like gold, and I just ordered them. I used one and then I gave one to my sister, which she lost. So she's asking me for another one. I'm like, "Go buy some if you can't find the one I gave you, girl." Anyways, you just pop off this metal part. Take the peel off, and then this is one peel. You can use this on your face, your chest, your neck, and your chest. I suggest when you start your peel for the first time, you only do your face because this skin is very, very thin, and this is very thin too, so you want to see what your face can take before you move down. And then on your face, you don't want to do more than a few passes before you, you know, you can tell how your face is going to react. And then if you do here, you only want to do one pass, and one pass. Trust me. Until you can build up a resistance, but that is another video that I'll teach you how to do peels. But again, so this is not oxidized. Once I open it, it's oxidized, but this is made to only use one time. That's the beauty of it. So I get all the 30% strength in this. Whereas this 30%, every time I use it, it goes down, down, down, down, and I'm getting like 5%, you know, two months after I open it because this lasts for about five months, but it's not really worth it because it gets oxidized and doesn't work. It becomes just, after a while, it just feels like I'm putting water on my face or maybe a little bit of alcohol or like a burn. But this really works incredibly. I'm going to have my link here for you to check it out. But again, when you buy products that become oxidized, they turn colors, and you're wasting your money. And so, with that being said, if you buy a peel online, don't buy the ones that can become oxidized. Buy the ones that are self-contained, and buy products in a pump, so they don't get air in them, and your skin will do a lot better, and you'll get better results. With that being said, thank you for watching my video, and I will see you next time. Take care! If you get time and you want to find out how to have smoother and more youthful skin, without a plastic surgeon, then check out the link below.  I'll show you how I do it 😀 https://how-to-get-smoother-skin.teachable.com/p/smooth-skin How to get smooth skin

title: Best Primer for Mature Skin
content:
Best Primer for Mature Skin

Best primer for mature skin

my affiliate link: https://amzn.o/2NUTYPC

 If you want to seriously get smoother skin then check out my "Smooth Skin" course.  Just four quick steps to make your skin younger guaranteed!  Click the link to watch the video:  https://how-to-get-smoother-skin.teachable.com/p/smooth-skin

Best Primer for Mature Skin

Hi everyone, welcome back! I am here to talk about face primers. Face primers specifically for us women that have mature skin. Yes, I said mature skin, but you know what, we can make our skin look amazing. We can start by using primers, and you don't have to spend a lot of money. I have tried products anywhere from $5 to $50. But I'm here to show you what works the best and for very little, so stay tuned and we'll do that right now. Okay, so I didn't start using primers until I was 52 years. I'm in my mid-50s, and I wish I had started using them earlier because it helps with large pores, which I have, it helps with texture, which I have. I have a lot of rough texture and primers really set the tone for your foundation and they make your skin look flawless. If you use the right primer, it won't settle into lines and wrinkles, because that can make us look worse and make us look older. So the primers I'm gonna start with, my very first primer was Fenty Beauty by Rihanna, and I love this primer, I swear by it, I love it so much. But it's pricey, I think I paid like $40 and it doesn't last really long. Using it every day, it probably lasted me about 30 days. I like products that work really well and don't cost a lot of money. So Fenty Beauty, if you have a lot of money to spend, good for you, but I don't because I like using a lot of products. But if you want to try this, I suggest that you do because it's really smooth, it lasts all day, and it's just amazing. So the Fenty Beauty by Rihanna is my number two for the price. And then, of course, you have all these little primers that we won't go over. Like I have 10 here, so we have Malani, which you can't get at Walgreens. And I didn't like it too much, because it made my face look kinda oily. And then the NYX Hydration, well, that's supposed to be for mature skin, but it makes my skin look a little oily as well. And then we have another one, this is LA Color, you can get it at Walgreens, and this is like five bucks, and it was okay. I didn't really like it as much as I like Fenty Beauty, but still, I didn't wanna pay the price, right? So I'm on a mission to find a better primer. Then I went and tried the Elf Poreless. And this is pretty good, it's like $3 and I got it at Target. So this is pretty good if you just want to use it to go to the grocery store, it's three bucks, it's pretty good. And then, of course, I tried some other ones by Avon, and some pore fillers by NYX. And I just tried a whole bunch. I tried about 10. So then I went into Sephora and the people that are working there, of course, they always have flawless skin and they do their makeup really well, and I asked them, "Well, how do you get your skin to look like porcelain?" And they said they use this Benefit primer, it's called Pore Primer. It fills the pores and makes your skin look really good, and I tried it, I really really liked it. Then after a while, I started feeling like I'm looking older, my face was looking caky and stuff. So I think this Pore Primer by Benefit, you can get it at Sephora or Ulta, it's probably more for younger skin than our older skin. So that is that. And then I started the Kat Von D. And this one was pretty good, but it felt a little sticky, a little heavy, and it was pretty pricey too. So these two I got at Sephora, and they're around the same price, like $40-$50, and that's a lot to spend when you have a ton of other products that you use.

Best Primer for Mature Skin

So what did I find? Tada! My number one primer for our age is Covergirl Trublend. It's a skin primer and pore reducer. But guess what, this is a purple. They come in different correction colors, and I accidentally got a purple, I didn't know there was a correction color line. So I got this and I love this stuff, and it's like $10, and I've been using it for a month now, and I still have half of a tube here. So I'm going to go ahead and say this Covergirl Trublend is the best primer that I have found for our age, and you can choose. You can do your yellow color for red correction. It says the purple is for reducing pores and outbursts of maybe spots and creates a perfect canvas for a long-lasting weightless feel, and truly it does work. And I will not switch back to any of these primers. I actually have these and I'm only gonna use this $10. I can buy five of these for what I pay for one of these. But a little secret here, with your primers, if you buy them, you could also use these for your legs or your arms or whatever you want and kind of put some body makeup. So don't throw away your old primers, and you don't necessarily have to buy a $10 or a $40 primer for your body. You can just go buy the $3 elf primer at Target or Walgreens and you can use that on your arms, and then you put a little bit of foundation on there, a little bit of powder. It gives you a really nice clean smooth look if you have spots. So with that being said, thanks for watching this video, and I will see you next time!

  Nuface toning review  

Nuface Toning Review

I'm having a bit of a bad hair day, I don't know what's going on, it looked good when I put it up, but it's just going crazy. I have really thin hair, so it never stays up when I put it up. But I want to show you my latest and greatest little product that I've been using. It's called the Gold Trinity by Nuface, and this is a really popular thing right now. What it is, it's a micro-current, and it sends currents to our muscles and blood and gets it to be toned, and it says that your face is 85% more toned by using it, 80% smoother. Let's see, so anyway, I'm really bad about not reading all the directions before I do these videos, I just do them on the fly, so I apologize for that. I'm learning as I'm doing this video myself. But I've been using this for about a month, I always say that you need to use things for at least a month before you really can review them, right? So this is, like a said, a micro-current, and it brings blood to your face. And it comes like this, you can buy it in different colors, and things like this, but one thing I wanted to warn you if you're going to use this, is there's a lot of fake ones out there. And I hate to say it, but on eBay, they have a lot of fake ones. And the way you can tell if they're fake or not is, see underneath here you see the little square that you go ahead and plug into your little charger? The fake ones, they're slanted, they're completely fake, and when you see those, you've bought a fake one. And then you're like, "Well then how do I know it's fake? I have to buy it to find out if it's fake." If I were you I would buy this at the Dermstore, my link is going to be here, and I'll have legitimate products here for you too. I was watching a girl on YouTube and she bought a fake one, and it cost her three-hundred-and-something dollars, so you don't want to do that, I'm sure. So, again, you want the ones that have the little squares, and they're not slanted. When they're slanted you know they're fake. So this comes in this box right here, if you order this one, you get a gel primer, you'll use this primer on your face before you do your machine. And I'll show you that in a minute. And then it comes with these prep pads, and these are awesome, they're little individual washcloths, and they've got bead texture on them, so when you use them on your face it really exfoliates your face. I love them, I love them, when I go on trips and travel a lot, which I do, I take them, and it works amazing. And they give you a little pouch to put your thing in, but you know what? I couldn't get it in there, I don't know, maybe I'm not using it for the right thing. So again, you get this Nuface Trinity Toner, and you get the gel, and you get the little wipey, and you get the carrying case, and again, this is for micro ... and I'm going to kick myself for doing this again, it's a micro-current, I don't know why I'm saying micronutrients, maybe I'm hungry! I am hungry. So anyway, you're going to charge this little baby, and then you're going to use it at night. And you're going to put your primer gel, your gold kind of gel on there, it's a clear gel, and then you're going to start here, you're going to turn your machine on, and it'll make a little noise. And I always do everything extreme, so I do it all the way to the highest level. And then on a clean face, with your gel, you're just going to put it here, and you can feel the little current. And it'll beep, it'll tell you to move it. And you just continue, continue, continue. And I don't have any gel on, and so I can really, really feel it. And it's just like little bits of little teeny shocks. If I had the gel on there it would keep the pain off, or whatever, it's not really painful, it'll just keep that sensation from going away. So anyway, you just keep using it all over your face and then use it on your neck and your chest and everything. The only thing I have a problem with using these kinds of machines, it takes a long time. You can sit there and do it when you're watching TV and everything, and then hopefully you've moved it around and got it all in the right places, and you've done everything. You especially want to get up here and pull up your eyebrows, I can really feel that without the primer. And you just want to do that until it blinks. But it takes a long time if I do my face and my neck and my chest, it takes a good 15 minutes. Now on top of that, I do a couple other things, so when I do my wind-down routine at night, it takes a long time. And sometimes I don't always feel like doing it. So for these products to work consistently you have to do them consistently, every night. So if you are committed to 15 minutes, at least, to do this, it actually does work. I used to use this before when they first came out, it was a wand, and it was probably about eight years ago. And I liked it, I misplaced it, so now two months ago I bought this actually. And I like it, it tones my jaw, and I like the fact that I can do it around my eyes and it lifts my eyebrows up. And I like to do it around my cheeks, especially, because it lifts that. And then I like to go in here because I think it builds collagen in these little lines and folds right here. So again, I just wanted to show you this Nuface little machine or little gadget, it's pretty good. And if you have the time, and you're committed for 15 minutes at least a night, and you're consistent, this is well worth it. I have a link, or you can go on Amazon, or you can go to the Dermstore, and you can get it. Or I think they have it at Ulta and Sephora. I think I paid $325 for it, yes I did. So $325 ... And I think I just broke it. Hopefully, I didn't just break it. But I think you can get these on sale sometimes, like 20% off, you're just going to have to look for coupons on Google and things like that. So again, I would give this product a thumbs up, because it actually works if you're consistent with it. So thanks for watching, and thanks for watching all flaws, and I hope that I didn't just break this $325 machine, because it would not be the first time that I've done that. So thanks for watching, I'll talk to you next time 😀

title: Revitalash vs. Latisse for growing longer eyelashes
content:
Revitalash vs. Latisse for growing lashes

  https://youtu.be/4gJvRcUdPJI   Hi everyone. I'm here to talk to you about getting longer eyelashes. I would love to have lash extensions. I've actually tried them a few times but I found that they're too much maintenance. I can't handle them and I do not have the patience to go lay on a bed for two hours every few weeks to get them done so I went ahead and I tried Revitalash and it works pretty well. It's about $49, you can get it at Sephora, Bed Bath and Beyond and at, Ulta. Then I thought if I'm gonna go all the way and really try and get my eyelashes to grow I'm going to go ahead and try Latisse." Latisse is a prescription that you get from your dermatologist or doctor and you put it on your eyes every night and it makes your eyelashes grow. It comes with individual little brushes and you just take the little bottle that they give you and you use one brush and you only one drop. You want to put it inside of the white line of your eye, not on the top but inside because it works better when you do that. As you blink, it will go to the bottom and you want to do both sides. Then you want to toss your disposable brush and then do this every night for about 30 days.  Actually for life. I went to GoodRx.com  and got a coupon because this is $168 if you buy it from your regular pharmacy when you get a prescription.  I went to goodrx.com, I downloaded a coupon and, the cheapest one was to Walgreen's.  I paid $68. To be honest with you, I've been using it for about a month and I haven't really seen a big difference between Revitalash and Latisse. How Latisse and other lash serums came about is they used to give it to people who have glaucoma.  It had a serendipity effect, their lashes grew super long after thirty plus days. Like, I said, I've been using Latisse for a month and I don't see a big difference. I used Revitalash for a month and I saw about the same. Am I going to refill this again? Probably, because I have three more refills I'm going to go ahead and give it three more months but I'll probably end up going back to the Revitalsh because it does work just as well. Sometimes you can get it on sale for about, $29 at Bed, Bath and Beyond as well. I hope that this helped you and thanks for reading!  See you next time 😀

title: Without Existence
content:
Without Existence

  What is without existence? Often times these are the people that can't shake depression or have a mental illness.  It's not that they want to have no place to land it's just that they can't seem to be one with their soul. I know this because I watched my mother, my younger brother, my older brother, my aunt, my cousin and now my son suffers from an emotional pain that I wouldn't wish on anyone. They want to be happy but, they don't feel included in the world around them.  Their anxious, withdrawn, afraid, depressed, and the worse thing is, they continue to punish themselves over and over for things they have never done. I remember one day talking to my mom.  She was deeply depressed all of her life and her depression is what I mostly remembered about growing up.  I asked her one day, why she was so sad.  Why couldn't she just be happy?  I know asking a depressed person these questions is like asking a person with cancer, why they can't cure themselves. The questions I asked my mother were not because I was insensitive but to find out instead, one, how I could help her and two, what was it in her that was causing such significant suffering. She said, "I don't know what's wrong with me. I'm just not happy."  I asked her why.  She came back with the same answer that she didn't know.  I think this is the eye opener for me because, imagine if for twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, even sixty years of not knowing why you are unhappy. We all have times in our lives where life hits us hard via death, illness, finances, relationship losses, job changes and so on, but, many of us deal with it and eventually we move on and pick up the pieces.  We find happiness again.  We understand that its a temporary situation and not a permanent problem. My family didn't think like that.  No matter how many problems would come and go, they maintained this situation in their minds.  They were in a perpetual hell all of the time.  It's like their spirits were hijacked by some demonic thing that wouldn't allow them to get outside of their dark minds and for even a minute see that there was and is light and that it's not only at the end of a tunnel but always shining brightly. I couldn't help my mother and she took her life two years ago.  My little brother died from cancer which I believe manifested from his own demons that he couldn't shake.  My aunt died of the side effects of living with addiction and both my older brother and my cousin are like so many lost souls, they are homeless and walk this earth waiting for their time to go. My aunt died of the side effects of living with addiction and both my older brother and my cousin are like so many lost souls, they are homeless and walk this earth waiting for their the next place their soul will go. My son is trying very hard but, I see his path a dark one as he fights the good fight but is tired too.  It is the most saddening feeling when you can't even save your own mother let alone your only son. I hope that my family and all of those who suffer from being lost on this earth catch a break in the next one and their souls can feel what I feel which is happiness, joy, good and bad and know the difference between how to separate a moment and a lifetime instead feeling like walking with a thousand pound weight at all times. We are not so different from one another.  We all have a spirit.  Young or old, we are all amazing.  We are remarkable no matter what we have or haven't accomplished.  We are going to leave this life and before we do we have to find some sense of peace and with that, hopefully, happiness. We shouldn't let the world tell us what is normal and what isn't.  We should tell the world what is normal for us.  We are our own normal and not what others expect us to be in order to fit into society. If I can offer anyone that is suffering from depression and darkness is to not wait for your time to be up but to know that you're here to break the cycle so that you can live a happy life now. Don't delay or wait or live in "what if" because the road to someday is now.  Dare to be what God intended you to be.  The real pain is the sorrow we feel by not participating in the gift of life. Don't throw away your life.    As I think about it, what was my mothers real fear was she thought she was unworthy.  No matter what I told her she never felt otherwise and surrounded herself with men that reinforced her beliefs. You are worthy and you are not without existence.  Don't throw away your life.  You don't have to be lost and wait this life out until whatever your soul has in store for you next.  You are supposed to be here with all of us now and that's why you were born. No one is born better than anyone else and no one will ever be you.  Love yourself because you can't love others until you do.  When you are loved and you love back, this is the real joy and joy that will fill your soul.  No judgement.  No conditions, just letting life live through you. Forgive yourself and all that you believe to be true or not to be.  Forgive others and keep walking, don't stop searching and finding your truth. You are a miracle.  Need I say more?

Here is a link to my book if you would like to check it out:

https://amzn.to/2qvmkoL

Without Existence. Some souls were not meant to be on this earth

title: How to have young skin for life
content:
How to have young skin for life

 

Our skin is healthy and needs nothing until about the age of nine.  Up until then, we need no moisturizer because the vitality is natural.  According to the well-known dermatologist, Dr. Obaji, all the problems that happen to our skin, i.e., comes from the inside, and not from the outside, which is contrary to what we have been told our entire lives.

Dr. Obaji’s theory is that, if you have wrinkles then your body is not making collagen.  Collagen is the foundation for beautiful skin, and when we lose it, this is when we begin to age.

At approximate age thirty years old, the cells in our bodies pretty much go to sleep.  They become lazy, and collagen production begins to slow down dramatically as we age.

Why do our cells go to sleep and stop creating collagen?  A lot of it is genetics. Our skin is programmed and goes through changes in life.  

If you have Rosacea, this is caused by inflammation.  This and other conditions of the skin are caused by immune responses. Thus Dr. Obaji’s theory is that skin issues, and aging is caused by the internal factors of the body.

Dr. Obaji’s philosophy says the way to improve skin and maximize it’s potential rather than chasing wrinkles from the outside is to in his words is  "Restore the natural cellular activity that characterizes baby skin."

Essentially after thirty, we need to wake up the cells so that they can work together.  By using products that just sit on the top of our skin is a waste of our time and money.  We must use products that penetrate the skin and work in synergy to make the cells work together.  When we do this, the skin will repair itself, and its natural vitality will bring itself back.

The future of skin care

  The future of skin care is addressing one's skin on its specific needs.  It's not going to be a one size fits all like in department stores.  For example, I have brown spots, and I have larger pores around my nose.  After the basics of cleaning, I need Vitamin C, Retin-A, and a good moisturizer.  I am also in my fifties so along with these products I also need to stimulate my skin and create collagen and elastin. The future of skin care is treating skin at the cellular level.  Everyone's skin is different and has different needs.  As we age, our skin care needs will change, and skin care must be adjusted so that it corrects, restores and maintains our specific requirements to stay naturally healthy for the rest of our lives. The future of skin care is to address the needs of the skin. Thus, we prevent aging.  The younger we start, the less we will need invasive procedures like facelifts.  Preservation is the key to anti-aging.

Dr. Obaji's Skin Care Recommendations 

  Daily:
  1.  Clean your skin and remove all impurities.
  2. Stimulate your skin and clean your pores so that bacteria, oil, and makeup won't live in your pores.  (I use the  Clarisonic Mia 2, 2 Speed Facial Sonic Cleansing Brush):*  https://amzn.to/2ClDMDB
  3. Eliminate dead cells.  One of the first signs of aging is the accumulation of dead skin cells.  (Retin-A is the number one thing to use for cell turnover).  If you do nothing else, use Retin-A!
If you think that your skin is sensitive, Dr. Obaji says that there is no such thing.  He states that the real term is, "Our skin is weak."  We must strengthen our skin as the skin is capable of wearing anything.  

The moisturizer myth

  If we listen to all of the beauty and lotion companies, we are told and sold on the idea that we need more and more moisturizer.  These companies have ingrained in our psyche that we can't get enough moisturizer.  Dr. Obaji says differently.  He says that if we use too much moisturizer, then we send signals to our body by telling it to stop producing its moisturizer and thus, drying out our skin even more.  Our body compensates for what we do.  Basically, if we do all the work for our skin, we allow it to get lazy. Diet is an important part of skin care.  With that said, our diet can only convert so much that will contribute to our skin's ability to renew and regenerate itself.  Things like Vitamin A and antioxidants we can't get enough through our diets.  DNA is the brain of our cells so taking into consideration that we do need to use a skin system or steps if you will that are for our specific skin type.  Way too often we buy products because of marketing and smell.  This is not the way to use skin care because it doesn't work unless it addresses the stages of life that we are at. We have to use skin care that has science behind it.  When using a good skincare system, we must know our skin type and know that our skin changes with age.  Many of us, including me, don't know our skin type.  For so long I thought I had oily skin.  I found out that I do not.  I have more normal and dry.  So, for fifty years I was using the wrong products, and I  wondered why my skin wasn't changing.

Stimulating Your Skin

  The best way to get your skin to create the new skin from the inside out is to stimulate your skin.  Using products like Retin-A will enable your skin to create collagen and elastin, two vital building blocks for younger and healthy skin.  Some may think that we could eat a whole bunch of Vitamin A and then get enough in our bodies to create enough collagen and elastin, but we don't synthesize Vitamin A, so we need to use Vitamin A on our skin to activate it. Vitamin C is another fantastic way to make our skin stronger and fight free radicals with antioxidants.  Vitamin C also removes and prevents hyperpigmentation (brown or age spots). Our skin is naturally supposed to be smooth.  Our skin should be even toned, strong, and naturally hydrated.  When we achieve and maintain these features, we have healthy skin. Will, we age and get loose skin?  Yes and no.  The sooner that we get on a scientific program that is based on our skin type, we can achieve natural and beautiful skin forever. Just a quick note here.  I would love to use the Obaji skin care system. However, I find it to be too expensive for me.  Most of us can't afford to use multiple hundred dollar products each month. Here is the basic minimum that I do:
  1.  *Clarisonic brush (https://amzn.to/2RZNXmG)  and Dove soap or a mild cleansing gel from your local drug store.
  2. Toner (I use Oil of Olay).
  3. *Vitamin C Serum (https://amzn.to/2pXw9vs)
  4. Any eye cream made specifically for the eyes.  With today's technology, all eye creams are good!
  5. *A growth factor to repair and stimulate new collagen and elasticity.  The Obaji growth factor is way too expensive for me so I've been using TNS for several years and it works great. However, it's not cheap.  It used to be under $100.00, but now it's a bit more.  Here is my link (https://amzn.to/2CjajtT).  Quick cheat way to get your growth factors and not pay a lot is to go to https://skinactives.com (I have no affiliation with them) the lady that owns the company is a chemist and sells some pretty powerful products at very good prices.  You can get them already mixed in a base cream or, buy the active ingredient and then mix it fresh in your favorite moisturizer.
  6. Moisturizer made for my skin type.  It's best that once per year you see a Dermatologist to maintain your skin type and any changes to get the best results.
  7. *Sunscreen.  I use EltaMD because it's amazing and not greasy.  It also feels like it has a primer in it, so my makeup looks great! (https://amzn.to/2NKoESj).  The best part is that it's under $25.00.
  8. At night I eliminate the sunscreen and Vitamin C and then use Retin-A.
  9. Twice a month I do at home 30% TCA chemicals peels (be careful if you try this until you know how your skin will react.  I recommend starting with a Jessner peel at 14% first).  Doing peels works in synergy with the Retin-A and gives you an amazing result.  Warning:  Don't use the Retin-A after a peel until you have completely healed and don't do a peel more than twice per month.
The total cost for the above (after you buy one time the Clarisonic brush) about $150.00 per month.  The Retin-A will last a couple of months.  Vitamin C will last about six weeks.  The TNS about a month.  If you go to skinactives.com, your cost will be less.  Peels usually last about four to six months. The * means that they are my affiliate links but by all means find them anywhere. 😊  

Thanks for stopping by!  See you next time. 😘

title: How to resist colds and viruses the natural way
content:
How to resist colds and viruses the natural way

 

It's crazy that there is no cure for the common cold yet.  I say this as I am starting to get a sore throat and a pressure in my chest.

I hate getting colds (duh! Who doesn't right?) and, fortunately, I only get them every few years.  I seem to get them more when I travel a lot.

Okay, with that said, I hate taking medicine so I usually suffer and ride out the cold all while feeling run down at work and hiding inside until the symptoms have passed.

How to resist colds and viruses the natural way

  So what exactly is the best way to resist colds and viruses the natural way?  Colds are caused by about 200 viruses that are constantly mutating.  As you may guess, trying to find a cure is light trying to hit a moving target. According to some statistics, we can get a cold up to four times a year, and a child can get about twelve per year! Most households have a ton of medicines to fight the symptoms of a cold, but as stated, there is no cure for the common cold. Of course, it's better to avoid getting a cold by washing your hands, keeping your hands away from your mouth, nose, and eyes.  Viruses penetrate our protective mucus and then quickly make a home in our throat.  This is me right now :( Once you feel the symptoms, the virus has replicated at least 10 to 12 hours. Once you get a cold, rest, hydrate, sip green and herbal teas.

Some safe and effective alternatives to fighting a cold

  Once you have a cold you may want to ease congestion with a peppermint or eucalyptus steam as follows:
  1. Pour 1 1/2 quarts of boiling water into a heatproof bowl.
  2. Add about 8 to 10 drops of either peppermint or eucalyptus essential oil or mix half and half.
  3. Put a towel over your head and breath in the steam for about five to ten minutes.
  4. Don't get too close to the steam as you can burn yourself.
  5. BREATHE :)
If you would like to fight germs the natural way rather than with chemicals, try natural antimicrobial soap.

It's easy to make and here's the recipe for hand soap:

  1.  6 ounces of natural liquid soap.
  2. 30 drops of eucalyptus essential oil.
  3. 30 drops of lavender essential oil.
  4. 15 drops of orange essential oil.
  5. 2 drops of tea tree oil.
Put all ingredients in a glass pump dispenser.

title: Marriage, Divorce, Single after 50 😊
content:
Marriage, Divorce, Single after 50 😊

  As I was flipping through my Sirius radio channels while driving, I heard a voice say:

"Your fifty-eight years old.  Stay in your marriage.  At your age, you won't be able to find anyone else and being alone is far worse at your age then the pain of staying in your marriage."

Of course, I thought this was both ridiculous and intriguing at the same time so I stayed tuned to the station, and it was the famous Dr. Laura talking to a woman that called in about her husband having multiple affairs and her question was "Should I leave him or stay?" To be fair to Dr. Laura, she was probably telling the lady what she wanted to hear because she had a vibe of being afraid to take the next step and leave. Dr. Laura explained that the fact that she had grown kids and that her husband would probably get remarried to a younger girl and then all of the families including her, most likely she'd be alone, would have to gather at family functions, and, this would be painful.  Maybe more painful than getting a divorce. The lady was a bit taken back, but ultimately she agreed because I guess she needed affirmation in her decision to stay. After listening to that conversation, I turned the station to Spa music which helps me to relax and keep my mind at peace.  But, not today.  I was bothered by the radio conversation because I wonder if all of us women of a certain age have to worry about whether or not our options will change.  And according to Dr. Laura and society, it's not an if, it's a certainty that they will. Maybe I have my fears because my mothers biggest fear was that she was going to die alone.  I always say that we create what we fear.  After several failed marriages, she did, in fact, die alone. However, dying alone is not my biggest fear.  I fear that I will get old and my husband will leave me for a thirty-year-old, and I will have no relevance.  I know, dumb things that we sometimes tell ourselves :( Just so you know, I don't sit around worrying about this, but it does make one a little off when at a certain age, we walk into a room, and it's like we have disappeared into a crowd. Or, like last night, I stood at the bar trying to get a glass of wine, and they looked right passed me.

Maybe my real fear is getting old?

Later that day, I met my daughter for dinner, and I explained the radio conversation, and she just rolled her eyes and said, "Mom that's not how it is." Although I would like to believe her, I also had to set her straight and explain that this is, in fact, is the way that it is.  Men can date half their age and women can barely get a date after fifty or sixty let alone beyond. Which brings me to a time when my husband and I were eating dinner, and I pointed to a few beautiful women, and I said:

"If we ever got a divorce, one of those women would be your next wife."  He quickly replied with "I'm not going to date women our age if we got a divorce."

 I was mortified because for one, I needed him to at least lie to me and say "Yeah" and two, I didn't need confirmation on what I already feared.

A friend of mine said she was playfully joking with her husband and she said:

"Okay if you get a girlfriend then I'll go find a guy too."

 He replied "Oh yeah?  Well, I have more value than you at your age.  The joke went from funny to not so funny, super quick!

I was listening to Kathleen Turners interview yesterday with Vulture Magazine, and she said that she once got a script and when she read it, it said, that she was going to be thirty-seven years old and "STILL SOMEWHAT ATTRACTIVE!"   Geeze, if we are only somewhat attractive at thirty-seven because that's when we're old, how are women over fifty supposed to feel?  I am not implying that we have to be what others think as beautiful but, we have to feel good in our skin. I know too that it's not about how we look, it's about the connections in life that we make.  It's not about things it's about living the beautiful life that we are given.  I know that life is short and if God forbid I am diagnosed with a terminal illness, none of this crap that I'm writing about even matters! So I am not going to insert the word but here because writing the above paragraph just put it all in perspective, whereas when I run it through my mind, it wasn't so clear. Life is not about fearing and worrying that someone that is supposed to love you and be faithful to you is going to trade you in for a newer model.  It's about trusting and loving that person with all that you have.  We can't fully love if we are in fear of loss. The truth is, we are all going to be alone one day.  Whether it's through death, divorce, or whatever.  Life has a beginning, a middle and an end. No matter what, it's important to live all three of these parts because while I was worried about stupid shit like getting old and younger women, the sun is starting to set in the third part of my life and there's no time to waste :)    

Marriage, Divorce, Single after 50!
tag_names: divorcegetting oldgetting olderlife mattersmarriagemarried menno time to wasteover 50single over 50single over 50 womenyounger women

title: 10 Ways to Reconnect With Yourself 😘
content:
10 Ways to Reconnect With Yourself 😘

  These days we have so many gadgets, apps., online conveniences, and so much more but still, it feels like we never have enough time for ourselves. When I do have some free time, I find myself looking for something to do rather than connecting with myself. When I was younger, I would do all kinds of soul searching and reading and, whatever felt good for my spirit.  Now, I find that I  rarely connect with myself anymore. So, I started a list (on my smartphone of course) on the ways that I have started connecting with myself again. The following is my list:

10 Ways to Reconnect With Yourself 😘

 

Do one of the following or more!!

  Connecting with yourself  
  1. Take fifteen minutes per day no matter what to reconnect.
  2. Sit next to a window and just stare and daydream.
  3. Take a walk.  When is the last time that you took a walk by yourself?
  4. Get on the floor and stretch every part of your body.
  5. Meditate.  It was hard for me to meditate because I am an anxious person by nature, however, using my smartphone, I downloaded an app. with meditation music.   I close my eyes and try to stay in the moment.  I go through a list of forgiveness and gratitude and before I know it, fifteen minutes is up, and I feel great!  It takes a few times, but the music helps.
  6. Sit in a sauna or Jacuzzi and just relax.  I use an infrared sauna, and I sit in it for thirty minutes per day.  I swear it clears my mind.
  7. Okay, I'm about to go deep here 😬  Comfortably lay down or sit and think back as far as you can remember to when you were a child.  Then, watch yourself grow up.  Go through every year of your life until now.  If you can do it, it's amazing.  If you're like me and you have some forgiving yourself to do, it is very healing and closes a lot of doors.
  8. If you're lucky enough to have a parent or both, spend time with them weekly.  It's one of the biggest connections with yourself that you'll miss when they're gone.
  9. Do something that you love.  I love to cook and I really get into the groove. It relaxes me.  Maybe you like to crochet or paint?  Fifteen minutes a day will create some beautiful things in no time.  Remember though, no agenda.
  10. Don't wait until the kids are grown, the debt is paid off, you retire, or anything else.  Do what you want now because today is a gift and tomorrow is not promised.  I'm sure that I don't have to remind you about how life goes so fast.
  Notice that I didn't say exercise on the list.  I think that doing anything that has a goal defeats the purpose of connecting with yourself as there is an agenda. The ten recommendations above are so that your mind and your soul can merge together without a whole lot of effort. It's like resting the mind so our soul feels regenerated. That was my list.  I would love to see yours. 😀  

If you would like to find more ways to Rejuvenate.  I have created a six-step course called "The Rejuvenation Program"  You can check it out by clicking this link: http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

title: Your Vagina after 50 🙄
content:
Your Vagina after 50 🙄

  I didn't know if I should write this post because I have a few people in my family that don't want to know about my vaginal health! With that said, they probably don't read this blog so I'm going to take a chance here and hopefully my son, God bless him if he reads this because for one, when I ask him to fold the clothes in the dryer he takes a pencil and picks up my underwear and carries it to my room 🙄 and then two, he would totally plug his ears and say "la la, la la" when any subject about his mothers body comes up! Okay, back to my original reason that I am writing this post is that I've had a bit of irritating last couple of months! One day I'm frolicking in jeans and then bam! I'm unable to wear jeans or anything that touches anything (get where I'm going here?) Without going into full detail (no diseases or anything like that) just a complete change in my bodies bullshit capacity to change as I age. How do I know it's a problem with changing as I age? Well because, when I went to my OBGYN, which I seem to have done more in the last year than in my entire lifetime, she says "oh, when you get older the balance of your vagina changes."   I'm like "Woman, what does that mean?"  I don't want my vaginas balance to change!  I'm trying to stay young, look good and age well.  The last thing that I need is an unbalanced vagina! So, I tell her to let's get it back into balance.  Afterall, I have a sex hungry husband that balanced or not; I have duties to adhere to.  I don't have the leisure in my marriage to wait out or balance out my vagina issues! I mean really, do younger girls have vagina issues? I don't hear of them.  Okay, no one talks about them no matter what our age but still, WTF! Does a vagina do what the hell it wants?  It must because it's not cooperating with me and I'm sitting here in a sexy black dress with no underwear (which I hate) waiting for my husband to go to dinner. Why no underwear... No, it's not because after 30 years of marriage I'm going to play some sexy game at dinner (guess what honey? I'm not wearing panties, hell no! I can't keep up as it is) but, it's more like. "God I hope he doesn't notice that I'm not wearing panties so I can rest." Because mostly, I can't wear them now!!!  

Here is what happens to our Vagina as we age

  Your Vaginal Health Over 50   I'm not going to talk about the aesthetics because that's a whole other story. As we age we lose the sex hormone, Estrogen.  Which causes dramatic changes is the appearance and the function of our vagina. The length and size shrink and then we lose our lubrication.  Which then, the vaginal area becomes irritated and with that, the walls become thin and we lose elasticity.  This can inhibit our sex drives and relationships.

Thankfully there are things that we can do to keep or Vaginas healthy and young!

 

Six Ways To Take Care of Your Vagina After 50!

 
  1.  Moisturize using moisturizers like Replens and Luvena to eliminate dryness.
  2.  Seems a bit different but you can use a good organic coconut oil too.  Just make sure you're not allergic to it and do a spot test on your forearm before using on your vagina.
  3. Use a low dose of Estrogen Therapy via a pill, cream, or a vaginal ring.  Just talk to your doctor.  You can do this two or three times a week.  If you don't want a pill, the cream is inserted at night and works amazingly.
  4. Your partner will love this one.  Stay sexually active as the vagina will go into atrophy if you don't.  You know what they say "Use it or lose it."  Sex helps the vagina maintain moisture and flexibility.
  5. Do Kegel exercises!  I do one hundred per day and if you want to avoid having to wear leak guard protection in your later years, this really helps.  Kegel's help with avoiding prolapse.  This happens when organs starting slipping out of place 😳
  6. Take a probiotic.  This really helps keep the good flora active as we age to avoid things like yeast infections, etc.
Doing the steps above are super easy and not time-consuming.  Both your vagina and your partner will thank you for it.

title: Chemical Burden
content:
“Chemical Body Burden”

    The toxic burden of chemicals we use  

Have you heard of “Chemical Body Burden?”

  Thousands of Americans have their blood tested to determine what their chemical levels are. The results of a CDC study were puzzling because those that lived in remote areas had hundreds of synthetic chemicals in their bloodstream. Sadly, are exposed even before we are born. Unfortunately, according to the CDC, 287 toxins were detected within the umbilical cord of babies. The question is, how do toxins get into our bloodstream? The answer is, most toxins come from everyday personal care and household products that we use every day. While I read on one website that our skin absorbs 60% of what we put on it and that, products and chemicals are absorbed within 26 seconds, I read on another that, then when asked the FDA, the following is their answer: “The FDA asks True or False; about 60 to 70 percent of what you put on your skin is absorbed into your body.” “False; Most of what we put on our skin is absorbed much too slowly, if at all, for that to happen. If the skin this much pass into our bodies, many of the chemicals that occur naturally in our bodies and keep us alive would escape through our skin, too, and that isn't happening. source: https://www.annmariegianni.com/much-skin-actually-absorb/

How Toxins Enter Our Body and the Chemical Burden

  The skin’s function is to be a barrier. It's there to keep our organs, etc. from harmful elements. Like, bacteria, radiation, the sun and other things from hurting us. It’s divided into three parts. I won’t go all in with regards to the whole anatomy of its structure; however, I will give just the basics here. We have three parts. The Epidermis, dermis and the hypodermis. Many substances are too big to be absorbed by our skin, however, contrary to what the FDA might say, absorption of chemicals is very real. Just look at medication we are given through things like medical patches, hormones creams, pain creams, fentanyl patches. Even sunscreens have warning labels on them. Also, the skin on our scalp and face have more absorption that the rest of our body. Temperature, skin integrity, the concentration of the product, length of time exposed, etc. all are factors in the fact of whether our skin absorbs products.  

Pathways of absorption

  One of the things that concern me is how many products that I put on my face that I get in my mouth on a daily basis like, serums, sunscreens, makeup, lipstick and so many others. Did I mention all the things that we breathe in too? Like, environmental toxins, house sprays, cleaning solutions, perfume, oil burners, candles, etc. Not to mention when I take baths and showers how products get absorbed in the female area. It sounds crazy but those of us who have had bladder infections and suffered significantly know that, we don’t dare use bubble bath or fragrances while taking a bath.  

Conclusion

Our skin absorbs toxins no matter what they say. The question here is how much? The only answer is to remove as many chemicals in our everyday life so that we have at least some control.

Just adding to what you already do :)

title: My how life has flown by
content:
My how life has flown by

  Graduation Party My how life has flown by.  I’m in my fifties, and I know ( I hope) that my best years are ahead of me. My daughter got her Masters degree this past weekend, and she is about to get married in a few months.  All of that didn’t make me feel old until I watched my son drive out of the driveway today to go live on his own. This isn’t his first time, but he swears that it will be his last.  A part of me wants to believe it because there is nothing healthy about a child becoming an adult and then living at home. It is our job to help them fly and to let them go.  But, a small part of me hopes that he will come back. I have to admit.  It’s a bit scary to see the sun setting more so than rising these days.  I know that we have no guarantee of another day and that this day is all we are promised but  “my how life flies by. One day you’re rocking in your thirties and forties and then bam! You’re getting close to sixty. I never thought I would be sixty and with God willing, I will make it there.  I know there are many who have never had the chance. I am so grateful to be alive and thankful.   Each day my appreciation and my gratitude for life expand, and I am humbled in a way I  that I never thought possible. I feel that I am in a good place in my life.  Where I used to have regret for the things that I have done and the mistakes that I have made, I feel now that there is no time for regret only time for forgiveness and moving forward. One thing that I am learning is to live with is the loss of my mother and my brother.  They died on the same day exactly two years apart.  I miss them both.  It took me over a year to accept that they nor I will live forever.  I’m grateful that my mother often visits me in my dreams. That’s one of the great things about being younger (besides being skinny and not having to work out), you never think that you or anyone you love is going to die.  I guess it crosses your mind, but you never get it until someone dies. I hope that my mother and my brother are in a beautiful place.  They were both in terrible spiritual pain that they tried to alleviate the pain through means of physical relief that ended their lives.  It is my prayer that they are together and out of misery.

My how life has flown by

I guess the point of this post was going to be about how fast life has flown by and all of the ways that it has, however, now, my heart is guiding me in a new direction of not focusing on what was but instead on what is. Sure my adult kids will never be my babies anymore.  I will retire, the calendar will move faster and faster and, my time will be over too.  Just like everyone else. The thing is, life is about living.  Live is half chance for me and everyone else.  If you’re lucky, you got most of it right but, if you’re human you a lot of it wrong.  I’m at the time where I can now make it right. At this point in life, I want to give more than I receive.  Put back more than I take.  I want to step back and let others shine.  I no longer need the spotlight and wish I knew then what I know now because I would have never needed it then. I have the life that I want because my mother taught me what not to do.  I created the complete opposite and have everything that she did not.  I have good kids, a loving spouse, materials and mostly, piece of mind and serenity.   These are the things that eluded my mother for her entire life. So my point (yet again, I know) is that the meaning in life is whether you will make it the best life that you can so that you can lift others up so that, they can do the same.  I believe this changes the world and this is our legacy. So to take it down the line, my daughter got her masters in School Psychology.  She specializes in helping autistic, and special needs children get noticed so that they won’t become a statistic. I guess God wanted my mom to be here so that she could have me, so I could break the cycle so that, I could have my daughter so that, she can change the world. My work is done :) I’m ready to get old now.

If you would like to find more ways to Rejuvenate.  I have created a six-step course called "The Rejuvenation Program"  You can check it out by clicking this link: http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

The Rejuvenation Program
