title: A woman’s guide to getting older and  feeling damn good while doing it!
content:
A woman’s guide to getting older and feeling damn good while doing it!

  How to get older and be happy.    

How to get more youthful skin 

 

Basic cosmetic procedures that are the least expensive and would be a natural progression after skin care. Compared to products, cosmetic procedures are not a commodity so finding bargain cosmetic procedures may not be a good thing.

We’re talking about wounding the skin, and this doesn’t necessarily correlate with cheaper. However, there is no reason you can’t call around to your local dermatologists or plastic surgeons to find out what procedures cost.

Then you can compare for yourself. I pick three or four good doctors or medical spas in my area and check their prices, and then I get on their email list. Before long, I get discounted offers of up to thirty percent off their procedures.

It’s worth it to compare and get on their lists. You’ll get weekly emails from all the places you signed up at to compare the prices. You can even call your favorite doctor or spa and ask if they will match prices. They do it all the time!

Botox – You should get Botox as a prevention measure. You may only need twenty units or so just to prevent frown lines or lines that may be forming between your nose and eyes called the elevens.

You can also have Botox used on your crow’s feet (the lines around your eyes). This helps tremendously. If you need thirty or forty units and you can’t afford it all at once, then get ten units every few weeks until you get all areas covered.

The cost varies, but I have paid up to fourteen-dollars a unit. When I got on the doctors’ or Spa lists, I received discounts, and now I only pay about nine to ten dollars per unit. That’s a pretty good savings. Some doctors will have a buy two get one free promotion.

Also, there are competing products to Botox. Because they’re competing with Botox, they may be less money. Botox, which is owned by Allergen, has a loyalty program, as well. I recently received a coupon for $100 off the total cost of my Botox!

This program is called BRILLIANT DISTINCTIONS. Make sure you sign up or have your doctor/injector sign you up and every time you get Botox or another Allergan product such as Juvederm, etc. you will receive points towards your next service.

I almost got my most recent Botox for free by doing this.

Chemical Peel – A chemical peel is great for removing the surface layer of the skin. The process wounds the skin, which causes it to heal itself by creating new collagen. A chemical peel has different strengths so the cost will vary.  You can do it at home.  Check out my course (https://how-to-get-smoother-skin.teachable.com)

In most states, a chemical peel will cost about $150 to  $200 in a doctor’s office. You’ll want to continue having peels, as they will help create beautiful skin with less texture and, diminish fine lines.

You can do them yourself, but start with a low strength.  Unfortunately, in my learning process, I bought a fifty-percent TCA peel online (I should not have been able to purchase this strength peel without a license), and I did some serious damage to my skin. Damage so bad that, I have to hide the scars every day for three years. It’s not the worth the risk to try and skip ahead rather than to start slow or let a professional do it.

If you want to do your peel, start with a small patch of skin to see how it will react. I do my own peels every two to four weeks, usually no more than twice a month. You can go to skin-peel.com to find them.

The secret to making peels comfortable is while they are on your face, use your blow dryer on the cool setting or, use a small hand fan pointed at your face. It makes a difference.

Retin-A – A prescription is required, but Retin-A is fantastic!! “Retin-A (tretinoin) is a topical preparation of vitamin A, which has antioxidant properties, just like the vitamin by itself. It’s an acid derivative of retinol (vitamin A).

The important aspect is the effectiveness of what Retin-A does. Studies have shown that Retin-A can help reduce wrinkles, reduce acne, exfoliate dead skin cells and redistribute melanin. Melanin redistribution results in lighter, more even skin color. Thus Retin-A is often used to treat skin discolorations caused by excessive sun exposure.

If you have sensitive skin, it may not work for you, it may be too harsh, but there are alternatives with lesser concentrations.  I would still try to mix a little every other night with my favorite cream. Just don’t give up. This stuff is amazing!  I heard it said that anyone with a pulse and a credit card should use Retin-A.

Get Retin-A for less at GOODRX.COM

Teeth Whitening – This makes a huge difference. You could have perfect skin and straight teeth, but if your teeth are stained and dull, no one will notice anything else. If you have bright, white teeth, you’ll look better, and younger, and feel better too.  

The cost in my state is about $100.00, which is down from $500 when I first had it done. There are many good ones over the counter too.

IPL-, which stands for intense pulse light or flash lamp therapy, is a noninvasive and non-ablative treatment that uses high intensity pulses of visible light to improve the appearance of birthmarks, port wine stains, broken facial veins, rosy cheeks, rosacea, red thread veins of the legs, freckles, age spots, facial lines and wrinkles, and the removal of unwanted dark hair. The procedure is referred to as photo rejuvenation and requires a series of treatments.  I can tell you personally that it doesn't work on legs :(

The cost nationally runs about $100 to $300. You should only need a few treatments. I have seen it as low as $80 per treatment if you agree to three or more.

 It’s important to know that brown spots on the body are hard to remove.  I add a skin bleach and put a little of my skin peel on each spot when I do peels on my face.  It takes a long time and staying out of the sun maintain my treatment.

Dermapen or Micro-Needling – “ Sterile surgical stainless micro-needles pierce the skin leading to apoptosis of cells in the dermis.” “What is Apoptosis? Apoptosis or programmed cell death is when a cell essentially commits suicide. This process is natural, controlled and routine. Little inflammation is caused.” “The Dermapen uses eleven, 33-gauge micro needles to stimulate the dermis. Needles vertically pierce the skin to enhance rejuvenation results. Small holes are punctured at a rate of 1000/second. This proliferation of the body’s tissue continues to release growth factors from fibroblasts, keratinocytes, and monocytes.”

Note: I have had Dermapen about six times and it works wonders. It’s comparable to lasers like Fraxel but without all the downtime and expense. Many doctors will give you a discount if you buy a package of four or more. You can save hundreds by doing this. I paid $150 per treatment vs. $300 – $350 by buying the package.

Juvederm – Juvederm is an injectable filler consisting mostly of hyaluronic acid. It’s used to fill in areas to smooth out wrinkles and deep folds on the face and can last up to a year. You can pay anywhere from $400 a syringe to $800. I pay only about $500 – $550 depending on the specials the doctors have. Currently, my doctor has a buy one get one half off, and I can save the second one for a later time. At first, you may need two but, as your stem cells work, you will need less later.  In my case, it lasts about six months.  Remember, you get points for this with the Brilliant Distinctions Program.

These are certainly not all of the basic cosmetic procedures available, but these tend to be the least expensive and the least invasive. These procedures do well concerning anti-aging and reversing past damage.

They’re also a good alternative to going under the knife. I think one day these products and procedures will be affordable for all of us

With today’s technology, the need for doctors to perform invasive procedures will diminish so they’ll be more eager to lower procedure costs to attract more patients. I hope that you get the best skin possible without having to figure out where you will get the money.

Let’s face it, many of us want to take care of ourselves but, products and procedures can be a little expensive.

How to be happy 😀

    How to be happy at mid-life  

First let me start off with I’m no Doctor Phil, Life Coach or anything more than just a person who has always had a pretty good life but, felt like there was something missing a lot of the time.

I felt happy most of the time but true, however, long-term happiness, eluded me. Some may call this depression, but for me, it wasn’t.  And, it wasn’t that there was always something greater and better that I was chasing either.  I know about watering my own grass.

I wasn’t looking to escape myself and I certainly never wanted to be anyone but me.  Sure I could be prettier, smarter and have nicer stuff but really, does any of that make someone happy for very long?

Pretty fades, smarter becomes irrelevant, and you can’t take stuff with you.

But, I always had this little hole that I couldn’t fill.  I got some therapy; I had my share of boyfriends to fill it and, I’ve spent my way through pretty good sums of money only to end up right back to where I had always been.  Back to me the person with the hole.

So when I turned fifty life clicked for me.  I finally got it.  I was happy all along but, I was creating my unhappiness by the disappointment that I created about, all of the ways that I thought life should be.

The truth is, life is half chance and half results.

Blame it on the media, magazines, reality shows, parents or whatever but, how to be happy comes back to whether we are comfortable in our skin, at any stage in life. Some are luckier than others and get this sooner than I did at fifty but, never the less, I got it before it was too late.  Better late than never.

That was it.  I was never comfortable in my skin.  I figured at age fifty; if I wasn’t comfortable by now, I’d better figure out how to get that way or figure out an exit plan because I certainly wasn’t going to allow myself to grow old and bitter.

Moreover, I didn’t want to walk around thinking a part of me was missing for the next half of my life.

It doesn’t matter what age you are, how to be happy is about being comfortable in your skin.  It’s not about comparing yourself to anything other than the person that you were yesterday.  Not tomorrow because, you don’t have that day yet and, you may never get it.

Another thing that has changed me is the acceptance that life is beautiful and, it’s quick and, those that we love are here one day and gone the next.  Like both my mother and my brother.

Let me say that when you forget that your mom has passed away but, you pick up the phone to call her and then you realize that she is no longer there, not today, not tomorrow, not ever again, life becomes pretty sobering.

If you are fortunate to have not lost a parent, please, call them every day because, when you do,  you’ll feel a kind of pain the hurts beyond what you thought was even possible (sorry. I know you don't need me to tell you that).

When we realize and contemplate that we too only have a short amount of time, we don’t have much time other than to be happy.  It is our duty to ourselves to give ourselves this gift. This is what most people will remember you for.  Not stuff, not your looks, not how much money you had.  This is your true legacy.

I know that really bad things happen in life and, these things will pass.  We will all die and so will the people we love.  We will have financial difficulties, and life will sometimes punch us so hard that it knocks the wind out and sometimes for longer than we had planned.  But, life goes on with or without us, and that’s just how it is.  This is the acceptance part that we must do.

I’m not here to give you a cheesy line about how grateful you should be.   Or that what you have others would probably kill to have.  I will say that you and I should take some time every day to realize how short life is and understand that, we don’t have a lot of time other than to live our lives to the fullest while we are here for the short time that we have.

There is no magic to being happy.  The secret is to accept the beautiful life that God has given, don’t over think, add a little gratitude and, keep smiling knowing that you have this day which may be your last.

 

Change is coming

READY FOR A CHANGE?

    Time for a change. Live like you mean it.  

Change is a natural part of life and to resist it is futile. Changes occur all around us, and there is nothing we can do about it. Sometimes change is good and sometimes, as we feel a change, it may be uncomfortable, so we resist it.

Even after all the resisting we do, there comes a time when we are ready for a change. When we accept it, we listen to our inner self, possibly the one that has been talking to us our whole lives, but only now are we listening.

It’s the voice that we have always wanted to hear but didn’t take its advice until now. It’s time for a change and with change comes healing and transformation.

The key to making a change is wanting to do it. Even if we fail on our journey, the more we keep trying, the higher the chance is that we will succeed. I don’t need a diet to deprive myself. As soon as I say diet, I get a negative emotion that pulls me in the opposite direction, and I automatically go right back to the way I was or sometimes worse.

Sometimes instead of feeling good, I feel bad, and this is what I focus on. I realize that I don’t need to live like this regularly. The fact is, I don’t need to diet; I need to eat better. We as a society put so many restrictions on ourselves and when we don’t succeed we punish ourselves, and the cycle continues.

I need to make a lifestyle change, that’s all. If you want to make a difference, make a change, but don’t do it because of others. You know what will and will not make you a better person. This is the only change we need to make.

There is no one solution for change. Everyone is different, and it is through trial and error that we succeed. I tend to go in circles when I don’t know how to make a change. This wastes so much time that I often stop trying and start again later, only to go in circles again.

Once I fall, I know why I fell, and I don’t fall that way again.

 No sense in kicking ourselves when we are down. It doesn’t make sense to be defeated before we start. I have wasted a lot of time in my life, not by trying and failing, nope, I have lost more time not doing anything at all.

If you are sitting on the fence or the couch for that matter and you know it’s time for a change, what are you waiting for?

Momentum kicks in in any situation when we get started. Think about when you were in school, and you had a term paper due. You may have been the kid who waited until the last minute because you didn’t have a topic and you didn’t know where to begin. Painfully, you waited until the last minute and got started the night before or the morning that it was due.

It’s not so much that time isn’t on your side, its momentum that kicks in and you get on a roll. Once you are in this phase, you are blowing and going, and you see the end in sight. It’s just like change. You realize that it’s not so hard and wonder why you didn’t do it sooner. We make things harder than they need to be.

Elements of change:

Readiness, barriers, and relapse should all be expected on the road to change. We only make a change when we are ready to. I want my mom to stop smoking and take care of herself, but she is not ready to and at seventy-one, she probably never will be. (She passed away last year).

I can’t do anything about it, only accept it, and she has to own it and pay the consequences. I spent a lot of years trying to get her and others to change for the better, and I was always met with resistance. It wasn’t until I came to terms with the truth that no one will ever change unless they want to, not because I wanted them to.

Why I needed someone to be other than who they wanted to be, I don’t know. It’s obvious when health is an issue; you want your loved ones to be around; however, if this is not what they want, it’s no longer a problem for me.

When I stopped preaching to my mother, our relationship got much better. She was happy with who she was, and if this is what she chose for her time on this earth, then it is what it is.

By the way getting older is also about death and losing the ones that you love.  I took my momma back home to San Diego and gave her a burial at sea.  It was beautiful.  If want, you can check out the three-minute video here.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qiqQrwy5crg

Barriers to change are other obstacles to overcome when we want to change. What is preventing us from changing? I will go back to my mother’s story (last time I promise). Why wouldn’t she want to stop smoking and get healthy so she can live longer and have a better quality of health?

I would surmise that she didn't want to make the change because, in her mind, it would have been more painful to live without cigarettes than it is to live with them.

It’s important to know that change happens gradually. There will be a relapse, and there may be discomfort. Very few of us are so strong-willed that we won’t ever have a relapse.

There will always be factors begging for our attention. Change means being proactive and, if you are, eventually, change will be a commitment you have to yourself.  Also, know that you may resist what you must do but, you must do what you resist.

 

A New Way to age

  A new way to age and live longer  

Renewing yourself is your body’s master plan for rejuvenation.  This consists of three important steps; protect, repair and rejuvenate.  Our body’s renewal system prevents disease by protecting the cells and then repairing the damaged ones.  We have been given a specific healing system, and its mission is to achieve maximum health.

Why do we need an elaborate healing system to renew ourselves?  The damage that we do to ourselves and for what our environment does to us threatens our entire existence.

Renewal is a constant process in our body.  Just trying to repair the everyday wear and tear is bad enough but then, the renewal process must kick it up a notch should we get sick or injured.   When we have an acute or chronic condition, our body kicks into overdrive to repair the damage.

A good example of how the body can renew itself better is, if you break a bone, or cut yourself or, sustain an injury of some kind.  If you don’t have your renewal system revved up, then it may take you a bit of time to heal, and it may not be entirely as we age.

However, if your cells are in renewal mode, then you will heal much faster.     In order to extend our lifespan, we must halt cellular damage and increase our healing system.  To do this, we come back to, protecting, repairing and regenerating our cells.  Each one of these should function to its optimal level, and if they don’t then, the entire system will fail.

We already know the key to cell renewal is antioxidants because our cells are under constant attack from free radicals.  The damage free radicals do to cells shortens our life which means that we die before we need to due to cellular injury.

“A typical cell is hit by approximately twenty billion free radicals per day.”   So long as we have enough free radicals in our body, we can fight this.  Think about it, twenty billion free radicals hit just one cell! And, we have so many cells.

When you get down to it, why wouldn’t we help our body fight against this mass attack by consuming antioxidants and avoiding the things that cause free radicals in the first place?  See when we let our antioxidants fall below optimal then free radicals have the upper hand.  After a billion hits here and there, now you have severe cellular damage.

This type of damage not only causes disease but it’s the quickest way to aging.  Again, how to counter this is to take in generous amounts of antioxidant foods and supplements.

If you would like, I have a "7 Day Rejuvenation Program" that you can download right here:   How to rejuvenate your body in seven days without being rigid

Don't worry. It's no diet or rigidness.  Just something you can add to your life to make it better!

 

THE LOVE LIVES OF WOMEN

  The Love Lives of women. Relationships at middle age

 

Ah yes, the love lives of women.  I can’t tell you how many times I hear women say, “There are just no good ones left,” or worse, “I don’t want a man.” Is this true? Even when in a relationship, married or not, we can get bored.

I’m not saying we need a man to be happy; I wonder if some women quietly settle for not having one. I realize that at middle age, there doesn’t appear to be many single and qualified men out there and that the men we are married to have grown to be a bit unexciting and predictable.

I also realize the dating world is a different world out there. I hear stories from women who say men don’t want to commit or are disrespectful. I hear about men having multiple girlfriends and lying to them about seeing other people.

I listen to others say how lonely they are and have settled for mediocre instead of holding out for the right guy. I may not understand, but I feel for those who would like to have a partner, someone to love and to love them, but it’s just not happening. I feel for those who have given up, never expecting to find love at all.

Even those of us who are married, life isn’t always perfect. We go through times of doubt, and question whether we want to be married, too. I think one thing is constant and that is that, the older we get, the more settled we are with ourselves. Therefore, we may be or are okay with not having a partner, and we learn to create our happiness and, more importantly, we own it, and it feels good.

Today, I took lunch to a past neighbor who is elderly and just out of the hospital after hip replacement surgery. She lives alone, has basically no family, lost her job due to age discrimination, and it is highly unlikely she will ever find another job at her age.

She has no money except Social Security and spends a dollar a day at the Dollar General store for soup to survive. I asked her if she wished she was married and how it felt being alone. I asked if she was afraid. She told me she would never want to be married for the sake of being married, and if she didn’t have passion for a man, then she wouldn’t want to just exist in a relationship like a lot of people do.

She also said she was very happy at this point in her life, and then genuinely laughed as though she was. The teacher has, yet again, appeared through her by showing me that, for all she doesn’t have, she is still authentically happy, while I wake up each day looking for what could be better in my life.

This teacher has taught me to appreciate what I have and to stop looking for more and better. I already have it all, and there is nothing more or better that I need. That’s the secret: if you don’t need it, there is nothing missing.

 

BE YOUR BEST AT ANY AGE

  Your best at any age

 

Who knows what the fountain of youth is? We all know that aging catches up with us very quickly. They say, the older you get, the faster you get old. It’s as though we wake up one day and the years have passed us by!

You’re rocking along in your life looking and feeling great and then suddenly, out of nowhere, reality hits you; you can’t do the same things or look the same as you did.

Contrary to what we have been told, there is things we can do to slow down the aging process and keep ourselves on top of our game, and to, as they say, “age gracefully.”

As far as I am concerned, beauty companies are liars! And we all know they are not anti-aging us, but putting moisture on top of our skin and taking our money. Like the Oil of Olay, commercial says, “Do you still have wrinkles even after the wrinkle cream is gone?” The fact of the matter is, we are going to go through many changes in our mind, body, and appearance.

Unless you have a fortune to spend on plastic surgery (even that doesn’t look good after a while), you will be like the rest of us women. Your skin will age, and your body fat will shift to places you would never have imagined and you will slow down.

Is it fair? No. Can we do much about it, very little? The sooner we accept that we will age no matter what, the sooner we can move along and find peace and look our best at any age for the age we are at the time. At this point in life, we are on the last third of our lives.  Living life to the fullest is all you should do now.

If I could tell you one thing that will anti-age you, and it doesn’t cost you a dime, and it’s probably the closest to the fountain of youth you will ever know, would you want to know about it?

Of course, you do, so here it is!!!  It's called EXERCISE! That’s it! Exercise at least five days a week. You will keep your weight down and your butt where it is, and even improve upon it.

It will keep the blood pumped to your skin giving you a natural glow. People lose thirty percent of their muscle strength between the ages of fifty and seventy, and then lose another thirty percent for each decade after that.

Alarming, if you think about it because we need good muscle tone. We need to work out for balance and mobility as we get older.  It will be even more important to maintain muscle tone as we become elderly.

The reason staying active is more important than ever is it keeps us coordinated, so we don’t fall and break a hip, and it keeps the neurons in our brains firing. We need to keep our brains active to avoid dementia and to remember things like names of people, which I am very bad at. You don’t have to hit the gym and run ten miles or take a cardio spinning class until you pass out either.

I’m simply talking about walking, riding a bike, swimming, or taking a dance class, and lift weights to keep your muscle tone and bones strong. Whatever you do, you must also wear sunscreen every day, as the sun is the number one reason we get wrinkles!  Just saying :)

For me, I work out, and I take in one gram of protein for every pound I weigh, and I also take supplements daily. Although I do have my bad habits, like drinking wine daily, I justify this by taking exceptionally good care of myself the rest of the time, as in eating organic, very little carbs and drinking a ton of water.  I not about being rigid either.  I would rather enjoy the time I have left and simply balance it out.

Don’t forget to go to the doctor yearly, and get your mammogram.

Our cells are programmed genetically to die at a certain point and there is nothing we can do about that. However, don’t underestimate "environment versus biology."

We are in more control of our outcome then we give ourselves credit for. The goal may not be to live forever but to forever live a quality life while we are here.

LETTING GO OF EMOTIONAL PAIN

  Letting go of emotional pain  

 

Sometimes our hearts are weak, and our spirits are broken, but, still, we get up and go about the day and push down the pain. Maybe we were born with spiritual pain, or we have unresolved issues that we haven’t let go of, and we hold them inside not knowing how to let go.

Some believe in past lives and that we are born with pain and this pain is a punishment from a past life.

For those who are Christian, they don’t believe this, but believe that we can remove the pain by giving it to God. Give it to something or someone and let it go if you have it. It’s not worth holding on to. Without being mindful, we hold on to pain so tight that it leaves us exhausted.

 I am not saying things didn’t happen to you in your past. Maybe you can’t even remember or pinpoint anything. I couldn’t imagine some of the circumstances people have gone through and are still able to live each day.

I have had hardships, but I am blessed that my pain is not as deep as others.  All pain needs to be let go of, though. The point here is to give yourself the gift of seeking out help to rid yourself if you are in pain. Start fresh again, even if for only once in your life. Choose to be free.

Listen to your pain; it’s telling you something, telling you that you must do something about it. The problem is that we feel it, but we don’t acknowledge it. Just like a broken leg tells you it’s broken, your spirit also tells you it’s broken too.

The pain that we carry around could be minimal, or it could be monumental. I have heard that what doesn’t kill us, makes us stronger, and that suffering causes greatness. I don’t necessarily believe this as I believe it leaves pain wounds in our soul and, unless we intentionally choose to heal it, we have a problem.

Most of us think we are healing our pain by getting better at handling it. To solve your inner problems is to quit letting your mind mislead you. I don’t think time heals all wounds either. Time makes them a little easier to take, but we all know if we let ourselves go there, we can bring back the pain like it was day one. How we do this is by holding in that exact memory of when we first arrived at the pain. We can go back there again and again if we let ourselves.

When we think no one will love us and we are alone, or we will always be alone, or there will never be someone for us, we are dealing with our minds personal dilemma. When we do find someone, and the relationship doesn’t solve the issues that we have, we have an internal disturbance. We realize the void is still within us, and then we move onto something else because the pain is always there. But the real problem is we take our baggage wherever we go, and we want to give it to someone else to carry, all the while picking up more as we go along.

Freeing ourselves from pain is a matter of unloading the memory and detaching the connection we have to it and then allowing it to diminish. It will take time, and it will take a conscious effort to do it, but it can be done. If you have lost a loved one, you will have pain. In time it will get better. You will always have the good memories.

 There are no boundaries that we must live in, just the ones we create.

Real growth means dealing with discomfort, like it or not. Many times the actions we take are to avoid something. Stop avoiding and don’t let issues upset you. If you are avoiding pain and you encounter what you can’t avoid, then walk alongside it until it passes. And, if you do nothing else, don’t take things personally. Much of what goes on around you has absolutely nothing to do with you,

.

Controlling the middle-age weight gain!

  How to keep your weight down at middle age

9 Ways To Not Over Eat

 

I’m going to admit it!  I way overeat and then wonder why I feel bad both physically and mentally.

I do good for a while, and then I decide that I want pizza, pasta or fries!  I eat healthy about 80% of the time, and that used to be just fine when I was younger, but now, it’s not so good.

I could eat 80% clean and then 20% bad but, it’s come down to either my metabolism is slowing down as I’ve gotten older or, I’m eating way more food than I want to believe.

So, I have decided that I’m not going up a clothing size and, I’m for sure not going to increase my workouts from five days to seven days so, the only thing left to do (other than give in a eat whatever the hell I want) is to stop overeating!

 

Here are the 9 Ways To Not Over Eat:

  9 ways to not overeat  

It’s what I do when I want to get into shape fast!

  1. When you wake up if you eat breakfast, package it up and bring it with you to work, school or wherever you go with about 200 calories.
  2. Try and delay eating that breakfast until mid-morning.
  3. Eat a small snack an hour or two later (about 100 calories or less) like yogurt, nuts, a piece of cheese, teaspoon of peanut butter with celery, etc. at lunch.
  4. Eat your lunch later in the day, say around 1:00 or 2:00 pm. and eat a meal that is about 300 calories with protein, carbs, and veggies.
  5. Eat another snack in the afternoon with about 100 calories.
  6. When you get home, before dinner, drink a green smoothie with about 100 to 150 calories.
  7. Eat a small dinner with about 300 calories with protein, carbs, veggies.
  8. Have a small snack no later than an hour before bed about 50 to 100 calories.

This is about 1150 – 1200 calories.  If you stick with this, you won’t be hungry, and you will lose weight! Especially if you do a workout or two during the week.

9.  If you go out to eat, go directly to the salad menu and the protein menu.  Order one of each and put the dressing on the side.

Ditch the breading on the protein and the extras on the salad unless they are veggies.

I try and use lemon on my salad, and if I’m feeling deprived, I slightly dip my salad on the fork into the dressing.

These are nine ways no to overeat.  Of course, there will be times and days when you just can’t help it but, if you stick to this plan, for the most part, you will lose weight and feel great

I like to eat.  I hate being hungry.  I especially hate how my stomach hurts when I’m hungry.  I don’t like feeling light-headed either and, I hate looking for healthy food options when I’m starving.

 

11 Ways to curb your appetite 

  11 Ways to curb your appetite   click link to see the article here    
  1. Be prepared.  Always have a low-calorie meal/snack with you at all times so that as soon as you get that hungry feeling, you can eat!

2.  East small meals often.  I try and eat about five to six times a day.

3.  Eat protein and veggies and try and keep it to no more than 300 calories each time.

4.  Sip on hot cups of veggie broth throughout the day.  This warms and soothes the stomach and, provides lots of health benefits.

5.  Drink a couple of dark green veggie smoothies during the day.  Throw a couple of hands full of kale, a hand full of blueberries, some almond milk and, Stevia Sweetener.

This will be about 80 calories or so, and you’ll get your greens and your fill.  Great for hair, skin, and nails too.  I know because I’ve seen my hair grow about three inches since doing this for the past nine months!

For even better results, add in some probiotics (open a couple of capsules).  AMAZING!

6.  When dining out.  Don’t let the server bring bread or any appetizer and then, eat the meal that you want but, ask for a to-go box right away and box half of your meal.  You can eat the other half later or the next day!

7.  If you have to eat a lot (like I do) then SPIRALIZE! This is using an attachment to make spaghetti zucchini noodles and then cut up tomatoes, one teaspoon olive oil, salt, pepper, shredded basil and, a tablespoon of Parmesan cheese.

Heat in microwave for about two minutes.  It’s lovely and filling and, about 160 calories!

8.  When you do eat a meal, consume lots of veggies.  I eat 80% veggies and then 20% protein.  Others will tell you to probably reverse this, and yes, protein does make you feel fuller, however, I think with regards to health and aging, we need those phytonutrients that plants provide rather than too much protein which is acidic to the body. Plants neutralize our body.

9.  When you want to eat, step back and ask yourself if you are really hungry?  Is it habit, boredom or, are you hungry?  If you are then, go ahead and eat!  If you can wait, go do something for a while and come back to eating.

10.  Always have small GO TO meals in your fridge or freezer to pop in the microwave, that way you won’t stand in pantry grazing and overeating.

11.  Okay, number eleven is a mini list   Hydrate, get enough sleep, drink hot green tea, take in a tablespoon of apple cider vinegar, keep tempting food out of the house, use small plates for your meals.

 

This isn’t a diet of any kind.  Only mindful ways to keep you from overeating, eating when you’re not hungry or, binge eating because of boredom.

What I also do is, when I find myself constantly thinking about eating while at home, I take my keys, jump in my car and go to the mall and WALK around.  Of course, I always find something that I don’t need but, I’m working on that too.

This is how I keep the weight off and eat a ton! I love to eat.  Frankly, I wake up, and as soon as I open my eyes, I think about eating.

Today I went to lunch with my business partner and I ate a salad with Yogurt dressing, cabbage, spinach, vegetable soup, salsa, and tea sweetened with Stevia and, that was my second meal of the day!  I usually eat about five times a day plus snacks.

Now, my business partner had chicken fried steak, mash potatoes, and water. 

Who do you think ate more calories?  Not me. My business partner did of course. Sure, I ate more food but not even as many calories as he did.

See that’s the thing, you can eat a lot (and I mean a lot) may be more than you probably eat now and still maintain or lose weight.

Whenever I go out to eat with others, they ask me if I have a hollow leg.  Really?  I wish.  I don’t have a hollow leg, and I wasn’t blessed with a high metabolism either.  My mother told me ” You were born the big-boned one in the family” (thanks mom). In fact, does anyone have a high metabolism anyways?

Sure, there are some exceptions to the rule but when it comes right down to it, we either eat too much or we don’t. 

Working out is good but not as important as what you eat.  If all we needed to do to stay thin was to work out thirty minutes to an hour per day, then we could eat all the food we wanted right? Wrong.  Not even athletes can do this.

The thing is that it’s the type of food and in what combinations that we eat.  Going back to my business partner, a chicken fried steak paired with mash potatoes, that will put weight on us. Not to mention that the side effects of that type of food are probably not good for our health.

However, this blog post is not about lecturing anyone on the ways to eat for better health (although eating this way will make you more healthy).   Nope, this blog post is about showing you the ways that you can eat a ton of food, never be hungry and most importantly, satisfy your taste buds.

Let’s face it; no one likes to eat boring food or starve themselves.  Honestly, when I don’t eat a lot, I’m a bit grouchy, and no one likes a grouch.  I could never just not eat because my stomach hurts and I get a bit spacey. 

I love people and food too much because food should be enjoyed.  No one ever had fun while out to dinner with someone who pretends not to be hungry.

  Why fight it! Eat!

Get this,

99% OF PEOPLE FAIL TO LOSE WEIGHT AND FEEL GOOD BECAUSE THEY DO THIS!

 

  1. Eat too many processed foods.
  2. Believe that they will miss sugar and other unhealthy foods.
  3. Think that they will get bored with eating healthy.
  4. Believe that their food options will be limited.
  5. Don’t think that they can eat what they want a lot of times.
  6. They don’t know how to eat healthier and in the right combinations to not feel deprived.

CHEAT SHEET- FAST WEIGHT LOSS FORMULA!!

    cheat sheet weight loss formula  

Two Different and specific methods to lose 10 to 20 pounds fast without dieting, starving, or killing yourself in the gym. Guaranteed!

“Two Different and specific methods to lose 10 to 20 pounds fast without dieting, starving or killing yourself in the gym. Guaranteed!”

HERE’S THE STRATEGY:

1. Calculate your resting metabolic rate (RMR).  This is the amount of

calories that you need to breathe, pump blood and to stay alive.

  1. Take your goal body weight  _________ x 10  __________  = your RMR

      Example:  120 pounds x 10 = 1200 (Your RMR)

  1. Calculate your daily calories needed to move ( not including exercising) = 1200 x 20% = 220
  2. To get to your goal weight  without working out is as follows:

1200 + 220 = 1420

  1. To calculate question #3 would be as follows:   1200 (Your RMR) + 220 (the calories needed to move) = 1420 calories to be about 120 pounds.

If you want to work ou,t then you will lose even more weight.  For example, if you are a 140 pound person and you went dancing for an hour, you would burn about 600 calories. 

Whether you want to exercise or not is up to you (although you should move your body for at least thirty minutes, five days a week, for your health).  If you do then, here is a resource that I have found to find quick calculations to determine the amount of calories burned per workout type. 

 

Here’s the link that I found very helpful:  They even have an app that you can download to your phone.  http://www.myfitnesspal.com/exercise/lookup

 

To lose weight, a woman should eat between 1200 -1400 calories per day and for a man, 1800 – 2100, both while doing moderate exercise. 

Of course, if you work out really hard and sustain it, then you can eat more.  However, this guide is about balancing ourselves out so we don’t have to kill ourselves in the gym.

The following is a quick eating plan to ensure that you have plenty of options so that one, you don’t get bored and two, you get enough protein and food combinations that make you feel satisfied while you lose weight.

 

CHEAT SHEET #1

 

METHOD #1- THE FOUR WEEK PLAN

TO LOSE 15 -20 POUNDS!

Women eat:  1200 – 1400 calories per day.  Eat the following foods by creating six meals per day, approximately 2 -3 hours apart.  Use a measuring cup.  You will want to eat your two carbs early in the day.  You will want to have protein with every meal and then use the rest of the food as a combination with your protein.  The boxes are to be checked off once you have eaten that food. 

Use this daily sheet each day (make copies to check off boxes)

1. 3 - Cups of vegetables      

2. 3/4 Cup of fruit   

3. 6 – 3/4 Cups of lean protein        

4. 2- 1/2 cups of carbohydrates    

5.        ¼- Cup of fat like nuts, avocado, hummus, etc.

***Note:  Give or take, you’ll have a few calories to spare if you want to have a snack, however, try to make sure the snack is no more than 50 to 100 calories!

Men eat: 1800 – 2100 calories.  Eat six meals per day approximately 2 – 3 hours apart. Use a measuring cup. You will want to eat your two carbs early in the day.  You will want to have protein with every meal and then use the rest of the food as a combination with your protein.  The boxes are to be checked off once you have eaten that food.

Use this daily sheet each day (make copies to check off boxes)

1. 5 - Cups of vegetables.        

2. ¾ Cup of fruit     

3. 6 - ¾-  Cups of lean protein.           

4. 4 - ½ - Cups of carbohydrates.        

5. ¼  Cup of fat like nuts, avocado, hummus, etc.   

6. 4- teaspoons of oils or salad dressing.     

***Note:  Give or take, you’ll have a few calories to spare if you want a snack, however, try to make sure the snack is no more than 50 to 100 calories!

For both women and men, replace one of your proteins with a protein shake after you work out if you would like or otherwise, eat a meal to feed your body for your recovery mode if you decide to workout.

You can use mustard, vinegar, herbs, lemons, limes as much as you want.

You can and should, mix up your combinations so that one, you don’t get bored and two,  you can keep your body guessing.

Men just need to add a little more

You’ll see now that all of your boxes have been checked off for the day and you shouldn’t be hungry.  In fact, you shouldn’t skip a meal either. 

You will run out of some food combinations but that’s okay because, you don’t need a lot of foods like carbohydrates, etc.  I would suggest that you eat carbs in the morning and no later than lunch.  They are your energy for the day.

I don’t mean to sound repetitive and redundant here but, I just want to make sure we are clear on eating and the fact that you should eat!

Easy 3-Day Detox

& Rejuvenation Plan

 

The “Easy 3-day detox & rejuvenation plan” is to eliminate waste from your body a get rid of toxins.  Drink 10 to 12 glasses of purified water per day. This will not only eliminate waste but hydrate you as well.

If you hate water, combine lemon and a little plant sweetener called Stevia.  Drink decaf, green tea too.

Be sure not to drink all of your water at once because this can be dangerous.  Drink it during a 24 hour period.

 

Avoid processed foods and try to eat clean.  

Try not to eat any processed foods. That means don’t eat any food from your pantry, with the exception of certain proteins (see below).

Eat fresh food like vegetables, low glycemic fruits and, nuts.  Try and eat as natural as possible without overcooking.  Like raw, smoothies, salads, or, steamed.

Eliminate the following:  caffeine (or cut in half), sugar, flour and, alcohol.

Eat whole foods.

 

Your goal is to seek out and consume antioxidants.

 

Eat bright colored veggies.  They are full of antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals and, your liver loves these because phytochemicals help activate liver enzymes that remove harmful substances from our bodies.

They also help with inflammation (a big factor in disease) and nourish your gut.

  1. Limit meat consumption but get protein from other sources like tofu, nuts, beans, Quinoa, seeds, lentils, Tempeh, pea and rice protein, nut milks, chickpeas, etc.

Besides meat having a ton of growth hormones and antibiotics that you don’t need, meat can contribute to disease and stay undigested in our systems for longer than we need.

You don’t need to stop eating meat if you don’t want to, however, for this 3-day detox and rejuvenation plan, try to let your body rest from having to work too hard.

Try and eat organic

 

It’s unfortunate that in order to eat healthily we have to pay more for organic but, it’s the way it is and your body has to choose between cleaning off the pesticides or nourishing your body.  When you eat organic, you give your detox system a break, so that it can work on giving your body the nutrients that it needs.

If you can’t afford organic, then wash the heck out of fruits and veggies when you consume the skin.

 

Eat fermented foods

 

Kimchi, miso, sauerkraut, tempeh all offer payoffs because they help your gut fend off bad bacteria and provide good fiber.  Fiber is what we are also going for.  We need to mop up all the bad cholesterol and eliminate waste.

I get mine in the produce aisle where they have the vegetarian cold foods.  You can always get these at Whole Foods too.

The last step in our 3-day detox and rejuvenation plan is to get it all out! 

Being regular is your most important pathway.  Even if you go every day, chances are you could go a little more.

 

Extra and undigested food is processed through the intestines and we don’t seem to get rid of nearly half as much as we take in!

 

Try Smooth Move tea, one tea bag each day of the detox.  The tea is mild and not harsh on your system.

 

If you do these easy steps for just three days, you will feel great and, you may even lose a few pounds.

 

As you can see, the “3-day detox and rejuvenation plan” is not hard to do.  Three days will fly by.  YOU CAN DO IT!

 

Maybe, you’ll want to continue to eat like this forever?  If not, then try and do this three-day detox and rejuvenation every six weeks.

The Five Mistakes That Make Women Look Older 

And How To Correct Them!

Of course, we are going to age and yes, genetics are a big factor, however, we can either turn on genes by what we do or don’t do or, we can overcome them and look as young as we feel.

 

Are you aging yourself faster than you need to?

  five mistakes that ages women faster  

#1.   Not using Sunscreen, Vitamin C Serum, Eye Cream, and Moisturizer.

#5.  Not Lifting Weights and Losing Muscle Tone.

 

To me, there are two great things about exercising and the first is, when it’s over!! And the second is how my clothes fit.  No, I won’t work out like an athlete or look like I’m eighteen again but, I can look tone and so can you.

Lifting weights will change your life.  If you have never or you don’t know how just get started with what you can lift and move up the weight size.  Do one body part per day.  If it’s too much, then break it up by two times a day for fifteen minutes each, five days a week.  Many women think they will bulk up, and I have to say that “I wish” however, women don’t have that kind of testosterone.  As we age, we lose muscle every decade.  We can lift all day and still not bulk up so, lift away and watch the shape of your body change.

You’ll see amazing changes if you are consistent.  Use videos, fitness magazines, Pinterest, Apps, etc.  Just try it and in three months or so, you’ll see a difference in your shape.  Plus, it’s good for your bones as you age.
