The 5 Steps to Look As Young As You Feel

 

What are the 5 Steps to Look As Young As You Feel?  When it comes down to it, we can spend a lot of time, money and energy trying to stay healthy but really, it comes down to these five things!

At 20 years old I weighed 115 pounds, at 49 years old I weighed 145.  I was well on my way to some serious health problems.  Thankfully, I used this solution (The 5 Steps to look as young as you feel)  and I’m back in the 120’s and turning 50!

My skin has never looked better and, I have so much energy that seriously, I hate to go to bed at night! In fact, my energy has gotten so much better, I go to bed at eleven and pop up at five a.m. and here I am, hoping that the day doesn’t go by too fast.

When you have an abundance of good healthy energy, you have the energy to do so much and the only bad thing is that there really isn’t enough time in the day to do everything that you want!  I use every second of my time to do the things I want to and still, I have so many more dreams and aspirations.

When you feel this kind of energy, you’ll know exactly what I mean.  I want that for you too.

With “The 5 Steps to Look As Young As You Feel” it’s a simple and quick five-step plan that doesn’t take more than an hour or so of your day.  And, for those of you that think you don’t have an hour for yourself (Hmmm?) then, you can break it up into four, fifteen minutes sessions or any other time combinations.  Just so long as you do the steps.  They’re super easy, I assure you.

I promise if you do these five steps, you will “Look and Feel Younger” in no time. If I were asking you to pay for the plan, I could say something like “I guarantee it!” But, it’s totally free because I want to share the easy stuff that makes a difference.

There is no need to feel like you can’t look and feel young.  Today, we are living into our eighties and nineties and hell, pretty soon it’s predicted that we will live way past one-hundred.

The great thing is, with technology, we can still look and feel really great.  But also with technology, keeping us alive longer, it’s up to us to do the things necessary to stay healthy and young.

We all know what direction the healthcare industry is heading and that’s down a bad road. Even if you have health insurance, it doesn’t cover much anymore.  The best way to stay out of the doctor's office is to do these five steps.

The thing is that we have to actively pursue prevention methods.  Prevention of disease, the sun, food that causes disease and, we have to move our bodies.

How to get rid of the wrinkles at home like a doctors office!

How to get rid of rough texture on your face

 

This is how I smooth out my skin.

 

Morning:

  1. Cleanse my face.
  2. Use a daily, morning swipe of Glycolic 10% daily exfoliate ( it will make your cheeks pink and shine through your makeup. It looks really nice).  I get this at Skin-peel.com.
  3. Apply Vitamin C-serum, 20%. I get mine on Amazon.com.
  4. Apply growth factors, (TNS serum). I get this also on Amazon.com
  5. Eye cream made specifically for eyes.
  6. Apply a good moisturizer.
  7. Apply sunscreen.

 Before bed:

  1. Exfoliate and cleanse with a Clarisonic face brush.
  2. Apply growth factors (TNS serum).
  3. Apply Retin-A (get a prescription from your doctor and get a coupon from GoodRx.com. It’s much cheaper this way).
  4. Eye cream made specifically for eyes.
  5. Apply a good moisturizer.
 

Here’s the best part!

Every other Sunday, I do a skin peel.  I use a skin peel called the Jessner Peel 14%.  I get it at http://www.skin-peel.com.  If you do this, please talk to the consultants before purchasing to make sure this is right for you.

LITTLE SECRET:  I use a blow dryer!!

Let me explain…. I put a good amount of the Jessner solution on a cotton ball and smooth it all over my face.  I do this a few times (the more times that you do it, the deeper the peel).  Try one pass at a time when starting out.  Of course, always follow the directions that come with the product first.  But trust me on the blow dryer. J

The peel burns so take a blow dryer and set it on the cool setting and keep it on your face while the peel is working it’s magic! It only takes a few minutes.

The next day or so, your skin will peel a little or flake.  Viola! This is the old texture and new skin coming through.

Do this every two weeks to see good results.  Keep your new skin covered with sunscreen and keep using your Retin-A.

Using Retin-A, peels, and, sunscreen will work in synergy to give you that beautiful baby skin!

Look Younger For Less Money! 

Basic cosmetic procedures that are the least expensive and would be a natural progression after skin care. Compared to products, cosmetic procedures are not a commodity so finding bargain cosmetic procedures may not be a good thing.

We’re talking about wounding the skin, and this doesn’t necessarily correlate with cheaper. However, there is no reason you can’t call around to your local dermatologists or plastic surgeons to find out what the procedures cost.

Then you can compare for yourself. I pick three or four good doctors or medical spas in my area and check their prices, and then I get on their email list. Before long, I get discounted offers of up to thirty percent off their procedures.

It’s worth it to compare and get on their lists. You’ll get weekly emails from all the places you signed up at to compare the prices. You can even call your favorite doctor or spa and ask if they will match prices. They do it all the time!

Botox – You should get Botox as a prevention measure. You may only need ten units or so just to prevent frown lines or lines that may be forming between your nose and eyes.

You can also have Botox used on your crow’s feet (the lines around your eyes). This helps tremendously. If you need thirty or forty units and you can’t afford it all at once, then get ten units every few weeks until you get all areas covered.

The cost varies, but I have paid up to fourteen-dollars a unit. When I got on the doctors’ or Spa lists, I received discounts and now I only pay about nine to ten dollars per unit. That’s a pretty good savings. Some doctors will have a buy two get one free promotion.

Also, there are competing products to Botox. Because they’re competing with Botox, they may be less money. Botox, which is owned by Allergen, has a loyalty program, as well. I recently received a coupon for $100 off the total cost of my Botox!

This program is called BRILLIANT DISTINCTIONS. Make sure you sign up or have your doctor/injector sign you up and every time you get Botox or another Allergan product such as Juvederm, etc. you will receive points towards your next service.

I almost got my most recent Botox for free!

Chemical Peel – A chemical peel is great for removing the surface layer of the skin. The process wounds the skin, which causes it to heal itself by creating new collagen. A chemical peel has different strengths so the cost will vary.

In most states, a chemical peel will cost about $150 to  $200 in a doctor’s office. You’ll want to continue having peels, as they will help create beautiful skin with less texture and, diminish fine lines.

You can do them yourself, but start with a low strength.  Unfortunately, in my learning process, I bought a thirty-percent TCA peel online (I should not have been able to purchase this strength peel without a license), and I did some serious damage to my skin. Damage so bad that, I have to hide the scars every day of my life. It’s not the worth the risk to try and skip ahead rather than to start slow or let a professional do it.

If you want to do your own peel, start with a small patch of skin to see how it will react. I do my own peels every two to four weeks, usually no more than twice a month. You can go to skin-peel.com to find them.

The secret to making peels comfortable is while they are on your face, use your blow dryer on the cool setting or, use a small hand fan pointed at your face. It makes a difference.

Retin-A – A prescription is required, but Retin-A is fantastic!! “Retin-A (tretinoin) is a topical preparation of vitamin A, which has antioxidant properties, just like the vitamin by itself. It’s an acid derivative of retinol (vitamin A).  If you don't want to get a prescription then you can now get a good one over the counter called Differin Gel sold at most stores.

The important aspect is really the effectiveness of what Retin-A does. Studies have shown that Retin-A can help reduce wrinkles, reduce acne, exfoliate dead skin cells and redistribute melanin. Melanin redistribution results in lighter, more even skin color. Thus Retin-A is often used to treat skin discolorations caused by excessive sun exposure.

If you have sensitive skin, it may not work for you, it may be too harsh, but there are alternatives with lesser concentrations.  I would still try to mix a little every other night in my favorite cream. Just don’t give up. This stuff is amazing!

Teeth Whitening – This makes a huge difference. You could have perfect skin and straight teeth, but if your teeth are stained and dull, no one will notice. If you have bright, white teeth, you’ll look better, and younger, and feel better too.

The cost in my state is about $50.00, which is down from $500 when I first had it done. There are many good ones over the counter too.

IPL-, which stands for intense pulse light or flash lamp therapy, is a noninvasive and non-ablative treatment that uses high intensity pulses of visible light to improve the appearance of birthmarks, port wine stains, broken facial veins, rosy cheeks, rosacea, red thread veins of the legs, freckles, age spots, facial lines and wrinkles, and the removal of unwanted dark hair. The procedure is referred to as photo rejuvenation and requires a series of treatments.

The cost nationally runs about $300 to $400. You should only need a few treatments. I have seen it as low as $150 per treatment if you agree to three or more.

Just a quick note: I have been using a product called Black Magic Tattoo remover (it’s a small handheld pulse light machine) to remove a lot of my brown spots on my arms and legs.

It works the same as an IPL machine.  I got it on Amazon.com however, it takes time.

I wouldn’t use the machine on my face though. It’s important to know that brown spots on the body are very hard to remove. The light process takes time. I also add a skin bleach and put a little of my skin peel on each spot too when I do peels on my face.

Dermapen or Micro-Needling – “ Sterile surgical stainless micro-needles pierce the skin leading to apoptosis of cells in the dermis.” “What is Apoptosis? Apoptosis or programmed cell death is when a cell essentially commits suicide. This process is natural, controlled and routine. Little inflammation is caused.” “The Dermapen uses eleven, 33-gauge microneedles to stimulate the dermis. Needles vertically pierce the skin to enhance rejuvenation results. Small holes are punctured at a rate of 1000/second. This proliferation of the body’s tissue continues to release growth factors from fibroblasts, keratinocytes, and monocytes.”

Note: I have had Dermapen about six times and it works wonders. It’s comparable to lasers like Fraxel but without all the downtime and expense. Many doctors will give you a discount if you buy a package of four or more. You can save hundreds by doing this. I paid $150 per treatment vs. $300 – $350 by buying the package.

Juvederm – Juvederm is an injectable filler consisting mostly of hyaluronic acid. It’s used to fill in areas to smooth out wrinkles and deep folds on the face and can last up to a year. You can pay anywhere from $400 a syringe to $800. I pay only about $400 – $450 depending on the specials the doctors have. Currently, my doctor has a buy one get one free, and I can save the second one for a later time. At first, you may need two but, as your own stem cells work, you will need less later.  In my case, it lasts about six months.

These are certainly not all of the basic cosmetic procedures available, but these tend to be the least expensive and the least invasive. These procedures really do well with regard to anti-aging and reversing past damage.

They’re also a good alternative to going under the knife. I think one day these products and procedures will be affordable for all of us.

With today’s technology, the need for doctors to perform invasive procedures will diminish so they’ll be more eager to lower procedure costs to attract more patients. My hope is that you get the best skin possible without having to figure out where you will get the money.

Let’s face it, many of us want to take care of ourselves but, products and procedures can be a little expensive.

Hormones and Aging Skin

  Hormones at middle age

 

Hormones help prevent skin from aging. We have all seen it, or maybe we have been troubled by the changes we’re seeing in our own skin. Thin skin, sagging, dullness, lines, and wrinkles (sorry, I had to remind you).

Unfortunately, it happens to everyone at some time. For many of us, we want to look as young as we feel, however, sometimes the outside is not so accommodating to the inside. As we age, especially starting in our thirties and forties, our hormones begin to decline and then diminish over time.

Because of this, our skin becomes fragile, thin, wrinkled and, sags. If you have gone through menopause then you should know that it’s been stated that, we will lose thirty percent of our skin’s collagen in the first five years after menopause! Ouch! You can counter this effect! We can use oral hormones or hormone creams (prescribed by a doctor) to increase collagen support.

I personally am not one for taking synthetic hormones, as I believe there is an increased risk of breast cancer and other harmful effects. I use a bioidentical hormone cream prescribed by my doctor.

Does it help my skin? I like to think so. For me, it’s been an accumulative effect of bio-identical hormones, peels, topical retinoid, vitamin C serums, sunscreen, supplements, exercising and a semi-clean diet that keeps me and my skin balanced.

It’s important to have your hormones tested routinely, as you want to keep your hormones balanced. I was skeptical at first going on a bio-identical hormone treatment, as I thought if I did, I’d get cancer. Because of reading and hearing that hormones cause cancer (in the wrong context), I fought taking them! Eventually, I opened up my mind and learned just the opposite.

Note: All hormone replacement therapy has some cancer risks. However, if monitored, these can be minimized.

According to many doctors and research, balancing our hormones keeps us from getting cancer instead of the reverse. In fact, it’s having very little hormones that may cause cancer in the first place or, at least can contribute to it.

As I said, I personally would not take oral hormones, but that’s just me and you have to make an educated decision based on what is right for you. At the very least, it’s good to see where your levels are. Okay, back to my point. When you let your hormones fluctuate, it can have a negative impact on your skin. The bottom line is to get your hormones tested and get them balanced, if even just for a better quality of health.

 

The 4 Crucial Anti-Aging Hormones

 

I wrote a post about natural hormone replacement.  I wrote specifically about the four hormones that are crucial to anti-aging.

These are, DHEA, Melatonin,  Sex Hormones such as Estrogen, Progesterone, Testosterone and, Thyroid.

Some scientists believe that if we restore these hormones to pre-decline levels, we can reverse the aging process.  They may even prime us for extra decades of life.

Each of the above hormones does a specific job.  DHEA is profound because it’s the hormone that has the most influence on the aging process.  It alone could actually extend our lifespan.

Melatonin manages the body’s sleep and awake cycle and, scavenges free radicals.  Which in turn, reduces oxidative stress in our body which then, reduces degenerative disease like cancer.  It’s also the body’s time clock or aging clock.

Natural estrogen and progesterone combined, help us women ease through menopause.  They also perform as a safeguard for women’s health after menopause.

Testosterone replacement can help both men and women with low libido, protect against heart disease (although this is being debated right now), fight osteoporosis (even in men too), increase lean muscle mass, may reverse age-related fat accumulation and, other age-related diseases.

Thyroid affects tens of millions of people.  Millions have a thyroid issue and don’t even know it.  Symptoms vary from low energy, difficulty losing weight, low immune system, anemia, heart problems, hair loss, brittle nails, depression, and the list goes on.

I have been on thyroid medication for two years and just recently, I decided I didn’t need it anymore.  Ten days later, I was feeling great until I dropped a fork while putting the dishes away and cried my eyes out.

For the next two days, I felt down and I knew something was wrong. That’s just not me.  The only thing that had changed was me thinking I didn’t need my thyroid therapy.  When I got back on it, my mood was back to my happy self again.  Placebo?  I don’t think so.  I need thyroid medicine whether I like it or not.

Of course, you will need a blood test to determine what your hormone levels are.  It’s almost certain that, if you are in middle-age and beyond, you will need to balance your hormones.

It’s true that medical experts disagree about the significance of a Testosterone decline, and whether the health benefits of HRT outweigh the risks.

HRT (hormone replacement therapy) is something you will have to carefully consider for yourself and whether it’s right for you.

If you decide to do HRT, please be careful to work with your doctor and not with some unknown source on the internet.  It only takes the smallest amount of hormones to be effective, conversely, the same is true for damage to be done too.

Lastly, if you do HRT, try and do natural hormones.  I do bio-identical which are made by a Compound Pharmacist.  It’s important to know that, just because it’s a natural hormone doesn’t mean that it’s without risk.

Here’s a little side note that my doctor told me.  When I was worried about taking hormones because of a breast cancer risk or any cancer risk whatsoever, she said “Theresa, you have more of a risk for cancer by not balancing your hormones.”  I’m putting my faith in my doctor and in my research.

It makes sense because the longer we live the more exposure we have to the things that cause cancer right? So, if we keep our hormones balanced (they make the biggest decisions for our body) then wouldn’t it be true that without them, we have less of a fighting chance.

Do you have a thyroid problem?

  At home thyroid test  

At home test below:

 

It’s believed by many doctors that our basal metabolic temperature or BMT is the most accurate measure of thyroid function.

We can check our own BMT at home by using an oral thermometer.  Not a digital one.

 

This is how you do it:

Note:  Please do not use this as medical advice.  Please see your doctor for a proper diagnosis.
  1. When you are ready to go to bed, shake an oral thermometer down and put it next to your bed where you can easily reach it in the morning. Don’t shake it down in the morning because this can raise your body temperature and the test won’t be accurate.
  2. When you wake up in the morning, put the thermometer in your armpit and leave it there for 10 minutes. Try and lie as still as you can.  Don’t get up or move as this too will increase your metabolic rate thus, raising your temperature.
  3. After the 10 minutes are up, record your temperature.
  4. Repeat this process for 3 – 5 days (at least 3 but preferably 5).

If your BMT consistently falls below 97.8 F, you may have an underactive thyroid.  BMT Normally ranges from 97.8 F to 98.2 F.

**If you have any kind of infection wait to take the test.

If you fall below and you have some of the symptoms below, it may be time to see your doctor for a blood test.

Symptoms of Hypothyroidism

Fatigue

Weakness

Weight gain or increased difficulty losing weight

Coarse, dry hair

Dry, rough pale skin

Hair loss

Cold intolerance (you can’t tolerate cold temperatures like those around you)

Muscle cramps and frequent muscle aches

Constipation

Depression

Irritability

Memory loss

Abnormal menstrual cycles

Decreased libido

“Hypothyroidism is a condition in which the body lacks sufficient thyroid hormone. Since the main purpose of thyroid hormone is to “run the body’s metabolism,” it is understandable that people with this condition will have symptoms associated with a slow metabolism. The estimates vary, but approximately 10 million Americans have this common medical condition. In fact, as many as 10% of women may have some degree of thyroid hormone deficiency.   Hypothyroidism is more common than you would believe, and millions of people are currently hypothyroid and don’t know it.”

Again.  This is only a test and not a proper diagnosis.  

 

Why you should supplement your diet

  Why you should supplement your diet  

 

I eat pretty clean.  Lot’s of veggies and I don’t consume a lot of animal products.  I wouldn’t think that I need to add supplements to my diet.

Maybe a more valid point would be, if mother nature intended for me to have the right vitamins and minerals, they would already be included in the foods that I eat.  Especially when I eat a wide variety as it is.

The truth is, you should add supplements to your diet if you want to fight disease and have a longer lifespan.  Diet alone can’t do this.  With supplements, we get the extra boost needed to have a better quality of life.

Put in another way, I once read that “supplements are to humans what fertilizer is to plants.”  That statement makes sense, doesn’t it?  So the question is, water, sunlight and grow? Or, water, sunlight, fertilizer and thrive?

So, a good diet does the body good.  A good diet with supplements makes the body thrive!

If supplements are so important, how did our ancestors survive without supplements?  If you look back, most didn’t live that long.  Sure, even if we don’t supplement and we have a poor diet, genetically, we can survive into our 40’s and 50’s.  However, if we eat an optimum diet with supplementation, we may be able to live until we are 100 years old!

I don’t want to live to be whatever age if I don’t have a good quality of life. I’ve been to nursing homes plenty of times and it was heartbreaking to see people sitting in wheelchairs all lined up against the wall.  To me, I felt like they were just stuck there until it was time to die.

I know we are all going to get old and we’re all going to die but, it’s the way that we’re going to do it that is important.

It’s important that you don’t just start taking random supplements because some can have adverse effects on your health like taking iron if you don’t need it, etc.

I would advise that you talk to a professional.  Maybe a nutritionist.  I’m not sure if doctors know about nutrition these days as they are probably overloaded as it is trying to keep up with our general healthcare requirements.  You will also need a blood test.

I have created a “Better Health/Anti-Aging Supplement Guide” that I use and I swear by. You can download it from the link below.

I’m not some fanatic meaning, I don’t believe that we have to take handfuls of supplements.  We just need some basic ones and I’ve put the link below if you want to check them out.

As always though, please check with your doctor before starting a supplement program because they also can interfere with medication.

So the take away here is eating a variety of nutritious foods, cut out the saturated fat and sugar, and supplement your diet for a healthier and longer life.

How to handle a changing appearance

  How to handle fading looks  

The truth is, in middle age, if we don’t begin to find peace while aging, we better get a grip on it now! If you were always a stunning beauty, then you had fifty or more years of outside aesthetics, but know this is not your power.

Your power now has to come from within. If God wills and you take care of yourself, you will hopefully have at least another thirty or forty years to live your truth within. This is when the real living begins.

This will be your new power, which has nothing to do with what’s on the outside. You can’t control that anymore. Maybe this is what we are really afraid of. In middle age, it’s hard to control anything anymore, especially our looks and our bodies.

Just try to maintain your health and remain positive, and the rest will take care of itself. How can you find your new you? Start by being kind and gentle with yourself, just like you would for a friend who came to you for advice about the fears of aging. You would never be as harsh to a friend as you are to yourself. Be your own best friend. It makes a difference.

If you want to find out what great qualities you have other than your looks, ask your partner, your friends, and your kids about how you may have touched their lives in a positive way.

Listen to all the wonderful stories they will tell you about you. They will tell you things that will touch your heart and make you proud of who you are. Notice when they tell you about you, they never tell you about how good you looked, only about how wonderful you are or how unselfish you may be and, how much you are loved by everyone.

It’s a great freedom to let go of the fear of aging. Once you do this, and you really accept it, a great peace will come over you. You no longer have to spend wasted time on ways to stay and look younger.

You will no longer waste time comparing yourself to the younger generation or spending money on things just to keep up with the outside world. Just think about how much extra money and time you will have when you let go and age with kindness toward yourself.

You can now travel and do whatever you want. You are still you only better. Remember there is nothing broken about us because we have aged. We don’t have to fix our face or change our bodies for anyone, only unless we want to for us.

Should you choose to do anything to yourself, do it because it will make you feel better and because of you and only you want to do it. Don’t let your partner talk you into or out of whatever makes you feel happy about yourself.

You will never fool Mother Nature, nor will you outrun aging, but if it makes you feel better than do it! You will never be here again, so make it count for you.

One day we won’t worry about the wrinkles we have, and what we do or don’t look like, because the real worry will be about our mortality. The point here is to live and not burden ourselves about aging, because we will all age and, one day, what we look like will be the least of our concerns.

Our concerns will then be about how to live each day healthy and free from pain. What used to make us uneasy about aging will hopefully only be an issue that we will have let go of so that we may enjoy the time we have left.

Enjoy the time you have left. Go and do everything you want to do without fear, without judgment, and without guilt.

 

Do you change the way you look as you age?

    Do you like the way you look as you age?  

Older women are the most dangerous on the planet. We have nothing to lose!

~Jane Fonda

 

Are we happy in the circumstances we are in or have we settled as we have gotten older?

Let’s face it; aging requires change. We can’t wear those sexy clothes we once wore, or wear the same makeup as when we were sixteen because that would be ridiculous.

To some, this may seem sad, even like a death sentence, to be forced to make changes that we don’t want to. Unfortunately, and fortunately, we have to make sure we make changes as we age.

Many women don’t change, and they continue to do the same things they always did. Big mistake because you are not the same person you were when you were twenty, thirty, or even five years ago.

Life is moving faster, even when we feel we are slowing down. Look at it like this, you were a teen once and you wore stuff you wouldn’t dream of wearing now. You naturally changed as you went into your twenties. Somewhere along the way, we stopped and got stuck.

We continue to wear the same things and styles, year after year, decade after decade, without noticing that we need an update or, we do notice, but we nothing about it.

Maybe it’s because we get caught in a time gap. Are we still young, middle age, old or what? How do we perceive ourselves at middle age? At what point or decade do we make the necessary changes that should be made for our forever changing self?

The short answer is to look back at pictures, and if you have looked the same for the last ten, fifteen, twenty years or longer, you need a serious update. Don’t panic, because it’s not hard to do. A little change in your hairstyle, color, makeup and clothes, and you are all set.

I look at magazines for women my age, and I find inspiration through catalogs that cater to women over forty. It has served me well. In fact, I change a little too much.

I change my hair color at least every six months. It’s probably not the best thing to change so often. My son was horrified when he knocked on my bedroom door the other day to ask me a question, and when I opened the door to answer him, he looked shocked and yelled out, “Mom, your hair is blue!” That statement didn’t even faze my daughter, who was sitting at the kitchen table.

She didn’t even bother to look my way because she knows me so well, and this is not the first time, nor will it be the last, that I shock someone with the things I do to myself. It’s just who I am and I happen to like it. By the way, the blue color was accidental. You see I had blonde hair, and one afternoon I decided I might look better with black hair.

It was a funny mistake because the tint in the black dye turned my blonde hair blue (sounds like a country song doesn’t it?). I didn’t panic; did I mention it’s not my first time? My son, the tattletale that he is, couldn’t wait to call his dad to inform him that his wife has blue hair. My husband, being a person that doesn’t like change, and who had the lucky draw to be married to a person who does, was yet again, baffled by why I just couldn’t be like everyone else and be, in his words, “normal.” He does admit though, I keep him on his toes because he never knows who he will come home to. I rest my case! Change is a good thing.

Where Women Go As We Age

https://amzn.to/2Jb6mfy

  Where women go. The reality of middle-age  

What are we waiting for? We can’t wait for the future to happen and we certainly can’t live in the past. In middle age and beyond, we have to come to terms with the fact that our choices have changed.

For some, the changes may not be good, for others, aging is a time when we can do the things we have only dreamed of.

I am inspired by Diana Nyad, the first women to ever swim to Florida from Cuba without a cage. This is extremely inspiring because she was a sixty-four-year-old woman!

I am impressed because I know a few sixty-year-olds who believe they can’t park too far away from the grocery store doors because they don’t want to walk that far, let alone, swim for fifty-three hours and one hundred and ten miles.

Did I mention this was her fifth attempt? Just goes to show you that we are never too old and to never stop trying no matter what. She made her first attempt when she was twenty-eight, and then in 2011, she tried three times at the age of sixty-two, and again at sixty-three.

When she finally accomplished the swim on September 2, 2013, she had three messages for us all: one, we should never, ever give up, two, you’re never too old to chase your dreams, and three, it looks like a solitary sport, but it is a team.

Doesn’t that sum up what we women are going through right now? Never give up on yourself, no matter what age you are. Enjoy your life, love yourself, and do what it is that feeds your soul. It’s never too late to achieve and live your own personal dream. Just have the belief and do away with the fear.

Remember, large or small, your dream belongs to you, and it’s just as important as anyone else’s. We are all living our own dream and we can create a new one if we don’t like the one we are in.

Finally, you are never alone. It takes a team, meaning your friends, your family, your spouse, and your faith, especially faith in yourself. Whatever it is around you that lifts you and inspires you is what you are meant to be. It is important to always be mindful, moreover, keep an open mind.

You never know when the universe is offering you a gift, and if you are not awake, then you will miss opportunities and the energy will go elsewhere.

Too many times we get up, go to work, come home and then go to bed without taking even one second to appreciate the gift of life and what it has to offer us. For those of us who ask why are we here? The quick answer is to take a look around and embrace the gift of life.

The experience of being born may be the only reason we are here. We don’t need to create chaos trying to make a bigger meaning than necessary, otherwise, we waste the time we have. Sure it’s great if you are able to leave a legacy, but even if you don’t, its okay too.

The only wasted life is a life not lived fully. What does fully mean to you? If we embrace the experience of life without thinking there is an attachment, then we are living a life that is meant to be and, therefore, we receive the blessings that come with it.

The one day I will get there is now, and it’s a fork, and you must take the right path that makes you happy.

Our culture teaches us that we won’t ever get there; therefore, we are in a constant state of searching and wondering what’s next. I hope you realize your unique beauty and find the energy within right now, this moment. Every second counts.

This day too will pass and you will never get it back. Whatever holds you back now, you will look back in three or four years and realize how fantastic you really were. You will question why you stayed in certain states of mind, relationships, jobs or whatever held you back in the past.

As we get older, we tend to think we are more tired, especially women, because we are still thinking we can do it all. There are two kinds of energy. One is when you are tired and don’t feel like doing anything. You may feel a bit down on yourself; you decide you don’t have any energy to engage in life.

This energy level is the one when you haven’t slept or you need to eat, so you do and you get your energy back. The second energy level is when you have slept, eaten and still, you have no energy to enjoy life or to engage with others. Perhaps dare I say the word depressed? If you ate more or slept more, you would not find your energy in this state.

However, if suddenly your lottery ticket won or your soul mate came into your life in an instant, you would find your energy! This is the kind of energy you should strive to tap into. Wake up as though you have won the lottery of life, and you love yourself enough, more than anyone else could ever. You have the energy to live with excitement, just remove the negativity that is draining it.

We need to live in real moments in time. There is a book called Real Moments by Barbara De Angelis. If you take your life and your minutes for granted, then you should read this book. It will not only show you how to feel the sun on your face and the wind in your hair, it will show you how to live like you should before you die and actually feel like you live in the moment.

I know this may sound like a circular question, but there is a difference between going through the motions and living in the moment. When you actually live in the moment, time seems to stand still and you feel every experience and sensation happening in that moment. You owe it to yourself to live this way.

MAKING PEACE WITH AGING

  Making peace with aging

 

Making peace with aging, Hmmm? How does a woman make peace with aging in a culture obsessed with youth?

It doesn’t matter what age we are, the issue may change but the focus on aging remains the same. And that focus is how to keep a youthful appearance, stay healthy and remain active.

It’s great for an aging woman to center around taking care of herself, but it’s another matter to obsess about getting old, and, yet, at some point we all do it. I guess you could say I’m lucky because my appearance was never stunning, but I felt beautiful anyways.

I can age graciously by making peace with aging because I was, and still am, an ordinary woman, and that’s okay. It’s the beautiful women I feel for because they seem to be the people having the hardest time with aging.

I really believe when you are ordinary looking like myself, you age more lovely than when you have already reached your peak. However, all women get to the same place eventually, and there is no escaping it. But beauty is all relative anyway.

Sure, I look back at pictures and see my taught skin, my shapely body, my vibrant eyes and the youth that I didn’t appreciate, and I am reminded again how fast life really goes by. With this reminder, I gain a moment of happiness because I also realize I am healthy, happy and look relatively good for my age.

I know life could be worse, so I don’t dwell on the past or question what God has given me. It won’t change where I am today or where I will be tomorrow. It would be wise to make peace with aging sooner than later just in case there is a little more work to do down the road.

Life is a creation in progress, and it shouldn’t be that we are looking and waiting for the end, because that could come for anyone on any day. As we all know, there are no guarantees that we will have another day beyond this one.

I have heard it said that, if you don’t feel old by the time you hit fifty, you soon will. If we live long enough, half of our lives will be spent as older women. I have never thought about it like this before. When I was young, I said I wanted to live forever!

Now, I just want to live a good life and be happy while I am here. I don’t think the answer to getting old is lying about our age, either. Some women add a few years to their age when asked so that others might say they look good for their age.

How can this make us feel good because we, if no one else, still know how old we really are? Don’t fall into the trap of being afraid to tell your age. Just making it another year is a miracle at any age, young or old

 

Free yourself to let grow old compassionately

    Grow old with compassion for yourself  

Call it growing old, getting old, aging, or whatever you want to call the inevitable. Getting old is going to happen no matter what. As we move towards the later years and age, there is something we still have yet to do and that is to forgive.

Forgive ourselves and forgive others, to let go and free ourselves to grow old with compassion for ourselves. Maybe we could have been better wives, mothers, sisters, givers, or whatever you may have regrets about, so what, the past is the past and it no longer matters anymore.

What’s done is done, now it’s about being kind to yourself. If you need to let others know what you now realize, then let them know and ask for forgiveness, forgive them if you need to and move on.

Whatever we have been searching for outside of ourselves is already within us. There is nothing to find out there that we don’t already have inside. I talk to or hear about many older people that are deeply sad about the past. Maybe its things they wished they had done or wished they hadn’t done.

If you are holding in sadness, despair, regret or any other emotion that you may be attributing to unhappiness, then just let it go. If you can do something about it, do it now and do it quickly, but don’t dwell on it. Whatever the past was, it doesn’t equal the future and the future is now. There is no reason not to forgive ourselves for whatever mistakes we have made in the past even if they were made only by omission.

In order to grow old, we must not fear growing old. The biggest problem that we all have, both men and women, is fear. We are afraid to live, to be alive, and to risk being ourselves.

Nothing defines us like death, and yet death is not our greatest fear, but genuinely living is the real fear. We have all had bad luck, bad breaks, heartbreak, or things didn’t turn out the way we wanted them, however, we and the world still keep going.

We have to get old.  We have no choice, but we continue to hold in pain and, with every breath, we don’t let it out. We have to let go of pain and release it along with the blame and guilt. If you can’t do this, then you owe it to yourself, and to those who love you, to make peace with yourself so that you can fully live and love those around you.

title: Does EndyMed work?
content:
Does EndyMed work?

  Okay, ladies.  Have you seen the commercials about how to get rid of crepey skin?  You know the body lotion that claims to tighten your skin and make it look youthful again? I won't say the name of the product that claims to do this but, I will say that I have tried that product and it DOES NOT WORK. Long story short, I am in my fifties and I abused my skin for most of my life by laying in the tanning beds and in the sun.  My skin is both crepey and the elasticity is compromised. It doesn't help either that I am in menopause and now my collagen formation is at an all-time low. I tried working out a lot and lifting heavy weights and although it helped, it didn't get rid of the crepeyness of my skin. One day I was in my doctor's office and he had a poster on the wall that said "EndyMed" for tighter skin. Now, I am a pretty skeptical person but even saying that I try just about everything at least once to verify my skepticism.  I inquired about the EndyMed and they explained that it works by allowing energy to be delivered deep down into the skin in virtually a painless manner. It uses multiple generators to ping pong the energy to a deep level of the skin.  It's used as a non-invasive procedure and either in specific areas like face, neck, cheeks, legs, arms or, a whole body rejuvenation. It's for skin tightening, acne scars, and wrinkle reduction.  It also helps with pigmentation issues which I have all of these issues.  It's an innovative technology and the fact that the energy goes deep down to the skin surface allows collagen to reproduce thus, tightening the skin. The wand on the machine is used in the areas of the body that you want to be tightened etc.  It heats up the skin and stimulates collagen remodeling.  They call it "3D energy."  

So the question is, "Does EndyMed work?"

I had three treatments done on my upper arms because I had cellulite and loose skin.  I also had two treatments on my inner thighs because I had sagging skin.  I was at the point where I hadn't worn shorts in two years. My arms got about thirty percent tighter and my cellulite got about ten percent better.  The doctor said it will take about four to six treatments so I will go back and have three more. For my legs, I saw immediate improvement and I actually wore shorts the other day and I could not believe it!  It has been painful not wearing shorts and skirts like I did in the good old days.  I will also go back and have four more treatments on my legs to get the full effect. With that said, in both of these cases, I increased my workouts with targeted workouts for these areas using heavier weights and specific techniques that shape these areas. I also dropped five pounds too.  Did that have anything to do with my results?  Absolutely.  Unless one is having surgery, doing something that is non-invasive only works if you work along with it. Would I have gotten results if I didn't diet and workout?  Yes.  But not as good.

The cost for EndyMed

  I think the cost is pretty good.  I paid $297 for three treatments.  The treatments are spread to every other week per area.  I think it's a bargain because the emotional pain that I felt by hiding my legs for two years was well worth trading a few hundred bucks for.

How long does it EndyMed take?

  The procedure takes about thirty minutes for inner thighs and about the same for arms.  There is a setting they put on for each part of the body that tells them how much heat to put on and how many passovers with the wand to use.  Once the passovers are done, it's done.  Super painless and almost feels light a light massage.  

Facial Rejuvenation with EndyMed

  After I get the other treatments finished up.  I will go back and do my chest and my face.  I like the fact that it creates collagen and as we get older our skin sags on our face and neck because we stop producing collagen at the rate we did in our early years. I'd rather produce my own natural filler like collagen instead of getting unnatural fillers injected.  To me, it just doesn't look the same.

Does EndyMed work?

Yes! I would say EndyMed does work and it is well worth the money :) Here is a link if you want more information on EndyMed  http://www.endymed.com/VALIDATION

title: To be buried or cremated?
content:
To be buried or cremated?

  To be buried or cremated?  Two years ago, the woman that I never thought would age let alone pass away did in fact die. I got a call, it was unexpected (aren't most deaths anyway?) and then my mother was gone. We never talked about where she wanted her final resting place to be but, it was something we all knew, and that was, none of us wanted to be put into the ground. So, when she passed away, I was solely responsible for her as I lost my little brother eighteen months to the day of her passing and, my older brother was disabled due to a twenty-five-year opiate addiction in which sadly, my mother succumbed to as well. I was in charge of deciding where I would place my mothers remains. My mother was distraught like any mother would be when she lost her youngest child.  But, she put on a brave face for the time being, and I had my baby brother cremated (mostly because it was affordable and again, no one ever talked about death in our family so what else would I do?). Cremation was swift and efficient.  No long and drawn out funeral arrangements or watching my mom fall apart next to his grave.    My mother was never a strong-willed person.  I always rescued her from herself and taking care of my little brother was something I had always done. When I offered to take my brothers ashes back to our hometown of San Diego, California, she resisted and said that she wanted them to be with her for a while.  "Until she was ready to let them go," she said. Oddly enough, I knew what that meant.  She too would go with my brother. That's exactly what happened. He passed on June 21, 2013.  She passed on December 21, 2015. I heard my cell phone right at 1:30 in the morning, looked at the number coming from my mom's house and knew instantly, that she was gone.  We all know that when a phone rings in the middle of the night, it's never good news. I drove an hour to her house.  Sat by her side on her couch.  Kissed her goodbye on the cheek and then stood back while the coroner put her frail little body into a black zip-up bag. The coroner said he was sorry.  I watched them drive away.  I took my little brothers ashes from her coffee table, and I went back home. It was Christmas then, and I had a house full of people.  I  had little time to grieve, but crazy as it was, I called the same funeral home the next day and arranged to have her cremated as soon as possible. I couldn't wait to take her and my brother back home where they could finally be together. It was as though it was meant to be. April 17th, 2016 (on her birthday), I flew to San Diego with my mother and my brother tucked away tightly in my designer carry on bag. After the airport security opened up and checked out the ashes, I was on the plane. I chartered a boat, and right at the border of San Diego and Mexico, I released my brother and my mother. The pain finally weighed on both my mind and my chest.  I hadn't cried until that moment. It was relieving to cry, but it was even more relieving to see them together again. It was beautiful, and FINALLY, they were at peace and selfishly I was too. I watched their remains drift peacefully out into the ocean while at that very moment the world stopped and I could feel every part of them and every memory of growing up with them both. I don't think I could have fully appreciated bury them in the ground. Yes, when a person is cremated, no one can come and visit them.  But really, are they there? I have some peace in thinking that I let them go and they are patiently waiting for me rather than me going to a cemetery when I know darn well they are not there. I'd rather know that somewhere out there; my soul is released and then maybe, if there is another life, I will drift back again. If you're interested in seeing their burial at sea,  I have posted the video below for you to check out.  I was using my iPhone while my husband released their ashes. https://vimeo.com/251253286

I hope there is life after death and they know that they are together again.  I hope they are with everyone that passed before them.  I hope they are happy.  You know, in a way that we don't understand just yet?

So the question of "To be buried or cremated?" Is most likely to be answered by how your family usually deals with death throughout their history or, like mine, doesn't deal with it at all thus,   having to create my traditions.  I hope I was right in making the decision I made and when I look back at the video, I know that I was.

I hope I was right in making the decision I made and when I look back at the video, I know that I was.

Yes, I will be cremated, and I will be put at the same longitude and latitude at sea.

I used to think that if you talked about your death and where you want your remains to go, that it would create a bad omen.  That's not how I feel, and I have let my husband and my kids know where I finally be.

That's not how I feel now, and I have let my husband and my kids know my wishes.

Until then, I am going to live like there is no tomorrow :)

To be buried or cremated?

In case you would like to see a spiritual perspective, I had attached a link below:

https://www.spiritualresearchfoundation.org/spiritual-research/death-and-dying/Cremation-vs-burial

If you are interested in a biblical perspective, I have also attached a link below:

https://www.thoughtco.com/what-does-the-bible-say-about-cremation-700373

title: What are CoconutPods?
content:
What are CoconutPods?

COCONUTPODS.COM 

     

    CoconutPods are all natural and organic, moisturizing body melts. I created this product because I was diagnosed with all kinds of autoimmune issues like thyroid disease, shingles, arthritis and, gland problems. My skin was having all kinds of issues from feeling dry to looking crepey. I would do like most of us do and get out of the shower or bath and grab a bottle of lotion full of all kinds of chemicals. I would start applying from my neck down to the bottoms of my feet.  My skin was drenched in chemicals that I couldn't even pronounce or, that I even knew what the heck they were. Of course, I did this for years until I hit my middle forties when I got shingles.  It was a bit too early in life to get shingles as most people that have them get them later in life. That was the beginning of my autoimmune journey on a down hill spiral. Shortly after that, I was diagnosed with Hashimoto's disease.  It's a disease where your immune system attacks your thyroid gland. I had nodules (growths in my thyroid) that had to be biopsied and still have to be once a year to check for cancer. I won't bore you with the fact that one ailment leads to the next and the next and then, more and more medicine to treat the issues.  It was a total nightmare trying to adjust to my new life. I got tired of feeling like hell all of the time, so I decided to find out what was causing my problems. After reading that the types of health issues that I was going through were very common in today's environment.  Moreover, they are dramatically increasing at alarming rates. Is it the plastic in our water, chemicals in the air, pollution in our food, chemicals in our lotions? I am not a doctor or scientist, and frankly, I could research all of the reasons and write about what those folks think the problem is but, to me, it comes down to common sense. FACT:

  • The skin is the largest organ of the human body.

  • In a 120 pound person, the skin;

    • Covers 3000 square inches

    • Weighs 6 pounds

Common sense to me means that I begin to look around and find out what the heck was causing my issues. After all, I am a vegetarian, work out, drink lots of water, supplement and, I have no history of any of the stuff I was going through in my family. I couldn't do much better on my food because I was already eating organic.  I only drank purified water (and wine) nothing else. I supplemented according to my yearly checkups to keep me healthy. I had no bad habits so what the heck gives?

What are CoconutPods?

After I had read that our skin is the largest organ of our body (next to our liver I guess), I took a good look around, and I was disturbed to see that I had a couple of hundred beauty products just laying around. The worse part is that I decided to read a lot of the labels.  I was beside myself.  I was a little mad at both myself and the product manufacturers. Here is why.  Mad at myself because unlike the food that I put into my body, I didn't take two seconds to check the chemicals that I let absorb into my skin and thus, into all of the organs of my body. I was mad at the manufacturers because they were using all kinds of preservatives that are known to cause hormone disruptors such as thyroid disease and Lupus and, a ton of others. Here are some of the toxic chemicals that you will want to avoid:
  • Parabens. ...
  • Synthetic colors. ...
  • Fragrance. ...
  • Phthalates. ...
  • Triclosan. ...
  • Sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS) / Sodium Laureth sulfate (SLES). ...
  • Formaldehyde. ...
  • Toluene.
These are only ten of them, and if you go deep, you will see that the beauty industry is not pretty. I took all of my products and got rid of them.  However, I still needed a way to moisturize my skin. I am one of those people that want to use one or two products for some things, so this was when I decided to create my product called "CoconutPods." I knew that there could be absolutely no chemicals or preservatives what so ever.  It had to be organic, and it had to moisturize quickly and effectively. After doing lots of testing, I found my formula which is just five natural and organic ingredients:
  1. Organic Shea butter
  2. Organic Cocoa butter
  3. Organic Coconut Oil
  4. Organic and local Beeswax
  5. Organic essential oils.
Everything is natural and won't throw your body off like traditional lotions and chemicals that are being sold to us without us knowing that many of them could be doing more harm than good. Just one CoconutPod (show picture or video below) a day from head to toe does the trick.  Most likely, you will even have some left and by all means, put it into your hair to soften and moisturize dry hair. No bottles to carry.  No wasted product because you can't get it all out.  No chemicals that you have to worry about.  Just all natural moisturizer. It's all about choices.

What are CoconutPods?

 

COCONUTPODS.COM

title: My Ambien experience
content:
My Ambien Experience

    So it's three in the morning, and as usual, I am wide awake. It wasn't always like this.  I used to be able to sleep until I hit around age forty-five. Then came pre-menopause.  I got my hormones regulated and took Progesterone to help me sleep.  It helped for all of about one month. I drank wine and took Melatonin to get me to sleep. When the wine, melatonin, and hormones no longer worked, I decided to pay my doctor a visit.  The hormone doctor wanted to keep increasing my hormones.  She told me to stop stressing, chill out, meditate.  Get my mind right.  Find out what it was that was keeping me up. I knew what was keeping me up; it was my effing brain that wouldn't shut the hell up.  It would remind me every morning, about this time and tell me about all of the things that I didn't do, needed to do and, what I could do better.  I couldn't stop it. It was awful.  I would lay in bed staring at the ceiling for hours until I finally threw the covers off and got up.  Only to leave me tired and complaining to everyone the next day about how tired I was.  Then I would repeat the cycle every night. The night would come, I would drink a couple of glasses of wine, pop my Melatonin, take my hormones and pray that I would not only get to sleep but stay a sleep for at least a couple of hours. The problem was that I would wake up in the middle of the night from the alcohol. "Waking up early after a late night drinking is common. After two drinks, alcohol disrupts your sleep patterns. After alcohol is metabolized, adaptations your body made to adjust for its effects are now unnecessary, throwing your body out of whack and jolting you awake." (http://www.businessinsider.com/why-wake-up-early-after-drinking-alcohol-2017-3) Yep!  That was me.  I not only woke up from the alcohol, but I was also dehydrated as hell and felt like shit.  Now I had even more problems.  I was sleep deprived and hungover, and I was more awake than ever..  

My Ambien Experience

  Which brings me to my Ambien experience. After giving my primary care doctor my entire sob story about how the quality of my life was diminished by my lack of sleep, thinking that I needed him to approve or justify why I needed drugs, he could give a shit, and in all of ten seconds, he wrote me a prescription for Ambien. He gave me ten milligrams and told me to bite it in half at night.  One so that I could build up a tolerance and two so that I could get double the dose and save on my insurance co-payment. I took that prescription and went straight to my pharmacy where I told them that I, like an addict, needed my pills today! I got my Ambien and waited for dark.  I was eager to get started right away and fantasized about all of the time that I would have once I was able to sleep for eight hours. I wanted the quality of time that I once had like when I slept all day as a teenager.  I remember my mother opening my door on the weekends saying "get up, you're going to sleep your life away." Those were the days when you could sleep all day until you force yourself to get your ass up.  Now, it's the opposite; I have to force my ass to stay in bed. Maybe I'm paying the price later in life for sleeping all day, and now, I am being punished. I bit the pill in half, and within minutes, I felt like I had been put under anesthesia.  It was incredible.  I was out in no time.  I woke up and felt pretty darn good and thought that I had found my magic pill. Until I built up a tolerance and they no longer worked.  Soon I was taking a whole pill and then one and a half.  I told myself that there was no way that I would graduate to taking two ten milligrams because then what? Was I addicted to Ambien? Is Ambien addictive? "Ambien is in a class of drugs known as sedative-hypnotics. This non-benzodiazepine “Z-drug” has the same medical effectiveness as benzodiazepines like Xanax without the same hazardous and habit-forming properties those drugs are known for. ... Although it is not as habit-forming as benzos, Ambien is an addictive substance." (https://www.addictioncenter.com/sleeping-pills/ambien/) I know addiction very well because my mother suffered horribly until her death with addiction and I had to be careful.  It's not that I thought I was addicted (I know that's what most people addicted say) but, I was more addicted to the nightly ritual ( I know again). I was reminded the next day from others about all of the things that I did the night before when I would take Ambien.  I had no recollection of any of it.  I would send odd and random text messages to my contact list, create Facebook posts that I was mortified about and would quickly delete the next day. The worse was the sleep sex.  Of course, I wouldn't remember it but would quickly realize it when I would wake up naked the next day. Not to mention that I felt like I was losing my mind.  I was at a loss for words.  I couldn't remember shit.  I would read the same sentence over and over and not understand it. My body felt like crap, and I wasn't myself anymore. I began to drink wine again and then pop the Ambien, Melatonin and try to sleep.  I felt even worse, and I created this loop that I lived in for several months. I remember sitting in my office feeling like my body was shutting down.  Worse than when I just didn't sleep. So, I quit! I went home, threw away the bottle of pills and vowed to never take that shit again! And I didn't. Can I sleep now?  No.  But I do get a couple of hours here and there.  The best part is, I feel so much better and I appreciate what I took for granted before. They say the older you get, the less sleep that you need because, the less time that you have left.  I think that whoever the hell said that was like me, up at three in the morning and decided that time is more valuable and sleep is overrated and, I'd rather walk around sleep deprived and complain about it than to walk around like an Ambien zombie :)      

 

 If you want to do something really great for yourself, I created a six-step course called "The Rejuvenation Program"  You can check it out by clicking this link: http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

title: 8 Rejuvenation Tips to help you feel great
content:
8 Rejuvenation Tips to help you feel great!

 

Tip #1

Try to eliminate sugar and white flour – You will not regret this!  To reduce your cravings as you eliminate these, eat protein for breakfast like eggs, tofu scramble or a protein shake.  Use Stevia for sweetener.

Tip #2

 
Always combine “good” proteins, fats and carbs at each meal.  For example, fish and salad with avocado or at snack time, nuts, berries.

Tip #3

 
Try and drink filtered water throughout the day.
If you hate water, add fruit and Stevia for extra flavor, especially lemon.
At the end of the day, you'll be surprised on how much you drink when adding flavor.
 

Tip #4

Take 15 minutes a day for yourself.  
Sit outside or next to a window and daydream.
 Reflect on the person that you are.  Don't think about your to-do list.  
Just let your thoughts flow and daydream like when you were a kid.

Tip #5

Try to only take medications that you absolutely need to.  
If you have a headache rather than quickly take a pain reliever, lay down and use an ice pack.  
Give your body time to heal and then decide.

Tip #6

Try not to rush or be in a hurry.  
Take your time and move slower.  
Everything will still be there either way.  
Before getting out of bed in the morning, rather than grab your phone, close your eyes and appreciate, pray or just be present before the day takes over.

Tip #7

What are your most toxic habits?  
Make a list of the top three and try to eliminate one of them.  
It could be things like procrastination, drinking too much, bitterness, eating sugar, or whatever.  
Choose one.
 

Tip #8

I think this tip of the day has to be the most important one of all.
Every morning go to your mirror, look straight into your eyes and say, "I love you" and mean it. 
Let the inner child and the adult become one and heal any damage from the past.
 When you can see your soul (it may take a few times) you won't believe how transforming it can be.
 

8 Rejuvenation Tips to help you feel great!

 

If you would like to feel fantastic without detoxing then check out "The Rejuvenation Program"  It's just six steps to add to your life that will transform how you look and feel!

title: Look Good For Your Age
content:
Look Good For Your Age

      Just because we're getting older doesn't mean that we have to have wrinkled and dull skin.  In fact, we don't even have to look our biological age if we don't want to.

We also don't have to go to a surgeon either!

 

  Sure, some people age better than others and in the end, we all catch up with each other. But do we have to?  

The answer is no!   

  If you take care of your health, you will most likely live a long life.  Conversely, if you take care of your skin in a way that I will show you, a unique way of wounding the skin little by little and, then allowing it to heal itself and then, building upon it, you will create brand new and more youthful skin.  

Look Good For Your Age

  You can have younger more youthful skin and even look five to ten years younger than you are. It's not about looking twenty-five when you're fifty; it's about looking the best at any age.

HOW THE QUICK AND EASY PATH WORKS TO GET YOUNGER LOOKING SKIN:

1.  I will show you in four easy steps how to change the skin on your face, neck, chest, and hands completely.

title: How to do Microneedling at home
content:
How to do Microneedling at home

 

Derma Roller and Vitamin C & E from   THERESA SKROBANEK

   

How to do Microneedling at home

   

Micro-needling is a procedure that usually your doctor or an Esthetician does.

It works by using tiny needles that go over the skin that create tiny puncture wounds (small little holes) and then our skin repairs these wounds by creating collagen.  Thus, creating the new skin that is smoother and tighter.

Collagen also helps with building new scaffolding in our skin.  What this means is that it will somewhat tighten the jaw area.  It will not tighten like a facelift but, over time, if you have minimal sagging Microneedling will help.

As we get older, we produce less collagen and the signs of aging appear.  We can also consume collagen supplements daily to help with this too and, I show you how on another post here.

Micro-needling is a non-invasive procedure with very little downtime.  When I get it done my dermatologist's office, it usually takes about an hour to complete and that time is spent mostly numbing my face because, doctors have certain settings they use and they can go up or down on the pressure, which for most of us, it can get a little painful.

However, if you are like me, and you want to do procedures at home with minimal downtime and, that work fantastic.  Then I am here to introduce you to Derma Rolling.

 

How to do Microneedling at home

 

If you watched the video I have above, you would have seen how it works.

I use it about every two to three weeks.  You never want to use a roller or, do anything to your skin, like a peel or other procedures until, the one that you have done is completely healed, which usually takes about two weeks or so.

The reason you want to wait is that we want to wound the skin in a controlled way, therefore, the body can do its job and create collagen to fill and repair the wound.  This is how we get smoother skin.

If you were to do a procedure on skin that is not healed completely, you would be causing inflammation and with this, you would actually cause damage to your skin and damage causes wrinkles and scars.

Get your Derma Roller and your Vitamin C & E serum from my links below and get started.  These are the exact products that create amazing results.

When you get the Derma Roller you will start with a clean face, neck, and chest.  Take the Derma Roller and on a scale of one to ten, begin rolling with a pressure of about a three or so.  As you get used to it, you can add pressure.

Step one:

Start with your face then your neck and then, your chest.  Go at your own tolerance.  It will tingle or sting slightly but again, you can adjust the pressure as needed.

Step two:

After you have rolled your face, neck, and chest, use the Vitamin C & E serum to go over these areas completely.  It will help heal your skin faster and stimulate collagen growth.  The vitamin c makes a huge difference, trust me.

title: How to keep the weight off for good
content:
How to keep the weight off for good

 

I am just going to get right to the point here!

If you're a middle-aged woman and you've tried hard to lose weight with no luck, here is how I finally did it and how you can too.

 Eat low carbs every day!  

I know you've probably already tried this a time or two.  But, hear me out for a minute.

You will get used to it.  You will be a bit tired about the third day but you will overcome this, and your body will adjust.  

The key is to keep hydrated and have some snacks at hand when you feel tired.

I love carbs too believe me.  But I don't miss them like before when I tried this.

 Move.  No matter what, do something for at least twenty minutes or more per day.

 Walk, do jumping jacks, do your steps, use the stairs, something. Download an app.

 Break it up if you have to but, move your body. 

 I do 15 minutes in the morning and 15 minutes in the afternoon.  That's it.  

The best part about working out is when its over, oh yeah, and how you will look and feel too!

 It will take at least ten days to lose at least 3 to 5 pounds.  

Sorry, my friends, it's not like when you were 20!  

You know, when you skipped a meal, and you dropped a pant size.😩  But, the weight you will lose is real weight and not just water. 

Once the first five pounds are gone, the rest will go even faster.

I promise that your clothes will begin to loosen after only a few days.

Last bit of news here,  you will have to do the 90/10 rule.

Meaning, this will be your new lifestyle 90 percent of the time you will eat lean protein and veggies and 10 percent of the time you can eat any carbs that you want.

That's it!  Pretty simple right?

The problem is, with all health concerns aside, we can't lose weight so easy as we age.  

The truth is, many of us gain ten pounds per decade as we age.  Ouch!

We try and control our eating, we get emotional, we get bored, we get around our partners, our friends and we revert to eating whatever we want.

 Remember, one night of chips, guacamole and, an entree leads to  waking up and starting all over again 😩  

We've all been on this train ride.

Today is the day.

And one more thing, you know how they say "eat good carbs" not bad carbs?  Well, carbs are carbs and they convert to insulin and if we don't burn it off, we gain weight.  Simple as that.

Stick to lean protein and, (I know drill sergeant here...)  veggies 90% of the time.

 

How to keep the weight off for good

 

I think it was Tony Robbins or someone else that said "We do more to avoid pain then we do pleasure."  

So you have to ask yourself what's more painful, not eating the chips or gaining ten pounds per decade?

I say give it a try.  It takes a few days to get used to it.  But your cravings will pass and your pleasure will increase by the way you look and feel.

 ❤️

 

If you want to learn how to Rejuvenate & Renew, I've created a quick 7-Day step-by-step plan.  No detoxing just quick steps too looking and feeling better fast!

title: PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND AGING
content:
PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND AGING

    Engaging in physical activity does the body wonders.  Basically when we exercise, every cell in our body benefits from it.  Exercising lowers our blood pressure and makes our arteries stronger. It also makes our bones stronger, our brains better and, helps our immune system, not to mention it helps maintain our weight goals as well.  I workout daily although my motto is “the best part of working out is when it’s done” it does feel good to have done it. Three types of exercising and these are cardio, strength training and, yoga/stretching.  Of course, there are different types of programs such as, plyometrics, circuit training, high intensity interval training, Tabata, CrossFit, etc. These all have value but cardio is the best overall.  Of course, you get some cardio from weight training from strength training; it's is better to get your heart rate to seventy-five and eighty-five percent of its maximum capacity for at least 20 minutes. This translates into about 120 beats a minute for the average person.  If you like riding bikes, dancing or fast walking, these can also be beneficial as well.  Of course cardio will burn lots of calories fast. Lifting weights creates lean muscle mass.  The more muscle mass we have the more growth hormone and other anti-aging combinations we will have.  Not to mention we will look lean and toned which looks aesthetically pleasing to say the least. Yoga and stretching improves mobility and flexibility as we age.  It also helps improve strength and we need all of these as we age to prevent injury.  Endorsing both the renewal process and the exercise process, you will endorse a better body both inside and out.  You will also add years to your life.

PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND AGING

  Of course, exercising takes effort.  A lot of people don’t like to exercise or say they just don’t have the time.  If you absolutely hate to exercise, I say do the easiest one that way you will do it.  Anything is better than nothing.  Who knows, after a while, you may do more and more as you look and feel better.  If you say you don’t have time, then get up earlier or split your workout into two sessions. Do twenty minutes before your morning shower and twenty quickly before you eat dinner.  You will be amazed how well this works and how fast it goes by breaking it up.  If you think you will fail to eat right, workout and renew your body because maybe, you have failed many times before, I want you to know this is not some diet. Living in the renewal process is simply the way our bodies want us to in order to optimize its longevity.  You don’t have to do it in one big leap, just take your time.  It’s easier than we might think.  Go easy at first and then the harder stuff will come easier too. To the extent you take care of yourself is the extent that your body will return the favor.  If you only follow a few of these steps, then so be it.  At least you are taking care of yourself and you are becoming mindful of the process.  When we become mindful and aware, we tend to automatically put it into our subconscious and it becomes a reflex and second nature.

title: "Resveratrol" How to turn on the Longevity gene
content:
"Resveratrol" How to turn on the Longevity gene

 

"The French Paradox" which suggests that despite a high-fat diet and a high consumption of red wine had a low incidence of heart disease compared to Americans.

Most researches agreed that the substance in wine offered the protection.  Even the American dietary guidelines changed their premise stating that moderate consumption of red wine is beneficial to our health.  Before you go out and drink a whole lot of red wine, keep reading on.

Now scientists have identified the exact substance in red wine called Resveratrol which they believe protects more than just our heart.

They are also stating that Resveratrol in high doses could significantly extend life and prevent a host of other age-related illnesses.

If they are right, we could all be taking a pill very soon to add a decade or two to our lives. If what they think to be correct about Resveratrol, then this may change health care as we know it!

This pill that we will take ( Resveratrol) could delay the inevitable.  It will prevent and forestall many of the diseases that come with age starting at age 50, 60, 70 and beyond.

It's not a wonder drug that will turn a 90-year old into a 30-year-old, but it will slow the train down at whatever age you are at.  That in itself would have me running out to get it!

We can slow down the death train if you will.  This is how it works.  In almost all life forms there is a SIRT1 Gene. It's ordinarily inactive within us, but when it's active,for it triggers a survival mechanism that extends life.

Red wine is loaded with Resveratrol and found in the skin of the grapes.  The Resveratrol protects the skin of the grapes from fungus and bacteria.

Another way to turn the longevity gene on is to "stay hungry" eating a lot of food turns the gene off and dieting (eating fewer calories) turns it on.  It's called calorie restriction.

Looking at monkeys in a controlled study, the monkeys that took in fewer calories than the second group who got to eat what they wanted, looked younger, had fewer health problems and lived longer than the "chunky monkeys."  Pound for pound the lighter monkeys do much better.

A hungry life turns on our genetic survival switch and appears to lead to a longer life. So there is a survival advantage live on a calorie restrictive diet.

I have to say that I am going to try this however, as I write this it's about lunch time for me and I'm starving just by thinking that I will restrict my calories but, it's worth it to try it as I like to do things that keep me healthy and not fad diets and supplements, etc.

title: Do you need natural hormone replacement?
content:
Do you need natural hormone replacement?

 

Does natural hormone replacement have the ability to keep us youthful and disease free for life?

Hormones are substances naturally produced by components of the endocrine gland, ovaries, testicles, pituitary, pineal gland,  and thyroid.  Levels change and influence the aging process.

Hormone replacement can turn back the clock if the levels are stabilized which gives us leverage in our bid for anti-aging.

Hormones are different from vitamins and minerals because hormones regulate the metabolic activity in our bodies.  While vitamins and minerals do the rest of the work. Hormones make all the big decisions in our bodies, and they are effective in small numbers.

Correcting hormone deficiencies can play a huge role in our health and our longevity. The key is to detect and correct hormones successfully.  Hormones can reverse many of the mental and physical changes that we see as normal aging.

For example, hormone replacement therapy can help with the immune system, brittle bones, muscles loss, memory, insomnia, fatigue, loss of libido, and a lot more.

Hormones help the body become healthier and heal faster so that we can live a better life and live a longer life.

When they say "hormone replacement" they don't mean that all of a sudden you no longer have any hormones circulating through your blood.  What is meant is that our bodies are making fewer hormones as we age.  In our thirties, the decline begins to take place.

Did you know that the gradual deterioration in hormone reduction is already programmed in our genes? As hormones slow down, aging speeds up.  The rate of reduction usually equals the rate of aging.

Here are the hormones I'm talking about:
  • Melatonin
  • Estrogen, progesterone, testosterone
  • DHEA
  • Pregnenolone
  • Thyroid

If we restore these hormones, hopefully at the level of when we were younger, we can slow down or dare I say it "reverse the aging process?"

Each type of hormone is specific.  Currently, I am on a small dose of estrogen, a testosterone cream, melatonin, and thyroid hormone.  Do I feel great?  I'd like to think so. I'm pushing fifty in a couple of months so, yes, I would want to reverse or at the very least, keep disease away.

In the next post, I will break down the above five hormones and how they work.  I will also tell you how you can get tested and what synthetic hormones there are.

Until then, I will ask you.  Have you ever had your hormones tested?
