title: I'm gonna describe loneliness ...
content:
"I'm gonna describe loneliness

so y'all who have never experienced it no how I feel"

 

While scrolling down my Facebook page today, I came across this post from someone I met while on vacation a couple of years ago.  Although we don't know each other that well, we keep in contact like most everyone else on Facebook.

I found her post to be very moving because I'm sure that there are many lonely people in the world and I'd predict that many of us will be there at some point in our lives.

Even if we have a companion now, as in life, we will all end up of alone one day.

The question that I ask myself is "'Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all?"

Alfred Lord Tennyson

With her permission, here is her exact post:

"I'm gonna describe loneliness so y'all who have never experienced it no how i feel you wake up in the morning to your own alarm you take a shower and cook your own breakfast and go to work with no one to kiss good bye at the door you come home to nobody who asks you how your day was and no one to tell it too you take off your fcn bra and get into something comfortable and pour yourself a drink turn on the gut wrenching news to keep up with the hateful world we live in and cook your own dinner during the commercials without missing a thing on the news when you've finished and are ready to sit down and eat you,sit in front of the tv and watch the rest of the commercials and finish by the time the programming,comes back on then you get up and scrape the plate and wash the dish and the pots you used and go back to the tv for more,commercials while you wish you could turn off the tv and have someone to talk to about your day your plans your dreams and there is no one there so you go on face book and make a few status comments about how your day was so stressful and the pain you're feeling from working so hard and all you get back is "likes" so you've cleaned the kitchen and everything is shiney and its time for your bath. You run the water sit in the warm tub and relax with a drink while you soak until your finger tips are wrinkled then you pull the drain plug and step out onto the bath mat and fish for the soft towel while you still have water on your eyes and your hair is dripping wet, you dry your eyes then your hair with the towel and then the rest of you while you enjoy the soothing pleasure of the towel scratching your back since it hasn't never been scratched by a human for as long as you can remember,,you take another towel to dry the rest of your hair and wrap your naked body into the towel you used to dry yourself and go to your bedroom and put on a negligee thinking you want to look pretty just in case that moment might come and you go back to the tv for more commercials because its still too early to go to bed and you watch,tv until you fall asleep and wake up at 3 am feeling to awake to go back to bed until the alarm goes off at 6 am but you do anyway and you toss and turn. Praying for the alarm to go off so you can get up and get ready for work... This is every day no one comes over no one calls everyone thinks you're so happy bcz they see you on Saturday dancing your ass off with some ass hole that just dances with you cz he thinks its a chance to get close to your body who he hasn't even bought you a drink yet and is already thinking about,getting laid while you are buying your own drinks,,,boom then its time to go home you go in your house crash in your bed and wake up to another similar day to enjoy by your self with no vocal sounds from you except a cough or a phone call from a wrong number or to reject a telemarketer how do you define lonely or am i just being selfish?"

title: What's up with doctors these days!!
content:
What's up with doctors these days!!

 

I feel both pissed off and like I won the lottery at the same time!

For the last two years, I have had PVC's which means that my heart has premature ventricular contractions.  "Premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) are premature heartbeats originating from the ventricles of the heart. Premature ventricular contractions are premature because they occur before the regular heartbeat."

I found this out because I was going to have a minor cosmetic procedure and the doctor did an EKG, and it came back abnormal.  She said that she wouldn't do the procedure until I got a heart doctor to clear me.

So, after thousands of dollars to satisfy my deductible, I had a stress test, a heart halter monitor, more EKG's, a Nuclear heart test (radio active dye put in my veins), and an echocardiogram, and a few other tests.

I went' to my "Natural OBGYN" to tell her that every since she put me on thyroid medicine, I could feel my heart palpitating.  She took blood, I went back and she said, it was not the thyroid medicine but that my heart issue was just part of aging.

With sadness, I took her words and thankfully my heart came back normal.  I got my clearance from the heart doctor and I got my procedure.

For the next year or so, I went back four times to tell my OBGYN that there was something wrong with my heart.  She couldn't find anything.

I decided to get another opinion and went to an Endocrinologist and he said that I should stay on the thyroid medicine because he said my blood level was normal and now found a nodule on my thyroid meaning, my thyroid was attacking itself.

I Got the nodule tested and it too was fine. So, I took more thyroid medicine. I felt like I was on diet pills, my heart felt like it was jumping out of my chest and, I felt bad all of the time.

I was close to accepting living this way.  Until, I needed another minor surgery and the anesthesiologist decided to give me yet, another EKG because, by now I was on blood pressure medication because of my heart rate and, my PVC'S were twice as bad as the time before.

She said she would not put me under and said again that I needed heart clearance. They pulled the I'V'S out and after losing my payment to secure the surgery, I was again, spinning trying to figure out what to do next.

After getting dressed and being kindly told not to come back until I could figure out my health issue, I sadly walked to my car.

I called my OBGYN in the parking lot and she said to come right over and get my thyroid tested.  By now, I was tired of playing this game.  I decided she was the problem and that I needed to find a way to get off of thyroid medication.  She actually wanted me to take more as she said I was even on the low end!

I almost cried because I thought for a second that maybe my heart was failing and my life would end up being short.  I recently lost my brother to the side effects of radiation near his heart and I concluded that I would be next.

After all, I am going to be 50 in a couple of months and they say that heart disease is the number one killer of women over 50.  I thought it was just my fate and I was going to have to live with a bad heart valve or something.

I did get another blood test and took it to a new endocrinologist.  He said as soon as I told him the symptoms and what I was taking, he told me the problem was the name brand "Armour" and that it was made from pigs and that, sometimes we can't handle pig thyroid.

He said in some people it causes an electrical arrhythmia.  He might as well have said, "Theresa, your hell is over and you've been saved."

Now, I'm 90% Vegan which goes against me taking pig medicine but I'm also 100% proactive in my health and I know my body.

The doctor also said that, every dose is a different dose meaning that, it comes from different pigs so my body has an issue with it.

I don't know how many times I asked my "Natural OBGYN" to think about switching my brand.  Nope! She knew best because she was "the doctor."

Long story short (okay I'm making it short because you're probably tired of this already), the new endocrinologist took me off of Armour thyroid medicine and eight weeks later my blood tests show I don't or maybe never needed thyroid medication it in the first place!

My heart rhythm is back to normal and I don't feel like I'm ready to jump off a cliff!

I won't get back all of the money and time that I lost over this and I swear being over medicated aged me but, it's better late than never to save myself.

The take away here is:  If you know your body and it's telling you that the doctors are not right then listen to yourself.

No doctor will take care of you like you and, get lot's opinions until you get the right answers.

While my heart was being damaged, my "Natural OBGYN" was ranting about how she's opening her seventh natural anti-aging clinic.  I kindly said, maybe you should work on your first one!

I think I will re-think natural aging from now on. What's up with doctors these days?

 You can check it out by clicking this link: http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

title: I love GoodRx.com!! Here's why!
content:
I love GoodRx.com

I love GoodRx.com!! Here's why! If you read this blog, you probably know that I write fifty-percent about health issues and the other half about anti-aging and, aging issues.

I've also written a book about "The secret to getting products and procedures cheap" and in it, I tell you how to get these for less than retail.  In one chapter (the products) I write about how I found Retin-A online at Canadapharmacy.com and, up until yesterday, that was my go-to place to get it.

If you don't know what Retin-A is, I will give you a quick explanation and move on.

"What is Retin-A? Retin-A (tretinoin) is a form of vitamin A that helps the skin renew itself and is used to reduce the appearance of fine wrinkles and mottled skin discoloration, and to make rough facial skin feel smoother." (http://www.drugs.com/retin-a.html)

I couldn't agree more with the statement above as I have been using Retin-A for about twenty years and it has really changed my skin.  That said, you can't get it without a prescription and even worse, most (if not all) insurance plans don't cover it because of its cosmetic use.

So until I found canadapharmacy.com, I was paying retail about $275.00 for a tube of Retin-A that only lasted me about six weeks (if that).

Let's be real here, I'm turning 50 next month, and I've seriously done some sun damage, and I need this stuff everywhere!  I can't be skimping on a product that works because of its price!  With canadapharmacy.com I paid about $95.00, and I was happy.

The downside was that I had to wait a few weeks for them to mail it but, so long as I ordered it before running out of what I had, I was good.  But that's the thing, I didn't always stay on top of it, and I ended up having to pay retail a lot just to use Retin-A consistently.

Now is where GoodRx.com comes in!  I came across their website by accident, and on their website, they have a search bar, and I put the name Retin-A in, and they came back with prices of five or so pharmacy's in my area with competing prices!

I almost fell out of my chair because not only was the price $50.00 at CVS but, the tube size was double!  I thought this was too good to be true.  You know, the old bait and switch thing?

I figured I didn't have anything to lose and I downloaded the coupon on my phone, took my prescription to CVS, they scanned the coupon on my phone and, done!

The pharmacy clerk told me these sweet words "$50.00, and it will be ready in fifteen minutes!"  I stood there like I had won something or that I needed to feel guilty because I was kind of ripping them off somehow.

Dumb way to think right?  Since the drug companies rip-off us consumers but, that is another blog post, and I won't let my ADHD kick in right now!

I couldn't believe it!  I happen to have another prescription for skin bleach (you know to lighten all the sun damage on my legs too!), and the clerk downloaded another coupon for me from GoodRx.com and, the cost was $20.00!  I have been paying 69.00 dollars for the same product!

Long story short ( I know, none of my stories are short), if you have any prescription, covered by insurance or not, run it through GoodRx.com and check out the cash/coupon price of competing pharmacies.  You just might be surprised at how much money you will save.

I figure I'm saving a couple of hundred dollars a month to do what I want wi. That's exciting, and for that, this is why I love GoodRx.com. (this is not a sponsored post)

title: There's no place for old people
content:
There's no place for old people

  I've always said, "there's no place for old people."  I'm turning 50 next month and yeah, I know, I was young once.  I have nothing against the younger generation as I see them as being one of the most creative generations there has ever been.

I didn't say the most inventive (but close) however, definitely, the most creative.  To live in a time of such where there are so many creative minds of young people where they create systems and platforms from just pure imagination is a gift that I feel honored to be a part of.

Let's be honest here, my mother is 71 years old and she has no clue about technology, apps or, where the world has the potential to go.

The closest thing she sees outside of her world is the YouTube channel that I set up for her on her living room television.

She's fascinated to see the world through the eyes of others, more specifically, through real life videos and what she has and will, never experience.

The truth is, at her age, YouTube will be the closest that she'll ever get to a world outside of herself.  And with that, I say, have fun mom.. Do what makes you happy while you still can.

Back to my initial topic of "there's no place for old people."  Sorry, my ADHD kicks in quite often!!  Actually, about every five seconds and it's only getting worse as I age.. But it's also my gift as well as my curse.

Okay, now what was I talking about? Oh yeah!

They say the older you get the faster you get older.  I know what this means because the last ten to twenty years have flown by.  Each day flies by in fact, and I watch the clock and instead of when I was younger, wanting the time to go by as fast as possible, I watch the clock as my heart sinks and I fear that another day is about to end. I hate how fast time is going but, I have no control over time. We're all going to get old whether we like it or not.

I'm getting older and if life goes faster now that I'm older then how much longer do I have, I wonder?  Right now I still look reasonably okay and I am able to do anything physically.  The real worry is when, I get to that age where I'm really old and when people look past me.  Like being invisible. Which is not very far away even if I still feel and act like I'm eighteen!

Society loves youth and society rewards youth and, probably like most others, I feel like I didn't appreciate my youth when I had it.  With that said, I like most people, did the best I could with what I had, and for that, I am grateful for who I am today.

If I could sum up what I'm trying to say here is just read the lyrics the Baz Luhrmann, Wear Sunscreen song below.

"Enjoy the power and beauty of your youth Oh, never mind You will not understand the power and beauty of your youth until they have faded But trust me, in 20 years you’ll look back at photos of yourself And recall in a way you can’t grasp now How much possibility lay before you And how fabulous you really looked"

"Don’t worry about the future Or worry But know that worrying is as effective as trying to solve an algebra equation by chewing bubblegum The real troubles in your life are apt to be things that never crossed your worried mind The kind that blindside you at 4 PM on some idle Tuesday Do one thing everyday that scares you."

"Don’t be reckless with other people’s hearts Don’t put up with people who are reckless with yours."

"Don’t waste your time on jealousy Sometimes you’re ahead, sometimes you’re behind The race is long And in the end, it’s only with yourself."

"Remember the compliments you receive, forget the insults. If you succeed in doing this, tell me how."

I don't know about you but, I think those are some pretty powerful lyrics and you pretty much have to be older to appreciate them.

I feel like I have some time to do the things that I want and to love the people who are in my life and, who I know  will naturally leave me sooner than I hope.

Maybe that's the key to getting old.  We become fulfilled with the love that we give and the things we did while we are here.  Once you can or have done this, you can begin to step back and let others have the space that you once had.

Maybe its not looking at others like they're taking your space at all but, it's just the natural form of energy that we as old people have to transfer so that energy can re-circulate so that, the younger generation can have it to use.

Whatever the rest of my days will bring me and no matter how fast they come, I will remember that,  I got to live an incredible life because it was my life.

Even if didn't create some huge powerful company, an app that changed the world or, I wasn't the most beautiful woman in the world, I had the opportunity to grow old and for some, they don't even get that chance.

All that will matter in the space and time I have left is that I was born, born free, I created some beautiful kids and I was nice, giving, loving and compassionate towards others.

I guess the whole point to this blog post is not so much about "there's no place for old people" but about "reflection is the greatest gift an old person can give themself."

Here's to our place :)

*Since writing this post, my mom passed away.. Rest in peace you are free now I will see you in heaven mom 😇

title: Goodbye Moma you're free now..
content:
Goodbye Moma you're free now..

    Goodbye Momma you're free now..  On December 20, 2015, at one in the morning, I heard the sound of my phone buzzing in my purse next to my bed.  Now, I always turn off my phone because I don't sleep too well and if my phone is on, I will surely look at social media all night, which in turn, keeps me awake.

On this night, I didn't turn my phone off and unfortunately, as everyone knows, when your phone rings in the middle of the night, the news is probably not good.

I looked down at my purse, I saw the light flickering and thought it's bad news so why answer it?  Couldn't the bad news wait until the morning when I could handle bad news better?  But then, I realized how selfish that would be if I did wait and how unfair it would be for the person on the other side making the call.

I got out of bed, got my phone and went into the living room.  It was my brother, and in a sad and raspy voice he told me that our mother had passed away on her living room couch all alone.

Earlier in the day, he and our mother had gotten into an argument (which was happening more often between them) and that he had storm out the door.  When he returned that night, he saw her laying on the couch but the weird thing was that, she was laying in the same position for seven hours.  He said when he saw her he knew that she had passed away.

I told him to call 911 and go outside and that I would come over.  I sat silently in my living room for two hours just wondering if I really wanted to rush over to my mothers house and see her dead on her couch.  I just didn't think I could handle seeing her laying there and I certainly didn't want that to be my last memory.

But, something came over me and I took a shower, got ready and made the forty-five minute drive to her house.

I drove up and saw the police outside as the EMS had already left.  I knew there was only one person we were waiting for and that was the coroner.  As I got out of my car and talked to the police, I watched my brother pacing on the front lawn.  I hugged him and he said, "Terry, if you want to see her, you can look through the living room windows and see her laying on the couch."

His words felt like a knife piercing my heart.  Did I really want to see her or did I want to remember the last time I saw her?  I didn't want to remember so much the last time I saw her because it was the Thursday before and it didn't go so well.

I went to her house to visit and she looked horrible.  Her clothes looked ratty, she smelled like cigarettes and she only weighed about seventy-five pounds. She just looked awful and I wasn't going to have it!

I grabbed my moms arm and told her to sit down.  I scolded her about her appearance and begged her to tell me what was going on with her.  She assured me that she didn't know why she was losing so much weight and that she was eating but she just didn't feel well.

I told her that if she didn't start eating and taking care of herself that I would call a Social Worker and have them come over and do whatever was necessary to find out what was really going on with her.  I gave her some new clothes and I told her that she should put on some makeup, fresh clothes and start taking care of herself.  I told her that the next time I saw her, I didn't want to see her like she was then.

I saw the pain in her eyes and I also knew in my heart that her spirit way dying.  She was dying.  It broke my heart and I just couldn't add to her pain.  After all, I'm the one who has tried to save her for most of her life. My mother eyes told everything and right there they were telling me that she was more like my child.

I said "mom, I'm not here to be mean to you.  I just want you to be okay.  I want you to be happy.  I don't like to see you this way."  She said to me that she didn't think I was being mean but that, I loved her and that I cared about her.  That made me happy and we sat and talked for a bit.  Now I wish it had been longer.

Her words comfort me every time I doubt myself and think that I could have done something more to save her.

You know they say you don't know how strong you are until you have to be and man that is so true.  I lost my younger brother two years ago and I think this is when my mom gave up.  In a short time after my brother died, she lost the only man that loved her and my other brother developed a brain tumor.  I think some people are just not as strong as others and in my mothers case, she was probably born a very weak soul.

Not to say that if you lose a child it shouldn't weaken you because I never ever want to find this out and, I could only imagine how much will it takes to pull yourself out of a dark hole and try to move on.

My mother lived in a dark hole and she could never pull herself out.  The good times didn't last for long for her, when they came, she worried about how long they would last.  She never lived in the moment, ever.

Today I picked up my mothers ashes.  They gave me her final belongings which was a cross and a St. Christoper that she wore around her neck to keep her safe and so that God would know that she was afraid of dying.

I thought that picking up her ashes would affect me worse than it did but, it was more of a feeling of peace.  I knew the ashes were not her and that she was now free.

It feels comforting to me knowing how much spiritual pain that my mother was in that now her body is strong, her mind is free and her soul is happy for once.  Although I rarely saw this, I remember her last words were, "and I love you."

Someone asked my if I think it was harder to lose my mother in a sudden passing as compared to losing her to cancer and watching her suffer or die slowly and I told them that, I watched my mom die my whole life.  And, it will always haunt me to know or think that her only daughter couldn't save her from herself.

I don't want to ever minimize the way anyone dies because when you lose someone you love it hurts deep no matter what the circumstance is.  When you watch someone in pain, no matter what kind of pain it's agonizing.  I have learned that it's also a blessing to allow them to be free and to appreciate that they are.

On Christmas Eve, like I had done for so many years before, I picked up my cell phone and dialed her number to tell her Merry Christmas but, as the phone rang, I realized that she was gone and that I would never talk to her again.  I will never see her again and I will never get to hug her frail little body ever again.  I put my phone down and cried in a Walgreen's parking lot.

My mother died of an accidental drug over dose by using Methadone.  I know it wasn't exactly intentional because while saying my final good bye to her on the couch, I noticed that she had her done, she put on makeup and was wearing the new clothes that I bought her.

She listened to me that day when I told her the next time I saw her that I didn't want to see her the way she was and she was all made up.  Maybe she knew where she was going or maybe she wanted to look nice for me, that I'll never know.

My question or wonder is, is it suicide when you don't intend to kill yourself but you use drugs?  I don't know but, if you use drugs to escape then you are already committing spiritual suicide because you don't feel comfortable in your own body and for that, her intentions are what they are.

Rest in peace my sweet dear mother.  I know you tried and I know that you're in heaven and your with your son and, I know most of all that you loved me as best as you could. I'll see you again one day and on that day we won't have to worry about the elephant that was always in the room.  We can celebrate together.

Goodbye Momma you're free now..

*The picture on this blog post is of the time when my mom was happy for a minute.  I took her back to where she grew up.  This is how I will remember her.. I

title: 11 Ways to curb your appetite
content:
11 Ways to curb your appetite!

I like to eat.  I hate being hungry.  I especially hate how my stomach hurts when I'm hungry.  I don't like feeling light-headed either and, I hate looking for healthy food options when I'm starving.

11 Ways to curb your appetite

  1. Be prepared.  Always have a low-calorie meal/snack with you at all times so that as soon as you get that hungry feeling, you can eat!

2.  Eat small meals often.  I try and eat about five to six times a day.

3.  Eat protein and veggies and try and keep it to no more than 300 calories each time.

4.  Sip on hot cups of veggie broth throughout the day.  This warms and soothes the stomach and, provides lots of health benefits.

5.  Drink a couple of dark green veggie smoothies during the day.  Throw a couple of hands full of kale, a hand full of blueberries, some almond milk and, Stevia Sweetener.

This will be about 125 calories or so and you'll get your greens and your fill.  Great for hair, skin, and nails too.  I know because I've seen my hair grow about three inches since doing this for the past nine months!

For even better results, add in some probiotics (open a couple of capsules).  AMAZING!

6.  When dining out.  Don't let the server bring bread or an appetizer and then, eat the meal that you want but, ask for a to-go box right away and box half of your meal.  You can eat the other half later or the next day! Or share an entre.

7.  If you like to eat a lot (like I do) then SPIRALIZE! This is using an attachment to make spaghetti zucchini noodles and then cut up tomatoes, one teaspoon olive oil, salt, pepper, shredded basil and, a tablespoon of Parmesan cheese or a vegan cheese option.

Heat in microwave for about two minutes.  It's lovely and filling and, about 120 calories!

8.  When you do eat a meal, consume lots of veggies.  Eat 80% veggies and then 20% protein.  Others will tell you to probably reverse this, and yes, protein does make you feel fuller. However, I think with regards to health and aging; we need those phytonutrients that plants provide rather than too much protein which is acidic to the body. Plants neutralize our body.

Others will tell you to probably reverse this, and yes, protein does make you feel fuller. However, I think with regards to health and aging; we need those phytonutrients that plants provide rather than too much protein which is acidic to the body. Plants neutralize the acid.

9.  When you want to eat, step back and ask yourself if you are really hungry?  Is it habit, boredom or, are you hungry?  If you're hungry, go then eat!

If you can wait, go and do something for a while and come back to eating.

10.  Always have small GO TO meals in your fridge or freezer, that way you won't stand in the pantry grazing and overeating.

11.  Okay, number eleven is a mini list :)

Hydrate, get enough sleep, drink hot green tea, take in a tablespoon of apple cider vinegar, keep tempting food out of the house, use small plates for your meals.

This isn't a diet of any kind.  Only mindful ways to keep you from overeating, eating when you're not hungry or, binge eating because of boredom.

 TIP:  When you cant control overeating, take a five-minute walk, do a task, or do something for fifteen minutes and the feeling will pass :)

title: Don’t fear menopause
content:
Don't fear menopause

 

I remember going to my yearly OBGYN appointment and sitting across from my doctor.

She had my most recent blood tests laid across her desk, and we were about to go over them.  As we went down the list, she said: "And this one shows that you are in the beginning stages of menopause."

What she said for the next fifteen minutes after that, I do not know.  I was numb.  I could feel my heart sink and I wanted to cry.

I can't possibly be going into menopause.  I was never supposed to get old.  When I was young, I said I never would!  What the hell!

What I was feeling was that I had lost my youth and I was now an old lady.  How did I get here and now what?

First, let me say that I've been incredibly fortunate to get to be old because many never get the opportunity to get old but damn, did it have to come so fast and damn, I better not fall apart!

After leaving my doctor's office, I called everyone that I knew and told them the news "I'm in menopause (like it was some awful diagnosis and my time was ticking away) and it didn't seem to phase anyone.

I got stories back like, "Oh yeah?  I've been for several years now.  Or, welcome to the next part of your life."

I drove home and contemplated what my next step would be (like I had no choices left in life or something).

One month after the blood test report, I went back to my doctor and told her that I was ready to fight!  I wanted to stimulate my ovaries and keep my body as young as possible.

This was when the real trouble began because trying to regulate your hormones is challenging.   I asked for Bio-identical hormones, and then one led to the next and the next, and they just kept coming.

I had long cycles, missed cycles, sleep issues, mood changes and other problems that weren't the nicest, to say the least.

I was 48 years old then.  Now I am going to be 51 next month, and I think I have a handle on menopause and I am accepting of getting old.  In fact, I have a whole new outlook on the next chapter of my life.

Don't fear menopause and here's why

 

     

Back in the day when our mothers went through menopause, they either had to suffer through the symptoms or take synthetic hormones that caused more harm than good.

I remember how miserable my mom was.  Not only the physical symptoms were bad, but back in the day, they didn't have the resources and opportunities that we have today.

Now that I have almost completed my menopause and have my bio-identical hormones stable, I can concentrate on things like living life.

Life is almost better now.  I miss my kids, and I wish that they didn't have to grow up so fast but, they have moved out and my husband and I have the house to ourselves.

It's amazing.  I don't have to clean up, chase after anyone, spend my money or do anything other than what I want to do.

I can often travel, which I do.  I can buy whatever I want for me.  I can do the things that I've put off while raising a family and, life seems much more meaningful at the same time.

Sure, there are tradeoffs like losing my appearance, declining muscle tone, losing memory and, knowing that my health may decline.

However, I always knew that the day would come where I would look into the mirror and see my aging self.  Not that I don't fight it!  I can because I have money now and if I wanted to get some work done, I would.  For now, I will wait.

About losing my once perfectly toned body, well, I work out to keep what I can, and that's all I can do.

I will not let my health decline because I don't have to.  With technology and a clean diet, I can avoid many of the diseases that come along with aging.

There are emotional issues that accompany menopause as I have seen it first hand with women I know and these are depression, anxiety, and a few others.  Not to diminish any of these, however, if you have these issues now, please do something for yourself and seek help.  There are so many treatments that will help you.  There is absolutely no reason to suffer.

I also believe that many of the emotional issues that come with menopause are because we haven't yet accepted that our roles have changed and that we are not needed like we once were by others.

Sometimes we don't let go of the past and then we get stuck in a sort of mourning place.  Although it may not be easy to move on, we have to.  We had to move on from being a baby, a child, a teen and now it's time to move into probably the best part of our lives.  We cannot stop what must be.

The biggest thing that I see that causes emotional and spiritual pain at middle age is when we have nothing going for ourselves.  No hobby, no interests, or anything.  This is the time that we need to find our joy, our voice, our peace for our next chapter.

Now is the time of our lives.  No more menstrual cycles to deal with anymore.  No more raising kids.  No more having to put everyone else ahead of our needs.  IT'S OUR TIME!

Don't fear menopause because I believe this will be the absolute best time of your life if you accept it.

Enjoy because by now you can appreciate how fast time goes by.

title: How to find a good cosmetic surgeon
content:
How to find a good cosmetic surgeon

Finding a good cosmetic surgeon is not as easy as one may think.
Sure you can search the internet and find cosmetic surgeons and, you'll get a long list of doctors but, how do you know if they're any good and, how do you know about their past mistakes?
The truth is, many of the lists that are online are paid ads.  The reviews are usually the good ones, and the good ones are most commonly promoted by yet again, paid ads.
If a doctor has made mistakes and they get a bad review, these reviews are usually pushed so far down that you typically don't see them.
Are there excellent cosmetic surgeons that you can find online?  Of course, there are but, how do you know?
The answer is, you don't know who will be operating on you from an internet search or another type of ad.  So, it's up to you to do enough research to feel as sure as you possibly can before going under the knife.

How to find a good cosmetic surgeon

The best ways to find a good plastic surgeon is:
  • Get a referral from someone that you know who has had good results.
  • Make sure the doctor is board certified.
  • For me, I want someone who has been practicing for at least ten years.  Experience matters.
  • Go for a consultation and trust your gut!
  • Do a Google search and go past the first few pages to look deep.
  • Go to https://www.abplasticsurgery.org/public/verify-certification/ModDefault.aspx?section=SurgeonSearch   to check and see if the doctor that you are considering is board certified and has no complaints or alerts.
  • You can also go here http://www.fsmb.org/policy/contactst to see if the doctor has any licensing complaints
  • Try and pick someone who specializes in the type of procedure that you want.  The face and the body are very different and I think it takes a skilled hand to be able to work on a face.
  • Ask where they perform surgery, and find out that facility’s level of accreditation. Look for AAAASF, AAAHC or JCAHO operating facility certification.
  • "Ask about the anesthetist’s qualifications. For safety, you want either a Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetist (CRNA) or a Board Certified Anesthesiologist administering your anesthesia. (http://www.americanboardcosmeticsurgery.org/patient-resources/choosing-a-cosmetic-surgeon
  • I always check to see how friendly and how happy the staff are.  If they are not happy then, to me, it raises questions in my mind.
  • Never get cosmetic surgery based on the price.  Procedures are different but the knife is a whole other story.
  The key to getting good results after you have researched your doctor is to be in good health, expect realistic results and, to maintain the results afterwards. These are only some of the ways to find a good cosmetic surgeon.  Please do your due diligence when it comes to finding a good plastic surgeon.

title: 2019 Cosmetic Surgery Trends
content:
2019 cosmetic surgery trends

It was common to see people who had telltale signs of looking like they were plastic, overfilled, overinflated with big lips, big cheeks, and, a super tight forehead.  But,  that was then and it's 2019 now!

2019 Cosmetic Surgery Trends

There is a new shift in cosmetic surgery trends in 2019!

In the past, people were unrecognizable now it's more of not looking different but looking better.

The trend for 2018 cosmetic surgery is to look better and more refreshed.  More yourself, just a better version.

In the past, it used to be the bigger the breasts were the better.

Now, it's more of a soft look and natural look.   It’s about not looking plastic and not looking fake.

The trend is also about balancing out your features. Before if you got your nose done, it was the smaller the better.  

Now, if you get your nose done it’s not done too small and sometimes you may need to get your chin done to give the face more balance.

Or, if you get your breasts done, you may get some liposuction around the breast areas, etc. to give a more balanced look rather than a doctor just inserting big round implants.

If you get your brows lifted, you might want to get your eyes done to give an overall softer look.

If you get a facelift, you may add a neck lift as a lifted face accentuates a sagging neck.

Fillers are to add volume to our face as we age and to accentuate our lips and cheeks but not too much at one time.

Too much at one time can make you look over-injected and like you have a ton of products in your face. We have probably all seen this or have been guilty of it.  Believe me, more is not better and it will only make you look older!

If your face is sagging no filler will lift it up.  You will need a facelift.

The 2019 cosmetic surgery trend is looking like you got nothing done at all

 

Don’t do too much at once it's best to do your injections by splitting them up so you will have multiple visits so, you don't look like you're overfilled and then get re-evaluated.   Add to it as needed so you don't look artificial, plastic or ridiculous.

Believe me, people will notice that you filled your face up with a bunch of stuff and you don't look right and, it will be uncharacteristic of your looks. A big sign that you've had work done!

The biggest thing that you can do to look younger after taking care of your skin and working on the texture is adding volume to your face but, do it in increments as our face ages the volume disappears and as it disappears you add a little volume at a time.

Subtle enhancements are the key and any good doctor will tell you that

title: Side effects of facial fillers or the "Liquid Facelift"
content:
Side effects of facial fillers or the "Liquid Facelift"

  One of the signs of aging is a loss of volume.  Many women get facial fillers to replace lost volume. Whether it's to rejuvenate the cheek area to add volume and lift the cheeks or to add volume to hollow areas like under the eyes or plump up the lips, eventually the filler dissipates leaving behind loose and sagging skin.  

"Liquid Facelift"

  The so-called "Liquid Facelift" has been around for some time now.  It's an option for those of us who don't want downtime or invasive procedures and, as a fast remedy to regain a more youthful appearance. While these fillers look good initially if, they are not overdone, over time, there are side effects that we can't fully appreciate at the time that we are excited to make a change to our appearance when aging. We might then ask ourselves if once getting fillers, will fillers be a constant need to overcome sagging of the skin?  Because fillers certainly don't correct sagging skin.  Only a facelift can do that. Is our skin going to sag anyway?  The answer is yes! Gravity will take over no matter if we get fillers of not.  

 Side effects of facial fillers or the

"Liquid Facelift"

  The question is, do fillers increase the time that our skin will sag before it was supposed to by stretching out the skin to make it look fuller? The previous question is a catch-22 because, if we are getting fillers in the first place, then we are already having issues with the way that we perceive how we look and the gamble to stretch out our skin later is an even exchange for what we want at that moment. It's kind of like getting a tan.  You know later you might pay for it but, at the moment it looks good now. I think the question becomes or the answer is if we "need" fillers (not before we do) then it's going to be a delicate balance between not over doing fillers and maintaining healthy skin moreover, a natural look. Then there is the other side effect or the mental side effect of fillers, and that is what I call "filler regret." It's when you get filler for the first time, and you get just the right amount, and you look pretty good and then you do more and more because of the way you looked or felt the first time that you got it.  Naturally, many of us think that more is better. I don't know if it's because when you get your first filler you are the youngest, you'll ever be and as you get more filler to try and reduce the signs of aging, you convince yourself or your injector that you need more.

We are going to age no matter what.  Just ask the people with all the money in the world!

  No filler will ever stop the aging process and with that process, filler or no filler, gravity is going to take over, and you will look older and sometimes when getting older, the filler can make you look even older and sometimes, even, I hate to say this but, a little hideous. I won't say her name but she is an actress, and she did an interview in a magazine about how she regretted doing fillers and over time how they not only made her look older but made her depressed about how she looked. The magazine showed before and after pictures and just as I stated already; initially, she got fillers in her early 40's and kept going into her early 50's (she's 56 now) and fillers could no longer keep up with gravity. Her face kept getting bigger and puffy and she no longer had any of the facial features that she once had. On a positive note, getting a little bit of filler to balance out your face when there is lost volume can be a good thing.  Just be realistic and do it sparingly because it won't take the place of a good cosmetic surgeon or being okay with aging itself.  

Just a quick note.  I am putting my affiliate links to two products that I swear by below.  Vitamin C & E Serum is fantastic for smoothing out and evening out your skin and, TNS Recovery Complex is amazing in that it has the most growth factors that help me with skin texture and wrinkles!

  1.  Vitamin C + E Serum   (http://amzn.to/2nLH9fh)  
  2.  TNS Recovery Complex   (http://amzn.to/2oKKTLR)

title: "From now until dead.  How do you want to live?"
content:
"From now until dead.  How do you want to live?"

  Sometimes while flipping through the radio stations in my car, I find Dr. Laura.  If you don't know who she is, this is what Wikipedia.com says: Laura Catherine Schlessinger (born January 16, 1947) is an American talk radio host, socially conservativecommentator and author. Her radio program consists mainly of her responses to callers' requests for personal advice and has occasionally featured her short monologues on social and political topics. Her website says that her show "preaches, teaches, and nags about morals, values, and ethics.Many" I listen to her about once or twice a week.  While I don't always agree with her, I found one statement she said that hit home for me, and it goes something like this:

"From now until dead, how do you want to live?"

  Although it may seem like a simple statement, it is not.  When I think about that phrase, it pretty much puts things into perspective. It sums up how we should be living our lives. For all of the times that I have been indecisive in wondering if I have made or will make the right or wrong decisions, all I ever needed to do was to answer that question. "From now until dead. How do you want to live" tells us that we shouldn't live our lives for other Many of us do. There is not a whole lot of time and, we don't know how much time we have left. The people that are gone didn't wake up and think that that today was their last day. I have struggled when deciding to stay in a relationship or leave a job because I worried about what others might think or that I might hurt someone by doing what was right for me. Now that I think about it, that was pretty dumb of me to care. When in reality other people didn't care what I did nor do other people think about anything other than their own lives.

I gave more credit to others than I did to myself.

  Let me share with you some words of wisdom and that is if you are looking to go into therapy because you can't seem to find your place in life well then, ask yourself this question "From now until dead. How do you want to live?", And then don't just let the question become a fleeting thought but ponder it and contemplate the answer like maybe you've never done before.  Doing this will save you a lot of time and money if you are true to yourself.  

"From now until dead.  How do you want to live?"

  If you are struggling to live the rest of your years the way that you want and are worried that you will have to make some serious life changes, then, let me remind you about how fast life goes by, and in no time you may regret the things that you didn't do. If you don't believe me, then go and find that old box of photos that you have tucked away (assuming you're not twenty years old and they're all on Facebook) and start looking through them and you will be reminded how fast the years flew by. You will also be reminded that you weren't as fat as you thought you were and, you were more beautiful than you could have imagined (okay, I threw that one in there :)) You probably still have some good years left.  The kind of years that you must live because, well, if you've lived some time on this planet, you like me, have probably lost many of those that you loved. One day they were here and the next they were gone too soon. So I've got to ask you one more time.

"From now until dead.  How do you want to live?"

 

Before you go, I created “The 7 Steps to Rejuvenate and Renewal.” In just seven

steps you can feel amazing without depriving yourself!  Click the link below:

THE REJUVENATION AND RENEWAL PLAN

title: HOW TO LIVE A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE
content:
HOW TO LIVE A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE

  Even if you haven't been living the healthiest way, it's never too late to start. For me, I tend to live by the 80/20 rule of eighty percent of the time living as healthy as I can and the other twenty percent in doing whatever the heck I feel like. Life is meant to be enjoyed and living a rigid lifestyle is not a fun way to live, if, you ask me.  

How to live a healthy lifestyle

 

Here are the basics of living a healthy lifestyle:

 
  • If you smoke, STOP!
  • Exercise and get some physical activity every day.
  • See a  doctor every year.
  • Get enough sleep
  • Find something that you love to do and do it.  A hobby, cooking, writing, whatever, just do it for the joy and yourself.
  • Eat a healthy diet with less fat, fewer animal products, and more organic fruits and veggies.
  • Drink lots of clean water.
  • Supplement.
  • Use lots' of herbs instead of salt and seasonings.
  • Reflect, meditate, or do yoga daily.
  • Reduce stress and tension as much as possible.
  • Find your joy.
  Smoking will kill you if you do it.  I'm sure if you do smoke you already know this as I know it can be difficult to stop, but it is going to kill you sooner than later. The importance of regular exercise is that it's a key factor in overall health.  We all know this, yet many of us only get a fraction of the physical activity that we need. Not only does exercise help with stress and better cardiovascular health, but it also enhances the transport pf oxygen and nutrients into our cells.

The benefits of exercise 

 
  • Increases muscle strength
  • increases flexibility and stamina
  • Creates stronger bones
  • Lowers resting heart rate
  • Strengthens heart function
  • Lower blood pressure
  • Improves oxygen delivery
  • Enlarges the arteries to the heart
  • Increases blood supply to muscles
  • Reduces heart disease risk
  • Lowers our bad cholesterol
  • Raises our good cholesterol
  • Prevents osteoporosis
  • Improves our immune system
  • Increased endurance
  • Promotes lean body mass and burns fat
Exercise also provides a natural release for tension, anxiety, and stress.  This, in turn, improves our mental outlook and helps relieve some types of depression.

Why you should see a doctor every year

 
  • To establish any health risks that you may have.
  • To keep your body in check so that you can monitor any changes.
  • To maintain good mental health.
  • To combat sleep issues.
  • Prevention because prevention is better than a cure.
  • Routine screenings.
  • Keep your health care costs down.
  • Peace of mind.
 

Why you should get enough sleep

  Sleeps value to our health and proper functioning is without question vital to our entire wellbeing.  Many health conditions like depression, chronic fatigue syndrome and other diseases are related to sleep deprivation. How much sleep do you need? Each person requires sleep at different levels.  I have to have about eight to nine to feel my best.  I am envious of people who say that they only need four or five hours of sleep per night.  Wow, I could get a lot more done if I only needed four or five.  Sorry, I'm digressing but, still, it's a fantasy of mine not to need to sleep so much. Back to our point.  As we age our sleep needs,loose tend to decline and with that, so does their ability to stay asleep. This is because we have a decrease in brain chemicals such as serotonin and melatonin levels.  

Find something you love to do

    I'm sure that I don't have to tell you that when you are doing something that you enjoy, this is when you are the most content and happy. Being happy by finding a hobby or something that you enjoy regularly doing benefits as follows:
  • Happiness protects your heart.
  • Your immune system.
  • Combats stress.
  • Improves mood and depression
  • Happy people have fewer aches and pains.
  • Combats disease.
  • Lengthens our lives.
One quick suggestion.  Don't turn the thing that you love to do into a business or job because many become unhappy when the thing that they love becomes a machine that they are no longer in control of.

Eat a good diet and drink clean water

 

It has been established that certain dietary practices can cause or prevent disease.  The following are ways to have a health-promoting diet:

 
  • Eat a plant based diet.  Primarily vegetarian.  If you can't then limit meat of any kind (that includes fish) to two to three times a week.
  • Reduce fat intake.
  • Eliminate sugar.
  • Reduce exposure to pesticides and herbicides.  Eat organic.
  • Eliminate additives like food coloring, etc.
  • Eat whole foods and stay clear of packaged foods.
  • Lower salt intake.
  • Drink 32 to 48 ounces of filtered water per day (or more).
  • Identify if you have food allergies and steer clear of them.
  • Stay withing a daily calorie intake to maintain ideal body weight.
 

Supplementing

I supplement every day with supplements such as vitamin D, vitamin C, fish oil, vitamin B and, about five or six others.  I get my levels checked once a year, so I know where I stand with regards if what I'm doing is working or just a waste of money. I feel better while supplementing because when I miss a day or two, I notice a difference.

Here is what the FDA says about supplements:

 

What are dietary supplements?

"Dietary supplements include such ingredients as vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, and enzymes. Dietary supplements are marketed in forms such as tablets, capsules, soft gels, gel caps, powders, and liquids." source: http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm109760.htm

What are the benefits of nutritional supplements?

"Some supplements can help assure that you get enough of the vital substances the body needs to function; others may help reduce the risk of disease. But supplements should not replace complete meals which are necessary for a healthful diet – so, be sure you eat a variety of foods as well." http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm109760.htm Unlike drugs, supplements are not intended to treat, diagnose, prevent, or cure diseases. That means supplements should not make claims, such as “reduces pain” or “treats heart disease.” Claims like these can only legitimately be done for drugs, not dietary supplements." How to take supplements

Are there any risks in taking supplements?

"Yes. Many supplements contain active ingredients that have strong biological effects in the body. This could make them unsafe in some situations and hurt or complicate your health. For example, the following actions could lead to harmful – even life-threatening – consequences."
  • Combining supplements
  • Using supplements with medicines (whether prescription or over-the-counter)
  • Substituting supplements for prescription medicines
  • Taking too much of some supplements, such as vitamin A, vitamin D, or iron Some supplements can also have unwanted effects before, during, and after surgery. So, be sure to inform your healthcare provider, including your pharmacist about any supplements you are taking.
  • source:  http://www.fda.gov/Food/ResourcesForYou/Consumers/ucm109760.htm
Deciding to take supplements is a personal thing and one that should be decided along with your doctor as some supplements interact with certain drugs.  

The importance of Reflection, meditation and, Joy

 

  Taking time out of your day either in the morning fresh or anytime that you can to reflect and pause is beneficial to our health

Physical Benefits of Meditation

With meditation, the physiology undergoes a change and every cell in the body. i

On a physical level, meditation:
  • Lowers high blood pressure
  • Lowers the levels of blood lactate, reducing anxiety attacks
  • Decreases tension-related pain, such as tension headaches, ulcers, insomnia, muscle and joint problems
  • Increases serotonin production that improves mood and behavior
  • Improves the immune system
  • Increases the energy level, as you gain an inner source of energy
source:  http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/meditation/meditation-for-you/benefits-of-meditation

Mental Benefits of Meditation

"Meditation brings the brainwave pattern into a relaxed state that promotes healing. The mind becomes fresh, delicate and beautiful. With regular practice of meditation:

  • Anxiety decreases
  • Emotional stability improves
  • Creativity increases
  • Happiness increases
  • Intuition develops
  • Gain clarity and peace of mind
  • Problems become smaller
  • Meditation sharpens the mind by increasing focus and expands through relaxation
  • A sharp mind without expansion causes tension, anger, and frustration
  • An expanded consciousness without sharpness can lead to lack of action/progress
  • The balance of a sharp mind and an expanded consciousness brings perfection

Meditation makes you aware - that your mental attitude determines your happiness."

 http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/meditation/meditation-for-you/benefits-of-meditation

Other Benefits of Meditation

Emotional steadiness and harmony

It cleanses and nourishes you from within and calms you, whenever you feel overwhelmed, unstable, or emotionally shut down.

Meditation brings harmony in creation

When you meditate, you are in the space of vastness, calmness, and joy and this is what you emit into the environment, bringing harmony to the Creation/planet.

Personal Transformation

Meditation can bring about a real personal transformation. As you learn more about yourself, you’ll naturally start discovering more about yourself source:  http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/meditation/meditation-for-you/benefits-of-meditation

title: "4 Step Blueprint On How To Look Good For Your Age."
content:
" 4 STEP BLUEPRINT ON HOW TO  LOOK GOOD FOR YOUR AGE."

Here's the "4 Step Blueprint On How To Look Good for your age."

 

The chances are that if you're reading this post, you probably have some wrinkles or have done some damage to your skin. Particularly for those of us with sun damage.

The following four steps will show you exactly what you'll need to do to repair your skin and moreover, create new and fabulous skin for years to come; that will have you looking years younger in no time. If you are a young person and you only want to keep your skin looking young and vibrant than this information is definitely for you too!  In fact, you should begin an anti-aging regimen in your early twenties.

Last note.  I am assuming that you already know how to clean your face to remove daily pollution and grime that contributes to aging skin so, I won't go into it now.

Always start with a clean face, neck, and chest.

Again, assuming that you have wrinkles or sun damage and that some or all of your skin on your face, neck, and chest needs attention.  The following steps are what you'll need to do to have younger, firmer and more youthful skin.

"4 Step Blueprint On

How To Look Good For Your Age."

 

Step #1 - REPAIR PHASE

     

Repair:  There are four phases which mean four products to use in the repair phase.

PRODUCT #1 - Vitamin C-Serum in the morning on your face, neck, and chest and top of hands.  Following the product directions.

PRODUCT #2 - Use an under eye cream.  Use morning and night.  

PRODUCT #3 - Stem Cell Complex on the face, neck, and chest.  Use morning and night.

PRODUCT #4 - A good moisturizer on face, neck, and chest.  Morning and night.

Apply each step as per product instructions and let the product absorb for a few minutes in between.

MISTAKE:  Not letting the products absorb before applying the next one.  Give products about 3 to 5 minutes in between applying.

Don't be afraid to use the necessary amount for best results, however; you don't need to use too much either.  You'll just waste your money.  Correctly applying them will ensure your best results.

 

Step #2 - THE REVERSE  PHASE

    Step #2 is the step where you will create new skin!  It's amazing.  

PRODUCT #1 - Do an at-home skin peel.   Skin peels are super effective with today's technology, and you should start off with a mild peel and COMPLETELY FOLLOW the directions!

As you progress, you can build up your tolerance and go stronger. But PLEASE! FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO THE LETTER.

I do a peel every two weeks and usually on a Sunday.

 

A little secret that I have found and that is if you want firmer and tighter skin for an evening,  more like a temporary benefit for the first eight to ten hours while you're out on the town, do your peel the morning before your event. Then apply moisturizer and BAMM! Your skin will look beautiful.

However, just like Cinderella, the night will come to an end and so will the temporary tightness leading into the next day where you will begin to see flaking, dryness, maybe some cracking (depending how deep and what peel you've used) but, don't let it worry you. Underneath that flaking, etc. is new collagen trying to repair the wound that the peel created by bringing new and fresh skin in its place.

MISTAKE: Never do a peel while you are healing from a previous one as this could damage and scar your skin. I do them twice a month and usually of a Sunday.

AGAIN! PLEASE FOLLOW THE PEEL INSTRUCTIONS AND BUILD AS YOU WATCH HOW YOUR SKIN REACTS.  

I guarantee that if you keep up the consistency, you will have fabulous skin even if it's damaged right now.  You'll see your lines go away, deep wrinkles soften, brown spots disappear and your skin will have a more even and luminescent appearance.

Step #3 - THE CREATE NEW SCAFFOLDING AND COLLAGEN  PHASE

    PRODUCT #1  - Use a retinoid.  Preferably a prescription strength and you'll get the prescription from your local doctor or dermatologist.  This is the best product on the list.  This product will change your skin like nothing else will.  Well except for the step #4 the protect phase.  

Step #4 - THE PROTECT PHASE

      PRODUCT #1 - ALWAYS USE SUNSCREEN.  ESPECIALLY USING THE ABOVE PRODUCTS.   Your skin will be very sensitive to the sun just like a baby's skin is.  This is the goal of your skin to get it back to that smooth, soft and plump skin that it once was. Keep sunscreen it in your car, purse, office, everywhere.  A mineral sunscreen with SPF of 50 is a good one for your face, neck, and chest and hands. When you get into your car, use products like Oil of OlayTM facial moisturizer with at least SPF 30 if not 50 SPF for your hands.   I like this product because it's not greasy and absorbs right in, quickly.  Use anything that you feel you will use consistently.  Nothing gives away our age like the hands and neck. If you don't protect your skin, then everything that you've done up until this point will be wasted and there is no sense in spending money and time on yourself if sunscreen is not a part of the equation. Many of us put a little sunscreen on in the morning or have  SPF 15 in our makeup but, that's honestly not enough. You get more damage from everyday sun exposure over time than you do from sitting in the direct sun now and then. Sunscreen needs to be reapplied as it breaks down after two hours.  We can't just dab sunscreen on in the morning and then forget about it. SOLUTION:  We all know that it's kind of hard to reapply sunscreen on our face while we have makeup on during the day.  So after applying a healthy amount to my face, neck, and chest, I usually carry a dry mist sunscreen and spray it on myself once or twice per day afterward.  Okay at least once :) I keep light cotton wraps, sunglasses, and hats in my car.  I keep Oil Of Olay moisturizer with 50 SPF at all times in my car and every time I get in, and I quickly moisturize my hands, and I keep reapplying too. The wraps don't keep the sun out entirely but, they do help while I am driving.  If you drive a lot like I do, then chances are you probably have some brown spots on your left side. I hope that you do these four steps because I know that if you do, within about thirty days or so, you will see amazing results and over time, it will continue to get better and better.  You'll see :)  

Just a quick note.  I am putting my affiliate links to two products that I swear by below.  Vitamin C & E Serum is fantastic for smoothing out and evening out your skin and, TNS Recovery Complex is amazing in that it has the most growth factors that help me with skin texture and wrinkles!

title: Why do we let ourselves gain weight as we age?
content:
Why do we let ourselves gain weight as we age?

 

Okay, this post is not about hurting anyone's feelings.

However, I would like to share what I have observed, and that is, as we women get older we tend to put on weight.

At first, it may be a few pounds every couple of years and then about ten pounds per decade!

Before we know it, we are overweight and don't realize how we got there.

Don't get me wrong; I too have gained my share of weight especially in the last eight to ten years.

Sure, I can chalk it up to getting older or that my hormones are out of wack but, I am putting more food into my mouth and not moving like I once did, and this is the real reason that I am gaining weight.

I also drink a lot of wine as I have gotten older and I know that alcohol has a lot of empty calories and, stopping drinking would not only help me to lose weight but improve my overall health.

I also eat a lot when I'm bored or stressed.  I reach for food to keep my hands busy while I'm trying to figure out the task at hand and even worse, I eat just out of habit and when I'm not even hungry.

I've tried using the excuse of "I don't eat that much, why am I gaining weight?" but in reality, drop me on an island alone, and the weight would melt off like butter!

But that's just the thing here.  Food is comforting.  I love carbs just as much as the next woman.

Being that I am a social observer by nature (not to confuse a social judge because I don't think they are even remotely the same). I like to ask questions to perfect strangers, and I like to observe people so that I can figure out issues and then write about their pain points.

I have noticed that a lot of us use food as a comfort mechanism.  Some of my friends are in denial, and some say that they don't care, but in the end, food seems to be an issue that if we don't make peace with, the emotional part of weight gain will only drag us down.

What do I see happening?  Well, besides the health ramifications of being overweight, there is the emotional part too.

Yes, at times I tend to be a bit superficial by talking about things like being overweight; however, I think that for women, it's painful not to fit into the clothes that they once did and to look in the mirror and not like what they see.

I go out with my daughter of twenty-six, and she is small and petite like I once was, and I love the way she looks.  I also ask myself often why I needed to jump four sizes in twenty years too.

My husband says "it's because I'm not twenty and who wants to be?"  Bless his heart he is very supportive.  But for me, I'm bothered by not fitting into my clothes and more so of the thought of moving up a size or two each decade.

I see some of my friends do what I call "the great cover-up."  They wear big oversized shirts that cover themselves so that they don't have to see the weight but, they know it's there because they talk about it and how much they need to lose it.

They use phrases like "when I was younger"  "when I was skinny"  "when I lose this weight."  I can understand their pain.  But, when is the time?

Weight affects our happiness.  If you've gained a lot of weight, you may not want to have sex with your partner.

You may stop doing the social things that you once did when you were younger.

Carrying extra weight is emotionally and spiritually painful, and yet, we get to a place where we don't know how to get back to who we once were.

So we live with it because there is always tomorrow or worse, we have come to think that not being overweight is no longer an option and that, it comes with getting older.

Shame is something that a lot of us women feel when we are overweight.  I'm not saying that we need to be ashamed of ourselves about anything and especially for being overweight.

What I am saying is that many of us who hide our fat feel somewhat ashamed of it.  It's not your fault, and there is no reason to feel ashamed of anything.  When we are ready, we will make a change, but we have to decide to do it too.

 I am writing to those of us who feel unhappy with the way we feel because time went by, life moved on and then one day, we realize that we don't feel as confident and happy as we once were.

Of course we are getting older, and of course, we will put on a little weight because our metabolism is, in fact, slowing down but, we can't use it as an excuse.

 Losing weight is hard, very hard.  Why is it hard?  Because it's about changing our mindset.  Not about spending our lives at the gym or dieting.

Changing your mindset will set your body free.

 

Why do we let ourselves gain weight as we age?

 

Let's take a look at how being overweight and changing our mindset is related.  I already said that I eat when I am bored or stressed and even out of pure habit.

Sure I could become mindful and stop eating when I'm bored, stressed or whatever but, that's not the same as changing my mindset.

What matters here is changing the real issues and not just the symptoms of why I overeat.

For example, you may overeat and when you do your brain rewards you and releases pleasure chemicals ingo to the same way as drugs and alcohol do.

I know when I'm stressego-tofood is potatoes of any kind!  Man does it feel good.

But the truth is, I suffer from anxiety.  It's in my DNA.  I was born anxious. My mom died from it; my brothers have it, and I hate to say that, I have even passed the gene down.

With that, I know why I eat too much and drink too much wine.  The thing is, what I do about it that will ultimately cure my weight issue.

An issue that's not the real problem but only the symptom of my anxiety.

What is it that causes you to overeat or use comfort food as an escape?  If you can take some time to step back to see what the triggers are that make you want to overeat or eat foods that are not healthy, then you can change your mindset.

But, I warn you.  You will have to go deep.  You'll have to admit to yourself that there is something undone, lacking or that possibly you are unhappy about a situation or situations in your life.

Then, you will have to change them, and this is the part that will either keep you overeating or not.  Once you do this, you will never have to talk about weight issues again.

Sure you'll have the few pounds that you'll probably always think that you need to lose but the real weight, the weight that carries all of the pain will be gone.

It won't be easy at first, and you may slip into old habits of saying that it's just your metabolism or getting older and that, you have no control.

But honestly, you do, and you can have a healthy body if you rid yourself of negative mindsets that have become vicious circles in your life.

Why do we let ourselves gain weight as we age?

 

The weight that we carry is not about the food that we eat but instead the emotions that we tie to food.  I know I am not saying anything new here, but when we get this message then we get it!  I mean really.

I used to stand in front of the pantry in sheer boredom grazing at everything that I could take a bite of and before long, I was eating thousands of calories mindlessly.  It kept my mind busy so that I didn't have to do the things that had I needed to get done or so I could escape the things that I could not change in my life.

It kept my mind busy so that I didn't have to do the things that had I needed to get done or so I could escape the things that I could not change in my life.

For me, I finally gave in to my anxiety issue, and I have learned to forgive myself for something that is beyond my control, and I learned to see it as a blessing.  I am a sensitive soul, and I guess that's not so bad.

Each time I feel the sensation of anxiety coming upon me, instead of reaching for something to consume to take away the feeling, I just sit still, breathe deep and then let it pass.  I try to only eat when I am hungry and not when I need to fill my emotions.

Now, I try to only eat when I am hungry and not when I need to fill my emotions.

I wish the same for you :)

steps you can feel amazing without depriving yourself!  Click the link below:

title: THE REJUVENATION AND RENEWAL PLAN
content:
THE REJUVENATION AND RENEWAL PLAN

 

I've been doing rejuvenation programs for a couple of decades now.  I have to say that I don't do the extremes of colon cleanses or drinking juice for seven days straight or any other rigid things. Heck, I wasn't to be happy and not miserable! Frankly, I like eating, and I like having a full life.  Thank you very much.

 I have never been sold on living a rigid life as in detoxing or starving myself. Did you know that you don't even have to detox your body?

However,  allowing our bodies not to have to work so hard by taking a break from meat and chemicals and, finding daily peace to reconnect outside of the busy world that we live in is a whole different thing.  It's called rejuvenation instead of the rigidness of detoxing.

 Honestly, it's pretty easy to rejuvenate and what I have found through my research is that we don't need to detox so much as we need to steer clear of daily things that harm our body, mind, and soul.

 

HOW TO REJUVENATE

 

Truth be known, if we have to make ourselves detox, then we probably shouldn't be doing what needs to be detoxed in the first place.  This is the part of detox that I believe in.

Don't worry; I'm not going to go into how you should take a holistic journey so that I can convince you to cross over into the world of meditation, yoga, and veganism.  Although if you do this or learn to, it's a pretty amazing feeling.

I believe that there are many ways to a path of contentment and mine is writing, contemplating and cooking.  Just like there are many different religions, one way doesn't fit everyone and for that, finding what makes your spirit connected is your meditation and yoga.

Your body doesn't need for you to do anything drastic to keep it running smoothly.  The idea of drinking a tonic of green veggies and then washing away all of the bad that we have done to it is only a myth.

Just a made up term used by marketers so that they can scare you and then sell you the "detox cure."  It's not true.  There is no such cure because you don't need it.

Let me clarify something while I'm on the subject.  There are detox programs that are beneficial, and that is for alcohol, smoking, and drugs.  But, for now, we are merely talking about our everyday lives of overeating, over consuming and overusing chemicals.

If your body is healthy, you already have the perfect detoxification systems, and that is your liver and kidneys.  Our body is so remarkable at healing itself that it does this even in the worst conditions, even when we inflict bad daily habits.

So rather than try and convince you that you need to take drastic measures to detoxify your body, I'm going to state the fact that our bodies already do this and us going to the extremes of punishing ourselves to feel psychologically better about doing so, is not the answer.

I'm going to propose a different scenario, and that is rather than "detox" one should "rejuvenate."

You might be asking yourself what is the difference between detox and rejuvenation?

They sound like the same thing right?

The answer is that detox is an extreme measure that has no validation other than in the marketing and the entrepreneurial world.

But, let's be real here.  Rejuvenation is about a lifestyle.  A way to reverse disease, turn back the clock, feel more energetic and extend your lifespan.

Rejuvenation is the ultimate detox because it is living a life of rejuvenation and that is healthy living, living in moderation and exercising.  Of course, this means not smoking, not over drinking and eating a healthy diet.

The Mediterranean diet comes to mind which is characterized especially by high consumption of vegetables and olive oil and moderate consumption of protein.

A Vegetarian or Vegan diet is also fantastic.  ( I know that I said I wasn't trying to get you to become for a Vegan, but it's a good plan if you wanted to.  Just saying :) )

For myself, I eat a vegan diet of 60% vegetables, 20% protein and about 20% healthy carbohydrates at most meals and a snack of nuts or smoothies in between.

 I get off track from time to time, but when I do, I enjoy it and then get right back to my healthy eating.

I feel great, and that's all that matters.  If you eat a healthy diet, you will feel great, and if you feel great then, you're doing something right. Right?

So now we know that our bodies don't need detox programs because we already have a super efficient detox system which is or liver and kidneys.

For example, when we drink alcohol, our liver breaks it down in a two-step process, and then our kidneys wash it away.  Did you know that broccoli and other greens, even brown rice produce cyanide?  Our liver takes care of these too.

Now let's move on to Rejuvenation and what it is.  

THE REJUVENATION AND RENEWAL PLAN

Rejuvenation is the same as renewal.  It's different from detox in that it's not about deprivation but more about eating healthy, supplementing, exercising regularly, minimizing stress and, avoiding exposure to toxins that will hurt you.

Very few of us reach our potential and maximum lifespan.  Instead, we die too soon because of disease caused by free radical damage.

We will start with the American diet which is high fat and processed foods, full of preservatives and, full of chemicals. This is the start of the free radical damage.  A diet like this is a free radical overload.

Examples of these foods would be meat, butter, white flour, alcohol, sugar.

The foundation for Rejuvenation and promoting longevity is:

 

Maximize antioxidant intake with food and supplements.  Minimize what causes free radicals.

Here are the basics that will help you minimize free radicals:

 
  • Eat organic.
  • Drink purified water.
  • Avoid chemicals including hairspray, perfume, glue, paint, smoke and any chemicals you can.  I know, we live in real life, and we can't get away from them.  But really, you can if you are mindful of them in the first place.
  • Avoid pollutants.
  • Only get X-Rays when necessary.
  • Only take medications when necessary (always check with your doctor and don't stop any meds. before doing so).
  • Avoid animal products.
  • Supplement
 

Take this quote my Thomas Edison "The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest his patients in the care of the human frame, in diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease."

That's the thing about rejuvenation.  Once you get started, you won't have to worry one bit about your body because your body will do what it is naturally programmed to do and that is to detox and heal itself.

Of course, I know that we will get older and we will die.  I know, no one is getting out of here alive.  However, just because we get older doesn't mean that we can't feel and look our best even better than we did when were-were much younger.

In closing, we have a choice when it comes to extending our life, and that is we can sabotage it and accelerate the aging and disease process we can swing the pendulum in the direction of everyday choices and lifestyle commitments that give us the ticket to optimal health and maximum longevity.

I have created a 7 Day Quick Start To Rejuvenating Your Body, and you can get it here free. Try it.  It's easy; it works, and it gets on the beginning path to a life of rejuvenation and renewal.

Steps you can feel amazing without depriving yourself!  Click the link below:

THE REJUVENATION AND RENEWAL PLAN
