title: HOW TO BECOME A VEGAN OR VEGETARIAN
content:
HOW TO BECOME A VEGAN OR VEGETARIAN

 

What is your diet?  What do you eat?  Do you eat meat?

If you want to stop eating meat and become a vegetarian or vegan, you have stopped by the right place.

I'll show how to make the switch without feeling that you have lost something but instead that you have gained a whole new lifestyle and one that is healthier and one that will extend your life and how to become a vegan or vegetarian.

First, let me start off by saying that I'm not here to badger you about eating meat or harming animals.

Even though I have been a vegetarian for about twenty-five years and ten of those years a vegan, I believe that we all must make our own choices and to each their own.  However, not eating meat would help the environment and prevent the exploitation of animals and, that in itself is a great thing because, as humans, we have emotional attachments to animals and without a balanced planet, none of us can thrive.

Vegetarianism has gone mainstream.  Its cool to not eat meat.  Some famous vegetarians are Paul McCartney, Tina Turner, Leonardo Da Vinci, Charles Darwin, Albert Einstein, Socrates, Plato and I could go on and on, but you get the point.

HOW TO BECOME A VEGAN OR VEGETARIAN

What it means to be a vegetarian or vegan

 

Let's define what a vegetarian is first.  Vegetarians fall into three categories.

  • Ovo-lactovegetarian
  • Lactovegetarian
  • Vegan

Ovo-lactovegetarians consume eggs and dairy products.  Lactovegetarians eat dairy products but not eggs.  Vegans do not eat any food of animal origin, even dairy products.

Many times, I see people that say they are vegetarian but still eat fish or chicken.  Fish and chicken are both considered meat.

Then there are some that instead of eating meat, they consume a lot of dairy products like cheese and butter,   This kind of diet has way too much saturated fat, and this is bad news for our health.

Honestly, if one were switching to vegetarianism for their health and they ate a diet like this then, it would be far wiser to keep eating lean beef which would decrease the amount of fat and cholesterol, however, keep reading because I don't recommend this either.  Also, remember the environment part and the exploitation of animals I talked about?

"If you wanted to stop eating meat to gain better health then I would suggest that you stop all animal products including dairy."

 

By reading that last sentence, basically did you feel a little uneasy and think to yourself that nothing left to eat?  Or did you think that maybe you could do this and then cheat every once in while by having a nice juicy burger?

What about putting butter on your toast? Or having to go without cheese on your pizza?  These are reasonable thoughts and questions.

Keeping with the idea of becoming a vegetarian or vegan for your health, one could sum up these questions and more by saying that a high fat, fiberless, plant deprived, toxin-laden, animal food diet, not only shortens life but turns our final years into an extremely unpleasant experience.

Instead of enjoying our golden years we spend huge amounts of time and money running from doctor to doctor because of degenerative health problems.

Diseases like high blood pressure, circulatory problems, heart disease, kidney failure, stroke, cancer, diabetes, arthritis, brain disease, and much more.  This lowers our quality of life and  I'm saying this can mostly be avoided by my not eating animal products.

Not to blame anyone but could we say that a lot of disease is self-inflicted?  What if we ate a vegetarian diet, supplemented appropriately  and exercised regularly?  Then most of the suffering that we as humans could be avoided.

What's the first step in changing your way of life by eliminating meat?  I will give you the steps that I took to become a vegetarian and then a vegan.

Vegetarian/Vegan

  1. If you can't stop eating meat all at once, then try eliminating one animal at a time until you get to the no meat part.  This can easily be done within thirty days or so.
  2. Replace meat with plant proteins like beans, tofu, nuts, Quinoa, Lentils, Seitan, Tempeh, Green Peas, nut butters, veggie burgers, protein drinks, and beans and brown rice.  These are only some examples of many.
  3. Start adding more fruits and veggies with your proteins.
  4. Eat more frequently in smaller meals.
  5. When dining out, order off the sides and veggie menu and eat plenty.  You will see that you can eat way more than most and still not gain weight. Use the ratio of example number seven below.
  6. To avoid gaining weight, don't swing to the other side and just eat carbs instead of meat.  Many people go from eating meat to only eating lot's of carbs and this will make you heavy and, it will not be good for your health.
  7. My food plate consists of fifty percent veggies, twenty-five percent good carbs and twenty-five percent protein.
  8. Contrary to what most people think, you do not need a lot of protein and, you will get protein in just about everything you eat so don't worry about the nay sayers that ask "How will you get your protein?"  Honestly, have you ever seen someone walking around with a protein deficiency?  It could happen but it's rare.

NOTE:  If you don't want to eat like a vegan in the eight steps above, you can eat dairy as in a vegetarian.  I did this for a while but honestly, dairy is not so good for us either.  However, I think transitioning from vegetarian first to vegan is the easiest way to go.

Let me say that there are a whole lot of yummy vegetarian and vegan foods to eat.  i practically live in Whole Foods and Pinterest has a ton of tasty dishes that you can save to an idea board.

You can still have Mexican food, Italian food and everything else that you like.  You simply replace the meat with another protein and that's it!  Simple right?

The Pinterest boards that I have save me when I'm eating out and I sometimes don't know what to eat or when, I'm craving something yummy.  I simply scroll down on my phone and find creative meals and deserts to eat.  Also, who carries around or probably even reads cookbooks anymore?

I usually pack snacks like bars and nuts and fruit so I'm not tempted to eat chips or other bad foods when I'm starving and believe me, I'm always eating because, well, I just love to eat.

That's the thing, you can eat a lot being a Vegan.  People always ask me if I have a hollow leg :)  My business partner (who is a 6'2" man who body builds) says that I eat twice as much as him and that he always has to wait for me to finish all of my food when we go out!  You can't do that with other diets.

If you go to Whole Foods and probably in your grocery store, you will see that there are deserts like rice ice-cream, almond ice-cream and so much more.  Spend some time looking at all your options and trust me, there are way more than one can imagine.  Not to mention all of the new Vegan protein options out there.

Don't worry, you won't have to be rigid.  As you go along, your journey will evolve and you will learn so many ways to keep your palate happy.  Everything starts with the first step.

I also recommend that you consume at least one smoothie per day when beginning the transition and keep them up if you enjoy them like I do!

I mix one scoop of vegan protein powder, 1/2 of a banana, almond milk and some ice and this is my post workout recovery smoothie.  Tastes like a milkshake and so good.

For an antioxidant smoothie (which we should all do daily) I simply mix two handfuls of organic kale, 1/2 cup of the almond mile, probiotics, organic blueberries, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, quarter banana, 1/2 of lemon or lime, a little ice and blend!

The above smoothie is amazing and I drink it every morning and in the course of three months, it has reduced my cholesterol and all of my lab tests have improved dramatically.  You can always switch out the fruit for different flavors but always use the kale as your base.

Before I go, I have to mention some amazing things about not eating meat and that is how you will transform.  Your skin will change, you'll have more energy (because you're eating live things not dead things, am I right?) and,  you will have better clarity.  You will also probably lose a lot of fat too.

And did I mention that you just might save the planet?

 

If you would like to find more ways to Rejuvenate.  I have created a six-step course called "The Rejuvenation Program"

 You can check it out by clicking this link: http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

  The Rejuvenation Program

title: Is Stevia safer than other sugar substitutes?
content:
Is Stevia safer than other sugar substitutes?

 

They say don't use artificial sweeteners because they are bad for our health.  They also say not to consume natural sugar because it too is bad for our health.  When it comes to desiring some sweetness in our coffee, tea, cereal or anything else for that matter, is there a safe alternative out there?

I grew up consuming loads of sugar.  My sugar of choice was the drink Coke and well, anything else that I could get my hands on that was sweet.

When I was over at a friends house growing up, they would sometimes have the drink called Tab.  It was sweetened with that pink pack stuff called Sweet N Low.  To me it was pretty good but, to the health industry, it was poison.

As I grew up and started to take better care of my health, I switched from the pink packs to the blue packs of sweeteners called Aspartame.  At the time, it was a safe alternative (so they thought) to the pink packets.

Well, as everyone knows, Aspartame is also not good for our health.  Fast forward to about ten years ago (maybe more, maybe less), the yellow packets came out, and they were called Splenda. Which most of us thought were a safe alternative because Splenda  was "supposed to be made from real sugar."

Is Stevia safer than other sugar substitutes?

I thought for sure that now, I had a safe alternative to sugar and all the other artificial sweeteners out there.  However, check this out:

"Despite its marketing slogan “Made from sugar, so it tastes like sugar,” Splenda (sucralose) is not sugar. It is a chlorinated artificial sweetener in line with aspartame and saccharin, and with detrimental health effects to match."

(http://articles.mercola.com/sites/articles/archive/2009/02/10/new-study-of-splenda-reveals-shocking-information-about-potential-harmful-effects.aspx)

When I found out that there was no alternative sweetener that was safe, I did what most people did; I decided to forgo sweeteners along with real sugar for a long time.

I got used to it, but honestly, I missed a little sweeter in my coffee or tea.  So naturally, when Stevia ( a plant-based sweetener) came on the market, I jumped at the chance to use it.

However, I wasn't going to be fooled by marketing anymore or deceptive advertising that could in the long term, put my health at risk.  I decided to do the research myself to find out how safe Stevia is.

Here is what I found!

"The stevia plant has a long history of use as a sweetener in South America. These new sweeteners—sold under brand names like Truvia and PureVia—include a highly purified extract of stevia called Rebaudioside A (a.k.a. Rebiana or Reb A). Reb A is 200 times sweeter than sugar and does not raise blood sugar."

"Bottom Line: The FDA considers Reb A a safe sugar substitute, but has not approved other forms of stevia. If you want to use stevia, we suggest sticking with Reb A (look for it on the ingredient label)."

http://www.eatingwell.com/nutrition_health/nutrition_news_information/is_stevia_safe

For me, I will be sure of the quality of my Stevia sweetener by growing it outside on my back deck, alongside all of my other herbs.

Yes, you can get this plant, grow it, muddle the small leaves into your drinks, etc. even dry them out and sprinkle them yourself.

For now, I think that Stevia is a safe alternative to sugar but, that's what I thought about all of the others too.

I guess I feel a little better about consuming the Stevia plant because I'm growing it and it's not being processed or manufactured with other chemicals added.

Is Stevia safer than other sugar substitutes?

 If I find out otherwise, I will keep you updated.

 

If you would like to find more ways to Rejuvenate.  I have created a six-step course called "The Rejuvenation Program"

 You can check it out by clicking this link: http://www.therejuvenationprogram.com

The Rejuvenation Program SaveSave

title: How to be happy
content:
How to be happy

   

First let me start off with I'm no Doctor Phil, Life Coach or anything more than just a person who has always had a pretty good life but, felt like there was something missing.

I felt happy most of the time, but real and long-term happiness eluded me. Some may call this depression, but for me, it wasn't.  And, it wasn't that there was always something greater and better that I was chasing either.  I know about watering my grass.

I wasn't looking to escape myself and I certainly never wanted to be anyone but me.  Sure, I could be prettier, smarter and have nicer stuff but really, does any of that make someone happy for very long?

Pretty fades, smarter becomes irrelevant, and you can't take stuff with you.

But, I always had this little hole that I couldn't fill.  I got some therapy; I had my share of boyfriends to fill it and, I've spent my way through pretty good sums of money only to end up right back to where I had always been.  Back to me the person with the hole.

So when I turned fifty this year, life clicked for me.  I finally got it.  I was happy all along but, I was creating my unhappiness from the disappointment that I created about, all of the ways that I thought life should be.

The truth is, life is half chance and half results.

Blame it on the media, magazines, reality shows, friends or whatever but, how to be happy comes back to whether we are comfortable in our skin, at any stage in life.

Some are luckier than others and get this sooner than I did at fifty but, never the less, I got it before it was too late.  Better late than never for sure.

That was it.  I was never comfortable in my skin.  I figured at age fifty; if I weren't comfortable by now, I'd better know how to get that way or find an exit plan because I certainly wasn't going to allow myself to grow old and bitter.

Moreover, I didn't want to walk around thinking a part of me was missing for the next half of my life.

It doesn't matter what age you are, how to be happy is about being comfortable in your skin.  It's not about comparing yourself to anything other than the person that you were yesterday.  Not tomorrow either because, you don't have that day yet and, you may never get it.

Another thing that has changed me is the acceptance that life is beautiful and, it's quick and, those that we love are here one day and gone the next.  Like both my mother and my brother.

Let me say that when you forget that your mom has passed away but, you pick up the phone to call her, and then you realize that she is no longer there, not today, not tomorrow, not ever again, life becomes pretty sobering.

If you are fortunate to have not lost a parent, please, call them every day because, when you do,  you'll feel a kind of pain the hurts beyond what you thought was even possible.

When we realize and contemplate that we too only have a short amount of time, we don't have much time other than to be happy.  It is our duty to ourselves to give ourselves this gift.

This is what most people will remember you for.  Not stuff, not your looks, not how much money you had.  Happiness is your true legacy.

I know that bad things happen in life and, these things will pass.  We will all die and so will the people we love.  We will have financial difficulties, and life will sometimes punch us so hard that it knocks the wind out and sometimes, for longer than we had planned.  But, life goes on with or without us, and that's just how it is.

This is the acceptance part that we must do.

I'm not here to give you a cheesy line about how grateful you should be or that what you have, others would probably wish for.

 I will say that you and I should take some time every day to remember how short life is and, understand that we don't have a lot of time other than to live our lives to the fullest while we are here for the short period that we are.

There is no magic to being happy.  The secret is to accept the beautiful life that God has given, don't over think, add a little gratitude and, keep smiling knowing that you have this day which may be your last.

title: 9 Ways To Not Over Eat
content:
9 Ways To Not Over Eat

 

I'm going to admit it!  I way overeat and then wonder why I feel bad both physically and mentally.

I do good for a while, and then I decide that I want pizza, pasta or fries!  I eat healthy about 80% of the time, and that used to be just fine when I was younger, but now, it's not so good.

I could eat 80% clean and then 20% bad but, it's come down to either my metabolism is slowing down as I've gotten older or, I'm eating way more food than I want to believe.

So, I have decided that I'm not going up a clothing size and, I'm for sure not going to increase my workouts from five days to seven days so, the only thing left to do (other than give in a eat whatever the hell I want) is to stop overeating!

Here are the 9 Ways To Not Over Eat

"that I use When I want to get into shape fast!"

  1. When you wake up if you eat breakfast, package it up and bring it with you to work, school or wherever you go with about 200 calories.
  2. Try and delay eating that breakfast until mid-morning.
  3. Eat a small snack an hour or two later (about 100 calories or less) like yogurt, nuts, a piece of cheese, teaspoon of peanut butter with celery, etc. at lunch.
  4. Eat your lunch later in the day, say around 1:00 or 2:00 pm. and eat a meal that is about 300 calories with protein, carbs, and veggies.
  5. Eat another snack in the afternoon with about 100 calories.
  6. When you get home, before dinner, drink a green smoothie with about 100 to 150 calories.
  7. Eat a small dinner with about 300 calories with protein, carbs, veggies.
  8. Have a small snack no later than an hour before bed about 50 to 100 calories.

This is about 1150 - 1200 calories.  If you stick with this, you won't be hungry, and you will lose weight! Especially if you do a workout or two during the week.

9.  If you go out to eat, go directly to the salad menu and the protein menu.  Order one of each and put the dressing on the side.

Ditch the breading on the protein and the extras on the salad unless they are veggies.

I try and use lemon on my salad, and if I'm feeling deprived, I slightly dip my salad on the fork into the dressing.

These are nine ways no to overeat.  Of course, there will be times and days when you just can't help it but, if you stick to this plan, for the most part, you will get skinny and feel great.

title: Is aspirin a hidden beauty secret?
content:
Is aspirin a hidden beauty secret?

 

Okay, so I decided (which is probably a mistake by not confirming with my doctor first) that I would start taking a baby aspirin each day.  My thinking is that I would take it for the same reasons I used to take fish oil.

Fish oil has a ton of health benefits, and one is that it thins your blood.  Aspirin is made from the bark leaves of a willow tree and has been around for a very long time.

Aspirin has many benefits, and the most powerful medical advantage is its ability to reduce cardiovascular catastrophes such as heart attacks and strokes.

As I said, I started taking a baby aspirin a few weeks ago.  I noticed that the fine lines and wrinkles on my skin (face and body) had diminished and the skin on my face looked relatively younger than it did before.

Before my mother-in-law passed away a couple of years ago, I noticed that she didn't have a wrinkle or a line on her face at seventy-four years old.

I remember asking her about everything that she consumed, did and, what pills she took if any.  She told me she took aspirin every day but, at the time I didn't think anything of it.

Last Friday, I went to dinner with my father-in-law who is eighty-one, and I noticed that he didn't have one line on his face or any wrinkles anywhere.  Not even sagging skin!

I asked him if he spent a lot of time in the sun.  Hoping that he would say no and, that would be the reason he looked so young but, he said he lived in the sun and never wore sunscreen in his life.

Now, living in Texas, we get some serious sun.  In the past, I baked in the California sun then, moved to Texas and, in the Winter I used tanning beds and, in the Summer, I baked on the Texas beach some more!

 

Is aspirin a hidden beauty secret?

 

You can imagine how much I have damaged my skin and at about age 40 or so, it was showing big time!  I turned 50 a couple of months ago, and this is the age where everything you've ever done wrong tends to show up!  Kids if you're listening, wear sunscreen. I should have listened.

So, when my father-in-law said that he too takes aspirin every day, I decided to do some research for myself to see if my skin was changing because of the aspirin?

Here is what I found:

"Inflammation takes its toll on your skin in a variety of ways such as acne, rosacea and visible signs of aging, like wrinkles and sagging skin. Collagen is key to keeping your joints and your skin functioning younger; by boosting your skin structure, collagen helps it to look full, smoother and elastic. When that structure breaks down, your skin starts to sag, wrinkle and look less vibrant. High levels of inflammation also cause a faster rate of collagen breakdown, which accelerates the aging "look."

Source: (http://health.usnews.com/health-news/blogs/eat-run/2013/12/17/take-aspirin-at-night-to-reap-its-health-and-beauty-benefits)

To be honest with you too, my stomach tends to be a little upset lately.  I'm sure it's because of the aspirin. However, those little aches and pains that I used to get are almost nonexistent lately.

I think I will complete a cycle of one month to see how it goes and probably check with my doctor too.

Please don't be like me and begin an aspirin routine without checking with your doctor.  It could be detrimental to your health especially if you're on blood thinners.

Is aspirin a hidden beauty secret? I'll keep you posted :)

Just a quick note.  I am putting my affiliate links to two products that I swear by below.  Vitamin C & E Serum is fantastic for smoothing out and evening out your skin and, TNS Recovery Complex is amazing in that it has the most growth factors that help me with skin texture and wrinkles!

  2.  TNS Recovery Complex   (http://amzn.to/2oKKTLR) 

If you seriously want smoother skin then check out my "Smooth Skin" course where I will show you exactly how I get it.  No needles, fillers or surgeons needed here!

title: Should you take Ginkgo everyday?
content:
Should you take Ginkgo every day?

Research shows that taking Ginkgo can have positive short-term effects on the brain, specifically, memories, mood, and sociability. In a research study, half of a group was given Ginkgo, and the other half were given a placebo. The group that took the Ginkgo supplement had immediate and significant improvement in short-term memory, compared to the placebo group. Ginkgo is not a stimulant but sharpens memory by improving blood circulation and also, enhances the nerve and cell communications. Some people who take Ginkgo take it before doing projects like writing, reading or other tasks that require sharp mental clarity.  It's almost like a brain boost. Those who take exams may want to take a dose of Ginkgo beforehand. Studies have also shown that Ginkgo helps with the delay of Alzheimer's by slowing down the age-related effects of the disease. For those of us who are over forty, Ginkgo may play an important part in the age-related disease.  It may help with vision related disease and hearing loss. The herb also helps with boosting blood flow to tiny vessels that feed our eyes and ears.  Ginkgo may even go so far as protecting our eyesight from such diseases like diabetic retinopathy, cataracts, and macular degeneration. For our ears, it may help with tinnitus, vertigo, dizziness, and other equilibrium problems. Ginkgo shows to help with circulation problems for example, it can ease problems such as peripheral arterial insufficiency which is basically, poor circulation. An alternative to taking drugs, men can use Ginkgo for impotence caused by insufficient blood flow. Ginkgo offers another benefit against heart attack and stroke.  It helps prevent blood clots and sticky platelets.

Should you take Ginkgo everyday?

Millions of people take Ginkgo every day.  In many other countries, there is a standard recommendation that doctors give to their patients. The information given here is not to tell you to take any supplement without talking with your health care provider first.  However, it is clear that Ginkgo has its benefits and perhaps, you should do your own research to see if Ginkgo is right for you. The thing about taking Ginkgo is finding the right one to take.  They're not all the same.  According to Timothy J. Smith, M.D. in his book "Renewal," he suggests to his patients that they take "24 percent standardized extract." Standardized means that basically, it was verified in an approved lab and measured for its effectiveness. As per Dr. Timothy J. Smith, he suggests to stay clear of all non-standardized products because one never knows if they are getting a therapeutic dose or not. To recap here, taking a standardized Ginkgo every day has proven to help with the nervous system, circulatory system, and sensory system. Referenced from: "Renewal" By Timothy J. Smith, M.D.

title: 11 Ways to curb your appetite
content:
11 Ways to curb your appetite!

I like to eat.  I hate being hungry.  I especially hate how my stomach hurts when I'm hungry.  I don't like feeling light headed either and, I absolutely hate looking for healthy food options when I'm starving.

11 Ways to curb your appetite
  1. Be prepared.  Always have a low calorie meal/snack with you at all times so that as soon as you get that hungry feeling, you can eat!

2.  East small meals often.  I try and eat about five to six times a day.

3.  Eat protein and veggies and try and keep it to no more than 300 calories each time.

4.  Sip on hot cups of veggie broth throughout the day.  This warms and soothes the stomach and, provides lot's of healthy benefits.

5.  Drink a couple of dark green veggie smoothies during the day.  Throw a couple of hand fulls of kale, a hand full of blueberries, some almond milk and, Stevia Sweetener.

This will be about 125 calories or so and you'll get your greens and your fill.  Great for hair, skin and nails too.  I know because I've seen my hair grow about three inches since doing this for the past nine months!

For even better results, add in some probiotics (open a couple of capsules).  AMAZING!

6.  When dining out.  Don't let the server bring bread or any appetizer and then, eat the meal that you want but, ask for a to go box right away and box half of your meal.  You can eat the other half later or the next day!

7.  If you have to eat a lot (like I do) then SPIRALIZE! This is using an attachment to make spaghetti zucchini noodles and then cut up a tomatoe, one teaspoon olive oil, salt, pepper, shredded basil and, a tablespoon of Parmesan cheese.

Heat in microwave for about two minutes.  It's lovely and filling and, about 160 calories!

8.  When you do eat a meal, consume lot's of veggies.  I eat 80% veggies and then 20% protein.  Others will tell you to probably reverse this and yes, protein does make you feel fuller however, I think with regards to health and aging, we absolutely need those phytonutrients that plants provide rather than too much protein which is acidic to the body. Plants neutralize our body.

9.  When you want to eat, step back and ask yourself if you are really hungry?  Is it habit, boredom or, are you actually hungry?  If you are, then eat!  If you can wait, go do something for a while and come back to eating.

10.  Always have small GO TO meals in your fridge or freezer to pop in the microwave, that way you won't stand in pantry grazing and over eating.

11.  Okay, number eleven is a mini list :)  Hydrate, get enough sleep, drink hot green tea, take in  tablespoon of apple cider vinegar, keep tempting food out of the house, use small plates for your meals.

This isn't a diet of any kind.  Only mindful ways to keep you from over eating, eating when you're not hungry or, binge eating because of boredom.

What I also do is, when I find myself constantly thinking about eating while at home, I take my keys, jump in my car and go the mall and WALK around.  Of course I always find something that I don't need but, I'm working on that too.

title: Do we create what we fear?
content:
Do we create what we fear?

 

I've read the book "The Secret" and I often follow certain inspirational leaders.  I think that all of the stuff about "if you believe it, it will appear." As in, see the dream house that you want and focus on having it and, it will magically appear one day is probably not going to happen!

We either work hard for it and make it happen or it doesn't.

Sure, I received some of the stuff that I wanted in life but, only after about fifteen years of working my ass off for it!

I have to say that I don't believe in getting what we dream of just by putting our wishes on some dream board and then staring at the picture all day. But, that's just me :)

If this were possible most of us would not only be living in our dream home and driving that awesome sports car but, we would have won the lottery as well.  In fact, I wouldn't even be writing this post because it wouldn't be relevant.

Receiving what we dream of is completely possible but, no one knocks on your door and gives it to you.

Nothing is impossible just the impossibility of getting what we want without the effort.

Now, this brings me to the flip side of this topic.  And that is, do we create what we fear?

For those who believe they can manifest all of the material things that they want through the mind's eye, they may not think that the same thing is possible for the things that they don't wan't.

Creating what we fear is easier because, without realizing it, we put a lot more energy into running from our fears than running after what we want.

The difference is that, what we put into the back of our mind (the fear rather than the desires in the front of our mind) have a funny way of making themselves come true.

It's the constant thinking and awareness of what we are afraid of that we keep tightly suspended at all times keeping ourselves fully aware of the pain that it will cause so, we do everything to avoid what we hold in our mind only to actually, attract that very thing that we fear?

I can't tell you how much I have done this.  With the exception of one or two things, almost everything that I was afraid of has happened to me. Well, it didn't happen by itself, but by me creating what I feared.

For example.  My mother was married many times and me and my brothers all had different fathers that we never met.

When I was younger, I said that I would never be like my mother and when I got married, I would stay with the father of my kids so that they would not only have a stable life with a father that loved them but, they would always have two parents to be there for them (this was my fear).

For the most part, I achieved this however, I held on so tight that I caused a lot more problems by holding onto the fear of not wanting to be like my mother.

There have been many times in my business that my decisions were counter intuitive to what needed to be done because of fear, which lead me into situations where the decision that I made had nothing to do with the business but, by me wanting to avoid what I feared only, to create the exact opposite.

It's like as soon as you decide that you fear something, a universal magnet of some sort begins it's process in your subconscious mind and then, it's only a matter of time before that exact outcome happens.

Through out my mothers life, she worried that she'd end up alone. She was so afraid of it that it paralyzed her ability to have good relationships therefore, creating exactly what she feared.

When a man would come into my mothers life, he was usually a loser which is what she attracted (the fear of being alone) which then, manifested her belief system.

My mother died alone, two months ago of a methadone overdose on her couch.  She created exactly what she feared and the thing is, she felt this way since I was a small child.  She basically manifested and created the way that she would eventually die.

If I have learned one thing about creating what we fear it is to stop thinking about the negative things and, anytime the fear of what might or could happen, replace that thought with a positive one.

Don't tell yourself negative stories and for sure, try not to see a negative story unfold in your mind and, for sure, don't believe the lies that your mind tells you.

These kinds of stories have no place in our lives.  Our lives are not destined to be the story that we create but, only the story that we put into energy.

The difference is, which side will you put your energy into?  The fear or the desire.  Because, this is how either side will happen.

The real key to manifesting the things that you dream about are from letting go and freeing yourself from the things that you are fearful of.

title: Easy 3-Day Detox & Rejuvenation Plan
content:
Easy 3-Day Detox & Rejuvenation Plan

 

Drink

The "Easy 3-day detox & rejuvenation plan" is to eliminate waste from your body a get rid of toxins.  Drink 10 to 12 glasses of purified water per day. This will not only reduce waste but hydrate you as well.

If you hate water, combine lemon and a little plant sweetener called Stevia.  Drink decaf, green tea too.

Be sure not to drink all of your water at once because this can be dangerous.  Drink it during a 24 hour period.

Avoid processed foods

and eat clean

  Try not to eat any processed foods. That means don’t eat any food from your pantry, except certain proteins (see below).

Eat fresh food like vegetables, low glycemic fruits and, nuts.  Try and eat as natural as possible without overcooking.  Like raw, smoothies, salads, or, steamed.

Eliminate the following:  caffeine (or cut in half), sugar, flour and, alcohol.

Eat whole foods.

 Seek out and consume antioxidants

 

Eat bright colored veggies.  They are full of antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals and, your liver loves these because phytochemicals help activate liver enzymes that remove harmful substances from our bodies.

They also help with inflammation ( a significant factor in disease) and nourish your gut.
  1. Limit meat consumption but get protein from other sources like tofu, nuts, beans, Quinoa, seeds, lentils, Tempeh, pea and rice protein, nut milk, chickpeas, etc.

Besides meat having a ton of growth hormones and antibiotics that you don’t need, meat can contribute to, disease and stay undigested in our systems for longer than we need.

You don’t need to stop eating meat if you don’t want to, however, for this 3-day detox and rejuvenation plan, try to let your body rest from having to work too hard.

Try and eat organic

 

It’s unfortunate that to eat healthily we have to pay more for organic but, it’s the way it is and your body has to choose between cleaning off the pesticides or nourishing your body.  When you eat organic, you give your detox system a break, so that it can work on giving your body the nutrients that it needs.

If you can’t afford organic, then wash the heck out of fruits and veggies when you consume the skin.

Eat fermented foods

  Kimchi, miso, sauerkraut, tempeh all offer payoffs because they help your gut fend off bad bacteria and provide good fiber.  Fiber is what we are also going for.  We need to mop up all the bad cholesterol and eliminate waste.

I get mine in the produce aisle where they have the vegetarian cold foods.  You can always get these at Whole Foods too.

The last step in our 3-day detox

and rejuvenation plan is to get it all out! 

 

Being regular is your most important pathway.  Even if you go every day, chances are you could go a little more.

  Extra and undigested food is processed through the intestines, and we don’t seem to get rid of nearly half as much as we take in! Try Smooth Move tea, one tea bag each day of the detox.  The tea is mild and not harsh on your system. If you do these easy steps in just three days, you will feel great and, you may even lose a few pounds.  

As you can see, the “3-day detox and rejuvenation plan” is not hard to do.  Three days will fly by.  YOU CAN DO IT!

  Maybe, you’ll want to continue to eat like this forever?  If not, then try and do this three-day detox and rejuvenation every six weeks. DISCLAIMER:  The tea is an herbal tea.  Check with your doctor to make sure any medications you are taking will not have negative side effects.

title: When he leaves you for a younger woman
content:
When he leaves you for a younger woman

 

Gosh.  I hate to even write about this subject.  Any woman that has been married for a long time has thought about this topic at least once. Or worse, they have lived through this themselves.

I heard someone say "they always go younger" and damn it if it's not true!

Anyways, a sort of friend of mine (we know each other through mutual friends) just went through this experience but, not only did her husband leave her for a younger woman, the woman was someone that they both knew very well.  A double heart stab!!

I heard the news, and I felt really bad for her.  I wondered how I would be able to handle this if it happened to me.  Let's be real here, as I get older; it seems that the woman is getting younger and younger by the minute!

My man gets hit on all the time, and he works with many attractive younger women.  If I didn't have trust and he wasn't the kind of man he is, I'd be a little worried sometimes.

I saw this woman at a wedding recently, and I didn't want to say anything about her situation but, I wanted to let her know that I was there for her if she needed anything.  So I was happy and surprised when she started telling me that she was hanging in there after what happened (she gave me the full story).

Being that I love to write and I love to get real-life stories from people, I asked her how the hell she was getting through her husband coming home one day, packing his stuff and, telling her he was leaving her for this family friend!  I'm pissed just thinking about it now!

Anyways, she said she was taking it day by day and that one day she hoped to be okay and, to actually find a man and get married again. She was married to the other dude for twenty plus years.

After talking with her, I realized or determined that I should have titled this blog post as "how to through when he leaves you for a younger woman" because after talking with her this is the way to do it:

You take it day by day.  You don't take it personally because it's his cowardness, not yours. You don't compare yourself to her; you don't beat yourself up whatsoever, you give time, time, and, you trust and believe that YOU WILL find someone that is a real man that won't leave you for any reason.

title: Anti-aging stem cells and growth factors in skin care
content:
Anti-aging stem cells and growth factors in skin care

 

It's tough fighting the effects of aging.  They say the older you get, the faster you get older.  I know you don't want to hear that.  I sure don't! But it's true.

It's easier to fight the effects of aging on our face than our body because we have different cells that turn over much better above the neck. I'm not going to go into all the layers and cells of the skin because frankly, I'm not a Dermatologist and the point here is to find ways NOW, that work, to anti-age and re-engineer our skin.

Now, I'm not talking about not aging because let's face it; we're not going to get out of here alive!  With that said, I say, why can't we age fantastically too?

I am so fascinated with aging and on how we can reverse, fend off, or just stop using numbers to signify the stage of life that we're at.

There is also the reality of being a woman of a certain age (say 50, or so) that you kind of disappear in society.  People look past us sometimes and honestly, that can cause one a bit of insecurity.  Well at least for me sometimes.

The great thing is that at 50 we start to look inside ourselves and not so much on the outside (too bad society but, regardless of what you see, we see a beautiful person that feels good inside). Hopefully,  you see yourself this way?

Anti-aging stem cells and growth factors in skin care

  Stem cells and growth factors.  These are what I use on my face, neck and chest to prevent and reverse wrinkles. Real quick, I'll give you my ten minute daily regimen and then move on. Mornings:  Vitamin C 25% serum, TNS (growth factors), under eye cream, a good moisturizer, sunscreen, makeup. Night:  TNS, Retin-A, under eye cream, moisturizer.

This has been working wonderfully for the last, I'd say fifteen years.

A lot of people don't know what stem cells are used for in skin care or know what growth factors are so, I'm here to give you what I have learned so that one, you buy products that actually work and two, you don't get scammed by the words "Stem Cells" and "Growth Factors" and then pay way more than you have to.

 

Stem Cells

 

Not all stem cells are equal.  You've probably heard of stem cells in the medical field or a science fiction movie or somewhere.  Maybe you even feel that you're against them because, you don't actually know how they are harvested? A stem cell can actually turn into an organ depending on the signals that it's given. Pretty amazing I think!

Just like inflammation in the body causes diseases like heart disease and cancer, most aging skin is also caused by inflammation.

First, something internal or environmental happens, we get free radicals and then, inflammation sets in and boom! You've got a new wrinkle, sagging skin or whatever.  You wake up, look in the mirror and swear that your face changed over night!

Cytokines are growth factors made from stem cells.  By using these in our skincare, we can create an anti-inflammatory response.

We couldn't just take our own or someone else's stem cells and then throw them into our moisturizer because, they are not stable enough by themselves.  Believe me, I would have already done this if it was possible :)

Let's move on here..

So when companies say they are using stem cells in their products, they mean that "they are usually using ingredients derived from stem cells" (Zoe Diana Draelos, M.D.)

Dr. Diana Draelos, M.D. professor of dermatology, says that stem cells need to be purified and grown in Petri dishes.  They need to be fed a high protein diet with, amino acids and, glucose. (Hmm.. maybe this is the type of skin diet I can research for us all?)

Here's how stem cells get their beauty:

When stem cells are in the Petri dish, they have contact with other stem cells and then start to communicate thus, creating growth factors. These growth factors create signals to cause other cells to change or grow, etc.

The main sources of stem cells are plants, animals and humans.  Long story short (without going into all the scientific part), we don't need to hurt humans or do anything immoral or unethical to get them.

Labs can grow stem cells by bio-engineering them from our own cells, (or from another person), umbilical cords, bone marrow, placentas, and, fat tissue.  Stem cells from fat can be directly used without any modifications. Now how do I get my fat cells out of my body and into my moisturizer?

The problem with buying beauty products that say they have growth factors from stem cells is, efficacy.

When buying skincare products with stem cells, ask the company how they get them. Price doesn't determine quality either.

Of course, we won't grow younger using stem cells but by using them, we have some of the most potent tools to allow our skin to have a new life and with that, less wrinkles and firmer skin.

title: How hormone replacement testing works
content:
How hormone replacement testing works

 

When replacing natural hormones, the most common are estrogen, progesterone, testosterone, thyroid, adrenal, melatonin, DHEA, pregnenolone, and human growth hormones.

To get accurate results from HRT (hormone replacement therapy), it is imperative to find a doctor who is trained for more than relying on just blood tests and symptoms, because without the proper data, hormone replacement therapy can make a situation worse.

Some believe the responsible way of testing one's hormone levels is by using a circadian testing method.  This means that the hormone levels be monitored over a 24 hour period.

This provides a more comprehensive way to represent hormone levels. Our hormone levels change throughout the day, and an easy way to test this is by doing a saliva test which can determine hormonal imbalances.

So, one would give saliva samples at specific times during a 24 hour period.  This has its advantages over giving blood because who would want the pain of needles when they can just give a little saliva?

And, this can be done anywhere at any time.  Saliva can remain stable for up to five days and can be mailed so the patient can perform the samples themselves and then ship them off to the lab.

Moreover, hormone levels are higher when we wake up, so it makes sense to be able to test them at home rather than to travel to a doctors office while hormone levels drop.

The saliva test cost is typically less expensive than blood tests.

Here are some of the reasons that a women's hormones can become unbalanced:

  • Eating food that has hormones added to it.
  • Consuming supplements and herbs that have an estrogenic effect.
  • Birth control or other HRT.
  • Environmental toxins that mimic estrogen (plastics, pesticides).
  • Exposure to radiation.
  • I bet you didn't even think about this one! Chronic constipation.  Estrogen builds up in the colon and then is reabsorbed.
  • Liver toxicity.

Each person's HRT is different because of genetics and lifestyle. It's better to start with a baseline and then continue testing if HRT is started.

Do you want to look and feel younger? Do this and have a life that will keep you happy and healthy for a lot longer than the average woman.

title: Does a mans impotence really matter to a woman?
content:
Does and mans impotence really matter to a woman?

 

Definition of Impotence:  an abnormal physical or psychological state of a male characterized by the inability to engage in sexual intercourse because of failure to have or maintain an erection—called also erectile dysfunction (http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/impotence).

Can a woman be happy with a man, married or not and, love him unconditionally or, is it hard to be without the physical part too?

If there is frustration can that frustration be overlooked by love alone? Or, does love fade and become distant when there is no physical intimacy?

I know these are some deep questions, but really, as our population ages and as we age, if our partner is impotent, will our love still deepen, stay the same or, could there be some bitterness eventually?

While doing research on this topic, I came across many different opinions.  I was surprised to read in many cases that a man's impotence is highly caused, not by his inability to perform but,  for his lack of desire to do so.  Hmmm.? Interesting.

Does that mean as his marriage lives on his desire for his wife wanes? We've all heard the old saying "use it or lose it" right?

It also begs the question then, if another woman would come along that he was attracted to, would his impotence be cured?  Is boredom the problem?

Of course, there are tons of medical reasons why a man is impotent and there is a very strong case for impotency is if a man smokes or had smoked for a long time.  It seems that the blood flow or the NO2 in the blood just can't get it done anymore (I'm no doctor just going on memory of what I have read).

However, my point here isn't to blame anyone for being impotent but rather than, wondering if the sex (I know intimacy is about being close and doesn't have to be about sex) is gone, is the relationship the same?

Are there different degrees of impotency?  For example:

You meet a man that you are super attracted to and you have chemistry and he shows you affection, hell, he makes you feel that you are the most beautiful woman on the face of this earth!

You kiss, you have fun but when it comes to physical intimacy, he can't and he says he's nervous or something.

But, as time goes on, you begin to see that he that he can't perform.

Example number two is you've been with your partner for a long time and through illness, they can no longer perform.

Example number three, you stopped having sex and he can't perform because of it.

When a man is unable to have sex with his partner because of a medical condition (sometimes chronic) it seems that they become distant and maybe, somewhat bitter.

When the tables turn, is a woman more accepting?

title: Candidiasis In Women
content:
Candidiasis in women

 

Candidiasis symptoms can cover a broad spectrum which causes a lot of diseases from allergies, vaginitis, and, thrush (in the mouth or vagina).  Candidiasis can even invade the eyes, liver, heart and nervous system.

Causes of Candidiasis are from things like antibiotics, birth control pills, and estrogen replacement therapy.  It also can be triggered at a young age when kids are first treated with antibiotics.

According  to Leon Chaitow, N.D., D.O., of London, England, “Fully 35% of women using birth control pills have associated cases of acute vaginal candidiasis.”  And, there is yeast overgrowth as immune competition is compromised by “the hormonal onslaught.”

Candidiasis in women

“Since yeast infections enter the body easily through the vagina, and yeast is fostered by estrogen, women of childbearing years are more vulnerable to candidiasis.” (Murray Susser. M.D. of Santa Monica, California).

Women on hormone replacement therapy, specifically estrogen replacement therapy, are also at risk because of changes in the vagina due to menopause, etc.

Causes of Candidiasis:

  • Antibiotics
  • Diet (milk, dairy, foods that contain molds, breads, peanuts)
  • Sugar
  • Alcohol (This is going to be hard for me because I love my wine!)
  • Environmental Factors ( damp environments)

Have you ever felt like you were just not yourself?  People who suffer with a Candida infections sometimes have a feeling they are not themselves.  They feel that something is really wrong.  Usually doctors can’t figure this out and misdiagnose them with depression or anxiety.

There are tests that can detect Candida which are Blood tests, Stool tests, Electrodermal tests.

Treating Candidiasis.  If you have ever had a chronic yeast infection, etc. you know how difficult it can be to treat them and to finally get rid of all of the symptoms.  Sometimes it takes months if not years.

You could take an antifungal drug which should be taken as a last resort.  A drug such as this should only be taken after the reduction approach is done.

Treating chronic Candidiasis requires the patients immune system to be strengthened through diet, supplements, and herbal remedies.

Diet:

  • Don’t eat sugar
  • Don’t drink alcohol
  • Don’t eat refined sugar
  • Get a food allergy test (there is a cross associated with the food we eat)
  • Drink pure water, often

Supplements:

  • Pro-biotic
  • Vitamin C
  • Vitamin E
  • Evening primrose oil
  • Vitamin D
  • Zinc chelate
  • Drink pure water, often
  • Get your Vitamin B levels checked and your iron too

Candidiasis in women

Herbal Remedies:

As per Dr. Braly’s first line of attack on candidiasis is caprylic acid.  He only uses drugs if there is no improvement.  “In one study, patients taking 3,600 mg of caprylic acid daily for two weeks completely eliminated their Candida.”

So the theme here is about eliminating and avoiding Candida overgrowth.  How we do this is by basically eliminating all sugar and supplementing with a good probiotic.  We need to drink plenty of pure water.

The good news is that you will not only feel better regardless, you will probably eliminate other diseases along the way.

Include these foods in your diet to rid yourself of Candida:

  • Fresh vegetables and salads (lots and lots and organic)
  • un-processed grains like rye or millet which don’t produce much sugar (moderation)
  • Garlic
  • Olive oil (thank god!)
  • Fresh fruits like berries but, in moderation

What I do to get the good stuff in and the bad stuff out is one, I eat a ton of vegetables each day.  Were talking 15 to 20 servings.

How do I do this?  I wake up, put half of a bag of organic kale in the blender, almond milk, pure water, fresh lemon juice, frozen organic blueberries, two probiotics (I open the capsules and empty them into my blender) I add a teaspoon of Stevia (a natural plant based sweetener) and viola.~

Blend and you have an equivalent to two salads already in just a quick morning smoothie!

And, you do you know what else this does?  It also serves as a kidney and liver cleanser when you wake up first thing in the morning. If you can’t get your veggies in, try this two or three times a day and you’ll balance out your gut in no time :)

Do you want to look and feel younger? Do this and have a life that will keep you happy and healthy for a lot longer than the average woman.

title: "Why the hell would anyone want to kill themselves?"
content:
"Why the hell would anyone want to kill themselves?"

"Why the hell would anyone want to kill themselves when they have all the money they need, a good car and, a girlfriend?" This is what my brother asked me when I told him about a family member who was seriously struggling with depression.

I told him that money didn't make a person happy and I reminded him of the examples of movie stars that had it all and then their lives went to hell.

Those of us who don't have money make the mistake of thinking that if we did have money, that all of our problems would go away.

Well, as I get older I see that money can help with problems especially money problems but, it won't cure depression.  In fact, I think money could make the disease even worse. Just think if someone were depressed and they had all the money to throw at the problem and, it didn't work.  Where would the hope be?

I don't have depression (thank God) but I know depression because, I watched many of my dear family members struggle from it and then lose the battle with it.  Depression is not pretty, it's delusional and it's something that if you haven't lived with it, you can never fully respect it's devastation.

To ask someone "why are you depressed" or say to them "try and be happy" or, "get over it" is like saying to a dying cancer patient, "just get your out of bed and will yourself better."

Depression doesn't care about the person that it occupies.  It puts that person in a deep dark hole that most can't or don't climb out of.

Sure, there may be medication and talk therapy but, I don't see a lot of people recovering completely.  I think once it grabs on to your soul, you try and try as you may, you can't ever fully rid yourself of it's disgusting grip.

I know people can live with depression just like diabetes, aids, and other diseases however, these are diseases of the body that allow one to move about the day but having a disease of the mind and one of the spirit, stays with you twenty-four seven.  It never lets go and, never allows one to live with intention.

Two weeks ago, my mother finally found peace by overdosing on Methadone.  I was in awe when I saw her sweet little body on her couch.  I could see that she was no longer in spiritual pain and she was set free from the darkness that lived in her soul.  I was happy for her and I knew this day would come.  I was very sad but something in me found a comfort that I can't explain.

Genetically, the odds are against me.  Genetically they are against my children and, honestly the cycle has continued to where I can't say now however, when someone asks why a depressed person just can't be happy, I respond back with "yeah and why can't a brain tumor just magically disappear with only a smile."

title: In the end we will all look old
content:
In the end, we will all look old

 

I have been following certain marketers online who say that videos instead of written blog posts are where the internet is going.

That's a bit scary for me because for one; I don't write as good as I'd like to and two, I am terrified of being on video.

I don't like the way I look on video and what terrifies me.  While doing some Google research, it appears that I am not alone (thank God!).

In my mind, I think I'm still about twenty-five years old but, when I video myself on my iPhone, hell, I look my age of fifty!

I started looking into getting some cosmetic procedures done that might help me look a little younger or at least camera ready but, going through a bunch of plastic surgeries might one, make me look a little better but two, it could also make me look done.  And do to me means older!

Even if I did do a bunch of stuff, how long would it last?  I'm getting older like I have to and then, will I be a slave to trying to look younger rather than enjoy my time aging?

I would like to say that I'd like to do nothing and then enjoy my time aging. However, that's not how society works now, is it?

Women are not allowed to age, and this is one of the recent blog posts that I wrote about and, let's face it if I were selling something, a younger version of me on video would probably be more successful.

So, I have two points to this blog post, and one is, well about the topic of course, will I be okay in the end looking old just like everyone else? Or, will I try and delay it and run from it and, get plastic surgery along the way?

Look at Jane Fonda and Raquel Welch; they look pretty good.  I don't see a problem with them.  But, there comes a time of diminishing return meaning that no matter how much of what they do, the foundation is just not there anymore, and they will have to give in just like the rest of us. They begin to look their age only abnormally because those their age don't look that way.

People think that its gravity that makes them age, and so they get a facelift, and they think they look better and maybe, get a second one but, they also need to know that it's our bones that are shrinking and not so much as our skin slipping down.

You can verify this by seeing the way a person ages in their eyes.  We can nip, tuck, pull and, add volume but the eyes say it all.

In the end, we will all look old

It's also the fact that we lose fat and tissue as we age and a lift doesn't help this either.  Sure, we can get fillers, but then, we become a slave to them too.

Of course, then some people will age faster than others due to lifestyle and genetics, but the reality is, we will all get there about the same time.  Is it really worth it to fight it?  I would hate a life where I was so preoccupied with fighting aging every day that one day I woke up and my life was never lived because I was so afraid to age.

We are afraid because again, it's not okay in our society but, we can't be consumed by what society says is okay.  Women have enough pressure we certainly don't need to have to become a slave to aging too.

So my point here again (sorry, but if you read this blog you know that I am happily affected by ADHD) then I think one, I won't run after the plastic surgery route (although I will get non invasive treatments) and two, I will go ahead and start creating video because I think that, if I don't show the world how a woman is supposed to age then who will?

Do you want to look and feel younger? Do this and have a life that will keep you happy and healthy for a lot longer than the average woman.

 

If you seriously want smoother skin then check out my "Smooth Skin" course where I will show you exactly how I get it.  No needles, fillers or surgeons needed here!

title: Parasites in your body
content:
Parasites in your body

  According to the CDC, one in six Americans is host to a parasite.  Next to lice, the most common parasite that humans have is the microscopic protozoal variety.  This can be transmitted by air, food, bugs, animals, water and other people.

Parasites in your body

Another type of parasite is worms.  Pinworms, roundworms, and tapeworms.  Most parasites go undetected because they don't produce serious problems or they produce symptoms that can be attributed to another cause such as irritable bowel syndrome, chronic fatigue syndrome, bloating, some allergies, diarrhea, abdominal pain and many more. Parasites and organisms survive by feeding off each other.

Symptoms of a parasitic infection usually happen within three to five days after being exposed.  Below are some of the risk factors for getting a parasitic infection:

  • Traveling outside the U.S.
  • Drinking out of streams and rivers.
  • Household pets.
  • Eating sushi.
  • Eating raw, undercooked meat and, raw fish.
  • Working in a hospital or daycare.
  • Oral and anal sex.
  • Not washing hands often and properly.

An accurate diagnosis is a must because different parasites require different methods to kill them.

If you think that you have a parasite, then have your doctor test you by using the CDC guidelines (http://www.cdc.gov/parasites/references_resources/diagnosis.html).

Some of the ways to test are a stool test, rectal mucus swab and, blood tests.

Parasites in your body

Most doctors use antibiotics and other drugs to fight parasites. Alternative medicine uses things like detoxification, diet, and herbal medicine.

How to avoid Parasites in your body:

  • Don't eat raw meat or fish.
  • Don't put your hands near your mouth without washing them.
  • Use separate cutting board for meat.
  • Wash fruit and veggies good.
  • Think twice about sleeping too close to your pets.  They harbor worms and other parasites.
  • Of course, always wash after using the restroom.
  • Wash your hands after you work outside.
  • Be mindful of the water you drink.
  • Don't bite your nails.

Recommendations:

  • Because parasites live in the intestinal walls, you can flush them out with natural things like bentonite clay and psyllium combined.
  • Anti-parasite foods to be eaten are pineapple, papaya, onions, kelp, blackberries, raw cabbage, and almonds.
  • Use herbal remedies like seed extract and other Chinese remedies.
  • Drink lots of pure water.
  •  Sanitize your environment as in wash all bedding, clothes, etc.

title: How to have good intestinal health
content:
How to have good intestinal health

 

Every morning I wake up and put kale, spinach, beets, organic blueberries, raspberries, almond milk, cinnamon, turmeric, cayenne pepper, lemon, and two probiotics into a blender and make what I think is a pretty tasty gut cleanser.

Could I add even more goodies to make it even more healthy?  Absolutely but, the important thing here is consistency.

I not only feel great knowing that for breakfast I've already consumed half of my daily fruits and veggies but, I physically feel energized, my hair has started to grow again and, my skin is looking pretty good too.

How to have good intestinal health? The way to maintain your gut or your intestinal health is to do the following:

  • Eliminate sugar as much as possible.
  • Eat raw, fresh and unprocessed food.
  • Chew your food well.
  • Eat two low glycemic fruits each day.
  • Eat at least six vegetables per day (preferably raw).
  • Try and include sprouts in your diet.
  • Vary your foods each day from meal to meal.  Don't always eat the same things each day.
  • Eat your biggest meal at lunch and don't ever go to be with food in your belly.
  • Drink at least 64 ounces of filtered water per day.
  • It's better to drink fluids before and after your meals so that, your digestive fluids are not diluted.
  • Avoid things like coffee, black tea, soda, chocolate, nicotine and alcohol (I'm going to work on the last one! I love my wine).
  • Take probiotics each day.
  • Move your body.
I don't think the things above are hard to do.  If you follow the steps above, you will most likely feel pretty good too.

They say that most if not all disease start in the gut.  If this is true then, doing the steps above should cut your risk significantly.

Take care :)

title: An aging woman is not allowed
content:
An aging woman is not allowed

I was in my kitchen cooking today and I could hear some people laughing about the way an actress, specifically, Carrie Fisher's knees looked.  I wanted to see what the hell they were talking about, so I went to get the full story.

These guys on the show TMZ were laughing at a still shot of Carrie Fisher dancing at the opening party for the 2015 Star Wars movie.  They made fun of how old her knees looked and how bad her body was aging.  They all made comments as one after another took a shot at her.

Then they showed the video of her dancing, and she looked happy. She was in the zone dancing by herself while celebrating this movie that she had been in when she was a beautiful young woman.

Carrie Fisher has passed away recently 😔

I kind of felt sad for her because, well, I'm a middle-aged woman and I am beginning to feel self-conscious about my looks as I age.  I would certainly be completely hurt if I knew that men were laughing at the way that I have aged too.

Shame on people that don't allow us to age.  We are made to feel like it's some kind of disease.  Screw aging gracefully in our culture that is obsessed by youth and trying to be younger (me included) because that's just not reality.  It's not allowed here.

The thing is, men can age and look distinguished while women are not valued after a certain age.  It's bad enough that they say "men always go younger" because they have an unfair advantage of dating women that are ten, fifteen, even twenty years younger but, women after fifty are invisible.

I'm not here to rant about getting older or hate on younger women.  But,  I am here to ask why don't women get a freakin break when it comes to aging?  Yeah, we get it, we are not accepted, we don't age as well as men, blah, blah, blah, but really, could everyone just keep all the aging comments to themselves?

Women have a lot of pressure already in our society and, add aging to it and, well, we can only control so much.  The last thing we need is some idiots laughing at our knees.

Like I said, "An aging woman is not allowed."  Wait I know, instead of "Anti-Aging" let's "Positively Age!"

title: Goodbye Momma you're free now..
content:
Goodbye Momma you're free now..

Goodbye Momma you're free now..  On December 20, 2015 at one in the morning, I heard the sound of my phone buzzing in my purse next to my bed.  Now, I always turn off my phone because I don't sleep too well and if my phone is on, I will surely look at social media all night, which in turn, keeps me awake.

On this night, I didn't turn my phone off and unfortunately, as everyone knows, when your phone rings in the middle of the night, the news is probably not good.

I looked down at my purse, I saw the light flickering and thought it's bad news so why answer it.  Couldn't the bad news wait until the morning when I could handle  bad news better?  But then, I realized how selfish that would be if I did wait and how unfair it would be for the person on the other side making the call.

I got out of bed, got my phone and went into the living room.  It was my brother and in a sad and raspy voice he told me that our mother had passed away on her living room couch all alone.

Earlier in the day, he and our mother had gotten into an argument (which was happening more often between them) and that he had storm out the door.  When he returned that night, he saw her laying on the couch but the weird thing was that, she was laying in the same position for seven hours.  He said when he saw her he knew that she had passed away.

I told him to call 911 and go outside and that I would come over.  I sat silently in my living room for two hours just wondering if I really wanted to rush over to my mothers house and see her dead on her couch.  I just didn't think I could handle seeing her laying there and I certainly didn't want that to be my last memory.

But, something came over me and I took a shower, got ready and made the forty-five minute drive to her house.

I drove up and saw the police outside as the EMS had already left.  I knew there was only one person we were waiting for and that was the coroner.  As I got out of my car and talked to the police, I watched my brother pacing on the front lawn.  I hugged him and he said, "Terry, if you want to see her, you can look through the living room windows and see her laying on the couch."

His words felt like a knife piercing my heart.  Did I really want to see her or did I want to remember the last time I saw her?  I didn't want to remember so much the last time I saw her because it was the Thursday before and it didn't go so well.

I went to her house to visit and she looked horrible.  Her clothes looked ratty, she smelled like cigarettes and she only weighed about seventy-five pounds. She just looked awful and I wasn't going to have it!

I grabbed my moms arm and told her to sit down.  I scolded her about her appearance and begged her to tell me what was going on with her.  She assured me that she didn't know why she was losing so much weight and that she was eating but she just didn't feel well.

I told her that if she didn't start eating and taking care of herself that I would call a Social Worker and have them come over and do whatever was necessary to find out what was really going on with her.  I gave her some new clothes and I told her that she should put on some makeup, fresh clothes and start taking care of herself.  I told her that the next time I saw her, I didn't want to see her like she was then.

I saw the pain in her eyes and I also knew in my heart that her spirit way dying.  She was dying.  It broke my heart and I just couldn't add to her pain.  After all, I'm the one who has tried to save her for most of her life. My mother eyes told everything and right there they were telling me that she was more like my child.

I said "mom, I'm not here to be mean to you.  I just want you to be okay.  I want you to be happy.  I don't like to see you this way."  She said to me that she didn't think I was being mean but that, I loved her and that I cared about her.  That made me happy and we sat and talked for a bit.  Now I wish it had been longer.

Her words comfort me every time I doubt myself and think that I could have done something more to save her.

You know they say you don't know how strong you are until you have to be and man that is so true.  I lost my younger brother two years ago and I think this is when my mom gave up.  In a short time after my brother died, she lost the only man that loved her and my other brother developed a brain tumor.  I think some people are just not as strong as others and in my mothers case, she was probably born a very weak soul.

Not to say that if you lose a child it shouldn't weaken you because I never ever want to find this out and, I could only imagine how much will it takes to pull yourself out of a dark hole and try to move on.

My mother lived in a dark hole and she could never pull herself out.  The good times didn't last for long for her, when they came, she worried about how long they would last.  She never lived in the moment, ever.

Today I picked up my mothers ashes.  They gave me her final belongings which was a cross and a St. Christoper that she wore around her neck to keep her safe and so that God would know that she was afraid of dying.

I thought that picking up her ashes would affect me worse than it did but, it was more of a feeling of peace.  I knew the ashes were not her and that she was now free.

It feels comforting to me knowing how much spiritual pain that my mother was in that now her body is strong, her mind is free and her soul is happy for once.  Although I rarely saw this, I remember her last words were, "and I love you."

Someone asked my if I think it was harder to lose my mother in a sudden passing as compared to losing her to cancer and watching her suffer or die slowly and I told them that, I watched my mom die my whole life.  And, it will always haunt me to know or think that her only daughter couldn't save her from herself.

I don't want to ever minimize the way anyone dies because when you lose someone you love it hurts deep no matter what the circumstance is.  When you watch someone in pain, no matter what kind of pain it's agonizing.  I have learned that it's also a blessing to allow them to be free and to appreciate that they are.

On Christmas Eve, like I had done for so many years before, I picked up my cell phone and dialed her number to tell her Merry Christmas but, as the phone rang, I realized that she was gone and that I would never talk to her again.  I will never see her again and I will never get to hug her frail little body ever again.  I put my phone down and cried in a Walgreen's parking lot.

My mother died of an accidental drug over dose by using Methadone.  I know it wasn't exactly intentional because while saying my final good bye to her on the couch, I noticed that she had her done, she put on makeup and was wearing the new clothes that I bought her.

She listened to me that day when I told her the next time I saw her that I didn't want to see her the way she was and she was all made up.  Maybe she knew where she was going or maybe she wanted to look nice for me, that I'll never know.

My question or wonder is, is it suicide when you don't intend to kill yourself but you use drugs?  I don't know but, if you use drugs to escape then you are already committing spiritual suicide because you don't feel comfortable in your own body and for that, her intentions are what they are.

Rest in peace my sweet dear mother.  I know you tried and I know that you're in heaven and your with your son and, I know most of all that you loved me as best as you could. I'll see you again one day and on that day we won't have to worry about the elephant that was always in the room.  We can celebrate together.

Goodbye Momma you're free now..

*The picture on this blog post is of the time when my mom was happy for a minute.  I took her back to where she grew up.  This is how I will remember her.. I

title: Turning 50!
content:
Turning 50!

In a few weeks I will be turning 50 years old! I'm sure like many others before me, when you turn 50 you just can't believe it.  How did I get here, and who am I?

Where did the time go?  I still remember being fifteen and laying on a San Diego beach in my teeny bikini thinking that I would never get old.

Now that I'm about to flip the half century mark, it's both a scary and somewhat comforting at the same time.  One reason is because a week ago, I lost my mom suddenly right before Christmas and when you lose your mom it puts life in perspective. Not only did I never think I would get old but, I never thought my mom would die.

Suddenly, the world looks different now.  Would it look as different if my mother hadn't passed away while turning 50?  I don't know but since she passed, I look at the sky more.  I look around at the world and think about how lucky I am to be here.  I realize more and more that life is flying by and I wan't to slow it down but I can't.

I have to be grateful for being 50 because there are those who never made it to 50 and for that, I am blessed to be able to.  My mother and I had a unique relationship and to make a long story short, I loved her dearly while she had a hard time loving my back but, in the end, she did try and she did show me she loved me in the very best way that she could. Her soul is free and I am at peace.

Maybe her passing was her gift to me so that I could stop running around taking life for granted for the time that I have left.  She could never give me much but, for some reason, for as weird as it sounds, she gave me the ability to fully appreciate my life for once.

Honestly, I thought for my 50th birthday I would be giving myself a divorce because like many couples that have been married for almost thirty years, we had a lot of ups and downs and, for a while there, I pretty much figured that for the rest our relationship, it would be down and we would fall into the same situation as all of the couples before us.

Thankfully, through life, there will be times where you really think that you should leave and that, you'd be better off but, those are the times where you should do nothing and just wait it out.  Things do get better it's just that couples evolve both together and as individuals.  Sometimes you have to wait for the other one to catch up and vise versa.

While I now don't have to worry about taking care of an aging parent or finding a new life if I were on my own, I have the time and the resources to step back and get to know myself.  Something that I thought I knew but clearly I really didn't. I'm just beginning to feel the spiritual side of who I really am.

For my 50th birthday, the gift that I wan't more than anything is not some trip around the world to say that I saw everything (although someday that would be nice), but more of a journey with myself.

A journey that takes me to a place inside that trusts herself, loves herself, stops sabotaging herself and, instead of trying to be like everyone else, embraces the god given spirit and uniqueness that is inside of me.  I think everyone owes themselves this gift.  Otherwise we just breeze through life and get to end and wonder where it went and why didn't we use it better.

If I've learned one thing (okay a few things) in my 50 years it would be to love myself more, accept myself always, and to relax that anxious person inside and lastly, to quit stepping back in a crowd so that I wouldn't stand out but rather, step forward and shine in the light that I was given for such a short time.

Here's to turning 50!
