title: There's no place for old people
content:
There's no place for old people

I've always said "there's no place for old people."  I'm turning 50 next month and yeah, I know, I was young once.  I have nothing against the younger generation as I see them as being one of the most creative generations there has ever been.

I didn't say the most inventive (but close) however, definitely, the most creative.  To live in a time of such creativity with the minds of young people that create systems and platforms from just pure imagination, is a gift that I feel honored to be a part of.

Let's be honest here, my mother is 71 years old and she has no clue about technology, apps or, where the world has the potential to go.

The closest thing she sees outside of her world is the YouTube channel that I set up for her on her living room television.

She's fascinated to see the world through the eyes of others, more specifically, through real life videos and what she has and will, never experience.

The truth is, at her age, YouTube will be the closest that she'll ever get to a world outside of herself.  And with that, I say, have fun mom.. Do what makes you happy while you still can.

Back to my initial topic of "there's no place for old people."  Sorry my ADHD kicks in quite often!!  Actually, about every five seconds and it's only getting worse as I age.. But it's also my gift as well as my curse.

Okay, now what was I talking about? Oh yeah!

They say the older you get the faster you get older.  I know what this means because the last ten to twenty years have flown by.  Each day flies by in fact, and I watch the clock and instead of when I was younger, wanting the time to go by as fast as possible, I watch the clock as my heart sinks and I fear that another day is about to end. I hate how fast time is going but, I have no control over time. We're all going to get old whether we like it or not.

I'm getting older and if life goes faster now that I'm older then how much longer do I have, I wonder?  Right now I still look reasonably okay and I am able to do anything physically.  The real worry is when, I get to that age where I'm really old and when people look past me.  Like being invisible. Which is not very far away even if I still feel and act like I'm eighteen!

Society loves youth and society rewards youth and, probably like most others, I feel like I didn't appreciate my youth when I had it.  With that said, I like most people, did the best I could with what I had, and for that, I am grateful for who I am today.

If I could sum up what I'm trying to say here is just read the lyrics the Baz Luhrmann, Wear Sunscreen song below.

"Enjoy the power and beauty of your youth Oh, never mind You will not understand the power and beauty of your youth until they have faded But trust me, in 20 years you’ll look back at photos of yourself And recall in a way you can’t grasp now How much possibility lay before you And how fabulous you really looked"

"Don’t worry about the future Or worry But know that worrying is as effective as trying to solve an algebra equation by chewing bubblegum The real troubles in your life are apt to be things that never crossed your worried mind The kind that blindside you at 4 PM on some idle Tuesday Do one thing everyday that scares you"

"Don’t be reckless with other people’s hearts Don’t put up with people who are reckless with yours"

"Don’t waste your time on jealousy Sometimes you’re ahead, sometimes you’re behind The race is long And in the end, it’s only with yourself"

"Remember the compliments you receive, forget the insults If you succeed in doing this, tell me how"

I don't know about you but, I think those are some pretty powerful lyrics and you pretty much have to be older to appreciate them.

I feel like I have some time to do the things that I want and to love the people who are in my life and, who I know  will naturally leave me sooner than I hope.

Maybe that's the key to getting old.  We become fulfilled with the love that we give and the things we did while we are here.  Once you can or have done this, you can begin to step back and let others have the space that you once had.

Maybe its not looking at others like they're taking your space at all but, it's just the natural form of energy that we as old people have to transfer so that energy can re-circulate so that, the younger generation can have it to use.

Whatever the rest of my days will bring me and no matter how fast they come, I will remember that,  I got to live an incredible life because it was my life.

Even if didn't create some huge powerful company, an app that changed the world or, I wasn't the most beautiful woman in the world, I had the opportunity to grow old and for some they don't even get that chance.

All that will matter in the space and time I have left is that I was born, born free, I created some beautiful kids and I was nice, giving, loving and compassionate towards others.

I guess the whole point to this blog post is not so much about "there's no place for old people" but about "reflection is the greatest gift an old person can give themself."

Here's to our place :)

*Since writing this post, my mom passed away.. Rest in peace you are free now..

title: Zicam Cold Remedy is awesome!
content:
Zicam Cold Remedy is awesome! I love Zicam and here's why!

Last Sunday, I got a call from my brother at one in the morning telling me that my mother had passed away.  Needless to say, I was very sad and super stressed out, realizing that my world had just flipped upside down.  On the day that you lose your mom is the day that the world will never be the same.

Although this post isn't about my mother's passing, it does have something to do with the topic of Zicam Cold Remedy.

Two days after my mother's passing, I woke up with a sore throat and a heavy feeling in my chest.  I have to say that knock on wood, I haven't had a cold in probably ten years.  I take some great supplements and try to keep myself healthy and disease free.

With that said, when I woke up that morning, I knew that I had a cold coming on and that it was probably brought on my the stress of losing my mother.  I believe so much that when our body's are under stress, our body's have to manifest themselves in some way.  My cold was my body's way of dealing with my emotional toll.

My mother passed five days before Christmas this year (2015) so, not only did I have to organize her funeral, I also had to continue to keep living life and deal with the holidays so that, my family would know that I was going to be okay.

The thing was that, the more I tried to continue on, the more I felt my cold coming on.  I had congestion and I felt weak and, I knew that if I didn't get better quick, this was one of those colds that would last for weeks and, I just didn't have time for it right now!

This is when I remembered that I had read something about Zicam Cold Remedy.  I remembered the article said, "Zicam reduces the duration of a cold" so I figured, if I got some, I really didn't have anything to lose if it didn't actually work.  I was getting a cold anyways.

I got the Zicam nasal swabs.  The first day I used them just like the directions said and a little more than the directions said.  I broke up the swab, swirled it around the inside of my nostrils and repeated this several times per hour for that entire day.

The next day, I woke up and I swear, I didn't have one symptom.  The day before, I walked around with a box of Puff's, nose running, sore throat,  chest hurting and, I really felt awful.

I couldn't believe it.  I thought it was a fluke.  I thought for sure that my symptoms would return but they didn't.  And the next day, on Christmas Eve, I felt even better.  On Christmas Day, I had not one symptom of having a cold.

Now, some may not think that I actually didn't have a cold and that, maybe it was some kind of allergy.  But, I don't think so because , I have allergies to cedar and the cedar for this week has been extremely low and, I take allergy medicine when this happens.

I had a full blown Winter cold coming on and I used Zicam Cold Remedy and it worked! It's pretty sweet when a product makes a claim and it actually does what it says!

I love Zicam Cold Remedy because not only did it stop my cold dead in it's tracks, it also gave me the time I needed to grieve for my mother and be with my family for the holidays.

title: I love GoodRx.com!! Here's why!
content:
I love GoodRx.com!! Here's why! If you read this blog, you probably know that I write fifty-percent about health issues and the other half about anti aging and, aging issues.

I've also written a book about "The secret to getting products and procedures cheap" and in it, I tell you how to get these for less than retail.  In one chapter (the products) I write about how I found Retin-A online at Canadapharmacy.com and, up until yesterday, that was my go to place to get it.

If you don't know what Retin-A is, I will give you a quick explanation and move on.

"What is Retin-A? Retin-A (tretinoin) is a form of vitamin A that helps the skin renew itself and is used to reduce the appearance of fine wrinkles and mottled skin discoloration, and to make rough facial skin feel smoother." (http://www.drugs.com/retin-a.html)

I couldn't agree more with the statement above as, I have been using Retin-A for about twenty years and it has really changed my skin.  That said, you can't get it without a prescription and even worse, most (if not all) insurance plans don't cover it because of it's cosmetic use.

So until I found canadapharmacy.com, I was paying retail about $275.00 for a tube of Retin-A that only lasted me about six weeks (if that).

Let's be real here, I'm turning 50 next month and I've seriously done some sun damage and I need this stuff everywhere!  I can't be skimping on a product that really works because of it's price!  With canadapharmacy.com I paid about $95.00 and I was happy.

The downside was that I had to wait a few weeks for them to mail it but, so long as I ordered it before running out of what I had, I was good.  But that's the thing, I didn't always stay on top of it and I ended up having to pay retail a lot just to use Retin-A consistently.

Now is where GoodRx.com comes in!  I came across their website by accident and on their website, they have a search bar and I put the name Retin-A in and they came back with prices of five or so pharmacy's in my area with competing prices!

I almost fell out of my chair because, not only was the price $50.00 at CVS but, the tube size was double!  I thought, this was too good to be true.  You know, the old bait and switch thing?

I figured I didn't have anything to lose and I downloaded the coupon on my phone, took my prescription to CVS, they scanned the coupon on my phone and, done!

The pharmacy clerk told me these sweet words "$50.00 and it will be ready in fifteen minutes!"  I stood there like I had won something or that I needed to feel guilty because I was kind of ripping them off somehow.

Dumb way to think right?  Since the drug companies obviously rip-off us consumers but, that is a another blog post and I won't let my ADHD kick in right now!

I couldn't believe it!  I happen to have another prescription for skin bleach (you know to lighten all the sun damage on my legs too!) and the clerk downloaded another coupon for me from GoodRx.com and, the cost was $20.00!  I have been paying $69.00 dollars for the same product!

Long story short ( I know, none of my stories are short), if you have any prescription, covered my insurance or not, run it through GoodRx.com and check out the cash/coupon price of competing pharmacies.  You just might be surprised on how much money you will save.

I figure I'm saving a couple hundred dollars a month to do what I wan't with.. That's exciting and for that, this is why I love GoodRx.com.

title: This is how I stay skinny and eat a ton!
content:
This is how I stay skinny and eat a ton! I love to eat.  Frankly, I wake up and as soon as I open my eyes, I think about eating.

Today I went to lunch with my business partner and I ate a salad with Yogurt dressing, cabbage, spinach, vegetable soup, salsa, and tea sweetened with Stevia and, that was  my second meal of the day!  I usually eat about five times a day plus snacks.

Here's what I ate

Now, my business partner had chicken fried steak, mash potatoes and water with lemon.

Who do you think ate more calories?  Not me.. My business partner did of course. Sure, I ate more food but not even as many calories as he did.

See that's the thing, you can eat a lot (and I mean a lot) maybe more than you probably eat now and still maintain or lose weight.

Whenever I go out to eat with others, they ask me if I have a hollow leg.  Really?  I wish.  I don't have a hollow leg and I wasn't blessed with a high metabolism either.  My mother tells me " You were born the big boned one in the family" (thanks mom). In fact, does anyone really have a high metabolism anyways?

Sure, there are some exceptions to the rule but when it comes right down to it, we either eat too much or we don't.  You know,  the old calories in calories out kind of thing or, the magic of it all, we don't eat the right food combinations which is limiting.

Working out is good but not as important as what you eat.  If all we needed to do to stay thin was to work out  thirty minutes to an hour per day then we could eat all the food we wanted right? Wrong.  Not even athletes can do this.

The thing is that it's the type of food and in what combinations that we eat.  Going back to my business partner, a chicken fried steak paired with mash potatoes, that will put weight on us. Not to mention that, the side effects of that type of food is probably not good for our health.

However, this blog post is not about lecturing anyone on the ways to eat for better health (although eating this way will make you more healthy).   Nope, this blog post is about showing you the ways that you can eat a ton of food, never be hungry and most importantly, satisfy your taste buds.

Let's face it, no one likes to eat boring food or starve themselves.  Honestly, when I don't eat a lot, I'm a bit grouchy and no one likes a grouch.  I could never just not eat because my stomach hurts and I get a little spacey.  There is no way.  I love people and food too much because, food should be enjoyed.  No one ever had fun while out to dinner with someone who pretends not to be hungry.

We are all hungry and we all pretty much love food.  Why fight it! Eat!

Get this,

99% OF PEOPLE FAIL TO LOSE WEIGHT AND FEEL GOOD BECAUSE THEY DO THIS!

  • Eat too many processed foods.
  • Believe that they will miss sugar and other unhealthy foods.
  • Think that they will get bored with eating healthy.
  • Believe that their food options will be limited.
  • Don’t think that they can eat what they want a lot of times.
  • They don’t know how to eat healthier and in the right combinations to not feel deprived.
BIGGEST MISTAKE OF ALL?   YoYo Dieting!
(Weight cycling: the repeated loss and regain of body weight.  A weight cycle can range from small weight losses and gains (5-10 lbs. per cycle) to large changes in weight (50 lbs. or more per cycle).

Now, I will get to the point of this blog post and that is to tell you that I created a little cheat sheet that allows me to eat way more food than most people. And, I have included it below for you to download.

title: Why do we fall for beauty product claims?
content:
Why do we fall for beauty product claims?

I have to admit it.  I fall for every beauty product promise out there. Well, at least I used to.

I have had drawers full of beauty products and still have at least one drawer of beauty products that claimed to tighten my skin, remove wrinkles and make me look younger.

Now that I'm older, I am much more wiser to these claims because one, I have used just about every product out there and more importantly, I started doing research before I buy a new product.

Basically there are really only a few reasons why a beauty product works and it has nothing to do with the packaging.

Although packaging is something they probably put more effort into rather than the product so it will stand out or look like it's value is way more than what it's worth.

When you buy a skin care product and look at the ingredients they usually have one key factor, an ACTIVE INGREDIENT. 

The whole secret to the product is the active ingredient.  Take this out and all you have is a fragrant lotion, cream, water, or gel. 

Many skin care products don’t even have an active ingredient!  Some products that state they have active ingredients on their label and, in their product however, they don’t contain that much of the active ingredient or, they aren’t in high enough levels to create a positive effect on the skin. 

But you are paying for them via the name of the brand!  Of course we want them to work because we need them to and, because we spent a lot of money buying them.     

Just to be fair, not all active ingredients have to be high in concentration.  For example, Peptides and EGF’s, merely signal molecules however, vitamin-C needs to be higher in concentration to make a difference in your skin. 

Any ACTIVE lower than the preservatives in the bottle, may be too low to make a real difference.

In case you didn’t know, the first ingredient is the strongest and then it goes in descending order. 

Many products have their Active Ingredient towards the last of the ingredients; hum mm, how about that? Shouldn’t they be first or at least near first?

Whatever products you use, you need to use them for at least one month to see genuine results.  Many products claim to reduce lines and wrinkles but just add moisture to the skin thus, plumping up the lines and wrinkles giving you the APPEARANCE of them being gone. 

I don’t like the word appearance! I would rather the claim say that it get's rid of them!! Not just the look of them..

I was watching an infomercial about crepey skin (you know when our skin begins to look like tissue paper as we get older?)

I spent too much time in the sun in my younger days and now, I seem to be losing lasticity.  I would love a product to tighten my skin but really, is a product going to do this? No.

The product was some cream that I would put on my legs and then my legs would become firm and smooth. Yeah right!  I think exercise does this..

The great thing about knowing what the secret to beauty products are and knowing how to read the ingredient labels is that, when you want to buy a new beauty product, you can simply go online, Google it, and then read what is in it and verify if the active ingredients are there.

I researched the product for for my legs and it turns out that the active ingredient was almost at the last on the list and the rest was a filler product of shea butter.  That's it!

I saved about $100.00 by not buying this product and instead I went out and bought some shea butter and it's doing a good job. Turns out, I need more moisture on my legs and to workout!

The takeaway here is to save money and to not buy into beauty claims and products that are not true and that won't work.

We all have a grave yard full of these..

title: Plastic surgery makes you look older
content:
Plastic surgery makes you look older

 

I can't help but notice a lot of celebrities getting plastic surgery and, they not only look a little odd but, they look older than they were in the first place.

In my book "Where Women Go" I talk about if getting plastic surgery or cosmetic procedures, to do it gradually.  Don't wake up one day and think, damn! I need to do whole bunch of stuff to my face because, you won't look younger, you will look done!

I'm not saying that if you want plastic surgery or cosmetic procedures that you shouldn't.  Let's face it, unfortunately, we live in a world where it seems that women over fifty disappear.

We live under the pressure to not only look good but, look younger for our age.

I am a woman who uses Botox™, works out, injects filler now and again, and uses the best skin care creams that my budget allows.

However, there comes a time when you begin to see changes in your body, face, and skin that no creams, fillers or injections will ever change.

The thing is, now that I am turning 50 in two months, I have a little more money to do some cosmetic procedures but the question is, should I?

Do we all get to the fork in the road at a certain age and then, we go the surgery route or the natural aging route?

For some, it may be just a matter of aging gracefully and for those, I so admire you and wish that I could just be content and go with the flow.

The thing that gets to me the most is, when I walk into a room, it's like I'm not even there.  I know I'm there but no one else does.

With that said, it's starting to be okay because I'm finally accepting that I am, and I will, continue to age. We all will.

I used to think that it would be nice to stay the exact age that I am now and never get old but then, I got a little sad because those that I love would get old and they would die and, I would be left here without them.

I don't wan't to start a new life with new people all the time just to stay young.  Hell that already feels exhausting!  I wan't to go and age along with the people I love.

I guess this post was supposed to be about plastic surgery and how, if you get it, not to go drastic because, it will just defeat the purpose and make you look older.

That was the point of this blog but as usual, I got off track in pondering life and ultimately death.

Aging is scary because I guess, I'm afraid of dying so when I think about it, I don't need to worry so much about how I look while I'm still here but, how I will live, love and laugh with the time that I have left.

title: What's up with doctors these days!!
content:
What's up with doctors these days!!

 

I feel both pissed off and like I won the lottery at the same time!

For the last two years I have had PVC's which means that my heart has premature ventricular contractions.  "Premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) are premature heartbeats originating from the ventricles of the heart. Premature ventricular contractions are premature because they occur before the regular heartbeat."

I found this out because I was going to have a minor cosmetic procedure and the doctor did an EKG and it came back abnormal.  She said that she wouldn't do the procedure until I got a heart doctor to clear me.

So, after thousands of dollars to satisfy my deductible, I had a stress test, a heart halter monitor, more EKG's, a Nuclear heart test (radio active dye put in my veins), and an echocardiogram, and a few other tests.

I went' to my "Natural OBGYN" to tell her that every since she put me on thyroid medicine, I could feel my heart palpitating.  She took blood, I went back and she said, it was not the thyroid medicine but that my heart issue was just part of aging.

With sadness, I took her words and thankfully my heart came back normal.  I got my clearance from the heart doctor and I got my procedure.

For the next year or so, I went back four times to tell my OBGYN that there was something wrong with my heart.  She couldn't find anything.

I decided to get another opinion and went to an Endocrinologist and he said that I should stay on the thyroid medicine because he said my blood level was normal and now found a nodule on my thyroid meaning, my thyroid was attacking itself.

I Got the nodule tested and it too was fine. So, I took more thyroid medicine. I felt like I was on diet pills, my heart felt like it was jumping out of my chest and, I felt bad all of the time.

I was close to accepting living this way.  Until, I needed another minor surgery and the anesthesiologist decided to give me yet, another EKG because, by now I was on blood pressure medication because of my heart rate and, my PVC'S were twice as bad as the time before.

She said she would not put me under and said again that I needed heart clearance. They pulled the I'V'S out and after losing my payment to secure the surgery, I was again, spinning trying to figure out what to do next.

After getting dressed and being kindly told not to come back until I could figure out my health issue, I sadly walked to my car.

I called my OBGYN in the parking lot and she said come right over and get my thyroid tested.  By now, I was tired of playing this game.  I decided she was the problem and that I needed to find a way to get off of thyroid medication.  She actually wanted me to take more as she said I was even on the low end!

I almost cried because I thought for a second that maybe my heart was failing and my life would end up being short.  I recently lost my brother to the side effects of radiation near his heart and I concluded that I would be next.

After all, I am going to be 50 in a couple of months and they say that heart disease is the number one killer of women over 50.  I thought it was just my fate and I was going to have to live with a bad heart valve or something.

I did get another blood test and took it to a new endocrinologist.  He said as soon as I told him the symptoms and what I was taking, he told me the problem was the name brand "Armour" and that it was made from pigs and that, sometimes we can't handle pig thyroid.

He said in some people it causes an electrical arrhythmia.  He might as well have said "Theresa, your hell is over and you've been saved."

Now, I'm 90% Vegan which goes against me taking pig medicine but I'm also 100% proactive in my health and I know my body.

The doctor also said that, every dose is a different dose meaning that, it comes from different pigs so my body has an issue with it.

I don't know how many times I asked my "Natural OBGYN" to think about switching my brand.  Nope! She knew best because she was "the doctor."

Long story short (okay I'm making it short because you're probably tired of this already), the new endocrinologist took me off of Armour thyroid medicine and eight weeks later my blood tests show I don't or maybe never needed thyroid medication it in the first place!

My heart rhythm is back to normal and I don't feel like I'm ready to jump off a cliff!

I won't get back all of the money and time that I lost over this and I swear being over medicated aged me but, it's better late than never to save myself.

The take away here is:  If you know your body and it's telling you that the doctors are not right then listen to yourself.

No doctor will take care of you like you and, get lot's opinions until you get the right answers.

While my heart was being damaged, my "Natural OBGYN" was ranting about how she's opening her seventh natural anti-aging clinic.  I kindly said, maybe you should work on your first one!

I think I will re-think natural aging from now on. What's up with doctors these days?

title: This is how fat feeds cancer
content:
This is how fat feeds cancer

Fat is carcinogenic.  A high fat diet increases cancer risk dramatically!

In fact, "Fat causes cancer" is an accepted medical term.  In medical studies, breast cancer, colon cancer and prostate cancer are closely linked to high fat diets.

Other cancers such as uterus, ovarian, pancreas and others are also associated with a high fat diet.

This is how fat feeds cancer:

"Fats go rancid including the fat on our bodies."  When this happens free radicals occur.  Then, free radicals go looking for healthy cells to attack and blow a hole in the cell wall.  The cell leaks its contents and then dies.

Our body can fight many of this now and then but when free radicals damage the DNA, it causes the cell to reproduce wrong.  Free radicals can also damage our immune cells thus, interfere with our cells protective properties by not allowing our cells to repair the damaged ones.

Trans-fats are especially bad because they like to damage our DNA.  When this happens it gives way for promoting tumors because our immune system has also been compromised.

You will find trans-fats in vegetable shortening, margarine, processed oils, processed foods (especially those that sit in our pantry and have long shelf lives).

A poor diet weakens the immune system.  That's the bottom line.  Our immune system is highly sensitive to our diet and with that, it disables our ability to ward off cancer.

Fat elevates hormone levels, stimulates acid production and, packs on the pounds.  All of which free radicals thrive on.

I was going to go into a long post on everything bad that happens to our bodies when we eat bad fats but, I don't know about you, I like to get the summary of the information and move on.

By now you can see that eating bad fat promotes cancer so with the bad news I always think that it should be followed up by the good news or the antidote.

Here are the good fats that you should eat.  Not all fats cause cancer. Actually some fats can help prevent cancer.

Rules to eat by when consuming fats: Good fats:
  • Avocados
  • Olives
  • Nuts (almonds, peanuts, macadamia nuts, hazelnuts, pecans, cashews)
  • Walnuts
    • Sunflower, sesame, and pumpkin seeds
    • Flaxseeds
    • Non-GMO sources of soymilk and tofu
Note:  The above good fats are not all there is however, it gives you a good start.   Ways to avoid bad fats:  
  • This may be a hard one for many:  Eliminate animal products!
  • DO NOT eat hydrogenated oils.
  • Use oils that are high in essential fatty acids (see oils, nut oils, pumpkin)
  • Supplement with flaxseeds, omeg-3 fatty acids, borage oil, omega-6 fatty acids.  Do this everyday.
  • Cook your food on the lowest temperature.
  • Never fry your foods.
  • Bake, boil, steam foods.
  • Eat raw (veggies, fruits, etc.)

This is a start and if you only do a few of these at first then you're doing good.

Just try to be mindful of the type of fat that you put into your mouth and eventually try to eliminate the bad ones.

Source: Timothy J. Smith, M.D.

title: Do you really care if he likes you?
content:
Do you really care if he likes you?

This question is what my friend asked me today:

"If a man sincerely acts like he is madly in love with you when you're together but, only calls or texts you once a week, what do you think? Does he really like you or does he have someone else?"

I wanted to tell her what I really thought and that was that he probably liked her but, he either didn't wan't a relationship with her or that, he does have another person he is seeing.

So I told her to move on because if someone is not giving you what you need and moreover, when your intuition is asking you questions, then you already know the answer.

I was thinking about making this blog post about dating at middle-age and how difficult it is but then, I thought that, it's really not so much about age is it?  I think this question can come up at any age.

When someone is not in to you or they have other issues in their lives, it's not hard to take it personally especially when you really like someone.

I think the middle-age part comes in when you are limited in the people that are available to date or mostly likely, the ways to meet people to date.  Where do people that are over 50 meet these days?  Dating websites?  If so, and you've honestly found a good guy, please, email me at theresaskrobanek@yahoo.com to tell me your story.  I would love to share it with other women :)

So when you do find someone that you like and who makes you feel wanted but something is not right, sometimes you don't want to listen to your inner voice telling you the truth.  And sometimes that truth is saying "move on because you deserve better."

Is it that he's just not that into you?  Truthfully, who cares?  It's not your problem.

We only have so much time and if we waste it wondering and worrying about someone else having the ability to direct our lives, including our loves lives, then we are losing valuable time that could be used as open space for someone that does really love you. You can't find that person if you're tied up trying to change someone who will never be with you.

I'm not a relationship expert and really, is there such a thing?  Everyone is vulnerable and that's the great thing.  It's good to give 100% percent of yourself to someone. If they take advantage of it, it's not your fault.  Just like if someone cheats, it's an issue with themselves.

Now-a-days, it seems like people and relationship are disposable so that, with all of the technology, we can unlike, unfriend or block someone is a split second.

Like they say, "if it doesn't come easy, it's not worth having?" Well, I know there are things in life you have to work for but, in the beginning of a relationship if you have ask questions such as my friend did then, I believe that you will ask these questions the entire time that you in the relationship and, this is an indicator that the relationship won't last therefore, why waste time and just move on.

Do you really care if he likes you?

title: Look Younger For Less Money
content:
Look Younger For Less Money

Basic cosmetic procedures that are the least expensive and would be a natural progression after skin care. Compared to products, cosmetic procedures are not a commodity so finding bargain cosmetic procedures may not be a good thing.

We’re talking about wounding the skin, and this doesn’t necessarily correlate with cheaper. However, there is no reason you can’t call around to your local dermatologists or plastic surgeons to find out what the procedures cost.

Then you can compare for yourself. I pick three or four good doctors or medical spas in my area and check their prices, and then I get on their email list. Before long, I get discounted offers of up to thirty percent off their procedures.

It’s worth it to compare and get on their lists. You’ll get weekly emails from all the places you signed up at to compare the prices. You can even call your favorite doctor or spa and ask if they will match prices. They do it all the time!

Botox - You should get Botox as a prevention measure. You may only need ten units or so just to prevent frown lines or lines that may be forming between your nose and eyes.

You can also have Botox used on your crow’s feet (the lines around your eyes). This helps tremendously. If you need thirty or forty units and you can’t afford it all at once, then get ten units every few weeks until you get all areas covered.

The cost varies, but I have paid up to fourteen-dollars a unit. When I got on the doctors’ or Spa lists, I received discounts and now I only pay about nine to ten dollars per unit. That’s a pretty good savings. Some doctors will have a buy two get one free promotion.

Also, there are competing products to Botox. Because they’re competing with Botox, they may be less money. Botox, which is owned by Allergen, has a loyalty program, as well. I recently received a coupon for $100 off the total cost of my Botox!

This program is called BRILLIANT DISTINCTIONS. Make sure you sign up or have your doctor/injector sign you up and every time you get Botox or another Allergan product such as Juvederm, etc. you will receive points towards your next service.

I almost got my most recent Botox for free!

Chemical Peel - A chemical peel is great for removing the surface layer of the skin. The process wounds the skin, which causes it to heal itself by creating new collagen. A chemical peel has different strengths so the cost will vary.

In most states, a chemical peel will cost about $150 to  $200 in a doctor’s office. You’ll want to continue having peels, as they will help create beautiful skin with less texture and, diminish fine lines.

You can do them yourself, but start with a low strength.  Unfortunately, in my learning process, I bought a thirty-percent TCA peel online (I should not have been able to purchase this strength peel without a license), and I did some serious damage to my skin. Damage so bad that, I have to hide the scars every day of my life. It’s not the worth the risk to try and skip ahead rather than to start slow or let a professional do it.

If you want to do your own peel, start with a small patch of skin to see how it will react. I do my own peels every two to four weeks, usually no more than twice a month. You can go to skin-peel.com to find them.

The secret to making peels comfortable is while they are on your face, use your blow dryer on the cool setting or, use a small hand fan pointed at your face. It makes a difference.

Retin-A - A prescription is required, but Retin-A is fantastic!! “Retin-A (tretinoin) is a topical preparation of vitamin A, which has antioxidant properties, just like the vitamin by itself. It’s an acid derivative of retinol (vitamin A).

The important aspect is really the effectiveness of what Retin-A does. Studies have shown that Retin-A can help reduce wrinkles, reduce acne, exfoliate dead skin cells and redistribute melanin. Melanin redistribution results in lighter, more even skin color. Thus Retin-A is often used to treat skin discolorations caused by excessive sun exposure.

If you have sensitive skin, it may not work for you, it may be too harsh, but there are alternatives with lesser concentrations.  I would still try to mix a little every other night in my favorite cream. Just don’t give up. This stuff is amazing!

Get this for less at canadianpharmacy.com.

Teeth Whitening - This makes a huge difference. You could have perfect skin and straight teeth, but if your teeth are stained and dull, no one will notice. If you have bright, white teeth, you’ll look better, and younger, and feel better too.

The cost in my state is about $50.00, which is down from $500 when I first had it done. There are many good ones over the counter too.

IPL-, which stands for intense pulse light or flash lamp therapy, is a noninvasive and non-ablative treatment that uses high intensity pulses of visible light to improve the appearance of birth marks, port wine stains, broken facial veins, rosy cheeks, rosacea, red thread veins of the legs, freckles, age spots, facial lines and wrinkles, and the removal of unwanted dark hair. The procedure is referred to as photo rejuvenation and requires a series of treatments.

The cost nationally runs about $300 to $400. You should only need a few treatments. I have seen it as low as $150 per treatment if you agree to three or more.

Just a quick note: I have been using a product called Black Magic Tattoo remover (it’s a small handheld pulse light machine) to remove a lot of my brown spots on my arms and legs.

It works the same as an IPL machine.  I got it on Amazon.com however, it takes time.

I wouldn’t use the machine on my face though. It’s important to know that brown spots on the body are very hard to remove. The light process takes time. I also add a skin bleach and put a little of my skin peel on each spot too when I do peels on my face.

Dermapen or Micro-Needling – “ Sterile surgical stainless micro-needles pierce the skin leading to apoptosis of cells in the dermis.” “What is Apoptosis? Apoptosis or programmed cell death, is when a cell essentially commits suicide. This process is natural, controlled and routine. Little inflammation is caused.” “The Dermapen uses eleven, 33-gauge micro needles to stimulate the dermis. Needles vertically pierce the skin to enhance rejuvenation results. Small holes are punctured at a rate of 1000/second. This proliferation of the body’s tissue continues to release growth factors from fibroblasts, keratinocytes and monocytes.”

Note: I have had Dermapen about six times and it works wonders. It’s comparable to lasers like Fraxel but without all the down time and expense. Many doctor’s will give you a discount if you buy a package of four or more. You can save hundreds by doing this. I paid $150 per treatment vs. $300 - $350 by buying the package.

Juvederm - Juvederm is an injectable filler consisting mostly of hyaluronic acid. It’s used to fill in areas to smooth out wrinkles and deep folds on the face, and can last up to a year. You can pay anywhere from $400 a syringe to $800. I pay only about $400 - $450 depending on the specials the doctors have. Currently, my doctor has buy one get one free, and I can save the second one for a later time. At first you may need two but, as your own stem cells work, you will need less later.  In my case it lasts about six months.

These are certainly not all of the basic cosmetic procedures available, but these tend to be the least expensive and the least invasive. These procedures really do well with regard to anti-aging and reversing past damage.

They’re also a good alternative to going under the knife. I think one day these products and procedures will be affordable for all of us.

With today’s technology, the need for doctors to perform invasive procedures will diminish so they’ll be more eager to lower procedure costs to attract more patients. My hope is that you get the best skin possible without having to figure out where you will get the money.

Let's face it, many of us want to take care of ourselves but, products and procedures can be a little expensive.

If you would like to find out how I save a ton of money on products and procedures get my book below.  I guarantee that you will save thousands by using these methods.

title: Hormones and Aging Skin
content:
Hormones and Aging Skin

 

Hormones help prevent skin from aging. We have all seen it, or maybe we have been troubled by the changes we’re seeing in our own skin. Thin skin, sagging, dullness, lines and wrinkles (sorry, I had to remind you).

Unfortunately, it happens to everyone at some time. For many of us, we want to look as young as we feel, however, sometimes the outside is not so accommodating to the inside. As we age, especially starting in our thirties and forties, our hormones begin to decline and then diminish over time.

Because of this, our skin becomes fragile, thin, wrinkled and, sags. If you have gone through menopause than you should know that it’s been stated that, we will lose thirty percent of our skin’s collagen in the first five years after menopause! Ouch! You can counter this effect! We can use oral hormones or hormone creams (prescribed by a doctor) to increase collagen support.

I personally, am not one for taking synthetic hormones, as I believe there is an increased risk of breast cancer and other harmful effects. I use a bioidentical hormone cream prescribed by my doctor.

Does it help my skin? I like to think so. For me, it’s been an accumulative effect of bio-identical hormones, peels, topical retinoid, vitamin C serums, sunscreen, supplements, exercising and a semi-clean diet that keeps me and my skin balanced.

It’s important to have your hormones tested routinely, as you want to keep your hormones balanced. I was skeptical at first going on a bio-identical hormone treatment, as I thought if I did, I’d get cancer. Because of reading and hearing that hormones cause cancer (in the wrong context), I fought taking them! Eventually, I opened up my mind and learned just the opposite.

Note: All hormone replacement therapy has some cancer risks. However, if monitored, these can be minimized.

According to many doctors and research, balancing our hormones keeps us from getting cancer instead of the reverse. In fact, it’s having very little hormones that may cause cancer in the first place or, at least can contribute to it.

As I said, I personally would not take oral hormones, but that’s just me and you have to make an educated decision based on what is right for you. At the very least, it’s good to see where your levels are. Okay, back to my point. When you let your hormones fluctuate, it can have a negative impact on your skin. The bottom line is to get your hormones tested and get them balanced, if even just for a better quality of health and skin.

title: How to Look Younger
content:
How to Look Younger

Anti-Aging products are rapidly gaining acceptance. As people want less invasive

beauty procedures they are turning more toward anti-aging products that work well and

that really change their skin.

Time spent on personal appearance takes on added importance as we age. Men and

women want to retain the looks they had when they were younger. Of course, we can’t

go back, but we can age gracefully.

In the short-term, we’ll spend money on anti-aging products that we hope will prevent us

from having cosmetic surgery procedures. We’ll spend money on anti-aging products

that counter the visible signs of aging, thus, as we age, our spending will intensify.

In the long-term, we’ll either have to face the effects of aging skin or give into the

cosmetic procedures we had once hoped to avoid. By using effective anti-aging

products, we can prolong the need for cosmetic surgery and hopefully, get to a place

where it’s not as important as it once was.

The revolutionizing factor is technology. Technology will create more effective products

that penetrate the skin rather than sit on top of it. We already have products that use

nanotechnology, where the molecules are so small the delivery system is able to deeply

penetrate the skin, thus, delivering the optimal amount of ingredients that effectively

make a difference to our skin. In the future, we will use one product with all the

capabilities of many products, instead of the three or four currently sitting on our

shelves.

At this time, knowing that taking care of your skin before it becomes damaged by FREE

RADICALS, such as the environment and the sun, is the best defense. However, if

you’re like me and have damaged skin from too much sun exposure, and you’re now

concerned with how to reverse the damage, I’ll show you how. I call this, “Reverse Engineering your skin.”

We all know that as we age our skin becomes dull and tired. We are at the mercy of our environment and how well we take care of our skin.

There are a variety of reasons our skin ages faster than we’d like and many are due to our lifestyle, diet, heredity, the environment and, our daily habits.

1. The loss of skin elasticity (wrinkles, sagging).

2. Loss of volume (collagen).

3. Bone changes (the bones become thinner).

We all age at different rates. Some of us require surgical intervention sooner than others. In general, we all end up aging about the same. Some of the aging issues that many of us also deal with are thickening texture, thinning skin, dryness, and, brown spots.

The changes that occur below the skin, such as fat loss, bone loss, and cartridge loss at the nose, among other factors, can only be fixed with fillers and fat transfer. Contrary to what cosmetic companies want us to believe, there isn’t a topical product that will create and make a difference in volume.

However, products like Retin-A will help, as it stimulates collagen, but it won’t make significant volume changes like fillers or fat transfer. Retin-A is more for texture and exfoliating as it helps create new skin faster.

Smoking is an absolute skin ager, no matter what age you are and, it only gets worse with time. Facial movement causes lines that become visible after the skin starts losing its elasticity. As people reach their thirties and forties, lines will “appear horizontally on the forehead, vertically on the skin above the root of the nose (glabella), or as small curved lines on the temples, upper cheeks and around the mouth.”(webmd.com/effects of aging of the skin).

So, as you can see, it doesn’t look good for our skin as we age, however, with prevention starting in our twenties and beyond we can create a more youthful appearance by using products with ingredients that actually work. But what about now, you might ask? What about if you are forty and over? “What can we do now?”

In my next post, I will show you how to look younger..

title: How to eat fish safely
content:
How to eat fish safely

If you want to eat fish then eat it safely and here's how:

  • Limit the amount you eat per week to two to three ounces.
  • Eat cold water fish because they are the furthest away from the cities that dump the chemicals, etc. in the water.
  • Eat only fresh and not canned, packaged, processed.
  • Eat fresh salmon and cod.
  • Don't eat fish that live in coastal waters.
  • Don't eat fish that live on the top of the food chain because they have the highest amount of toxins from eating smaller fish.
  • Make sure you cook your fish thoroughly to avoid tapeworms, viruses, parasites and bacteria.
  • Avoid deep fried fish as it destroys the omega-3 fatty acids.  Deep frying also causes free radicals and, adds way too much saturated fat.

*How to eat fish safely

title: Fish Is Not Healthier For You
content:
Fish Is Not Healthier For You

Often we are told to get off red meat and start eating fish instead. But, is fish really healthy?

Fish has vitamins A, B12, D, choline, niacin, omega-3 fatty acids and additional minerals like, zinc, iron selenium and magnesium.

So why wouldn't we eat fish instead of red meat?  With all of it's vitamins and minerals and, lean protein, fish looks like a good alternative to red meat right?

The truth is that fish may be posing health threats and, the risk of eating it may outweigh the benefit.

Because fish travel in the water they ingest the toxins in the water. With that, fish are commonly contaminated in a soup of waste like, PCBs, pesticides, insecticides, industrial waste, lead, and mercury.

I could continue this list however, I'm actually feeling a little sick to my stomach while writing this post because, I was a Vegan and Vegetarian for twenty plus years and, a few years ago I switched to fish.  Right now, I'm not liking what I'm finding out.

I didn't wan't do any research on eating fish because I didn't want to know the truth.  If I did, like I'm writing about today, I would have stopped eating fish.  I thought, so long as I ate wild and not farm raised fish, I was good.

Fish, animals, and humans, accumulate toxins in their fatty tissue.  The larger the fish, the most vulnerable we are because they eat smaller fish and the concentrations could be thousands of times greater.

Here is what Dr. Timothy J. Smith said about eating fish:

"You've heard of Russian roulette? I call this ocean roulette.  And you play ever time you put fish on your plate."

A quick reference on how fish become contaminated:

Fish live in coastal waters, usually near large cities, these cities dump high amounts of toxins and billions of chemicals and these chemicals get passed along to us humans.  I can go into all of the ways that these chemicals are effecting our health but, you get the point by now.

When it comes to farm raised fish, the reason that they are not healthier is because the water they swim in is also contaminated by pesticides and herbicides from runoff.

Back to the wild fish.  Wild fish may be safer to eat because they live in cold water which is further away from cities (coastal waters).  However, it doesn't guarantee how safe they are to eat.

To make matters worse, preservatives are another problem with fish.  Fisherman add them to fish while in travel so they won't spoil or rot.

It's unfortunate that we humans have to ruin food like fish because what fish does provide is a powerful Omega-3 benefit.  The omega-3 fatty acids have the ability to protect against heart disease, prevent blood clots, reduce triglycerides, reduce inflammation, help with arthritis, and, even help with mental health functioning.

Okay, here's the kicker and the last of my bad news about eating fish because, well, what else is there left to say?

Another quote from Dr. Timothy J. Smith:

" The trouble is, when you eat fish, you're ingesting a lot more than omega-3 fatty acids- not just all those toxins."

"But also gobs of saturated fat and cholesterol.  In fact, fish, has just as much saturated fat as beef and chicken, and it raises cholesterol levels just like other animal-derived foods. Not exactly what you'd call heart-healthy."

Need I say more..Fish Is Not Healthier For You.

title: I'm gonna describe loneliness ...
content:
"I'm gonna describe loneliness so y'all who have never experienced it no how I feel"

While scrolling down my Facebook page today, I came across this post from someone I met while on vacation a couple of years ago.  Although we don't know each other that well, we keep in contact like most everyone else on Facebook.

I found her post to be very moving because I'm sure that there are many lonely people in the world and I'd predict that many of us will be there at some point in our lives.

Even if we have a companion now, as in life, we will all end up of alone one day.

The question that I ask myself is "'Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all?"

Alfred Lord Tennyson

With her permission, here is her exact post:

"I'm gonna describe loneliness so y'all who have never experienced it no how i feel you wake up in the morning to your own alarm you take a shower and cook your own breakfast and go to work with no one to kiss good bye at the door you come home to nobody who asks you how your day was and no one to tell it too you take off your fcn bra and get into something comfortable and pour yourself a drink turn on the gut wrenching news to keep up with the hateful world we live in and cook your own dinner during the commercials without missing a thing on the news when you've finished and are ready to sit down and eat you,sit in front of the tv and watch the rest of the commercials and finish by the time the programming,comes back on then you get up and scrape the plate and wash the dish and the pots you used and go back to the tv for more,commercials while you wish you could turn off the tv and have someone to talk to about your day your plans your dreams and there is no one there so you go on face book and make a few status comments about how your day was so stressful and the pain you're feeling from working so hard and all you get back is "likes" so you've cleaned the kitchen and everything is shiney and its time for your bath. You run the water sit in the warm tub and relax with a drink while you soak until your finger tips are wrinkled then you pull the drain plug and step out onto the bath mat and fish for the soft towel while you still have water on your eyes and your hair is dripping wet, you dry your eyes then your hair with the towel and then the rest of you while you enjoy the soothing pleasure of the towel scratching your back since it hasn't never been scratched by a human for as long as you can remember,,you take another towel to dry the rest of your hair and wrap your naked body into the towel you used to dry yourself and go to your bedroom and put on a negligee thinking you want to look pretty just in case that moment might come and you go back to the tv for more commercials because its still too early to go to bed and you watch,tv until you fall asleep and wake up at 3 am feeling to awake to go back to bed until the alarm goes off at 6 am but you do anyway and you toss and turn. Praying for the alarm to go off so you can get up and get ready for work... This is every day no one comes over no one calls everyone thinks you're so happy bcz they see you on Saturday dancing your ass off with some ass hole that just dances with you cz he thinks its a chance to get close to your body who he hasn't even bought you a drink yet and is already thinking about,getting laid while you are buying your own drinks,,,boom then its time to go home you go in your house crash in your bed and wake up to another similar day to enjoy by your self with no vocal sounds from you except a cough or a phone call from a wrong number or to reject a telemarketer how do you define lonely or am i just being selfish?"

title: Overcoming Anxiety Part #2
content:
Overcoming Anxiety Part #2

You Are What You Eat

 "Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food." – Hippocrates

This probably goes without saying because I’m hoping that you already know what you put into your body makes all the difference in the way you feel.  A diet that is rich in sugar and fat may be linked to poor mental health.

We don’t need science to confirm this because anyone who hasn’t eaten for a day or so knows the feeling of being light headed and having a feeling of non-mental clarity.  It’s hard to think right let alone make good decisions when our brains are starving.

A poor diet, energy drinks, large coffees, etc. can have a negative effect.  Caffeine is a stimulant and it’s bad news for someone with an anxiety disorder.

Why?  Because caffeine it gives us that jittery feeling and stimulates our “flight or fight” response and we all know that we have enough of that feeling in public on our own so we certainly don’t need to add to the problem.  Caffeine can make anxiety symptoms worse and can even be attributed to bringing on a full blown panic attack.

Start eating like the quality of your life depends on it!

  • Eat a small breakfast of lean protein, fruit and a small amount of good carbohydrates.
  • Try and eliminate or slow down your consumption of caffeine. If you can’t then try and drink tea for a while until you can.    Believe it or not once you have completely eliminated caffeine your anxiety symptoms may decrease by one-half.
  • Eat small meals throughout the day.  Preferably with proteins like nuts, low fat cheese, low sugar fruits, etc.  Don’t reach for chips, cookies, candy, or the cake that someone brought to work or school for a birthday!  You have to be mindful .
  • Eat as if the food you put into your body is helping you control your anxiety.  Unlike the other way around.
  • Get prepared in the mornings before you leave the house and pack  the days  meals.
  • Choose fruits, veggies and, lean protein before anything else.
  • By all means, stay off sugar! It will raise your glucose and then like the evil thing that it is, it will drop it like a rock leaving you tired, moody and most likely vulnerable to anxiety.
  • Stay hydrated.

Try and make this small change and see how you feel in thirty days.  The point here is to acknowledge that what we put or don’t put into our bodies makes a huge impact on the way we feel and the way we make decisions.

If changing your diet changes at least fifty percent of your symptoms, thus, your life, then why not do it?

It sure beats the alternative of going on medication, being treated by a Psychiatrist and, having to live with anxiety because medicine only treat the symptom and not the cause.

Why not eliminate the causes and be done with it?

To recap eat better because “You are what you eat.”

Overcoming Anxiety Part #2

title: Overcome Anxiety Part #1
content:
What is Your Gift?

How to Overcome Anxiety Part #1.

I’m going to go out on a limb here and say that I believe one-hundred percent that if we knew what our gift was then most of us would be just fine.  Sounds a little too easy doesn't it?  And when I say gift, I mean art, our God given talent or, the reason that we were put on this earth.

I think that most of us have an idea about what we love to do or at least, we have some things that we are interested in however, way too many times, we are preoccupied by ourselves calling it a job, life, or whatever.  Unfortunately, we never get to fulfill our true calling when we don't actively seek our gift and embrace it.

With anxiety disorder, we're not worried about our God given gift but, more worried that we will get into situations that will cause us to panic. What does having a gift have anything to do with anxiety?  Well, it does and here’s my philosophy on why.

Many people are in prison because they either didn’t find out what their gift was or they never did do anything with the gift they were given.  The gift I’m talking about is each persons creativity that’s locked up inside of us until we find it and set it free to light a fire in our soul.

Yeah, some people know what their gift is and it's easy for them.  Some of us have to struggle to find it.  Doesn't matter though, so long as we do.

I’m not talking about painting a Picasso picture or some abstract art.  Although if that’s it for you, then what are you waiting for?  What I’m talking about here is something that motivates you and you're passionate about. Don't ever underestimate passion.  It will free your soul.

Many of us think it’s not possible to have a passion or to even begin to figure out what that is but, I can tell you that anxiety is a fear and it’s a fear of many things and, fear robs of us of all the possibilities that are waiting for us.

What if you replaced fear and anxiety with a passion and a purpose?  It makes a huge difference in your life because instead of worrying about a situation in the future, you are constantly thinking about your passion as it consumes your mind.  You think of ways to expand and you'll see the world as an inspiration to fuel the art that's inside of you.

Let me give you an example of one type of art other than the traditional ones that we all think of.

Writing is my art.  I can’t even imagine going a day without writing because I love it.  I carry a note pad around and at least several times a day, I'm writing down book ideas and inspirational ideas.  I get these ideas because I am open to my passion and my passion feeds itself with possibility instead of negativity.

Once I found what is was that I was completely and utterly passionate about, the anxiety that I suffered from for longer than I care to admit, quietly disappeared.  In fact, it went away and I transitioned from the anxiety screaming in my brain each day to most days not even hearing the voice at all.

How does one find their art? To start, it’s the ability to see things differently than the rest. Each one of us sees the world different than the other and each one of us can use this as a reference to find our passion.  Don't fit into a mold because you are different and it's the only way to find how unique you are.

Find the source of creativity at the same place as you find resistance.  Stop resisting and allow yourself to be open and your passion will have room to enter.

 

Takeaway #1 - Decide for the rest of your life to commit to finding what your passion is and replace anxiety with it.

Overcome Anxiety Part #1

title: The 4 Crucial Anti-Aging Hormones
content:
The 4 Crucial Anti-Aging Hormones

Yesterday I wrote a post about natural hormone replacement.  I wrote specifically about the four hormones that are crucial to anti-aging.

These are, DHEA, Melatonin,  Sex Hormones such as Estrogen, Progesterone, Testosterone and, Thyroid.

Some scientists believe that if we restore these hormones to pre-decline levels, we can reverse the aging process.  They may even prime us for extra decades of life.

Each of the above hormones does a specific job.  DHEA is profound because it's the hormone that has the most influence on the aging process.  It alone could actually extend our life span.

Melatonin manages the body's sleep and awake cycle and, scavenges free radicals.  Which in turn, reduces oxidative stress in our body which then, reduces degenerative disease like cancer.  It's also the body's time clock or aging clock.

Natural estrogen and progesterone combined, help us women ease through menopause.  They also perform as a safeguard for women's health after menopause.

Testosterone replacement can help both men and women with low libido, protect against heart disease (although this is being debated right now), fight osteoporosis (even in men too), increase lean muscle mass, may reverse age related fat accumulation and, other age related disease.

Thyroid affects tens of millions of people.  Millions have a thyroid issue and don't even know it.  Symptoms vary from low energy, difficulty losing weight, low immune system, anemia, heart problems, hair loss, brittle nails, depression, and the list goes on.

I have been on thyroid medication for two years and just recently, I decided I didn't need it anymore.  Ten days later, I was feeling great until I dropped a fork while putting the dishes away and cried my eyes out.

For the next two days, I felt down and I knew something was wrong. That's just not me.  The only thing that had changed was me thinking I didn't need my thyroid therapy.  When I got back on it, my mood was back to my happy self again.  Placebo?  I don't think so.  I need thyroid medicine whether I like it or not.

Of course you will need a blood test to determine what your hormone levels are.  It's almost certain that, if you are in middle-age and beyond, you will need to balance your hormones.

It's true that medical experts disagree about the significance of a Testosterone decline, and whether the health benefits of HRT outweigh the risks.

HRT (hormone replacement therapy) is something you will have to carefully consider for yourself and whether it's right for you.

If you decide to do HRT, please be careful to work with your doctor and not with some unknown source on the internet.  It only takes the smallest amount of hormones to be effective, conversely, the same is true for damage to be done too.

Lastly, if you do HRT, try and do natural hormones.  I do bio-identical which are made by a Compound Pharmacist.  It's important to know that, just because it's a natural hormone doesn't mean that it's without risk.

Here's a little side note that my doctor told me.  When I was worried about taking hormones because of a breast cancer risk or any cancer risk whatsoever, she said "Theresa, you have more of a risk for cancer by not balancing your hormones."  I'm putting my faith in my doctor and in my research.

It makes sense because the longer we live the more exposure we have to the things that cause cancer right? So, if we keep our hormones balanced (they make the biggest decisions for our body) then wouldn't it be true that without them, we have less of a fighting chance.

title: Do you need natural hormone replacement?
content:
Do you need natural hormone replacement?

Does natural hormone replacement have the ability to keep us youthful and disease free for life?

Hormones are substances naturally produced by components of the endocrine gland, ovaries, testicles, pituitary, pineal gland,  and thyroid.  Levels change and influence the aging process.

Hormone replacement can turn back the clock if the levels are stabilized which gives us leverage in our bid for anti-aging.

Hormones are different from vitamins and minerals because hormones regulate the metabolic activity in our bodies.  While vitamins and minerals do the rest of the work. Hormones make all the big decisions in our bodies and they are effective in small numbers.

Correcting hormone deficiencies can play a huge role in our health and in our longevity. The key is to detect and correct hormones successfully.  Hormones can actually reverse many of the mental and physical changes that we see as normal aging.

For example hormone replacement therapy can help with the immune system, brittle bones, muscles loss, memory, insomnia, fatigue, loss of libido, and a lot more.

Hormones help the body become healthier and heal faster so that we can live a better life and live a longer life.

When they say "hormone replacement" they don't mean that all of a sudden you no longer have any hormones circulating through your blood.  What is meant is that, our bodies are making fewer hormones as we age.  In our thirties the decline begins to take place.

Did you know that the gradual deterioration in hormone reduction is already programmed in our genes? As hormones slow down, aging speeds up.  The rate of reduction usually equals the rate of aging.

Here are the hormones I'm talking about:
  • Melatonin
  • Estrogen, progesterone, testosterone
  • DHEA
  • Pregnenolone
  • Thyroid

If we restore these hormones, hopefully at the level of when we were younger, we can slow down or dare I say it "reverse the aging process?"

Each type of hormone is specific.  Currently, I am on a small dose of estrogen, a testosterone cream, melatonin, and thyroid hormone.  Do I feel great?  I'd like to think so. I'm pushing fifty in a couple of months so, yes, I would like to reverse or at the very least, keep disease away.

In the next post, I will breakdown the above five hormones and how they work.  I will also tell you how you can get tested and what synthetic hormones verses hormones means.

Until then, I will ask you.  Have you ever had your hormones tested?

title: WILL YOU GET CANCER?
content:
Everyone will eventually get cancer right?  Cancer is inescapable right? If we live long enough, most of will get cancer right? Wrong!

Trying to rationalize our bad habits will contribute to us getting cancer.  "I may as well eat whatever I want because we're all going to die anyways" is what I heard from a friend at lunch today.  This got me thinking about how we ourselves may actually be contributing to cancer by trying to rationalize our bad habits.

In no way am I blaming anyone for getting cancer here.  Cancer is a terrible thing and I have lost loved ones to cancer and it kills my heart when I hear of anyone being diagnosed.  With all of the money that we have poured into trying to find a cure, it doesn't seem that we're even close.  To me it just doesn't make sense.

Maybe you have cancer genes (genetics) and you have many family members who had cancer in each generation and you think that you may be genetically programmed to get it too.  Although we can't change our genetic makeup, heredity isn't everything either.

I am not a doctor but I do know from the research that I have done when my younger brother had cancer that, lifestyle choices may determine whether we express or turn on the cancer gene in the first place.

The point here is that, if cancer runs in your family, lifestyle choices and prevention could be the thing that keeps the genes from turning on and causing cancer.  Of course there are too many times where someone could do everything perfect and have all the money in the world to fight it and, it's still something their body was going to do.  Breast cancer comes to mind when I think about this statement.

What causes cancer?  

I'm going to give my non doctor version here.  Cancer is a disease made up of an uncontrolled growth of abnormal cells. Somewhere along the way, the immune system gets into trouble or collapses and left alone it can cause chaos.

A healthy cell gets attacked by a free radical and then damages the DNA causing cancer (remember this is the non-doctor version here).  The cell get's reprogrammed and unless the DNA is quickly repaired then, well, the cell will never be the same.

Cancer takes some time as it doesn't happen over night.  It goes through initiation, promotion and then progresses.  I have also found in my research that once its detected, it has doubled approximately 30 times and has about a billion cells.

Did you know that cancer is always being created in our bodies and its also always being destroyed?  It's when we have too many free radicals and not enough anti-oxidants to zap them is when our immune system runs amok.

There are tests that you can get from specialized doctors and one is to check your levels of oxidative stress.  This is a blood panel that measures three levels of free radical activity.  I won't go into all the things that are tested because it's pretty extensive however, talk to your doctor if you want to get this blood test as it shows where free radicals are punching holes in your antioxidant armor and, when that happens, you can get cancer, and other degenerative diseases.

With the results your doctor can put you on a good supplement and diet program to hopefully reduce inflammation which seems to trigger the beginning.  I'm not saying that when one has cancer that supplements and diet are the cure (it certainly is good for you) but, what I am saying is that, if you could prevent it before it happens with these things, then who knows?

What prevents cancer?

So our body prevents cancer in two ways.  First, it helps prevent cancer cells from forming and then it removes those cells that slip past our defense system. These are systems such as DNA repair, antioxidants, enzymes, immune support, etc.

It's important to keep our immune system in the best possible condition so that it can perform the necessary tasks of destroying cells before they become defective.

Immune health is crucial to cancer prevention and our longevity. If we minimize our exposure to immune suppressing factors like pollution, bad fats, sugar, pesticides, toxins, hormones, radiation, etc. then our immune system will have a chance to protect us back.

title: Do we need to add supplements to our diet?
content:
Do we need to add supplements to our diet? If you want to live longer than you do!

I eat pretty clean.  Lot's of veggies and I don't consume a lot of animal products.  I wouldn't think that I need to add supplements to my diet.

Maybe a more valid point would be, if mother nature intended for me to have the right vitamins and minerals, they would already be included in the foods that I eat.  Especially when I eat a wide variety as it is.

The truth is, you should add supplements to your diet if you want to fight disease and have a longer life span.  Diet alone can't do this.  With supplements, we get the extra boost needed to have a better quality of life.

Put in another way, I once read that "supplements are to humans what fertilizer is to plants."  That statement makes sense doesn't it?  So the question is, water, sunlight and grow? Or, water, sunlight, fertilizer and thrive?

So, a good diet does the body good.  A good diet with supplements makes the body thrive!

If supplements are so important, how did our ancestors survive without supplements?  If you look back, most didn't live that long.  Sure, even if we don't supplement and we have a poor diet, genetically, we can survive into our 40's and 50's.  However, if we eat a optimum diet with supplementation, we may be able to live until we are 100 years old!

I don't wan't to live to be whatever age if I don't have a good quality of life. I've been to nursing homes plenty of times and it was heart breaking to see people sitting in wheel chairs all lined up against the wall.  To me, I felt like they were just stuck there until it was time to die.

I know we are all going to get old and we're all going to die but, it's the way that we're going to do it that is important.

It's important that you don't just start taking random supplements because some can have adverse effects on your health like, taking iron if you don't need it, etc.

I would advise that you talk to a professional.  Maybe a nutritionist.  I'm not sure if doctors know about nutrition these days as they are probably overloaded as it is trying to keep up with our general healthcare requirements.  You will also need a blood test.

I have created a "Better Health/Anti-Aging Supplement Guide" that I use and I swear by. You can download it from the link below.

I'm not some fanatic meaning, I don't believe that we have to take handfuls of supplements.  We just need some basic ones and I've put the link below if you want to check them out.

As always though, please check with your doctor before starting a supplement program because they also can interfere with medication.

So the take away here is eat a variety of nutritious foods, cut out the saturated fat and sugar, and supplement your diet for a healthier and longer life.

title: DO YOU REALLY NEED TO EAT MEAT?
content:
DO YOU REALLY NEED TO EAT MEAT?

Meats have a reputation of being the best source of protein.  Sure they supply all the amino acids that our bodies need but, are they the best protein source?

We can't make these amino acids on our own. The bad part of eating meat is that you're also getting saturated fat, cholesterol, pesticides, hormones, and other substances that harm your body.

We all know that saturated fat and cholesterol harm the heart by clogging and hardening our arteries.  This gives way for heart disease and other ailments.  Pesticides and other toxins weaken our immune system and put stress on our organs.

Did you know that meat has little to no fiber?  We need fiber to clean out our digestive tract. If we don't clean it out, we increase the workload for the kidneys, liver and colon.  These three organs are responsible for cleansing our bodies.

I was a Vegan for almost twenty years, now I eat a bit of fish and some dairy.  So basically, I'm not defined as even a Vegetarian, even though 95% of my diet is fruits and vegetables. Maybe I have conditioned myself to think this way but, I can't go without a ton of vegetables daily.  I absolutely crave them.

This blog post isn't about converting anyone into being a vegetarian nor is it about all of the reasons that meat is bad for you.

It's about telling you how you can have an alternative to meat sometimes.

So when I was a Vegan, people would always ask me "how do you get your protein?" I heard this all the time!  The bottom line is that meat promotes the aging process and you can get all of your protein from other healthier sources such as plant proteins that are better for your body.

Grains, fruits, beans, and vegetables are naturally low in protein.  By eating them in combinations your body gets a balanced supply of amino acids without risking a protein overload, because, more protein is not better for your body.

While animal protein raises cholesterol, vegetable proteins have been shown to lower cholesterol.  Also, there is a higher amount of calcium in plant protein which gets absorbed into your bones to be stored rather than being neutralized by amino acids from meat. So it's probably wise to say that as we get older, meat contributes to poor skeletal health and more importantly, may contribute to osteoporosis.

Not counting soy, no single plant food supplies a complete protein.  Meaning that, no plant provides all eight amino acids needed for our body.   Even one amino acid deficiency is enough to stop our cells from gathering or assembling all the proteins needed for our bodies to grow and heal.  This is what's meant when we hear about cells building proteins by joining amino acids to form chains.

Here's a quick overview of why you might consider adding plant based foods to your diet:

  • Grains and beans are complementary plant proteins.
  • Contrary to common belief, you don't have to have have complementary proteins at the same time or same meal.
  • Feed your body a variety of of complementary plant proteins on a regular basis therefore, you will optimize all of the amino acids you'll need.
  • Plant based foods are a way for your body to renew itself.
  • Plants are low in fat, high in minerals, vitamins, phyto-chemicals, and fiber.
  • You won't get protein overload which hurts your body over time.

One note to mention here.  Be careful of where you buy your plants as most are corrupted with pesticides and chemicals that can do more harm than good.

You can spend money on your health now by prevention, thus buying organic or spend your money on managing your health later when it may be too late.

Yes, organic food costs more and that's really unfortunate that we have to pay more money to eat cleaner food.  I say shame on the food industry however, for the time being, it is what it is and unless you wan't to grow your own (and good for you if you do), then, buy organic so that your organs don't have to be overloaded by cleaning your food.

DO YOU REALLY NEED TO EAT MEAT?
