title: The Five Mistakes That Make Women Look Older
content:
The Five Mistakes That Make Women Look Older 

And How To Correct Them!

 

The Five Mistakes That Make Women Look Older. Besides not smoking, drinking too much or, eating too much sugar, a lot of the way we age is in our own hands!  Yep! I said it. We can control a lot of the way we look by our daily routine.

Of course we are going to age and yes, genetics are a big factor however, we can either turn on genes by what we do or don’t do or, we can overcome them and look as young as we feel.

Are you aging yourself faster than you need to?

The Five Huge Mistakes Women Look Older And How To Correct Them!

#1.   Not using Sunscreen, Vitamin C Serum, Eye Cream and Moisturizer.   #2.  Not using Retin-A or an alternative Retinoid and, Not Doing Skin Peels to  Create Collagen.   #3.  Not Eating a lot of Vegetables and Plant Foods throughout the day, Every day!   #4.   Not Supplementing Correctly and Consistently.   #5.  Not Lifting Weights and Not Gaining Muscle Tone.   Okay, technically that’s ten things that most women don’t do that ages them fast however, I didn’t want to overwhelm you into thinking I want you to do a bunch of steps that are not practical!

Life’s too short to be rigid.

Aging is going to happen however I think it’s important to look as good as we feel. If you only do these five (okay ten) things consistently, I promise your skin, face, and body will look at least ten years younger within three to six months! I dare you to take the challenge! Here’s your CHEAT SHEET BELOW! You didn’t think I would just tell you and not give you the resources did you?  One more thing before we get started!  There is no need to spend a lot of money to look good! I’m going to get right to it and tell you where to get the best products (that actually work) for the least cost and that take the least amount of effort. ­­

Five Aging Mistakes:

  #1.   Not using Sunscreen, Vitamin C Serum, Eye Cream and Moisturizer:  

On my face I use L'Oreal® Paris Advanced Suncare Silky Sheer BB Face Lotion SPF 50+ - 1.7 oz.  It can be bought for about ten dollars and found at any CVS or Walgreens.  I used to use one for about $50.00 and it felt and worked the same way. Don’t forget one for your body too.

Vitamin C Serum is used to brighten and even-out your complexion.  It’s also used as an antioxidant and as a barrier for pollutants, etc.  It works amazing!  I use the Vitamin C 20% Serum + Ferulic Acid & Hyaluronic Acid for maximum Anti-Aging! 100% Safe & Effective!  It’s a highly concentrated solution to Repair, Protect, & Prevent Skin Aging. No Parabens or oils!  Stimulates Collagen and neutralizes Free Radicals, 1 oz / 30 ml from Cosmetic Skin Solutions LLC.  I get it online at Amazon for about $28.00.  I used to use one that cost $150 that didn’t even come close to this one.

It’s really important to use an under eye moisturizer that is specifically for eyes.  Honestly, just go to your local CVS or Walgreens and look for one that is for the eyes.  It makes a huge difference.  Make sure to use it twice a day and watch how great your eyes look!

It doesn’t matter what brand of moisturizer you use so long as you use it. Even if you think you can’t because you have oily skin, chances are you need it.  Get the one that is for your skin type.  I use Regenerist by Oil of Olay.  I have used ones that cost hundreds of dollars

and I always go back to Oil of Olay because it works.  Just use it daily.  With today’s technology, they’re all good.  No need to be duped into paying a ton for ingredients that we can’t even pronounce.  There are some exceptions like stem cell technology and peptides but to start, just chose one and be consistent.

Many women want to use more natural products with less chemicals and by all means do so.  Just use them consistently!

The above products should last you four weeks (probably longer).  If you add them together, the cost is about $20.00 a week.  It’s important that you use enough of the product too.

#2.  Not using Retin-A or an Alternative Retinoid and, not doing Skin Peels to  Create Collagen.

 

Retin-A is the only thing you will need a doctor’s prescription for and your regular doctor can give it to you.

Here’s the kicker!  Usually insurance won’t cover Retin-A because it’s considered cosmetic and a tube can run about $250.00 but, do what I do and go online to CanadaPharmacy.com and order it there.  You’ll create an account, fax your script and, they will ship it for about $60.00!  How’s that for saving some money?

Retin-A is so good and it will change your face, neck and chest, like nothing you’ve ever used before.  I could go on and rave about it but here’s the definition online:

“Retin-A (tretinoin) is a form of vitamin A that helps the skin renew itself.”

Shall I say more?  I’ve used it for about ten years!  Just talk to your doctor or NP and then get it as fast as you can.  Start off with the lowest strength and move up.  There are alternatives on the market but I think Retin-A is the best (generic too).

Keep exfoliating and turning over those skin cells! KEY, KEY, KEY to younger skin!

I do an at home skin peel two times a month.  Go online and talk to the people at skin-peel.com and they will guide you on what peel is right for you.  It’s literally hundreds if not thousands of dollars that you’ll save by doing them yourself.   Face peels literally only take less than five minutes to do and the results are amazing.  Peels are the second most valuable game changer in my regime, next to Retin-A.  Just two times a month!  How easy is that?

PLEASE, PLEASE!  ALWAYS WEAR SUNSCREEN WHEN USING THESE PRODUCTS.  After all you’re creating new skin!  It’s like a baby’s.  Protect it.

#3.  Not Eating a lot of Vegetables and Plant Foods throughout the day, Every day! 

If you don’t think that a mostly plant based eating plan will change the way you look (and feel for that matter) then I dare you to try it for 90 days!  I’m not saying don’t eat meat if you’re a meat eater (don’t worry) however, try to eat about 80% to 90% vegetables and nuts throughout the day.  Notice how I didn’t say fruit?  Eat fruit sparingly because it has a lot of sugar with the exception of berries, etc.  Follow this and your skin and body will drastically change.

#4.   Not Supplementing Correctly and Consistently.

Supplementing is an excellent way to get you looking and feeling your best.  You don’t need to take loads of them or spend a lot.  Of course, as always, check with your medical professional before beginning any supplement program.

Your skin reflects how healthy you are in the inside so it makes sense to supplement your inside with the nutrients that balance and maintain your body therefore, creating a great body and a younger looking appearance.  Not to mention all of the health benefits too!

What supplements and/or vitamins do you need to be healthy and have great skin?

Vitamins C, D, E, A, K, ALA, B complex, CoQ10 (Ubiquinol), multi-vitamin, Omega-

3’s, and probiotics.

 

Here’s the Supplement Breakdown:

   
  • Vitamins C and E help by reducing the damage caused by free radicals. Vitamin A is needed especially if your skin is dry and flaky but you usually get this well enough through food such as fruits and veggies.  A good multivitamin should have enough A and E in addition to a good diet. (Please consult your doctor before taking A and E by themselves)
  • “ Vitamin B Complex. When it comes to skin, the single most important B vitamin is biotin, a nutrient that forms the basis of skin, nail, and hair cells. Without adequate amounts, you may end up with dermatitis (an itchy, scaly skin reaction) or sometimes even hair loss. Even a mild deficiency causes symptoms.” (webmd.com)
  • “Alpha-Lipoic Acid (ALA) is a very powerful antioxidant. In fact, it’s way more potent than vitamin C or E.  Alpha-Lipoic Acid may turn out to be a super boost for aging skin. What makes it so special, skin experts say is, its ability to penetrate both oil and water, affecting skin cells from both the inside and the outside of the body. Most other antioxidants can do one but not both.” (webmd.com).  I take one twice a day and I can see a secondary affect and that is, I’ve dropped five pounds without trying and my skin is much more radiant.
  • Maybe your doctor has told you to take fish oil or flaxseed oil? If not you should!  In fish oil, the omega-3 fatty acid serves as a skin barrier and also helps to maintain inflammation.  It also supports mental health, promotes cognitive agility and decreases the risk of cardiovascular disease and heart attacks.
  • Ubiquinol Coenzyme Q10 is great as it protects your skin from oxidative stress and helps your skin repair itself. The Co means together and enzymes are the catalyst for all chemical reactions in our bodies.  With this, we couldn’t sustain life!  The problem is, as we get older, we make less and less of it.
 
  • Just eat your green leafy veggies to get your daily Vitamin K. It’s also in your multi-vitamin too.
  • “Vitamin D deficiency has now been linked to breast cancer, colon cancer, prostate cancer, heart disease, depression, weight gain, and other maladies. These studies show that people with higher levels of vitamin D have a lower risk of disease, although they do not definitively prove that lack of vitamin D causes disease -- or that vitamin D supplements would lower risk.” (WebMD/com).  Just get your levels checked to see if you need it.
  • There has been a lot of mixed data about taking a daily multi-vitamin meaning, some are saying that a daily vitamin is useless. However, until they can actually prove otherwise, enhancing your diet with nutritional supplements can get you closer to optimal health.  One of the reasons we may need a daily vitamin is because our soil is not producing as much nutrient rich food.
  • It’s said that most if not all disease starts in the gut! Probiotics provide lots of benefits for your immune system. “When probiotics are abundant in your body, it’s harder for bacteria that cause illness to get a foothold.” (doctoroz.com)

For all of my supplements, I go to Whole Foods and use their brands.  They are very inexpensive and most are plant based.

If you have the ability to, get a blood test to see if and what you may be deficient in.  I was surprised that I needed iron.

DISCLAIMER:  I am in not a doctor or health care worker.  I am not recommending any supplement program.  I am only sharing what has worked for me and what I have researched personally.  Please consult your physician.

 

#5.  Not Lifting Weights and Losing Muscle Tone.  

To me there are two great things about exercising and the first is, when it’s over!! And the second is how my clothes fit.  No, I won’t work out like an athlete or look like I’m 18 again but, I can look tone and so can you.

Lifting weights will change your life.  If you have never or you don’t know how, just get started with what you can lift and move up the weight size.  Do one body part per day.  If it’s too much then break it up by two times a day for fifteen minutes each, five days a week.  Many women think they will bulk up, and I have to say that “I wish” however, women don’t have that kind of testosterone.  As we age, we lose muscle every decade.  We can lift all day and still not bulk up so, lift away and watch the shape of your body change.

You’ll see amazing changes if you are consistent.  Use videos, fitness magazines, Pinterest, Apps, etc.  Just try it and in three months or so, you’ll see a difference in your shape.  Plus, it’s good for your bones as you age.

Quick Recap:  As directed by the product manufacturer and consistently:
  1. Wear Sunscreen, Vitamin C Serum, Eye Cream and Moisturizer.
  2. Use Retin-A and do Skin Peels.
  3. Eat Lots of Veggies, Nuts and Seeds.
  4. Lift Weights.
 

 The Five Huge Mistakes That Make Women Look Older And How To Correct Them!

I wish you all the best!

title: "Resveratrol" How to turn on the Longevity gene
content:
"Resveratrol" How to turn on the Longevity gene

(Make sure to watch the fascinating 60 Minutes video below)

 

"The French Paradox" which suggests that despite a high fat diet and a high consumption of red wine had a low incidence of heart disease compared to Americans.

Most researches agreed that the substance in wine offered the protection.  Even  the American dietary guidelines changed their premise stating that moderate consumption of red wine is beneficial to our health.  Before you go out and drink a whole lot of red wine, keep reading on.

Now scientists have identified the exact substance in red wine called Resveratrol which they believe protects more than just our heart.

They are also stating that Resveratrol in high doses could significantly extend life and prevent a host of other age related illnesses.

If they are right, we could all be taking a pill very soon to add a decade or two to our lives. If what they think to be true about Resveratrol, then this may actually change health care as we know it!

This pill that we will take ( Resveratrol) could delay the inevitable.  It will prevent and forestall many of the diseases that come with age starting at age 50, 60, 70 and beyond.

It's not a wonder drug that will turn a 90 year old into a 30 year old but it will slow the train down at whatever age you are at.  That in itself would have me running out to get it!

We can slow down the death train if you will.  This is how it works.  In almost all life forms there is a SIRT1 Gene. It's normally inactive within us but when it's active it triggers a survival mechanism that extends life.

Red wine is loaded with Resveratrol and found in the skin of the grapes.  The Resveratrol protects the skin of the grapes from fungus and bacteria.

Another way to turn the longevity gene on is to "stay hungry" eating a lot of food turns the gene off and dieting (eating fewer calories) turns it on.  It's called calorie restriction.

Looking a monkeys in a controlled study, the monkeys that took in less calories than the second group who got to eat what they wanted, looked younger, had fewer health problems and lived longer than the "chunky monkeys."  Pound for pound the lighter monkeys do much better.

A hungry life turns on our genetic survival switch and appears to lead to a longer life. So there is a survival advantage for to live on a calorie restrictive diet.

I have to say that I am going to try this however, as I write this it's about lunch time for me and I'm starving just by thinking that I will restrict my calories but, it's worth it to try it as I like to do things that keep me healthy and not fad diets and supplements, etc.

Let me know what you think and you'll try it.

 

See the 60 Minutes Video Below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qNanExS_bos  

Do you want to look and feel younger? Do this and have a life that will keep you happy and healthy for a lot longer than the average woman.

title: HORMONE INTERUPTERS AND AGING
content:
HORMONES INTERRUPTERS AND AGING

I will start with pesticides and how they affect our hormones.  Many of the most widely used pesticides are known to copy estrogenic hormones.  This is because they firmly bind to hormone receptor sites in the body.

Endocrinology strange things are happening to our bodies, moreover to our younger youth.  Although some may deny that there is a connection between pesticides and hormone related issues, however, the fact is, even in minute doses, they can cause abnormal functions of our immune system, reproductive system, and central nervous system.

For example PCB’s are in the environment and can act like thyroid hormone.  I myself was recently diagnosed with thyroid disease and so was my mother, sister in law, friends and co-workers.  I have wondered if there is something causing this other than our own natural deterioration.  When most everyone you know is on the same medication with the same diagnoses, I believe something is happening and, some questions should be answered.

Then there is Dioxin in bleached products we consume which depletes sperm production and does other harmful things.  Nonylphenols that are added to plastic also mimics estrogen.  I can keep going and add to the list but you get the picture.

Don’t forget, the government and corporations used to tell us that asbestos, PCB’s and DDT were all deemed safe and effective, yet all of these chemicals have since been banned. (http://www.collective-evolution.com/2014/09/13/chemical-found-in-colgate-total-toothpaste-linked-to-cancer/)

So, I am not writing this to create fear, nor do I want you to live in a bubble, that’s not the point.  What I do want to convey is for you to understand that certain chemicals and pesticides disrupt the endocrine system.  This is the system that balances out our hormones.

In upcoming posts, I will give you ways to avoid these while not having to live a rigid life while trying to do so.

title: Supplementing and Living Disease Free
content:
Supplementing and Living Disease Free

Our bodies renew themselves 24/7.  Just trying to keep up with our bodies every day wear and tear is hard enough but, the process can go into overdrive because of injury or an illness.  We know that our body is trying to renew and heal itself by way of symptoms that we get when our body is not okay.

We are receiving a message that there is damage and we better pay attention to it.  Our cells try and patch or replace bad cells.  It’s easy to see the outside of the body heal like when we get a cut or a bruise and it heals.

We can’t see our insides heal so other than symptoms, we really don’t know if our bodies are okay.  For heart disease, cancer and other degenerative diseases, symptoms may not show themselves until it is too late.  That’s why it’s important to be proactive instead of reactive when at that point; we have little to know control.

To extend our lives, we must get rid of cellular damage and while doing so, we must super charge our healing system.  In three steps we can protect, repair and regenerate our cells.  Again, as long as all three of these are functioning properly we are renewing our cells.  If one of these goes array, then our cells become weakened.

Did you know that free radicals attack our cells so much that the damage they do shortens our lives and kills us rapidly?   Our cells can withstand a massive amount of punishment from free radicals on their own as long as we have enough antioxidants to neutralize them.

If our antioxidants falls below where they are supposed to be, then the free radicals gain the momentum to do us harm.  A few billion hits hear and a few there and then Bam! You have major cellular damage.  If this happens your cells won’t be able to reproduce which in turn ages you and causes death.  The best way to avoid this is to be in the protection mode by supplementing our diets.

Antioxidants are like worker ants for our bodies.  We need essential nutrients and we need phytochemicals.  Essential nutrients are what we absolutely have to have to wake up and stay alive.  These are: A, C and E (antioxidants), antioxidant minerals such as copper, selenium and zinc.  These minerals scavenge free radicals.

Next is, essential fatty acids and amino acids.  These do double duty by being an antioxidant and strengthening our membranes so we can fight viruses.  They are not made by our bodies so we have to get them from our diets.  Unlike essential nutrients, phytochemicals are not required for survival.  However, the nutrients that we get from plants are essential in order to protect ourselves from a degenerative disease.

We have cells like T lymphocytes and macrophages that digest free radicals.  They get rid of viruses, bacteria, allergens, and pollution.  They do this before trouble begins.  Thus, we have the protection mode.  Next is the repair defense mode. From fixing minor dings to replacing entire cells, the repair must occur rapidly and efficiently.

The slower the rate of repair the faster we age and die.  The rate of repair must be the same as the rate of damage.  There is an exception to repair and it’s our DNA.  When we damage our DNA, it’s a direct damage to our genetic code and, without this being intact, a cell can’t do its job to repair or replicate itself.

When this happens, the message to our body becomes scrambled.  A failure like this translates to aging and death. Regeneration is when a cell dies and our body replaces the cell with an exact replica. Renewal is our bodies healing system.

title: THE ANTI-AGING WAY TO EAT (Part #2)
content:
THE ANTI-AGING WAY TO EAT (Part #2)

With today’s American diet, we may be losing the battle to create cell renewal by eating processed foods, pesticides, foods whose vitamins have been depleted, saturated fats and sugar.  These foods create free radicals and little nutrition to our cells.  Foods like meat, dairy products,  fried foods and, fast foods, taste good and, they satisfy but, they shorten our life.

To counter the effects of the American diet and, to provide us with the necessary nutrients to our cells, it is advisable to eat a low-fat and vegetarian diet and, supplement with vitamins and minerals.

Our cells are where everything that goes into our mouth ends up and, they have a purpose even if we are not mindful at the time we are shoving a donut down the hatch.  If our cells could talk, they would not allow us to eat unhealthy, but instead, guide us as we eat, in the right direction to optimize our cells.

Until they can talk, it is up to us to improve our diets therefore, improving our life span.  We may be able to live to 100 and beyond without degenerative disease if we make an effort to.

Allow me to give you a few examples of how some of what we put into our mouths can have some pretty detrimental effects to our cells.  Let’s take wine for example.  I love wine and I probably drink too much of it.

Alcohol hurts our cells.  Our livers can clone cells to keep up with it (in moderation) but, when nerve cells die, and then we produce no more.  If our kidneys had their choice, they would ask you to drink only purified water because they already have to filter out the entire body, by consuming tap water; they have the added job of having to fight off toxic chemicals, etc.  The pancreas has to handle the sugar in our bodies.

It doesn’t like it when we pour down loads of processed sugar. We have immune cells called lymphocytes and they need fewer animal fats and more essential fatty acids.  They need this so they can strengthen our membranes.  They protect against viruses.  So, it’s wise to pass over the butter, margarine and hydrogenated oils.

Not to worry however, I am not saying you have to avoid eating, drinking (oh and breathing), but, the goal is to reduce free radicals and to avoid chemicals as much as you can to live a longer and more healthy life.

We just don’t want to overload our bodies to the point or to any point, that it becomes overloaded at any given time.  The renewal way to eat is to choose grains, legumes, fruits and, vegetables.  We must lose foods from animal sources as they invite heart disease, cancer and many degenerative diseases.

I was surprised when I had my heart checked and told my heart doctor that I was eating wild fish, now, after being a vegan for many years.  I thought he would be happy for me because I had come to believe that fish is excellent for our hearts, brains and bodies.  To my surprise he said, “There is no beneficial reason for me to eat fish.”  He explained that fish was being pushed as an alternative to red meat eaters, and that was better for them, however, for me, it was healthier to continue on a vegan diet.

Who knew?  It’s mind boggling how you hear one thing and then shortly after it’s the opposite.  Who knows what to believe these days?  With that being said, I like to give more weight to things that make common sense that to some scientic facts that come along.

It would seem like more common sense and more healthy to eat a plant based diet rather that our red meat, processed, French fried diet that Americans are living on now.  We can’t act like its not ruining our arteries, because deep down inside we know the truth so why delay?  Pay now or pay later.  But, one way or the other, we will pay the price of bad eating with poor health.

title: THE ANTI-AGING WAY TO EAT (Part #1)
content:
THE ANTI-AGING WAY TO EAT

Once you understand that you must consume antioxidants and adequate supplies of nutrients, you will have the knowledge to create meals that include the essentials required to renew your cells.  There are about six nutrients that will accommodate the renewal process.  If anyone one these are lacking then the renewal process will slow down conversely, if all of them are highly functioning, the process will speed up with the goal of a healthy and disease free body. These nutrients are:

Amino Acids which are enzymes and enzymes are proteins.  These proteins are building blocks.  It is best to get these by consuming whole grains and beans rather than by consuming meats.  Meat and other animal based products are acidic and they cause free radicals in the body, whereas whole grains and beans do not.  Plant based foods are neutralizers.

Complex Carbohydrates provide energy to our cells.  Again, unrefined, whole grains and beans offer the best quality.  Don’t be fooled by natural sugars because they undermine the cells ability to regenerate by fueling your body with junk instead of clean fuel.

Essential Fatty Acids are the fat vitamins that serve as building blocks for our cells membranes.  They are free radical killers and they enhance our body’s immune system.  Essential fatty acids are used by the body as an anti-inflammatory protector.  Foods like seeds, beans and vegetables have minimal amounts of essential fatty acids however, for the optimal amount needed; we can supplement our diet with flax seed and borage oil.  Fish oil is another good source.

Vitamins and Minerals are needed to help with the chemical process of our bodies.  For example when we talk about antioxidants which are the scavengers that eat free radicals, we are relating to vitamins such as A, C and E.  With regard to minerals, these are cofactors that help our enzyme systems, thus helping our enzymes perform the tasks necessary to renew our cells.

Phytochemicals These are the difference between basic nutrition and super nutrition. They are key factors in preventing heart disease and cancer.  Phytochemicals are only found in plant foods.  The brighter the food colors the better.

There are approximately 100 trillion cells that make up the human body.  The body needs food to generate energy.  Our cells try to stay healthy.  When we don’t take care of them, we are fighting against their natural ability to heal themselves.  They greatly need our help in the process.  Every cell in the body is dependent upon key nutrients.  When we don’t feed our body with the right nutrients and, when key nutrients are not available, a cell may become compromised.

title: What If You Won The Lottery!
content:
What if You Won The Lottery!

I have this little analogy that I tell others when I hear them whine about not having this or that, and why they don’t make more money and how life is not fair. I tell them; you bought a lottery ticket on Thursday and on Saturday your numbers were called.

Each and every one of your numbers matched! How exciting would that be? In fact, you would see your whole life pass before you. Your past, your present and what you hope will now be an amazing future. You have the kind of energy that is exhilarating, the kind that you where you don’t want to sleep or eat, but just dream of how happy you will be. No more worries, you think.

You prepare to collect your earnings, still reeling that you of all people won the lottery. You think how lucky you are when the phone rings and it’s your doctor’s office calling to give you last week’s mammogram results (because now we have to get them each year). You secure your lottery ticket in your wallet, after dreaming of the things you will buy and do with your new found wealth.

In the mean time, your doctor would like for you to come in to the office to read over the results of your mammogram from last week. He never called before, but maybe that’s not so unusual you think. You get to the appointment, you see the doctor and he says he has terrible news.

“You have advanced breast cancer and it’s also metastasized into your lungs and your bones.”

You try to swallow to feel any type of reality that has just left your body, but you don’t feel anything, just a huge hole filled with fear. Your chest feels heavy and you feel your body go limp. He says, “I am sorry.

At best you may have three months to live. You should get your affairs in order.” He asks if he can call your family. “There is nothing at this point we can do to treat it.” Your life just stops!

It’s that thing that hits you out of nowhere on a Tuesday afternoon, like life seems to do. Your doctor pats your shoulder, and tells you to let them know if you have any questions or if there is anything he can do for you.

You get up from your chair in utter shock and despair. You can’t cry because you can’t feel anything. You are so numb you can barely move, but you get yourself up and make it to your car.

After who knows how long, you sit in your car and you begin to talk to God. Your life flashes by and you wonder how you will tell your family the news. You say, “God, how could you do this to me?” “How could you let me die when I am not ready to? I am too young to die.” You begin to bargain with God.

The lottery ticket is the furthest from your mind at this point. You tell God you will do anything if he will let you live. “Let me live to love my kids, my grandkids, let me keep my life. Please don’t let me die, God, I don’t want to die.”

You feel the presence of God in your car and he allows you to know what he thinks about your plea for a moment, and then says, “I will make a deal with you. I will let you live but you have to give up your lottery ticket. You will no longer be rich and I will give you your life back. You must go back to the life you had.”

You don’t blink, you don’t even think twice, and you say, “Yes, yes, yes! I will give up all materials and money to have my life back.”

YOUR LIFE BACK? The one you already have right now. The one you didn’t appreciate when you bought the lottery ticket. The not-so-good life you had when you bought the lottery ticket so you could escape the life you now want back. The one you would give anything to have again.

Would you die for that new life? Or would you give back the lottery ticket to keep the life you have now? You don’t have to die for what is already in your hands.

You have already won the lottery because you have your health and, therefore, you have your life. The gift that no money can buy, and you already own it. You don’t have to wish for it, you don’t have to long for it, you only need to be thankful to have it.

The fortune of health is, therefore, your precious life. Appreciate it, because it won’t last forever, and it too will be gone in a blink. Next time, God may not bargain with you. On this day, you are a winner. Go out and enjoy your prize. You are your jackpot!

No one person’s, or generation’s time is more valuable than the other. Time is just as important to any of us, no matter what age we are. We can go and be who we have always wanted to be, we have a job to do, a calling to enact and a self to become. If you were born to paint, it is your job to be a painter. It is your job to be what you were born to be.

I hope you are where you have always wanted to be, but if not, then ask yourself, why not?

When we're old and near the end, we’ll go home and start again.

Thank you so much for reading this blog and sharing your time with me.  You have enriched my life just because you have allowed me to do what I love.

content:
LONGEVITY AND HAPPINESS #1

 

We are all on one heck of a journey in life, and to make it to this point in good health, and with a hopeful outlook, says a lot about how great we are aging. We need to put the superficial second to the physical and emotional in our lives.

Right now, and from here on out, we should consider our longevity instead of our wrinkles. Think about it, if you could look absolutely stunning, but not have the physical and mental abilities to go with it, would that be better?

Honestly, I would rather be healthy and in shape with some wrinkles and sagging skin than the alternative, and I certainly don’t want to be eighteen and clueless either. Who gets to decide how we are supposed to age and how we should look: the media?

After all, they are the ones that give us harmful feedback about aging in the first place. Who are they to us anyways? When’s the last time your partner or a friend, said you looked bad? If they’re a good friend or companion, they will only see how beautiful you are.

We receive negative information from the time we are young girls, and then it’s reinforced by the media by placing unrealistic and negative expectations upon us. Then we perpetuate the lie by thinking we can measure up to this picture. We can’t achieve this image; no one ever does or ever will, as it’s a lie, and the truth we have inside of us.

We don’t need to go outside of ourselves to validate who we are. We know who we are and we certainly don’t need the media or any magazine telling us. If we could all step up to the plate and admit that we do love ourselves in spite of what we compare ourselves to, just think how content we would become. We are all unique and no one knows you like you do, not even your spouse. This is the key; get to know yourself.

I read a great book in which the author wrote, “Why should other people try to know who you are when you don’t even know yourself?” If you think about that statement, you can see it may be true for you.

We want our spouse, our kids, and our friends to know what and who we are, but do we really know who we are and what we want? For me, I am still trying to figure this out by taking the first step to quick assuming that others know what I am thinking. I am the only one who knows what I am thinking, and I am the only one who knows what I want; therefore, if I want a happier life with others and with myself, I must be a better communicator instead of a criticizer of others.

Life takes work, we all know that, but it doesn’t have to be hard work. Real change and happiness begins with acknowledging the things we can change and ignoring the things that we can’t.

Situations in life may bother us when we can’t change the outside world, but rather than hold in the conflict, ask yourself, “What is it about this part of me that is making me feel this way?” Then ask, “How can I make peace with it?” Don’t forget, there are plenty of aspects of our lives that should make us feel proud, no matter what age you are. Need I go into them?

Look at yourself and see who you will be in ten or twenty years. The goal should be to make peace with aging and choose to be happy. Live in the moment and feel the experience of life, because it doesn’t last very long.

Remember, as you got older, you looked back at pictures of yourself and saw how good you looked and how happy your were, but you didn’t appreciate it at the time? Leave the past and embrace the future.

title: BE YOUR BEST AT ANY AGE
content:
BE YOUR BEST AT ANY AGE

 

Who knows what the fountain of youth is. We all know aging catches up with us very quickly. They say, the older you get, the faster you age. It’s as though we wake up one day and something’s changed!

You’re rocking along in your life looking and feeling great and then suddenly, out of nowhere, reality hits you; you can’t do the same things or look the same as you did. Never fear, contrary to what we have been told, there are things we can do to slow down the aging process and keep ourselves on top of our game, and to, as the say, “age gracefully.”

As far as I am concerned, beauty companies are liars! And we all know they are not anti-aging us, but putting moisture on top of our skin and taking our money. Like the Oil of Olay commercial says, “Do you still have wrinkles even after the wrinkle cream is gone?” The fact of the matter is, we are going to go through many changes with our mind, body and appearance.

Unless you have a fortune to pay for plastic surgery (even that doesn’t look good after a while), you will be like the rest of women. Your skin will age and your body fat will shift to places you never would have imagined.

Your shape will change, your health will change and, suddenly, you will have to make quick modifications in order to work with what you have. Don’t be sad, it happens to all of us.

Is it fair? Heck no. Can we do much about it, very little. The sooner we accept that we will age no matter what, the sooner we can move along and find peace and look our best at any age for the age we are at the time.

If I could tell you one thing that will anti-age you, and it doesn’t cost you a dime, and it’s probably the closest to the fountain of youth you will ever know, would you want to know about it?

Of course you do, so here it is!!! EXERCISE! That’s it! Exercise at least five days a week. You will keep your weight down and your butt where it is, and even improve upon it.

It will keep the blood pumped to your skin giving you a natural glow. People lose thirty percent of their muscle strength between the ages of fifty and seventy, and then lose another thirty percent for each decade thereafter.

Alarming, if you think about it, because we need good muscle tone. We need to work out for balance and mobility as we get older.  It will be even more important to maintain muscle tone as we become elderly.

The reason staying active is more important than ever is it keeps us coordinated so we don’t fall and break a hip, and it keeps the neurons in our brains firing. We need to keep our brains active to avoid dementia and to remember things like names of people, which I am very bad at. You don’t have to hit the gym and run ten miles, or take a cardio spinning class until you pass out.

I’m simply talking about walking, riding a bike, swimming, or taking a dance class, and definitely lift weights to keep your muscle tone and bones strong. Whatever you do, you must also wear sunscreen everyday, as the sun is the number one reason we get wrinkles!

For me, I work out, and I take in one gram of protein for every pound I weigh, and I also take supplements daily. Although I do have my bad habits, like drinking wine daily, I justify this by taking exceptionally good care of myself the rest of the time, as in eating organic, very little carbs and drinking a ton of water.

Don’t forget to go to the doctor yearly, and get your mammogram, too. I know we can only control, and so do, so much to ward off disease and remain energetic and the rest is, just what will be what it is. Our cells are programmed genetically to die at a certain point and there is nothing we can do about that. However, don’t underestimate environment verses biology.

We are in more control of our outcome then we give ourselves credit for. The goal may not be to live forever, but to forever live while we are here.

title: Should you age naturally or get procedures done?
content:
Should you age naturally or get procedures done?

Yesterday I got Fraxel Laser on my face.  I was excited to think that my thick textured skin could possibly be eliminated by burning off the top layer of my skin.

While that may have been exciting to think that I would have nicer and even younger looking skin, when I woke up this morning I looked like I had been in a fire.

Even worse, when the furniture delivery guys came, they had a look of shock when I answered the door!  I could see that they were very uncomfortable so I relieved their tension by telling them I had been in a freak accident!! Okay, I told them that I had laser on my face.  They weren't amused.

I couldn't go to work today let alone out in public because I know people will look and people will ask "What the hell happened to your face?"  I know this because I always do things to my face and people looked and people asked!

One day, I bought a skin peel online, a peel that no regular person such as myself without a medial license should have been able to purchase, and I used that peel and gave myself third degree burns under my eyes, and along my nose.  It was not pretty and I had to hide under a cap for about three months.

Long story short, my journey for younger skin went from trying to get rid of my wrinkles to searching for a plastic surgeon to undo the damage that I had done.

That was about four years ago and there wasn't much the doctor could do.  In time the scars have lightened but in no way are they gone.  A constant reminder that in the wrong hands, chemicals can do some serious damage when you don't know what your're doing.

Did I learn a lesson?  Yep, and that is for most of the stuff that wounds, let a professional do it.  But, will I ever stop anti-aging? No.

Which brings me to the point of this post.  While reading emails this morning an article about Julia Roberts popped up and it was about her stating that women should just be themselves and she said “Perfection is a disease of a nation."  I agree.  I'm not trying to be perfect.  No one can be.  Believe me, I not deluded in thinking that I'm not getting old and that soon, my wrinkles will be beyond repair.

Here is a little more of what Julia Roberts said about women and aging:

“We overlay our faces with tons of make-up. We get botoxs and even starve ourselves to become that perfect size. We try to fix something but you can’t fix what you can’t see. It’s the soul that needs the surgery.”

Roberts, who recently attended an event with her kids, also issued a call to action saying it’s time to take a stand. “How can you expect someone else to love you if you don’t love yourself? You have to be happy with yourself. It doesn’t matter what you look like on the outside, it’s whats on the inside that counts.” (https://www.yahoo.com/style/julia-roberts-fights-beauty-standards-with-a-128644174578.html

Here I am reading this and agreeing with what she says and I really think she is right however, we live in a world where when you hit about 50 as a woman to men, you disappear.  I like myself and it should be each persons prerogative to do what they want but only if they do it for themselves.

Sure you could be married, in a relationship but, you still want to look good and feel good about yourself.

If that means that some of us want to fight aging a little and get some procedures here and there, well, to each her own..

If you don't that's okay too :)

title: Free yourself to let go and grow old compassionately
content:
Free yourself to let go and grow old compassionately.

Call it growing old, getting old, aging, or whatever you want to call the inevitable. Getting old is going to happen no matter what. As we move towards the later years and age, there is something we still have yet to do and that is to forgive.

Forgive ourselves and forgive others, to let go and free ourselves to grow old with compassion for ourselves. Maybe we could have been better wives, mothers, sisters, givers, or whatever you may have regrets about, so what, the past is the past and it no longer matters anymore.

What’s done is done, now it’s about being kind to yourself. If you need to let others know what you now realize, then let them know and ask for forgiveness, forgive them if you need to and move on.

Whatever we have been searching for outside of ourselves is already within us. There is nothing to find out there that we don’t already have inside. I talk to or hear about many older people that are deeply sad about the past. Maybe its things they wished they had done or wished they hadn’t done.

If you are holding in sadness, despair, regret or any other emotion that you may be attributing to unhappiness, then just let it go. If you can do something about it, do it now and do it quick, but don’t dwell on it. Whatever the past was, it doesn’t equal the future and the future is now. There is no reason not to forgive ourselves for whatever mistakes we have made in the past even if they were made only by omission.

In order to grow old, we must not fear growing old. The biggest problem that we all have, both men and women, is fear. We are afraid to live, to be alive, and to risk being ourselves.

Nothing defines us like death, and yet death is not our greatest fear, but genuinely living is the real fear. We have all had bad luck, bad breaks, heartbreak, or things didn’t turn out the way we wanted them, however, we and the world still keep going.

We have to, we have no choice, but we continue to hold in pain and, with every breath, we don’t let it out. We have to let go of pain and release it along with the blame and guilt. If you can’t do this then you owe it to yourself, and to those who love you, to make peace with yourself so that you can fully live and love those around you.

title: Born for What? Part #3 My final
content:
Born for What? Part #3 My final

We are humans with brains, and if one person can create a distinct­ life, then shouldn’t another human being be able to do the same? Why then do some people live in the depths of hell never to rise up, to know anything else?

Life is peculiar­­ sometimes, and, again, one has to wonder if everything is prearranged and we really don’t have any control of who we are or where we will go.

We may think we do by staying busy or getting on with life, but are we really just passing the time instead? Maybe God wanted us all to do something different and what we are doing is exactly what we were put here to do and nothing more.

For some reason I think there is more to this because humans are miracles in and of themselves and, like Stephen Hawking, are we doing all we can with the miracle we were given?

The answer I come up with as to why we don’t become all that we can be is because of fear. I will say that Stephen Hawking has a genius mind that puts most of us at a disadvantage (doesn’t seem right to use that word when we are talking about the horrific nature of living with ALS), however, even with a genius mind, conversely, many of us who have abled bodies and intelligent minds don’t do more than what is necessary.

Stephen Hawking used his mind to overshadow his disability and not the reverse. Many of us don’t do more than we are capable of, and it’s more than just being lazy, it’s that we are afraid of something, something we don’t want to confront so that we can live in a comfort zone, or, even worse, uncomfortably because it’s more painful to try to move beyond it.

Fear is the reason we are not all that we can be. Somewhere along the way, for those of us who are lost, fear was the beginning element in our journey that brought us here. We stay in many situations because of fear, and humans will do more to avoid pain than they will to gain pleasure.  We dream about the life we want but it's sometimes too painful to have.

Do we get off track and become lost souls, while our fate and inner being should be moving another way, the predestined way created by our higher power? Do our outer personalities want something different, thus the reason we lose our way? Which one is right? In other words, are we fighting a losing battle when we are lost?

My cousin and I talked the other day about how concerned we both were about her brother. He was leaving weird messages for my cousin and his daughter and me. His comments were bizarre. Though he may have some kind of mental illness, undiagnosed but clearly realized by others, he was managing himself okay.

He had a job and some sort of relationship with others. But he was still struggling with life, the kind of struggles that I don’t understand, but which others and I can see.

The kind of struggles where you quietly ask yourself, Why does this person continue to make life hard on himself? Why doesn’t he just make the right choice and life would be easy?

I wonder why it’s so hard for those who struggle to exist, who remain lost, to live a life without suffering, to merely make the right choice, the choices I would make to stop the suffering, and the ones I see so clearly in front of me.

I have come to realize that my cousin can’t see the easy choice in front of him, because it’s not so easy at all. Those who may be lost don’t see any choices at all. The only choice they see is the one that keeps them suffering like a perpetual hell they can’t escape from.

For them, they have no choice but the choice to wake up and suffer each day like the one before. Do they want to agonize and endure a life of pain and punishment? I don’t think so; who would want pain and suffering?

Those who are lost create a painful life for themselves and maybe it’s so they can feel at least something. They may procrastinate, resist, lash out and create chaos as a protection method to stay and justify where they are. They are comfortable being uncomfortable; it’s all they know. The un-comfort ability of being in agony has now become their security. The unknown is more painful.

I am tired of seeing people who are lost in this world because it hurts my heart, especially when I can’t help them. People who are born into and go through life with one bad situation after another only to suffer and never see, feel or realize any happiness is a sad thing to watch.

It’s as though the world is a holding pattern for them until they get to the next one. It’s even as though they were accidentally born before their time, therefore, they need to wait this life out in order to cross through and make the transition to do it again only, hopefully, the next one will be a more kind one.

I am hoping this was the case for my brother Chris. I hope he is happy now and I hope his body is perfect. I hope he is smiling now. I know I am not supposed to say that someone who was born wasn’t meant to be born, that’s just silly.

Every soul is important, especially one that had the chance to fight to be born. But is this really true? If this were true, why do we see so much suffering? Is suffering just a thought process, meaning, I am not suffering in my life because I made a choice not to? Are we a product of ourselves, but blame our circumstances.

I know my cousin wants to be loved and I know he wants to be included, but he can’t because every time he is loved and included, he sabotages himself by not respecting those around him, and then others alienate him, therefore casting him back into his dark world.

At this point, he believes it’s others who have the problem and that no one likes or cares about him. What he doesn’t understand is that others do want to include him in their lives but he makes it impossible to the point where, unless those around him want to be miserable, they back away and stay in a place where they can grow, even if he doesn’t want to.

Really, I don’t think he knows or even thinks he is damaging his relationships with others through his words and his actions. To him, he is just himself and, because of this, it’s everyone else who has a problem.

In his world, he is the victim and lives in the victim world. He knows nothing different; therefore he is alone with himself while others avoid him. He is now isolated and lonely and he blames others for what they do to him, the past, the future and for whatever is not creating congruence in his life.

He knows no different and has no tools to be anyone other than himself, the self that no one understands, and not even he does. We all know these types of personalities. They are not bad people whatsoever; they just don’t have the tools, may never have the tools or will not accept the tools to see another way of looking at the world other than their own way.

There are many among us who are not so blessed in life. Even those who have a privileged life can be eluded by events and circumstances in life. Sometimes the delusion is our own self-doing, or maybe it’s something beyond what we can see or comprehend.

We may be born into money, have highly intelligent parents, we can even be extremely intelligent ourselves, however, there is a pulling force from somewhere in the cosmos, somewhere in Karma, maybe somewhere from a past life, whatever it may be or, whatever we may call it, and that something takes a certain percentage of us away and sucks us into a life of eternal defeat and darkness, even if it is in our own minds.

Some of us hide behind things to avoid suffering by creating an illusion in life and we choose never to see the truth, we just exist in life. But, to merely exist is living a life without existence.

By the way, the picture along with this blog post is my little brother Chris who died last June at the age of 44 and on his birthday.  He walked this earth very much depressed and alone and, in the end, I guess God decided he shouldn't suffer anymore.

I talked to him the day before,  I gave him a long hug and told him I loved him.  He died in his sleep that night.  When I got the call, although I had some peace that he wasn't suffering with lonliness and spiritual pain anymore, I still closed my eyes and wish he'd had a better life while he was here.

Peace :) Thank you for reading my three part blog post on "Born for What"

title: Born for what? Part #2
content:
There are those who walk among us who have never been in the right place at the right time. In fact, there is never a right place or a right time for them, as every time and every place they land is not right. They drift, they get lost and they go through life with one setback after another.

Disasters always occur, tragedies happen, and they are always waiting for the next interference that will affect their lives. They wait for it and it always shows up just as they had expected it would. These are the people who live their entire lives never to find happiness and never to feel authentic joy. Contentment is a word they will never know.

They look at others as being more fortunate than they are, and this reinforces their beliefs that they are not good enough and don’t deserve what others have. I once heard someone say that they didn’t deserve Christmas presents. Though this sounds so trivial, this person really meant it.

He is the nicest person with the biggest heart, and believe me, if anyone was deserving, he certainly was. It broke my heart to see someone in such pain who thought he wasn’t worthy of even a single gift. And it’s not the Christmas presents that are the gift, but the love of those who wanted to give him the gifts that mattered. ­Unfortunately, that was my own son.

Throughout the years, I haven’t always had the best life, but I have had a lot of lucky breaks, and I had many people along the way who wanted to help me for some reason or another. I realize that I have been very blessed, and this is one of those circumstances where luck comes in.

For whatever reason I, unlike my brother, have been helped, encouraged and handed things without having to ask. For this, I am very fortunate. I know this isn’t the case for a lot people, and for some they have rough and difficult lives. Sometimes, even when those who are lost and have the support around them, they still flounder and have difficult and troubled lives.

Their lives on earth are troubled and painful. For those people, only they know their pain. We who appear to be strong will never comprehend the pain they are in. We may say, “Cheer up, what’s wrong, why can’t you be happy?” And all they really want is to be all of those things, and in fact, they want it more than we know.

For some of us, it’s pretty easy to get up, get dressed, breeze over to the coffee pot and think about how great our day will be. For others, just getting out of bed and facing the day is daunting, and not because they are depressed, although they could be, but because they see the world as just another day to get through, and they see no joy, have no hope and have nothing to look forward to. It may be all in their thinking, but they are thinking it just the same.

I know that I am fortunate, and I try to never forget that I am very blessed to have good health and to be a person of sound mind. I believe that if you have these two things, you can have a good life. I know through disease, genetics and outside forces, life and circumstances can change this in a blink of an eye.

When we are born, is our fate already decided? Are we born with a blank slate and unlimited choices to become whoever we desire to be? Or, is fate predestined, and we are not born with unlimited choices at all, but only a limited number of choices that have already been laid out for us.

Is it this dynamic that is the reason why some people fall victim to themselves, the environment, disease or something that doesn’t allow them to live in the light, but rather keep them in the dark?

It’s as though some of us live in a constant hell because we are desperately trying to escape who we were destined to be. The question becomes: are troubled lives merely a product of fighting what was meant to be?

One would have to ponder this question because there has to be a reason why others don’t struggle when so many do. Think about it, many people go effortlessly through life, while others have to fight every minute of every day for some sort of existence, some sort of peace and some sort of normalcy.

Part #3 continued tomorrow..

title: Born for what? Part #1
content:
BORN FOR WHAT

Too many times I see people needlessly suffer and I ask myself if their suffering is really necessary. Is it they who cause the suffering, or is it because they have some seriously bad luck? Or worse, has Fate dealt them a terrible hand that their souls must endure until they die, and only then they will have freedom?

Are some people put on Earth to suffer so the rest of us can learn or have meaning? Are they the unlucky ones? We could answer this question by asking another question: Is anything really luck in the first place?

Sure there are times when we may be in the right place at the right time, or we may pick some lotto numbers and with some extraordinary luck, we win. This is luck and it separates real life from luck.

Living a life in conflict is different from luck because many times we battle ourselves and, therefore, we create our own luck. We create fateful situations because of the way we see the world.

I know I get in my own way a lot and it’s because I’m trying to avoid something, and I only end up creating more chaos by doing this. And then the outcome is twofold. If I had a dollar for all the times that I sabotaged myself or made things more difficult than they needed to be, honestly, I would be a millionaire by now, or at least on my way to being one.

I struggle like anyone else, only now I’m more aware of my actions so I try to do it a little less. I’m not perfect and I try every day to do my best; well, most of the time. I know when I’m not doing my best and I know when events beyond my control are actually happening, or whether I’m creating them for justification.

If we are born disabled, that’s not luck. No one would say, “Look at that boy with MS,” or “Look at that lady with cancer, how unlucky.” It’s not because they were unlucky that they got sick, and that we are lucky because we didn’t; it’s a matter of timing, or it’s our genetics already set in motion and it’s beyond our control.

Sure we could argue that we are lucky or fortunate to be of good health. And that I agree with; every second that we are alive and healthy we are lucky because there are so many who are not. But it’s not as though I earned my good health and those like my brother didn’t.

It’s just what was supposed to happen at some point in life. Sometimes life isn’t fair. We can say that we can’t do anything about our genetics; but then there are those who would beg to differ and say that we have absolute control over them.

I disagree to a point because why do kids and babies get cancer and other diseases? They never had a chance. Sure, as we grow and take care of ourselves, we can offset genetics and hopefully avoid turning on the genes that give us cancer, such as not smoking to avoid lung cancer, or staying out of the sun to avoid skin cancer.

But for the most part, we can’t control our fate. My brother had absolutely no control, no matter how hard he willed himself to be well, and in the end, it’s what his body was meant to do. Although it’s totally not fair, it is what it is.

In general, that is a true statement, but it’s not whether we are in the right place at the right time. Things that are meant to be will happen to us and that’s part of life. We are born and we are given life, and our genetics are the program that runs us for the most part.

Luck has nothing to do with it otherwise. When we are pregnant, we don’t say, “I hope my luck pans out and I have a healthy baby.” No, we say, “Please God, let my baby be healthy.” Life, and for the most part of what happens throughout it, is out of our hands.

Because life is not about luck, luck is only a bonus or a benefit; everything else is probably pre-destined. It’s what we do with the life we are given that is the important thing, and this is where our will comes in, along with our choices.

Choice is what separates luck from a life worth living. We can’t change the environment we are born into, or how our genes will express themselves, but we can make choices that mitigate some of the circumstances we are handed.

Herein lies the choice of seeing life as full, and not empty. Look at the physicist Stephen Hawking; he is a beautiful example of a life well-lived under the most extreme circumstances. When life gave him a lemon he made more than lemonade.

Just using that statement seems ridiculous because he didn’t just make lemonade, he made a lemonade machine. He made the most of the situation in the life that he was given. Though he is severely disabled, suffering from a motor neuron disease related to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), and is unable to even talk, he has continued to create a lifetime of accomplishments.

And, on top of it all, he maintains a sense of humor about it. The greatest thing about Stephen Hawking is that he is defined by his accomplishments and not by his disability. We need to remember that we too are defined by what we believe and by what we do, and not for what we have or don’t have, or who we are, but by how we look at ourselves and at the world. If we change our thinking, we can change our life.

Please read part #2 tomorrow :)

title: Where Women Go As We Age
content:
Where Women Go As We Age What are we waiting for? We can’t wait for the future to happen and we certainly can’t live in the past. In middle age and beyond, we have to come to terms with the fact that our choices have changed. For some, the changes may not be good, for others, aging is a time when we can do the things we have only dreamed of. I am inspired by Diana Nyad, the first women to ever swim to Florida from Cuba without a cage. This is extremely inspiring because she was a sixty-four-year-old woman! I am impressed because I know a few sixty-year-olds who believe they can’t park too far away from the grocery store doors because they don’t want to walk that far, let alone, swim for fifty-three hours and one hundred and ten miles. Did I mention this was her fifth attempt? Just goes to show you that we are never too old and to never stop trying no matter what. She made her first attempt when she was twenty-eight, and then in 2011, she tried three times at the age of sixty-two, and again at sixty-three. When she finally accomplished the swim on September 2, 2013, she had three messages for us all: one, we should never, ever give up, two, you're never too old to chase your dreams, and three, it looks like a solitary sport, but it is a team. Doesn’t that sum up what we women are going through right now? Never give up on yourself, no matter what age you are. Enjoy your life, love yourself, and do what it is that feeds your soul. It’s never too late to achieve and live your own personal dream. Just have the belief and do away with the fear. Remember, large or small, your dream belongs to you, and it’s just as important as anyone else’s. We are all living our own dream and we can create a new one if we don’t like the one we are in. Finally, you are never alone. It takes a team, meaning your friends, your family, your spouse, and your faith, especially faith in yourself. Whatever it is around you that lifts you and inspires you is what you are meant to be. It is important to always be mindful, moreover, keep an open mind. You never know when the universe is offering you a gift, and if you are not awake, then you will miss opportunities and the energy will go elsewhere. Too many times we get up, go to work, come home and then go to bed without taking even one second to appreciate the gift of life and what is has to offer us. For those of us who ask why are we here? The quick answer is to take a look around and embrace the gift of life. The experience of being born may be the only reason we are here. We don’t need to create chaos trying to make a bigger meaning than necessary, otherwise we waste the time we have. Sure it’s great if you are able to leave a legacy, but even if you don’t, its okay too. The only wasted life, is a life not lived fully. What does fully mean to you? If we embrace the experience of life without thinking there is an attachment, then we are living a life that is meant to be and, therefore, we receive the blessings that come with it. The one day I will get there is now, and it’s a fork, and you must take the right path that makes you happy. Our culture teaches us that we won’t ever get there; therefore, we are in a constant state of searching and wondering what’s next. I hope you realize your unique beauty, and find the energy within right now, this moment. Every second counts. This day too will pass and you will never get it back. Whatever holds you back now, you will look back in three or four years and realize how fantastic you really were. You will question why you stayed in certain states of mind, relationships, jobs or whatever held you back in the past. As we get older, we tend to think we are more tired, especially women, because we are still thinking we can do it all. There are two kinds of energy. One is when you are tired and don’t feel like doing anything. You may feel a bit down on yourself; you decide you don’t have any energy to engage in life. This energy level is the one when you haven’t slept or you need to eat, so you do and you get your energy back. The second energy level is when you have slept, eaten and still, you have no energy to enjoy life or to engage with others. Perhaps dare I say the word depressed? If you ate more or slept more, you would not find your energy in this state. However, if suddenly your lottery ticket won or your soul mate came into your life in an instant, you would find your energy! This is the kind of energy you should strive to tap into. Wake up as though you have won the lottery of life, and you love yourself enough, more than anyone else could ever. You have the energy to live with excitement, just remove the negativity that is draining it. We need to live in real moments in time. There is a book called Real Moments by Barbara De Angelis. If you take your life and your minutes for granted, then you should read this book. It will not only show you how to feel the sun on your face and the wind in your hair, it will show you how to live like you should before you die and actually feel like you live in the moment. I know this may sound like a circular question, but there is a difference between going through the motions and living in the moment. When you actually live in the moment, time seems to stand still and you feel every experience and sensation happening in that moment. You owe it to yourself to live this way.

title: Finding our purpose at middle-age
content:
Finding our purpose at middle-age

Middle age is when we may begin to (should I dare say it?) feel old. We feel the effects of aging and begin to see our own mortality. This is the part that gets me. Sometimes at this age, it’s hard to relate to those who are younger.

This is when our outward appearance and the perceptions of others begin to change. This can be a scary time. I am going to say what we already know, and that is aging is not looked upon so well. The value placed on appearance in our society far outweighs the value of experience and compassion. Aging can make one feel shelved and unneeded. Even if we may sometimes feel this way, it is certainly not the truth.

You may have grown tired of the relationships in your life at this stage of life. Many women stay in relationships because of the kids when they know full well they are not happy. Sometimes we stay for financial reasons.

We look ahead and fear we will be penniless on the streets and think we should stay for stability. However, many of us believe this is the right time to leave and start a new life. When someone says they don’t want to leave an unhappy situation because of the fear of the unknown, I have to ask them, why don’t you fear what you know?

You already know that you are unhappy, so the unknown can’t be that much worse. At least when you head out into the unknown, you basically get to redesign the life you want. Staying in certainty, but living in misery, is detrimental to living a full life, and that in itself is daunting.

Both men and women fear being alone. Men are more likely to find a younger version, while we are more likely to trade companionship for passion. Women are more likely to put importance on intimacy and connections with those already around them.

Many young people think old people are loners, and yes some are alone, but many are not. Older women and men are becoming less self-centered and more connected to others. I have always believed that we get the love we ask for, so we simply just need to ask ourselves, “What kind of love do we want?” and then put it out there for others to see and feel.

Too many times we hide the truth, because we don’t want others to see the real us because we feel it makes us look vulnerable and needy. Put this kind of thinking aside. Everyone needs to be, and should be, loved in some way or another.

There are different kinds of relationships, therefore, different kinds of love. One type doesn’t fit everyone. The important thing is, love is love. If not in intimacy, then in whatever relationship makes us feel important, needed and respected.

Women do a great job when it comes to loving and respecting others. We deserve the same in return and it's not too much to ask for.

A fear that every woman has probably thought about at least once in her life (even if you are wealthy) is becoming the bag lady or an old homeless woman. We are all aware of the recent Great Recession 2.0.

Many industries, like real estate, construction, and sales, left a lot of us, who wereemployed, displaced, and a significant proportion of working people and their families were forced onto the streets and became homeless, or for the first time, needed to depend on the government or charities to make it.

Maybe you got through it (though, tough), or maybe it didn’t affect you. If you were the latter, than you were lucky.

Maybe we have images of homeless elderly women living on the streets and it scares the hell out of us, creating this fear and mantra in our heads that tells us, “I will never be like that,” all the while the fear creating turmoil in the back of our minds, reminding us that we are just a few paychecks away from being alone, on the streets and penniless.

Not every woman will have enough money for retirement, but don’t worry or panic. Try to put a little away each week. It will make a big difference later on. You pay your payments each month; just create an auto draft into savings each week. Out of sight, out of mind, and ultimately peace of mind.

And remember, DON’T WORRY because worrying is just a waste of your precious time. The antidote to worry is to take action and try to resolve the problem as best you can and then, more importantly, move on.

title: How to handle fading beauty
content:
How to handle fading beauty. The truth is, in middle age, if we don’t begin to find peace while aging, we better get a grip on it now! If you were always a stunning beauty, then you had fifty or more years of outside aesthetics, but know this is not your power.

Your power now has to come from within. If God wills and you take care of yourself, you will hopefully have at least another thirty or forty years to live your truth within. This is when the real living begins.

This will be your new power, which has nothing to do with what’s on the outside. You can’t control that anymore. Maybe this is what we are really afraid of. In middle age, it’s hard to control anything anymore, especially our looks and our bodies.

Just try to maintain your health and remain positive, and the rest will take care of itself. How can you find your new you? Start by being kind and gentle with yourself, just like you would for a friend who came to you for advice about the fears of aging. You would never be as harsh to a friend as you are to yourself. Be your own best friend. It makes a difference.

If you want to find out what great qualities you have other than your looks, ask your partner, your friends, and your kids about how you may have touched their lives in a positive way.

Listen to all the wonderful stories they will tell you about you. They will tell you things that will touch your heart and make you proud of who you are. Notice when they tell you about you, they never tell you about how good you looked, only about how wonderful you are or how unselfish you may be and, how much you are loved by everyone.

It’s a great freedom to let go of the fear of aging. Once you do this, and you really accept it, a great peace will come over you. You no longer have to spend wasted time on ways to stay and look younger.

You will no longer waste time comparing yourself to the younger generation or spending money on things just to keep up with the outside world. Just think about how much extra money and time you will have when you let go and age with kindness toward yourself.

You can now travel and do whatever you want. You are still you only better. Remember there is nothing broken about us because we have aged. We don’t have to fix our face or change our bodies for anyone, only unless we want to for us.

Should you choose to do anything to yourself, do it because it will make you feel better, and because you and only you want to do it. Don’t let your partner talk you into or out of whatever makes you feel happy about yourself.

You will never fool Mother Nature, nor will you outrun aging, but if it makes you feel better than do it! You will never be here again, so make it count for you.

One day we won’t worry about the wrinkles we have, and what we do or don’t look like, because the real worry will be about our mortality. The point here is to live and not burden ourselves about aging, because we will all age and, one day, what we look like will be the least of our concerns.

Our concerns will then be about how to live each day healthy and free from pain. What used to make us uneasy about aging will hopefully only be an issue that we will have let go of so that we may enjoy the time we have left.

Enjoy the time you have left. Go and do everything you want to do without fear, without judgment and without guilt.

title: Are married couples really happy?
content:
Are married couples really happy?

After a deep and dreaded argument with my husband, a fight that seemed to cut much deeper than our regular bickering that we do on a daily basis, I asked my daughter to confirm the answer to a question that I had and that was

“Is any married couple really happy?”  And, “What couple can you name that is happily married?”

As we went through the list of every married couple we know, we couldn’t come up with a single couple that we could use as an example of being truly passionate ( like in the movies) and, it didn’t matter how long they were married.

Now I know that even the healthiest marriages aren’t 100% conflict free.  Couples have to settle into the real world of jobs, bills, kids, etc. but I’d like to think that there are couples who have a lot of passion just as they may have had since day one.

The question I have is, for us women  did we have passion in the beginning and then we lost it  or, no passion at all or worse, did we just get bitter and become bitchy?

I sat down with my husband and asked him what he didn’t like about our relationship and about me.  Of course I was totally expecting him to say “There is nothing wrong with us and especially, nothing wrong with you."

Matter of fact, I don’t think that you shop or go to the spa enough is what I was hoping for.  (Okay, that was me dreaming while he was talking).  But instead, he seemed to be elated that I had finally asked.

Here it comes! “I want us to think alike and I want us to be more on the same page.” Translation: I want you to be less like you and more like me.

Instead of blurting out the word “Whatever” like I usually do, I thought I would try something different and give him what he wants for the next ninety days to see if it makes a difference or it compromises who I am.

So, here is to the next ninety days to stop being me and and be a better wife.

I'll keep you posted!
