title: What is a Compounding Pharmacist?
content:
What is a Compounding Pharmacist?

Recently, my doctor prescribed progesterone, estrogen and testosterone.  She called it into a compounding pharmacy.  What is a compounding pharmacist?

Compounding pharmacists make medications from scratch, using raw chemicals, powders and devices.

Compounding pharmacists allow doctors to prescribe custom tailored medications for their patients which are not available commercially.

It's also good because the medicine is fresh and can be made in small doses and more frequently, to ensure the stability of the product.

Also, compounding pharmacists can create bio-identical products free of dyes, preservatives and other unwanted additives.

How is pharmaceutical compounding different from drug manufacturing?

"Compounding is the preparation of an individual drug to meet the prescriber’s exact specifications and to be dispensed directly to the patient or the prescriber. Pharmaceutical compounding is performed or supervised by a pharmacist licensed by a state board of pharmacy Compounded drugs are not for resale by the patient or prescriber." (http://www.pharmacist.com/frequently-asked-questions-about-pharmaceutical-compounding)

There is one thing that I would like to mention here and that is that many or all of the drugs that compounding pharmacists make have virtually the same side effects as the manufactured ones.

I made the mistake of walking around thinking I was never at risk for breasts cancer because I wasn't taking a synthetic estrogen replacement hormone but, a compounded, bio-identical one.  I thought that this freed me from any risks associated with regards to an increase in breast cancer.

I was wrong! My doctor told me they are virtually the same risk.  So the take away here is that, yes, having a compound pharmacist create a prescription specifically for you is great however, it doesn't free you from the risks associated with benefits.

title: Making peace with aging
content:
MAKING PEACE WITH AGING

 

Making peace with aging, Hmmm? How does a woman make peace with aging in a culture obsessed with youth?

It doesn’t matter what age we are, the issue may change but the focus on aging remains the same. And that focus is how to keep a youthful appearance, stay healthy and remain active.

It’s great for an aging woman to center around taking care of herself, but it’s another matter to obsess about getting old, and, yet, at some point we all do it. I guess you could say I’m lucky because my appearance was never stunning, but I felt beautiful anyways.

I can age graciously by making peace with aging because I was, and still am, an ordinary woman, and that’s okay. It’s the beautiful women I feel for because they seem to be the people having the hardest time with aging.

I really believe when you are ordinary looking like myself, you age more lovely than when you have already reached your peak. However, all women get to the same place eventually, and there is no escaping it. But beauty is all relative anyway.

Sure, I look back at pictures and see my taught skin, my shapely body, my vibrant eyes and the youth that I didn’t appreciate, and I am reminded again how fast life really goes by. With this reminder, I gain a moment of happiness because I also realize I am healthy, happy and look relatively good for my age.

I know life could be worse, so I don’t dwell on the past or question what God has given me. It won’t change where I am today or where I will be tomorrow. It would be wise to make peace with aging sooner than later just in case there is a little more work to do down the road.

Life is a creation in progress, and it shouldn’t be that we are looking and waiting for the end, because that could come for anyone on any day. As we all know, there are no guarantees that we will have another day beyond this one.

I have heard it said that, if you don’t feel old by the time you hit fifty, you soon will. If we live long enough, half of our lives will be spent as older women. I have never thought about it like this before. When I was young, I said I wanted to live forever!

Now, I just want to live a good life and be happy while I am here. I don’t think the answer to getting old is lying about our age, either. Some women add a few years to their age when asked, so that others might say they look good for their age.

How can this make us feel good because we, if no one else, still know how old we really are? Don’t fall into the trap of being afraid to tell your age. Just making it another year is a miracle at any age, young or old.

title: Sugar ages us
content:
Sugar Ages Us

Sugar ages us by accelerating glucose molecules which attach themselves to proteins in the blood.

This is called protein glycation and results in the production of glue like substances called AGEs (advanced glycosylation endproducts).

These accumulate in our blood and stick to organs and tissues.  This in turn creates free radical damage.  This is when wrinkling of the skin occurs and could be a large contributor to Alzheimer's disease and other forms of mental impairment.

Sugar or AGE's also contributeS to heart disease by binding directly to LDL cholesterol by creating free radicals that oxidize LDL.

In general if we consume too much sugar, AGE's causes free radical damage causing accelerated aging, reduced organ capacity, and fast biological aging.

It the latest research on disease and aging, inflammation is the root cause of most disease and what causes inflammation? Sugar!

Try and avoid sugar as much as possible if you want to avoid disease and accelerated aging.

title: Are you losing your hair at middle-age?
content:
Are you losing your hair at middle-age?  If so, you should get your hormones and nutrient levels checked. Low thyroid, poor digestion, nutrient deficiencies such as iron, vitamin B, hormonal issues, aging, trauma and stress can create hair loss and hair thinning. If you are losing large amounts of hair you should get to your doctor ASAP because you may have an underlying disease. Once you get your levels checked and your doctor has made any changes as necessary, some of the suggestions for nutritional therapy are as follows:
  • Flaxseed Oil
  • Biotin
  • Zinc
  • Amino Acid Blends
  • Vitamin B Complex
  • Iron (if needed) I needed iron and didn't even know it!
If you have dull and lifeless hair, use primrose oil, flaxseed oil and vitamin E in the evening. Even poor liver functioning can play a role in hair loss.  If this is your case then consider using a liver supplement. A good therapy for hair loss is a juice therapy of:
  • Carrots
  • Beets
  • Spinach
  • Nettle
  • Alfalfa
Once you get your hormones in check and you have ingested the proper supplements, you can do massage scalp therapy with your fingers, nightly. Genetics, diet and the way you treat your hair can also be the reason you're losing your hair too. I wish I had luxurious long hair but, I look at my mom and she has baby fine hair. I'm thinking that I will probably end up more like my mom. I also color my hair and use the straightener a little too often which makes my hair break. My diet is really good as I only eat fish and vegetables but, I probably drink way too much wine. I know if I changed most of these things, my hair would be in much better shape but the trade off is, I kind of like my life and I can deal with my hair loss because of it. Hope for Thinning Hair "Research continues to dispel the notion that some types of hair loss are permanent. Experts at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine, for example, recently found that people who struggle with hair loss don’t have dead follicle stem cells, as previously feared — just malfunctioning follicle stem cells, which may be fixable. And another study found that mice with deep skin wounds could regrow hair, sparking hope for a cure for baldness in humans." (http://www.everydayhealth.com/womens-health/woman-dealing-with-hair-loss.aspx) I think there will be a stem cell or other therapy coming very soon to stop hair loss.  It may not stop the breakage from the damage that we do to our hair but it may stop the loss at the follicle. I'll be patiently waiting :) **Please only take supplements, etc with the proper supervision of your doctor.

title: MIDLIFE AWAKENING
content:
MIDLIFE AWAKENING

Just when I get my mind right, my body falls apart.

--Anonymous

Whenever I heard the term midlife crisis, I always thought of a bald man in a red sports car. That’s the stereo type we think of when we are younger. Rarely do we think of women in a midlife episode unless you count menopause. However, a midlife crisis can affect both men and women.

Conversely, I think of a midlife crisis the same as I do a nervous breakdown, unreasonable to put that title on anyone. To me it’s more of a midlife awakening, which shouldn’t lead to a crisis. A midlife crisis reminds me of the state of mind an African tribe goes into when they do a ritual.

If we do feel certain undesirable states, then it’s because something is out of balance in our mind, body or spirit, and it’s caught up with us. The crisis could just be all the things you once pushed down that have now come up for you to deal with. The question then becomes, do we deal with it now, or do we push it down for the next fifty years?

If we choose to acknowledge that which we don’t deal with, than we can overcome and, therefore, move through this phase in life with grace and splendor.

When many women face menopause, it is a huge physiological change, which can alter how we look and feel, especially when it comes to our libido. Let’s not mention what menopause does to our emotional state. But is it a huge change, or are we mentally changing, and focused on a new future? Maybe we should change menopause to “future modification.” They used to call it, in my mother’s day, the “change.”

I remember my mom saying, “Oh, she’s like that because she is going through the change.” I didn’t know what that was as a kid, but from the tone of my mom’s voice and the expression on her face, I knew it was not something that was good. I knew not to talk to whomever it was that was changing.

For both men and women, middle age is a time for reflection and a time of transformation. Change is definitely the key word for women. It’s time to make changes and begin to take care of our needs, hopes and desires. We need to stop feeling guilty and feel happy that we can now put ourselves first.

The key words being you first. I’m not talking about being selfish by spending the grocery money on Botox, or the mortgage payment on a new piece of jewelry (although, I do know a woman who does this), but to make it okay to be about what makes your heart, soul and spirit feel free and blissful.

Many women report feeling a sense of dissatisfaction in their lives in middle age, and perhaps this is why divorces peak at this time. Many women don’t like the fact that their role as mother or nurturer has changed. For me, even though I love my adult kids dearly, I am ready for them to start their lives so I can do the same.

Maybe this is where my sports car comes in. I know one thing for sure, when they do move on, I will get that much needed raise, and then I can use it to travel or for whatever I have been waiting for, or to buy that silver convertible Porsche I’ve had my eye on for twenty-plus years. Ahh, I can just feel the wind in my hair and the music turned up full blast (the kind I only like).

I, like many other women, rightfully so, put other’s needs first, and now it is my turn to put me first. This is exciting and thrilling to know I can do whatever I want to now. However, this is probably the time grandkids will arrive, and that’s okay too. I can give them back to their parents whenever I want, and there is the beauty of getting older.

Another issue women have in middle age is uncertainty in the work place. When reaching our fifties and sixties, we have fewer opportunities for advancement. Sometimes this is the age where we are dispensed for lower paid workers. I have a business degree, but I am back in school for a psychology degree because I know the psychology field, like a few others, is a field of work where it’s okay to be older.

It’s okay being older as others may feel you have more wisdom being middle-aged, rather than the reverse in fields like sales, marketing and management. If I were to try and find a new job with my business degree, I don’t think I would have much luck competing with the younger generation.

I know this is just a fact of life and, like I always say, “It is what it is.” Call it age discrimination or whatever you want, but until things change in our society, it’s no use fighting the order. Just move on and keep your energy for better things to come. The important thing in our lives now is to keep moving in an optimistic direction and not dwelling. Dwelling and rehashing what may or may not be is the same as worrying. It’s no good and it gets you nowhere.

Women should continue to reinvent themselves to stay in the game, and when I say game, I don’t mean to try to complete by looking younger. I mean keep yourselves fresh both mentally and physically, and don’t rest on your attainments. We need to remain educated, creative, and keep up with technology, and definitely keep your social skills sharp.

It doesn’t matter if you are a doctor, a hairdresser, a teacher, or whatever. The compassion that you give to others through your kindness and your actions is what will keep good people around you with respect to employment opportunities or otherwise. If you don’t maintain enthusiastic social skills, you are out of the game no matter what you do.

Don’t feel jaded, and try to be excited about your life. We should be amazed by the life we have, the choices we have, and the gift we have in front of us, and that’s ourselves. We are amazing women with so much to offer.

title: The Love Lives of Women
content:
THE LOVE LIVES OF WOMEN

She lies and says she's in love with him, can't find a better man.

~Pearl Jam

Ah yes, the love live of women.  I can’t tell you how many times I hear women say, “There are just no good ones left,” or worse, “I don’t want a man.” Is this really true? Even when in a relationship, married or not, we can get bored.

I’m not saying we need a man to be happy; I just wonder if some women simply settle for not having one. I realize that at middle age, there doesn’t appear to be many single and qualified men out there, and that the men we’re married to have grown to be unexciting and predictable.

I also realize the dating world is a different world out there. I hear stories from women who say men don’t want to commit or are disrespectful. I hear about men having multiple girlfriends and lying to them about seeing other people.

I listen to others say how lonely they are and have settled for mediocre instead of holding out for the right guy. I may not understand, but I feel for those who would like to have a partner, someone to love and to love them, but it’s just not happening. I feel for those who have given up, never expecting to find love at all.

Even those of us who are married, life isn’t always perfect. We go through times of doubt, and question whether we want to be married, too. I think one thing is constant and that is that, the older we get, the more settled we are with ourselves. Therefore, we may be or are okay with not having a partner, and we learn to create our own happiness and, more importantly, we own it and it feels good.

Today, I took lunch to a past neighbor who is elderly and just out of the hospital after hip replacement surgery. She lives alone, has no family, lost her job due to age discrimination, and it is highly unlikely she will ever find another job at her age.

She has no money except Social Security and divides a Dollar General store soup into two meals to survive. I asked her how old she was, and she said she is seventy-six. I asked her if she wished she was married and how it felt be alone. I asked if she was afraid. She told me she would never want to be married for the sake of being married, and if she didn’t have passion for a man, then she wouldn’t want to just exist like a lot of people do.

She also said she was very happy at this point in her life, and then genuinely laughed as though she really was. The teacher has, yet again, appeared through her by showing me that, for all she doesn’t have, she is still authentically happy, while I wake up each day looking for what could be better in my life.

This teacher has taught me to appreciate what I have and to stop looking for more and better. I already have it all, and there is nothing more or better I need. That’s the secret: if you don’t need it, there is nothing missing.

title: Women and Middle-Age
content:
Women and Middle-Age

From a social perspective, women tend to disengage as they get older. We are told or think that we need a hobby to keep us busy, and quietly bow out of society. When past roles and relationships are replaced or lost, we need to replace them with something in order to remain satisfied.

I say be a little selfish and do something extraordinary for yourself! Do something that makes you feel ecstatic once in a while, or better yet, very often! If you don’t know what that is, then begin the journey to find out.

It makes a big difference to do something for your soul rather than something because you need to fill the gap in time. Don’t under estimate how great it feels to jump into a car with your girlfriends and go away for the weekend, just like you did when you were younger. You remember those carefree days, don’t you? If not, it’s time to get back there. We have the opportunity to do that now.

For me socially, it was down to going to dinner with my husband on Friday nights, going with my daughter to dinner once or twice a month, or going with a girlfriend once in a while for, yet again, dinner.

Sure, as a couple we’d go to functions like weddings, funerals, benefits, graduations and all the other events we’re invited to for support of family and friends. I usually spend most of the time reading, working out and working at my job.

I watch my daughter dress up in costumes, and go to pub runs and concerts, and all the things that her age group does. What does our age group do? I don’t want to dress up in costumes and go pub running by any means, but it would be fun to do things spontaneously and out of the ordinary instead of the same old things day in and day out. Maybe that’s another secret to getting older, spontaneity? Have we lost it? Are we and our lives too predictable?

You have to admit, as we get older, we tend to get a little more rigid and structured. When was the last time you just up and went somewhere without a plan or, better yet, forgot everything you needed if you did.

When we were younger, if we forgot something, we would just buy it, borrow it or live without it. We didn’t fret about it; we just had fun because having fun was the main goal. As we get older, unfortunately we create agendas and fun becomes second on the list. We care more about the plan, the map, getting there and arranging what we will do when we are there, and then we lose the ability to be curious and open to new things as we did when we were kids. Remember how fun it was to be a kid and explore?

I can’t help but wonder if the actions I am taking today are preparing me for the ultimate slow down as I age.  I guess you could say I feel as though I am winding down. This is good in itself, but a little sad, as I comprehend slowing down as my mind and body age.

I understand to slow down is to enjoy life, but I liked being busy and feeling like I was achieving something in my younger days, even if it was only because I wasn’t still.

I book a spa day once a month, and look forward (as would all women) to just devoting that day to myself. If we don’t take care of ourselves, who will? If you can, devote one day a week or a month to yourself, and do what you can for yourself.

You will be much happier knowing that you are your own best friend, and don’t feel guilty, because you deserve it. I love doing this alone as much, or more than, spending it with my partner or a good friend.

I am able to center and reconnect with myself. The same self that sometimes is a little too hard on herself at times. I take this time to give myself permission to be okay with where I am in life.

It’s my let-go time. Deepak Chopra says that happy cells create a happier and prettier person. I don’t know about you, but I am happy to make myself happy. If making ourselves happy helps with looking good, even better.

I don’t like bad news and I certainly don’t like to dwell on the negative. I think as middle-aged women, we have a lot of hope and should hold out for a happier future. We don’t have to sit around and wait for an invitation or, worse, do something we are not enthusiastic about, simply because we don’t have another option.

Gone are the days when we were younger, and thought we had to please everyone by saying yes to the no things! At our age, we have a voice and an opinion and we are not afraid to let it be known.

I got tired of dreading Sundays because Monday was just around the corner, and knowing another week was about to begin, only for it to lead into yet another week and month, all the while doing the same things day in and day out. My life was becoming too predictable. Time passes very quickly when you don’t live.

When we let life live us instead of us living it, we only move from day to day, going through the motions and, pretty soon, we say, “Where did all the years go?” We are not living in this mode. Our spirit gets bored and, even if we desire more, we just keep living this way because it’s a habit. So, what is a middle-aged woman to do socially these days?

I felt this way, and I decided to take action and make a change in my life. And here’s what I did. Have you ever heard of a website called meetup.com? Well if not, you should go there immediately. You can join groups of people who have interests similar to yours, and as many as you like.

Just don’t do what I did and join ten at one time, because it’s hard to keep up with them. Join one or two and GO TO THE EVENTS! Don’t just join because they look fun, actually go to the events and enjoy it. If you love wine (which most women our age do, hum, hum), then you can join a wine tasting group and meet like-minded people.

I like cooking, wine, running, writing and a lot of other things, so I joined these groups. Fun! You can also join them with your partner and enjoy good times together or just join them by yourself for some alone time. Now, if they only had a spa group!

title: ARE WE HAPPY AT MIDDLE AGE?
content:
ARE WE HAPPY AT MIDDLE AGE?

Older women are the most dangerous on the planet. We have nothing to lose!

~Jane Fonda

      Are we happy in the circumstances we are in, or have we settled as we have gotten older? Let’s face it; aging requires change. We can’t wear those sexy clothes we once wore, or wear the same makeup as when we were sixteen because that would be ridiculous.

To some, this may seem sad, even like a death sentence, to be forced to make changes that we don’t want to. Unfortunately, and fortunately, we have to make sure we make changes as we age.

Many women don’t change, and they continue to do the same things they always did. Big mistake because you are not the same person you were when you were twenty, thirty, or even five years ago.

Life is moving faster, even when we feel we are slowing down. Look at it like this, you were a teen once and you wore stuff you wouldn’t dream of wearing now. You naturally changed as you went into your twehttp://tinyurl.com/5thingstostayyoungnties. Somewhere along the way, we stopped and got stuck.

We continue to wear the same things and styles, year after year, decade after decade, without noticing that we need an update or, we do notice, but we doing nothing about it. Maybe it’s because we get caught in a time gap. Are we still young, middle age, old or what?

How do we perceive ourselves at middle age? At what point or decade do we make the necessary changes that should be made for our forever changing self?

The short answer is to look back at pictures, and if you have looked the same for the last ten, fifteen, twenty years or longer, you need a serious update. Don’t panic, because it’s not hard to do. A little change in your hair style, color, makeup and clothes, and you are all set.

I look at magazines for women my age, and I find inspiration through catalogs that cater to women over forty. It has served me well. In fact, I change a little too much. I change my hair color at least every six months. It’s probably not the best thing to change so often.

My son was horrified when he knocked on my bedroom door one day to ask me a question, and when I opened the door to answer him, he looked shocked and yelled out, “Mom, your hair is blue!” That statement didn’t even faze my daughter, who was sitting at the kitchen table.

She didn’t even bother to look my way because she knows me so well, and this is not the first time, nor will it be the last, that I shock someone with the things I do to myself. It’s just who I am and I happen to like it. By the way, the blue color was accidental. You see I had blonde hair, and one afternoon I decided I might look better with black hair. It was a funny mistake because the tint in the black dye turned my blonde hair blue (sounds like a country song doesn’t it?).

I didn’t panic; did I mention it’s not my first time? My son, the tattletale that he is, couldn’t wait to call his dad to inform him that his wife has blue hair. My husband, being a person that doesn’t like change, and who had the lucky draw to be married to a person who does, was yet again, baffled by why I just couldn’t be like everyone else and be, in his words, “normal.”

He does admit though, I keep him on his toes because he never knows who he will come home to. I rest my case! Change is a good thing.

title: Don't be afraid of aging
content:
Don't be afraid of aging

Being old was something I was terrified of. Let’s admit it, doors open up for us when we are young. When we’re old, we don’t get the respect we deserve. As much I hated to admit it, it wasn’t the aging that I was running from, it was the fear of the unknown that I could not come to terms with. This is the real obstacle in my aging progression.

I used to be afraid of cancer or a disease that I would die from. Now, after seeing my mother-in-law go from a Friday evening dinner as a relatively healthy and strong women to unable to wake up from a stroke on a Saturday morning, to a nursing home where she could not even feed herself, all within a week or so, made me realize two things:

One, that life is really short so quit living in fear and just start living in the moment, and two, that a nursing home is no place to live. So while we are capable we must use every moment to live and use our bodies.

God sure does show up to teach us just at the right moment; when we are questioning our own existence. In Buddhism they say, “When the student is ready, the teacher will appear.” It’s a sad reminder, and the reality of where we all end up.

I’m not saying anything negative about reputable nursing homes, God bless them, but we all know how depressing they can be.

When I walk in the nursing home I am completely in the moment, deeply grateful and extremely aware of every fiber of my being. I want to run out of there and scream at the top of my lungs about how grateful I am to be healthy, alive, and for the opportunity to walk out of there and be me, the person I have taken for granted lately.

I have the opportunity and the great fortune to leave, and they never will. I feel that I’ve won the lottery of life and they have lost. How beautiful is it to have everything, and to be awakened to appreciate it?

When I walk through the halls to my mother-in-law’s room, I mourn for the people lined up against the walls, left in their wheelchairs to deteriorate until their final day arrives. Seeing it in their eyes as I walk by, while trying not to look into their eyes, I see many wish that that final day will come sooner than later.

I tell myself it’s not fair to get to an age and then be tossed aside. But I know it’s in God’s hands, and I only hope he is taking care of them in his own way,, and I hope they are feeling that he is too.

I see people who were once happy and vibrant, and had the world in front of them as I do now. I realize how close I am to where I will be, and I am stricken with the reality that I better start living with gratitude and appreciation this minute, and not live in a future that may or may not come.

Right now, today is all I have. I need to stop wasting my life fearing my future. I know that one day, I will look back at pictures of my middle-aged self I am so afraid of, and say, “Look how young you really were.”

title: The Importance of Probiotics
content:
The Importance of Probiotics

Inside of us live a vast amount of bacteria.  Without that bacteria we could not remain in good health.

Believe it or not, each of us has several billion!  Yep, several billion and they are divided into 400 species.

Most of the bacteria live in the intestinal tract.  Some of the bacteria keep our health on tract while the others allow us regain our health once the bacteria have been upset.

To help supplement the friendly bacteria, we could use a supplement known as a Probiotic.  A Probiotics meaning is "for life." 

Lactobacillus acidophilus is the friendly bacteria in our upper intestinal tract.  It helps to reduce harmful bacteria, yeast and produces lactase which is an enzyme that we need for digestion.

Bifidobacterium bifidum and B. longum are the friendly bacteria in the large intestine and they do the same as the previous but also, help to produce B vitamins and help our body detoxify bile.

Without bacteria such as acidophilus we would not be able to properly digest our food and absorb vitamins and nutrients.  However, digestion is only a mere part of what probiotics can do.

Here is the list of some of the benefits of probiotics and friendly bacteria:

  • Manufacture B vitamins
  • Enhance our immune system
  • Create the lactase enzyme that is important for the digestion of dairy products
  • They kill hostile bacteria
  • May be active against tumors
  • Help with digestion
  • Reduce cholesterol levels
  • Protect against radiation damage
  • Deactivate toxic pollutants
  • Recycle estrogen and helps with menopausal symptoms

Friendly bacteria has been show to be useful in treatments for a number of ailments and diseases, specifically, cystitis, candidiasis, colitis, irritable bowel syndrome and some forms of cancer and ongoing infections.

When to use probiotic supplements: (Not all but some)

  • Chronic bowel problems
  • When traveling and used against food poisoning
  • After taking (and during) antibiotics
  • For premenopause and menopausal women
  • High cholesterol
  • Chronic acne, skin issues, allergies, arthritis, cancer (with professional guidance)
  • Undergoing radiation
  • For vaginal or bladder infections like cyctitis
  • Bifidobacteria infantis given to all babies (talk to your doctor)

To find a good probiotic, I go to places like Whole foods.  You will find them in the refrigerated section of your supplement isle.

If you can, get the powder and make sure it comes in a dark glass container and NOT PLASTIC!

You should take a probiotic with meals as our stomachs have extreme acids that can kill the bacteria without food.

Check the expiration date and use your probiotic up to that date and then replenish them.

A usual dose is about one billion and ten billion bacteria per day. You can increase this amount to 15-20 billion if you are taking antibiotics however, talk with your doctor as some probiotics can affect the metabolism of certain antibiotics.

Once you open your probiotics, keep the refrigerated because they are alive!

title: The more old you are the faster you get older
content:
The more old you are the faster you get older

Scary isn't it?  I hate to write about this topic but really, I wan't my skin to stop wrinkling!! I know, I did it to myself with all the sun bathing.  I should have listened when they tried to tell me and now all I hear is " I told you so."

I don't need anyone to tell me because I'm paying the price for not listening, believe me!  I bleach my legs from all the sun spots but really, I can cover my legs.  What I can't cover is how much my hands, my face and all the rest of the areas that have to be exposed everyday show how much and how fast I'm getting old.

Sure, I should be grateful for what I have like my son said to me when I was folding clothes one day "I hate my hands" and he said "well mom, at least you have hands." Damn him!! He is right! And at that moment, my nineteen year old son gave me perspective.

Not that I don't have perspective but, I am not always grateful I guess.  He's right!  I should be grateful instead of complaining about how my hands are aging and yes, I should be grateful because some people never make it to my age (50 in a few months) but, well, while writing this post, I'm realizing that...

I should be grateful I have hands and put on a little lipstick and go out to dinner and be happy to be alive :)

title: His Menopause is not your fault
content:
His Menopause is not your fault

I'm about to turn 50 in a few months and although it's kind of scary, it's also a little exhilarating to know that I am at a place in my life where I can start doing things for me.

My kids have grown, I have a little money and, all of the mistakes that I made when I was younger are thankfully behind me!

With that said, I have also gotten my hormones balanced and added a good supplement program to my life.  All of this so that I can offset the side effects of menopause and so that I won't be that dreaded hormonal bitch that women are stereotyped at 50 and above!

I think balancing my hormones has helped me maintain a better quality of life and emotional state so that, I have a good foundation to live happily for the rest of my life.

His Menopause is not your fault.

Let me back up a second and give you a quick story from a couple of weeks ago (don't worry, I'll make it short).

I'm at a spa in Mississippi just minding my own business (which thankfully I do these days). I was laying on the pod chase, in a white luxurious robe, eyes closed, champagne in my hand and waiting for my therapist to come and take me away to my blissful day of pampering.

I began to dose off when the lady next to me says "I don't know what's wrong with my husband, but he's so angry all of the time."  Of course I wondered if she was talking to me so I removed my eye pads and looked to my right.  She was just talking while looking up at the ceiling and I guess she wanted me to listen.

I told her that it was too bad that he was angry at her all the time and she gave me some more back story and I told her that it wasn't her fault that he's angry all the time.  This is when she said, every since he turned fifty-five, he's been a different person.

I let her talk and I felt sad for her because I know that sometimes others want to put the burden of their unhappiness on another person and if that person will take the blame, they will pay a pretty heavy price for someone else's unhappiness.

I also know that if we let others put their unhappiness on us then we should be responsible enough into making them accountable even if that means they are not happy with you.

Let's face it.  People grow apart, people are not the same as they were when they first got married, etc.  Sometimes people get lost and they need to find their balance and when they can't a lot of people tend to look at the person by their side and blame them for being unhappy.

Maybe it's just coincidental that this usually happens for men and women around middle age and we blame it on menopause and hormone inbalance or whatever.  But true to the fact that it happens a lot.

While I've digressed a bit, I will get back to my point of this blog post and that is, not only women go through menopause.  Sure we get the bad wrap and we are held to a different standard then men, men also go through "male menopause" too.

Although a woman at middle age doesn't need me to go into depth about the symptoms of menopause, however, I am fairly sure that most women don't know the symptoms of male menopause.

Here is a short overview on male menopause:

At midlife, just like women, men's hormones begin to decline.   The symptoms manifest themselves with sleep problems, fatigue, less muscle strength, weight gain around the mid section, joint issues, depression, mood problems, panic attacks and a host of other symptoms.

This is also called andropause and is usually noticed when a man is in his fifties.  Men, just like women, can offset the symptoms by getting their hormones balanced and, seeing a therapist if needed.

So if your husband or partner of many years all of a sudden becomes angry at you for being the person that you are, one, don't change who you are for anyone and consider talking to them about seeing a physician to get their hormone levels checked and two, don't blame yourself.  This only creates damage.

Of course, sometimes people are not happy and it's because they are simply not happy and they don't see they have an issue therefore, everyone around them becomes miserable.

It is each person job not anyone else's job to make themselves happy.  When they can't and they won't and it starts to become your problem, sometimes a life worth living is not that life anymore.

title: CHEMICALS AND HORMONE DISRUPTION
content:
CHEMICALS AND HORMONE DISRUPTION

I will start with pesticides and how they affect our hormones.

Many of the most widely used pesticides are known to copy estrogenic hormones.  This is because they firmly bind to hormone receptor sites in the body.

Strange things are happening to our bodies, moreover to our youth.  Although some may deny that there is a connection between pesticides and hormone related issues, however, the fact is, even in minute doses, they can cause abnormal functions of our immune system, reproductive system, and central nervous system.

For example PCB’s are in the environment and can act like thyroid hormone.  I myself was recently diagnosed with thyroid disease and so was my mother, sister in law, friends and some co-workers.

I have often wondered if there is something causing this other than our own natural deterioration.  When most everyone you know is on the same medication with the same diagnoses, I believe something is happening and, some questions should be answered.

Then there is Dioxin in bleached products we consume which depletes sperm production and does other harmful things.  Nonylphenols that are added to plastic also mimics estrogen.

I can keep going and add to the list but you get the picture. I am not writing this to create fear, nor do I want you to live in a bubble, that’s not the point.

What I do want to convey is for you to understand that certain chemicals and pesticides disrupt the endocrine system.  This is the system that balances out our hormones.

title: PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND AGING
content:
PHYSICAL ACTIVITY AND AGING

Engaging in physical activity does the body wonders.  In fact when we exercise, every cell in our body benefits from it.  Working out lowers our blood pressure and makes our arteries stronger.

It also makes our bones stronger, our brains better and, helps our immune system, not to mention it helps maintain our weight goals as well.  I workout daily although my motto is “the best part of working out is when it’s done” it does feel good to have done it.

There is basically three types of exercising and these are cardio, strength training and, yoga/stretching.  Of course there are different types of programs such as, plyometrics, circuit training, high intensity interval training, tabata, crossfit, etc.

These all have value but cardio is the best overall.  Of course you get some cardio from weight training from strength training, it is better to get your heart rate to seventy-five and eighty-five percent of its maximum capacity for at least 20 minutes.

This translates into about 120 beats a minute for the average person.  If you like riding bikes, dancing or fast walking, these can also be beneficial as well.  Of course cardio will burn lots of calories fast.

Lifting weights creates lean muscle mass.  The more muscle mass we have the more growth hormone and other anti-aging combinations we will have.  Not to mention we will look lean and toned which looks asthically pleasing to say the least.

Yoga and stretching improves mobility and flexibility as we age.  It also helps improve strength and we need all of these as we age to prevent injury.  Endorsing both the renewal process and the exercise process, you will endorse a better body both inside and out.  You will also add years to your life.

Of course exercising takes effort.  A lot of people don’t like to exercise or say they just don’t have the time.  If you absolutely hate to exercis--ee, I say do the easiest one that way you will do it.  Anything is better than nothing.

Who knows, after while, you may do more and more as you look and feel better.  If you say you don’t have time then get up earlier or split your workout into two sessions.  Do twenty minutes before your morning shower and twenty quickly before you eat dinner.  You will be amazed how well this works and how fast it goes by breaking it up.

If you think you will fail to eat right, workout and, renew your body because maybe, you have failed many times before, you shouldn't.  Living in the renewal process is simply the way our bodies want us to in order to optimize its longevity.

You don’t have to do it in one big leap, just take your time.  It’s easier to take one day at a time and do your best.  Go easy at first and then the harder stuff will come easier too.

title: Reduce free radical exposure
content:
If you read this blog then you know that I have been writing a lot lately about free radicals and how they can damage our cells and, how they fast forward the aging process.  They also fast forward disease and unfortunately, death. Mother Nature has provided us with all the necessary ingredients to fight free radicals such essential nutrients and plant based foods. Without getting too rigid or making a rapid life change, here are things you can do to reduce your exposure to free radical damage:
  • Eat organic, pesticide free foods.
  • Don’t eat foods or drink anything with dye or additives.
  • Drink only filtered and purified water.
  • Avoid exposure to chemicals (this means perfume and hairspray too).
  • Avoid exposure to pollution. Stay off busy streets when running/exercising.
  • Only get any type of X-ray when absolutely needed.
  • Only take medicines when absolutely needed.
  It’s normal for our bodies to generate free radicals.  They are a by-product of our bodies metabolic functions like when cells use oxygen to transfer food into energy.  Our bodies expect this kind of thing so it is armed and ready to to naturally grab these suckers before they can harm us. What our bodies can't handle is an overload!

title: Supplementing
content:
SUPPLEMENTING

Our bodies renew themselves 24/7.  Just trying to keep up with our bodies every day wear and tear is hard enough but, the process can go into overdrive because of injury or an illness.  We know that our body is trying to renew and heal itself by way of symptoms that we get when our body is not okay.

We are receiving a message that there is damage and we better pay attention to it.  Our cells try and patch or replace bad cells.  It’s easy to see the outside of the body heal like when we get a cut or a bruise and it heals.

We can’t see our insides heal so other than symptoms, we really don’t know if our bodies are okay.  For heart disease, cancer and other degenerative diseases, symptoms may not show themselves until it is too late.

That’s why it’s important to be proactive instead of reactive when at that point; we have little to know control.

To extend our lives, we must get rid of cellular damage and while doing so, we must super charge our healing system.  In three steps we can protect, repair and regenerate our cells.

Again, as long as all three of these are functioning properly we are renewing our cells.  If one of these goes array, then our cells become weakened.  We have already stated that free radicals do the most damage to our cells and that our cells are under constant attack from them but, did you know that they attack our cells so much that the damage they do shortens our lives and kills us rapidly?

Our cells can withstand a massive amount of punishment from free radicals on their own as long as we have enough antioxidants to neutralize them.

If our antioxidants falls below where they are supposed to be, then the free radicals gain the momentum to do us harm.  A few billion hits hear and a few there and then Bam! You have major cellular damage.

If this happens your cells won’t be able to reproduce which in turn ages you and causes death.  The best way to avoid this is to be in the protection mode by supplementing our diets.  Antioxidants are like worker ants for our bodies.

We need essential nutrients and we need phytochemicals.  Essential nutrients are what we absolutely have to have to wake up and stay alive.

These are: A, C and E (antioxidants), antioxidant minerals such as copper, selenium and zinc.  These minerals scavenge free radicals.  Next is, essential fatty acids and amino acids.  These do double duty by being an antioxidant and strengthening our membranes so we can fight viruses.

They are not made by our bodies so we have to get them from our diets.  Unlike essential nutrients, phytochemicals are not required for survival.  However, the nutrients that we get from plants are essential in order to protect ourselves from a degenerative disease.

We have cells like T lymphocytes and macrophages that digest free radicals.  They get rid of viruses, bacteria, allergens, and pollution.  They do this before trouble begins.  Thus, we have the protection mode.

Next is the repair defense mode. From fixing minor dings to replacing entire cells, the repair must occur rapidly and efficiently.  The slower the rate of repair the faster we age and die.  The rate of repair must be the same as the rate of damage.

There is an exception to repair and it’s our DNA.  When we damage our DNA, it’s a direct damage to our genetic code and, without this being intact, a cell can’t do its job to repair or replicate itself.  When this happens, the message to our body becomes scrambled.  A failure like this translates to aging and death.

Regeneration is when a cell dies and our body replaces the cell with an exact replica. Renewal is our bodies healing system.

I'll be sharing more about the renewal process in upcoming posts!

title: ANTI-AGING WAY TO EAT
content:
THE ANTI-AGING WAY TO EAT

 

This is not a diet blog or a blog that will give you specific meal plans.  However, once you understand that you must consume antioxidants and adequate supplies of nutrients, you will have the knowledge to create meals that include the essentials required to renew your cells.

There are about six nutrients that will accommodate the renewal process.  If anyone one these are lacking then the renewal process will slow down conversely, if all of them are highly functioning, the process will speed up with the goal of a healthy and disease free body. These nutrients are:

Amino Acids which are enzymes and enzymes are proteins.  These proteins are building blocks.  It is best to get these by consuming whole grains and beans rather than by consuming meats.  Meat and other animal based products are acidic and they cause free radicals in the body, whereas whole grains and beans do not.  Plant based foods are neutralizers.

Complex Carbohydrates provide energy to our cells.  Again, unrefined, whole grains and beans offer the best quality.  Don’t be fooled by natural sugars because they undermine the cells ability to regenerate by fueling your body with junk instead of clean fuel.

Essential Fatty Acids are the fat vitamins that serve as building blocks for our cells membranes.  They are free radical killers and they enhance our body’s immune system.  Essential fatty acids are used by the body as an anti-inflammatory protector.  Foods like seeds, beans and vegetables have minimal amounts of essential fatty acids however, for the optimal amount needed; we can supplement our diet with flax seed and borage oil.  Fish oil is another good source.

Vitamins and Minerals are needed to help with the chemical process of our bodies.  For example when we talk about antioxidants which are the scavengers that eat free radicals, we are relating to vitamins such as A, C and E.  With regard to minerals, these are cofactors that help our enzyme systems, thus helping our enzymes perform the tasks necessary to renew our cells.

Phytochemicals These are the difference between basic nutrition and super nutrition. They are key factors in preventing heart disease and cancer.  Phytochemicals are only found in plant foods.  The brighter the food colors the better.

There are approximately 100 trillion cells that make up the human body.  The body needs food to generate energy.  Our cells try to stay healthy.  When we don’t take care of them, we are fighting against their natural ability to heal themselves.  They greatly need our help in the process.

Every cell in the body is dependent upon key nutrients.  When we don’t feed our body with the right nutrients and, when key nutrients are not available, a cell may become compromised.

With today’s American diet, we may be losing the battle to create cell renewal by eating processed foods, pesticides, foods whose vitamins have been depleted, saturated fats and sugar.  These foods create free radicals and little nutrition to our cells.  Foods like meat, dairy products,  fried foods and, fast foods, taste good and, they satisfy but, they shorten our life.

To counter the effects of the American diet and, to provide us with the necessary nutrients to our cells, it is advisable to eat a low-fat and vegetarian diet and, supplement with vitamins and minerals.

Our cells are where everything that goes into our mouth ends up and, they have a purpose even if we are not mindful at the time we are shoving a donut down the hatch.  If our cells could talk, they would not allow us to eat unhealthy, but instead, guide us as we eat, in the right direction to optimize our cells.

Until they can talk, it is up to us to improve our diets therefore, improving our life span.  We may be able to live to 100 and beyond without degenerative disease if we make an effort to.

title: A new way to age
content:
A NEW WAY TO AGE

Renewing yourself is your body’s master plan for rejuvenation.  This consists of three important steps; protect, repair and rejuvenate.  Our body’s renewal system prevents disease by protecting the cells and then repairing the damaged ones.  We are given a specific healing system and its mission is to achieve maximum health.

Why do we need an elaborate healing system to renew ourselves?  Because the damage that we do to ourselves and for what our environment does to us, threatens our entire existence.

Renewal is a constant process in our body.  Just trying to repair the everyday wear and tear is bad enough but then, the renewal process must kick it up a notch should we get sick or injured.   When we have an acute or chronic condition, our body kicks into overdrive to repair the damage that has been done.

A good example of how the body can renew itself better is, if you break a bone, or cut yourself or, sustain an injury of some kind.  If you don’t have your renewal system revved up then it may take you a bit of time to heal.

However, if your cells are in renewal mode then you will heal much faster.     In order to extend our life span, we must halt cellular damage and increase our healing system.  To do this we come back to, protecting, repairing and regenerating our cells.  Each one of these should function to its optimal level and if they don’t then, the entire system will fail.

We already know the key to cell renewal is antioxidants because our cells are under constant attack from free radicals.  The damage free radicals do to cells shortens our life which means that we die before we need to due to cellular damage.

“A typical cell is hit by approximately twenty billion free radicals per day.”   So long as we have enough free radicals in our body, we can fight this.  Think about it, twenty billion free radicals hit just one cell! And, we have so many cells.

When you get down to it, why wouldn’t we help our body fight against this mass attack by consuming antioxidants and avoiding the things that cause free radicals in the first place?  See when we let our antioxidants fall below optimal then free radicals have the upper hand.  After a billion hits here and there, now you have serious cellular damage.

This type of damage not only causes disease but it’s the quickest way to aging.  Again, how to counter this is to take in generous amounts of antioxidant foods and supplements.

title: The antidote to aging is renewal
content:
The antidote to aging is renewal.

We are to minimize cell damage created by free radicals and supply our bodies with ample amounts of raw materials to protect healthy cells and repair the damaged ones.  It is important that our bodies replace irreparable and dead cells.

In order to live a long and healthy life we must defeat free radicals.  In a nut shell, this is how free radicals wreak havoc on our bodies:  without going into all the science about atoms and electrons and how free radicals hate to be alone therefore, they grab onto a healthy cell and destroy it; I will tell you that free radicals left unchecked do a lot of structural damage to healthy cells.

When a healthy cell has been damaged by a free radical, the cell can’t function properly and may die, so, it’s important to repair or replace it.

Disease linked to aging is prolonged exposure to free radicals which fast forwards aging.  Free radicals foster disease and also, reduces our life span.  You have to know where free radicals come from in order to avoid and dispose of them.

We will never be able to eliminate them entirely because, unfortunately, even our own bodies create free radicals.  We eat them, breathe them and, drink them.  We are programmed to dispose of them however, when our bodies have more than we can manage, is when we have problems such as health issues, disease or even premature death.

I have a friend who just had a major stroke at 49 and is bed ridden for the rest of his life.  I am not a doctor but I would contribute his stroke to smoking two packs of cigarettes a day, drinking a twenty-four pack of beer nightly, high blood pressure and living a high stress life that did him in.

As sad as his situation is, we have to have some accountability.  My mother has a quirky motto and that is “Do one thing only and do it good.”  While I agree that we shouldn’t abuse our bodies with tons of bad things at once, we shouldn’t do major things like smoking even if it is just one thing.

I say, do ninety percent right and then do ten percent of whatever the heck you want to.  There are things we can do to offset that bad and I will get to that soon.  However, on the flip side, we can’t abuse our bodies most of the time and think our bodies wont make us pay for it.

 Our DNA is very forgiving so long as we don’t abuse and punish it consistently.

What are some of the usual causes of free radicals?  The American diet is a major free radical creator.  A diet high in fat, trans-fat, chemicals, pesticides and radiation can cause free radical damage. Cancer is not the only tragic side effect of free radicals.

Cumulative free radical damage causes or contributes to Alzheimer’s, arthritis, and atherosclerosis, infections, Parkinson’s, Multiple Sclerosis and many other degenerative diseases.   Okay finally, I get to the point here.

How can we lay the foundation for renewal?  We can start with a powerful weapon called antioxidants to neutralize free radicals.  How do we get antioxidants?  By way of nutrients of course.  Our body depends on antioxidant nutrients and antioxidant enzymes to renew itself.  We get these nutrients from food and supplements.

Once we get these nutrients, our bodies can then synthesize them so our body can repair itself.

title: RENEWAL AND THE AGING PROCESS
content:
RENEWAL AND THE AGING PROCESS

Let’s face it; we live in an incredible time.  With advances in longevity research and, biotechnology, one may wonder if the fountain of youth is just around the corner and if not, at the very least, will we be able to live a long and healthy life well over 100 years?

With genetic engineering and stem cell research providing us with the ability to renew and regenerate, we could potentially open the door to a life span lasting way past the hundreds.

As we move closer to finding out what life’s secrets hold, we may find out what the secret is to immortality.  Until we find what that secret is, we should take full advantage of how healthy we can be right now.  We are given approximately 120 years via our DNA.  Why not make the most of the time nature has given us.

This is where Renewal and the Aging Process come into play.  Even though Mother Nature may give us 120 years, it doesn’t mean we will live to be disease free and even make it to 120.

When we renew ourselves we can continue to exist and live a healthy life.  When we renew, we can enjoy good health far beyond the days of our youth.  We can outlive our chronological age and actually reverse much of the damage we may have done in past decades.  It is possible to have a healthy and young body well into our eighties and nineties and potentially beyond.

When we renew our bodies, it is literally a gift that nature has given us to replenish any damage that has been done to our bodies.  It’s through the renewal process that we can protect, repair and withstand what the environment does to us.  When we are younger we have more ability to renew our bodies without having much input in the process.

We can sleep too little, eat junk food, not exercise, smoke, drink too much and still feel fine.  At middle age all of that changes.  We slow down; we feel more tired and, absolutely have to take care of our bodies just to feel good each day.

Just because we turn 50, it doesn’t mean its all downhill for us.   Sure, when we were young we had a free ride and now, the free ride is over.  We shouldn’t panic.  Maybe we watched our parent’s age and it wasn’t so great.

Then, we expected we would age like them and felt we had no control in the aging process.  We see wrinkles and gray hair and, begin to believe we are destined to age and, there is nothing we can do about it.  We think “it’s just a matter of time” before our number is up.  But, it doesn’t have to be this way.  With a little modification, we can live a long and healthy life.

When we put effort into renewing our bodies, the old philosophies are shattered and, so are the popular myths about aging.  We are older and wiser now and, we have the key to good health through the renewal process.  Whether you received a key is up to you to decide if you want to open the door to great health and vitality.  It requires a bit of effort, discipline and a few lifestyle changes but its not anything we can’t have if we want it.

The rewards can be tremendous.  If you consider the alternative to renewal, it’s only a matter of time before disease will set in and your number will be up in one way or another.  We may still live long but the quality will be far different than had we taken the necessary steps to renew our bodies.

When we don’t eat right or we don’t exercise and, we endure emotional stress, it causes our bodies to wear out before their time.  For some, years or decades before they should have to.  We have all seen that 40 year old who looks 60 and vice versa.

Believe me, it’s more than just genetics.  By undermining the renewal process you deny yourself the support your body requires to renew its systems.  If we do our job and take care of our body, our body will do its job and take care of us.

Our body will remain strong for a very long time and we will benefit at any age.  It’s important not to accept a decline in our body’s ability to be healthy.  Contrary to what we are told, it’s not a natural decline.  It’s only natural if we abuse our body and not replenish it properly and, the sooner you begin, the better life you will have.

You are never too old to start taking care of yourself.  Even if you are very old, don’t tell yourself “why bother now.” Now is as good a time as any.  So you may be in your seventies, eighties or even nineties and think there is not enough time to make a difference.

Let me tell you that you can add good quality years to your life.  While you are living and breathing you  can still enjoy what life and the world has to offer.  Yes we will all die but why not live well and be healthy and happy while you are still here.  Why rush it?  Why not make just a few changes or makes some modifications slowly to have a better quality of life?

title: The fantasy of the perfect partner
content:
The fantasy of the perfect partner

Many of us are brought up believing that our main goal in life is not only to be happy and live a content and meaningful life but, to also find the perfect partner and get married. If we do this, then they say, we can be happy so, this is what most of us do whether we have found the right partner or not.

Whether we had two parents or a single parent who drilled this message into us, one way or another, most of us are taught this way of thinking.  We may get this message from the media, the movies, our teachers, friends, or our family.  The dream we learn is to get married, have a family and live happily ever after. It is our nature to be paired with another.

Those fantasies, the same ones that make us expect our husbands, boyfriends, girlfriends, to know what is always on our mind so that they will remember that special holiday without us reminding them or better yet, without them waiting until ten minutes before they come home to grab some cheap flowers that say “You are not that special, but I didn’t want to hear you complain so I grabbed these at the grocery store along with the toilet paper.”

You know, the images we have in our head, the one that stops us when we see a commercial and in 30 seconds condition us to believe that love is all that matters and the perfect mate is all you need to be happy.

If only we could have the perfect one? Oh, and last but not least, the fantasy about us being completed by someone else.  Completed by someone else? Can you imagine that?  As if that’s possible?

I am starting to sound like a sad country song I know.  I can already see the lyrics, girl finds perfect guy, they have the perfect wedding, careers, kids and then boom! He never comes home, she drinks too much wine and, the kids are all messed up!

By generating illusions about finding the perfect partner, we are setting ourselves up for failure.  Even our parents probably didn’t have such great marriages.

The Fairy tale of perfection doesn’t exist.  Who knows?  Will we be or, are we lucky enough to find the perfect person to share the rest of our lives with?  The vital point is that there is no other perfect person for anyone.

That’s why so many people can’t find that special person because the perfect person is a delusion propagated by things outside of ourselves.  We may have painted a pretty picture in our minds of the perfect love but really, you are your own perfect person.  What we need to focus on, if we want a long lasting relationship of any kind is, compatibility.

Sure, at first you may have some chemistry or the relationship is new so you live in the moment.  Once it begins to become comfortable, you begin to see how compatible or incompatible you are.

At this point, you have invested some time so rather than throw the relationship away if you are not compatible, you begin to overlook the many ways that you are not compatible with your partner.

Fairy tales can still exist for some but, for the most part, life is not about idealism, its about real life stuff and sometimes its difficult and sometimes its not so perfect.

title: Coping with Social Anxiety
content:
Coping with Social Anxiety

“About 3.7% of the U.S. population -- approximately 5.3 million Americans -- is affected by social phobia.”  This is the same as Social Anxiety (SA).

“Social phobia, also called Social Anxiety Disorder, is an anxiety disorder characterized by overwhelming anxiety and excessive self-consciousness in everyday social situations. People with social phobia have a persistent, intense, and chronic fear of being watched and judged by others and of being embarrassed or humiliated by their own actions”

Does this describe you completely or even moderately? If so as you can see, you are not alone.  Social anxiety is painful but it doesn’t mean that we have to live with it.

“What others think of you is none of your business”

Do you spend a lot of your time wondering and worrying about what others think about you?  Many with Social Anxiety do.  We wake up and our minds race and we worry about people and situations that may or may not occur in the day.

Even if they are only scenarios in our mind it causes us anxiety because of the “what if” situations we could get into.  It could be trying to create small talk with someone or trying to answer a question but feeling awkward in doing so.  Most people with Social Anxiety are very smart and yet we hide it and we hold it back for fear that we will be judged but then, we create the opposite when we hide our intelligence.

We do get judged somewhat by others because, they see and feel our anxiety.  We then judge ourselves and worse, we compare ourselves to others thinking they are better because they don’t seem to be suffering like we are.  We admire others ability to seamlessly carry on conversations and friendships like we wish we could.

“Am I smart enough, pretty enough, good enough?” Feeling insecure can cause a lot of problems in our lives.  But where did this feeling come from?  When we feel like this our values are not aligned with the way we act.

We over react, we become too sensitive, we may feel inadequate even when we have accomplished many goals and usually, more so than most people.  A method to overcome this feeling is to always be aware of you judging you.  And as soon as that voice creeps up into your head fight it by saying to yourself that “It is only me judging me.

People don’t know you.  It is none of your business what others think of you.”  99% of the time, others are not judging you at all.  Most people are too consumed with themselves.  They are walking around in their own world too.  

     When we have Social Anxiety, one of the things that we think we know about others is what they are thinking.  We shouldn’t get caught up in thinking this because, we have no clue whatsoever what others are thinking. 

Having self-esteem means finding a foundation and a place where you can anchor yourself.  Start by finding something you are proud of about yourself.  We all have special and unique gifts even if we don’t think we do.  Believe me you do too.  No one is better than you.

We are the cause of our thinking and we are also the solution to our problem.  You have heard of mind control.  Why not practice mind control for yourself?  When you understand how your mind works then you can control it.  It’s the loss of control that gets us here in the first place.

If I can offer one tip to help overcome Social Anxiety that is, to know that you can't control the outside and that you can only control you and your thoughts.  Start with a few minutes a day :)

And of course you are amazing too!

title: How to use Aromatherapy
content:
How to use Aromatherapy

Aromatherapy means using essential oils to affect the body.  We can receive the benefits by inhaling, applying them externally and, consuming them orally.

The following are some of the ways to obtain the benefits:

Diffusers dispense micro-particles into the air.  This can be used for respiratory or for elevated mood conditions.

Steam tents are a way to deliver essential oils into our respiratory tract. To do this, boil water and remove from heat and add two to three drops of essential oil like rosemary, lavender, tea tree, eucalyptus, chamomile or, palmorosa.

Put a towel over your head and tent your face over the pot or glass bowl, while capturing the steam along with the oil.  Breathe deeply and be very careful to keep your head high enough as to not burn yourself. Keep your eyes closed and enjoy.

Some say by doing this, we can avoid the onset of a cold, etc.  If at the very least, we relax and feel comfort by doing this.

Floral waters are made by using about ten drops of essential oil added to a sprayer with the purest water you can find.  Four ounces of water to a mixture of whatever oils that you like.  You can spray it on your skin to refresh and relax or, spray it into the air too.

Bathing with essential oils can stimulate your skin, induce relaxation, and provide energy to your body.  The heat of the water helps to penetrate your skin thus, enhances circulation.  Rosemary can actually help stimulate the release of toxins.

Use essential oils in foot baths and add them to your lotion for a soothing and invigorating feel.

Massage oil (my favorite), works oils into the skin. I'm sure I don't need to expand on how oils are used in massage however, massage oils are potent and they should be kept in the range of about 10 to 30 drops per carrier oil.

title: Don't worry.  Be happy!
content:
There’s no cure for growing old, but it’s our attitude that changes everything.

~Huffington Post

     I wasn’t sure if I wanted to write this, because I tend to generalize, and what I worry about may not be what others worry about. Let me start by saying, I try not to worry at all because, one, worrying causes wrinkles, and two, worrying gets you nowhere.

'As Dr. Phil says, “Worrying is like chewing gum in a rocking chair trying to solve an algebra problem.” It is just a waste of time and doesn’t get us anywhere. If we are not careful, worrying can turn into a hobby or, worse, an addiction.

   I know this because my mother worries even when she doesn’t have anything to worry about. She has done this for almost seventy years, so why stop now? She doesn’t know any other way to live and, unfortunately, she doesn’t have the will or the desire to change. She is comfortable in her worries. It’s become her friend.

I decided I wouldn’t be like my mother and, every time I thought about something that might cause me to worry, I would replace the fear with a positive thought. Eventually, I broke the habit that I had learned growing up.

It helps me to have a partner who is the complete opposite. He doesn’t allow me to think about the things I cannot change. He doesn’t want to hear it. He says worrying is making excuses.

There was a time I’d get really mad at him because he never wanted to hear me go on and on with my latest worry or story I had to tell. I mean, I wanted to complain and make assumptions about the world, and he wanted no part of it.

Worrying about things that we cannot change comes from the fear of what we cannot control. Once we understand that we can’t control anything, and we let it pass through us, we can break this cycle. When I can’t let something pass through me because I am so fixated on it, and nothing I do allows it to pass through me, I decide to step back and, like a bullet, let it fly in front of me and dodge it.

Sometimes it’s hard to get something out of our minds that we remain anxious about, so it then becomes comfortable. Don’t get comfortable in worrying. Don’t look for or allow things to occupy your mind 24/7.

We are all going to die and everything else in between doesn’t really matter. Worrying is just stories we keep telling ourselves over and over. Don’t talk to your mind when it’s like this, it’s just trying to keep itself busy by occupying your spirit. Trust me, you have better things to do with your time.

If we put the burden of worrying aside, and go about doing the stuff we are meant to do, just think how much we can accomplish in our lives. So much time is wasted on worrying.

If you are a woman who worries, it’s wise to stop the cycle, because worry turns into anxiety and then your life gets out of control. Right now, we have to be in control. There will always be things we can’t control, and we simply have to accept them and move on. If something catastrophic does happen, just wait it out, it too shall pass.

Truth be told, as we age, a lot will begin to go wrong all around us. There will always be another problem, crisis or issue. And it’s how we respond those problems and issues that will free us from worry. Don’t look for or wait for things to happen. Bad things will happen and, we create what we fear.

There will be deaths, divorce, sickness and other terrible events, so accept them and deal with them as best you can and then move on. We can’t change or stop what is meant to be. We can’t blame ourselves for circumstances that happen, either.

Women tend to blame themselves for bad things that happen, either to them or to those they love. I know I blamed myself when my kids weren’t happy, when my brother died, and when my beloved dog died. I thought if I could have been a better mother, sister and dog owner, things would have been better.

I realize now that my kids and other people choose their own happiness. Disease will overtake people and dogs, and they will die, just like I am meant to. It’s no one’s fault, just God’s will. Don’t think you can change destiny. You are not God, so don’t try to take on the role and just be you, the one and only, unique you and don't worry.

title: MEN DON’T UNDERSTAND US, BUT CARBS DO!
content:
MEN DON’T UNDERSTAND US, BUT CARBS DO!

I walked into my anti-aging OBGYN’s office and there on the wall was a large poster that read, No carbs after 40! Wow, I thought. This is so true, but so wrong at the same time. I love carbs, I absolutely do. I love to bite into creamy garlic mashed potatoes and feel my problems melt away. I love to eat rice and pasta so much that . . . Heck, I can’t, and don’t, want to live without carbs, ever! I tried it once for about a week and, I swear, I had a mental breakdown!

I actually lost it on the fifth day, and then checked myself into a Holiday Inn just so I could get away from my family. I needed space. I needed my fix. My body and my mind were so carb-deprived that I actually thought I was losing it. A little dramatic, probably, but wouldn’t you know, just as soon as I got back to those lovely potatoes, I was the good ole me again, happy and a little round.

 

Remember when you were younger and you could eat anything you wanted and never gain weight? I never thought twice about what food groups I could or couldn’t eat. The more ketchup on the French fries the better. Now, I eat carbs and I blow up. I mean it; I can go a few days on veggies and fish and loose a few pounds, however, just as soon as I put pasta in my mouth, bam!! I have gained weight. It may not be right, but it tastes so good, and it feels so right while I’m eating them.

Carbs know just the right way to make me happy. I long for the days when I could eat whatever the heck I wanted and never think twice about it, let alone feel guilty for doing so. I am so aware of the guilt when I’m eating carbs that I don’t taste them or enjoy them like I should or like I used to. It’s like I just put them in my mouth, then hurry up and swallow, because I feel so bad for eating them. It’s just wrong how we are punished for eating carbs by our scales and the clothing designers.

I have been conditioned by my doctor, the media, and magazines, and I have put conditions on myself to feel bad if I enjoy a plate of macaroni and cheese. When I complain that my muffin top looks horrible, and when I’m reminded of the movie stars who’ve had a baby and, within one week, were half the size they were before they got pregnant because they stopped eating carbs and ate only chicken, my mind tells me to just shut up and enjoy my life!

Our culture (for the moment, at least) looks down on women who eat carbs. As women, we are totally blamed for every pound we gain. I watched one of those housewives shows the other day and one housewife was having a dinner party for another housewife, and she told her chef the only condition she had with the menu was that there were to be no carbs at dinner! So they stay skinny, but they seem so miserable. Really, the only condition is not having even one carb on the menu?

I know it’s better for me to reduce carbs, yet, I still long for them.  I mean, if I am going to eat them, and get that insulin spike that goes along with them, the one that goes straight from my lips to my hips, I better damn well enjoy them. I better savor every bite of those garlic mash potatoes, that pasta and that wonderful, warm bread with olive oil, if I may say so myself.

I know full well that a good bowl of macaroni and cheese, though it may create the most pleasurable experience on my tongue and in my brain, will cause me emotional pain when trying to fit into my jeans or while standing in a dressing room of the department store wondering why I look so lumpy and why my stubborn belly hangs over my belt.

We know at our age, carbs are the villains that keep the weight on us, yet, we still crave and eat them. Honestly, unless you are craving a big boring salad, there is nothing better than the waiter delivering that wonderful pasta dish with a nice glass of wine. Your mood instantly changes when you see your food because, even if only temporarily, you will enjoy every bite you put into your mouth and, for a little while, you will be content.

Men and women are different because we each have different food preferences. Men love meat and women love carbs, it’s just a fact. Why deny it or fight it.

Women apparently eat carbs at a much higher rate than men, and we get the wonderful middle age hips and belly to show for it. And you know, once you gain weight at middle age, it’s almost impossible to get rid of it.

Oh, and did I mention a nice piece of chocolate cake? And who doesn’t like some really good pizza with red wine? Some things in life are not only irreplaceable, but also should be a part of one’s happiness, and this includes carbs. All of them! I say eat those lovely carbs, because carbs understand us even when men don’t.
